translation.en: On May 4, Turkish President Recep Erdoğan changed them to June 27 and 28.
translation.yo: Ṣùgbọ́n ní ọjọ́ 4 oṣù karùn-ún, Ààrẹ ilẹ̀ Turkey Recep Erdoğan yí ọjọ́ náà sí ọjọ́ 27 sí ọjọ́ 28 oṣù Keje.

translation.en: The changes and the uncertainties around the exam amid the COVID-19 pandemic launched countless discussions in Turkish society and on social media:
translation.yo: Àyípadà yìí àti àìdájú ìdánwò yìí ti ń kọ àwọn ènìyàn ilẹ̀ Turkey lóminú, ní ààrín ìgboro ìlú àti ní orí àwọn èrọ alátagbà lórí pé:

translation.en: How do date changes affect the psychology of students, given the level of stress associated to YKS for which candidates prepare for months?
translation.yo: Báwo ni ọjọ́ yíyí ṣe ní ipá lórí ìrònú àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ tí wọn ń múra sílẹ̀ de ìdánwò láti bí osù mélòó kan?

translation.en: How would COVID-19 prevention measures be applied and respected (social distancing, temperature measurements, the use of masks) when bringing together 2.5 million people?
translation.yo: Báwo ni àwọn àlàkalẹ̀ àti òfi ìdèènà ìtànkálẹ̀ COVID-19 yóò ṣe di títẹ̀lé (Jíjìnnà síra ẹni láwùjọ, ìwọn ìgbọ́nà/tutù, ìlò ạṣọ ìbomú) bí a bá ń kó ènìyàn tí ó tó mílíọ́nù méjì àbọ̀ papọ̀.

translation.en: In 2019, 74.16 percent of the candidates passed the first part of YKS, and only 39.4 percent succeeded in the second part of the exam.
translation.yo: Ní ọdún 2019, ìdá mẹ́rìnléláàádọ́rin ó lé díẹ̀ ni àwọn olùṣèdánwò tí wọ́n pegedé nínú ìdánwò náà, nígbà tí ìdá mọ́kàndínlógójì pegedé sí ìpele ìkejì ìdánwò náà.

translation.en: Turkey registered its first confirmed COVID-19 case on March 11, and by July 15, around 5,500 people infected with the virus have died, while there have been more than 200,000 confirmed cases of the disease in the country.
translation.yo: Orílẹ̀-èdè Turkey ṣe àkọsílẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ COVID-19 àkọ́kọ́ wọn ní ọjọ́ 11 oṣù kẹta ọdún, ní ìgbà tí ó fi máa di ọjọ́ 15 oṣù keje ẹ̀nìyàn ẹgbẹ̀rún márùn-ún àbọ̀ ti pàdánù ẹ̀mí wọn sí ọwọ́ ààrùn náà bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni iye ènìyàn tí ó ti ní ààrùn náà ti lé ní igba ẹgbèrún.

translation.en: On July 1, the government enforced special normalization measures:
translation.yo: Ní ọjọ́ 1 oṣù keje, Ìjọba gùnlé àwọn ìgbéṣẹ̀ ìdẹ́kun lóríṣiríṣi:

translation.en: Businesses such as restaurants, cafes, cinemas and wedding halls that had been closed for about three months reopened with social distancing restrictions.
translation.yo: Àwọn ilé oko-òwò bi ilé ounjẹ, àwọn oko òwò ẹ̀rọ ayélujára, ilé ìṣàfihàn eré, gbọ̀ngàn ạyẹyẹ ìgbeyàwó tí wọ́n tì pa fún bíi oṣù mẹ́ta ni wọ́n ti tún ṣí padà báyìí, àmọ́ ṣá pẹ̀lú àtẹ̀lé ìjíjìnà síra ẹni láwùjọ.

translation.en: Patrons are now required to wear masks and will have their temperature taken as well.
translation.yo: Àwọn olùbẹ̀wò báyìí nílò láti máa bo imú wọ, wọn yóò sì máa ṣe àyẹ̀wò ìgbóná/tutù wọn.

translation.en: While students and opposition parties called for a further postponement of the YKS, the government went ahead with its plans:
translation.yo: Bí àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ tilẹ̀ fi ìpè síta pé kí ìdánwò YKS ó di sísún síwájú, ìjọba ò tẹ̀tì nínú àlàkalẹ̀ rẹ̀:

translation.en: In late June, 2.5 million people took the exam.
translation.yo: Ní ìparí oṣù keje mílíọ̀nù méjì àbọ̀ ni ó jókòó ṣe ìdánwò náà..

translation.en: As can be seen in this tweet, concerns over enforcement of social distancing in this context proved to be legitimate:
translation.yo: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí a ṣe rí i ní inú túwíìtì yìí, tí ó nííṣe pẹ̀lú àsujù lórí ìmúnitẹ̀lẹ́ ìjìnnà sí ara ẹni láwùjọ:

translation.en: YKS, with 2.5 million students, is taking place despite all the warnings: social distancing disappeared
translation.yo: Ìdánowò YKS ń lọ lọ́wọ́ pẹ̀lú mílíọ́nù méjì àbọ̀ akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ládúrúu gbogbo ìkìlọ̀: Ìjìnàsíra-ẹni láwùjo gan-an di àwátì.

translation.en: A new YKS controversy: morality
translation.yo: Àìgbọ́raẹniyé Ìdànwò YKS tuntun: ìwà rere

translation.en: COVID-19 is not the only debate surrounding YKS in 2020.
translation.yo: Kì í ṣe COVID-19 nìkan ni famínfà tí ó yí Ìdánowò YKS ká ní ọdún 2020.

translation.en: An even more impassioned discussion started in early July in relation to a text selected for the Turkish language exam.
translation.yo: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ ló ti ń jà rànhìnrànhìn láti ìbẹ̀ẹ̀rẹ̀ oṣù keje èyí tí ó nííṣe pẹ̀lú ìwé àyọkà fún ìdánwò èdè Turkish.

translation.en: One of the questions referred to the song by pop singer Mabel Matiz, a member of the LGBTQ+ community, “Fırtınadayım” (“I am in the storm”):
translation.yo: Ọ̀kan nínú àwọn ìbéèrè abẹ́ rẹ̀ tọ́ka sí “Fırtınadayım, (mo wà nínú ìjì), orin olórin tàka-n-súfèé kan Mabel Matiz tí í ṣe LGBTQ “Fırtınadayım” (“I am in the storm”):

translation.en: The question about the meaning of “Gözümün gördüğü, göğsümün bildiği ile bir değil” (which can be translated as “what my eyes see is not what my heart feels”) has left its mark on social media because of Mabel's popularity among young people (some of his videos have 50 million views) and his sexual orientation.
translation.yo: Ìbéèrè lórí ìtumọ̀ “Gözümün gördüğü, göğsümün bildiği ile bir değil” (tí a le tú sí ohun tí ojú mi rí kọ́ ni ohun tí aya mí mọ̀) ti ń da àwọn ìkànnì àwùjọ rú gùdùgùdù nítorí Mabel jẹ́ ẹni tí àwọn ọdọ́ mọ̀ bí ẹni mọ owó (ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn àwòrán-àtohùn rẹ̀ ní ó máa ń ní ìwò tí ó tó àádọ́ta mílíọ́nù) àti ìṣe rẹ̀ lórí àwọn ohun tí ó jẹmọ́ akọ́ṣebíabo.

translation.en: Following growing debates on Twitter, Halis Aygün, the president of the Center for Measurement, Selection and Placement (ÖSYM), the government body responsible for preparing the exam, gave an interview to far-right conservative media Yeni Akit.
translation.yo: Ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú fàmínfà orí ìkànni Twitter, Halis Aygün Ààrẹ Center for Measurement, Selection and Placement (ÖSYM), ẹ̀ka ìjọba tí ó bójú tó ìṣètò ìdánwò sọ nínú ìfọ̀rọ̀wánilẹ́nuwọ̀ pẹ̀lú àgbà òṣìṣẹ́ ìròyìn kan, Yeni Akit.

translation.en: In which he said the matter would be investigated and that those responsible for including the text would be fired:
translation.yo: Níbẹ̀ ni ó ti sọ pé wọn yóò ṣe ìwádìí ọ̀rọ̀ náà, gbogbo àwọn tí wọ́n bá sì lọ́wọ́ nínú fífi ìwé náà si abẹ́ ìdánwò ọ̀hún ni wọ́n yóò lé kúrò lẹ́nu iṣẹ́:

translation.en: The 2020 YKS was completed safely and successfully in 188 exam centers in three sessions with the participation of approximately two and a half million candidates.
translation.yo: Ìdánwò YKS ọdún 2020 kẹ́sẹ járí kákàkiri àwọn ibùdó ìdánwò méjìdínnígbà (188) ní ìṣí ẹ̀ẹ̀mẹta, tí àwọn akópa nínú rẹ̀ sì ń lọ bíi mílíọ́nù méjì àbọ̀.

translation.en: The question pool is created with the participation of thousands of academicians from different universities of our country.
translation.yo: Àwọn ìdánwò rẹ̀ jẹ́ èyí tí àwọn onímọ̀ akadá káàkiri àwọn fáfitì orílẹ̀-èdè wa ṣètò.

translation.en: The sensitivity of the management of our institution about our national, moral values and social value judgments is clear.
translation.yo: Ìkíyèsí àwọn ẹ̀kọ́ ilé àti ọgbọ́n ìbágbépò láwùjọ fùn àwọn ilé-ìwé gíga wa máa ń jẹ́ kíkíyèsí.

translation.en: The members of staff responsible will be discharged from the process of question preparation.
translation.yo: Àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ tí èyí bá ṣí mọ́ lórí ni wọn yóò di gbígbọ́n dànù kúrò nínú ìṣètò ìdánwò.

translation.en: For some Twitter users, those measures aren't enough:
translation.yo: Fún àwọn asàmúlò ìkànnì Twitter kan, ìdájọ́ yìí kò tó:

translation.en: [Top]  ÖSYM President spoke for the first time after the exam!
translation.yo: [Òkè] Ààrẹ ÖSYM sọ̀rọ̀ fún ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ lẹ́yìn ìdánwò!

translation.en: "An investigation has been launched into the content of the problem. Responsible persons will be removed from the question preparation processes. "
translation.yo: "Wọ́n ti fi ìdí ìwádìí lọ́lẹ̀ láti wo ibi tí ìṣòro náà ti wọ́wá. Àwọn tí wọ́n bá lọ́wọ́ nínú rẹ̀ yóò di gbígbọ́n dànù kúrò nínú ìṣètò ìdánwò."

translation.en: [Bottom] It is not enough [to remove him], the neglecting president must be removed from the management process so that he is properly done with.
translation.yo: [Ìsàlẹ̀] Kò tó [lá ti yọ ọ́] nìkan, Ààrẹ tí kò ka nǹkan sí náà gbọdọ̀ jẹ́ yíyọ kúrò nínú ìṣàkósọ gbogbo kí ojú rẹ̀ le wálẹ̀.

translation.en: Conservative segments of society also question the intention behind the choice of that question:
translation.yo: Ọ̀wọ́ àwọn alẹ́nulọ́rọ̀ láwùjọ náà tún rí wí sí ìpinnu àti ṣètò irú ìbéèrè báyìí:

translation.en: In today's #YKS2020 exam, couldn't you find anyone else to show to teenagers other than the gay and LGBT advocate Mabel Matiz?
translation.yo: Nínú ìdánwò #YKS2020 tí ó wáyé lónìí, ẹ kò rí ẹlòmìíràn fi ṣe àpèjúwe fún àwọn ọmọdé wọ̀nyí àfi ọkùnrin oníbálòpọ̀-akọsíakọ nnì Mabel Matiz?

translation.en: (The one who carries a banner saying "we are faggots")
translation.yo: (Ènìyàn tí ó gbé àkólé tí ó fi ń polongo pé "Oníbálòpọ̀-akọsíakọ ni àwa"

translation.en: What are you trying to do?
translation.yo: Kí ni ẹ̀ ń gbìyànjú láti ṣe?

translation.en: Public opinion remains largely divided as other Twitter users point out the success and popularity of Mabel Matiz:
translation.yo: Èrò àwọn aṣàmúlò ìkànni Twitter kò ṣọ̀kan pẹ̀lú bí àwọn mìíràn ṣe ń tọ́ka sí àwọn àṣeyọrí Mabel Matiz àti bí ó ṣe lókìkí sí:

translation.en: Dear investigative board members, I recommend that you watch Mabel Matiz's clips.
translation.yo: Èyin ọmọ ìgbìmọ̀ aṣèwádìí. Mo fẹ́ kí ẹ wo àwọn fọ́nrán Mabel Matiz.

translation.en: Because we have no other artists who have embraced our culture this way for many years.
translation.yo: Nítorí pé a kò ní eléré mìíràn tí ó ti ṣe àmúlò àṣà wa tó báyìí ní ọ̀pọ̀ ọdún sẹ́yìn.

translation.en: That's why #mabelmatiz is the treasure of our land. He is a unique “artist”
translation.yo: Ìdí nìyẹn tí mabelmatiz ṣe jẹ́ ìsúra wa.

translation.en: This netizen draws attention to the fact that by focusing on a gay singer politicians avoid addressing real issues:
translation.yo: Àwọn èèyàn lórí ayélujára pé àkíyèsí sí i pé fífi ojú sun olórin tí ó jẹ́ oníbálòpọ̀-akọsíakọ, àwọn olóṣèlú yóò pa àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ tí ó ṣe kókó tì:

translation.en: Nobody makes any noise about rapists, yet Mabel Matiz question becomes the subject of an investigation.
translation.yo: Kò sí ẹni tí ó figbe ta lórí àwọn afipábánilòpọ̀, síbẹ̀ ìwádìí Mabel Matiz ni wọ́n ń gbà bí ẹni ń gba igbá ọtí.

translation.en: And this one concludes:
translation.yo: Eléyìí kó gbogbo rẹ̀ nílẹ̀:

translation.en: You say “our social value judgments” but Mabel Matiz is the best reflector of our culture.
translation.yo: Ẹ sọ pé "ìdààbò bo ìṣe wa" ṣùgbọ́n Mabel Matiz ni ẹni tí ó ṣe ìgbéjáde àṣà wa jùlọ.

translation.en: Thus investigation should be about the ones who insult Mabel Matiz and discriminate against him. #MabelMatizisnotalone [Top of post]
translation.yo: Ó wa yẹ kí ìwádìí ó dá lé àwọn èyí tí ó tàbùkù Mabel Matiz tí wọ́n sì ṣẹlẹ́yàmẹ́yá rẹ̀. #MabelMatizisnotalone [Àtẹ̀jáde òkè]

translation.en: Mabel Matiz's response to the controversy
translation.yo: Èsì Mabel Matiz sí àìgbọ́raẹniyé náà

translation.en: On July 3, as the debate became more heated, Matiz finally broke his silence:
translation.yo: Ní ọjọ́ 3 oṣù Keje, bí fàmínfà náà ṣe ń gbóná sí i, Matiz padà la ohùn:

translation.en: Hi:) I was very happy that my music was be the subject of such an important exam.
translation.yo: Ẹ ǹlẹ́ o:) Inú mi dùn pé orin mi jẹ́ lílò fún irú ìdánwò pàtàkì bí èyí.

translation.en: Now I am amazed at how my personal values are subject of the same exam.
translation.yo: Ní báyìí, ìyàlẹ́nu lójẹ́ fún mi bí ìgbéayé mi ṣe di ohun tí ó kan ìdánwò tí à ń sọ yìí.

translation.en: Look what I was tested with, while the geographical sign logo was about placed next to my name.
translation.yo: Ẹ wo ohun tí a fi dán mi wò..bí a ṣe gbé ààmi kan ní ìfẹ̀gbẹ́kẹ̀gbẹ́ pẹ̀lú orúkọ mi.

translation.en: Well, I say that life's exams never end :)
translation.yo: Kò burú, Ìdánwò ayé kò lópin:)

translation.en: Another roll call came from here.
translation.yo: Iyán tún di àtúngún wàyí.

translation.en: I read your intense messages of support.
translation.yo: Mo ka ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn àtẹjáde tí ó ṣègbè lẹ́yín mi.

translation.en: I understand what I want to say with my music, I sense that you understand me, and I feel even stronger now.
translation.yo: Òhun tí mo fẹ́ sọ nínú orin yẹn yémi, mó nímọ̀ pé ó yé ẹ̀yin náà, ara mi sì tún yá gágá sí i.

translation.en: I will continue to make my music, tell stories, and be part of this country.
translation.yo: N ó tẹ̀síwájú láti máa kọ orin sí i, láti máa sọ ìtàn àti láti jẹ́ ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè yìí.

translation.en: See you in another exam...
translation.yo: Ká tún pàdé nínú ìdánwò mìíràn...

translation.en: Matiz remains very popular: Just one day after Aygun's statement, he received two awards in a competition based on the popular vote.
translation.yo: Matiz sì lókìkí síbẹ̀: lẹ́yìn ọjọ́ kan tí Aygun sọ̀rọ̀ sáfẹ́fẹ́, ó gba àmì-ẹ̀yẹ méjì nínú ìdíje àmì-ẹ̀yẹ kan nípasẹ̀ ìbò tí ó pọ̀jù.

translation.en: He won in two categories, “Best Clip” and “Best Male Singer” at the 46th Pantene Golden Butterfly Awards.
translation.yo: Ó gba àmì-ẹyẹ ipele méjì, “Orin tí mùṣèmúṣè rẹ̀ dá múṣé jùlọ” àti “Olórin ọkùnrin tí mùṣèmúṣè rẹ̀ dá múṣé jùlọ” ní ìdíje àmìẹyẹ Pantene Golden Butterfly ẹlẹ́ẹ̀kẹrìndínláàádọ́ta irú rẹ̀.

translation.en: This seems to indicate that very large numbers of people support him against the homophobia expressed by the government and conservative citizens.
translation.yo: Èyí fi hàn pé ọ̀pọ̀ ènìyá̀n ni wọ́n wà lẹ́yìn rẹ tako ọ̀rọ̀ ìbálòpọ̀-akọsíakọ tí ìjọba àti àwọn alẹ́nulọ́rọ̀ tí ìjọba ń sọ.

translation.en: On July 5, Mabel Matiz tweeted again:
translation.yo: Ní ọjọ́ 5 oṣù Keje, Mabel Matix tún túwíìtì:

translation.en: I received the “Best Male Artist” and “Best Video Clip” awards at the 46th Golden Butterfly Awards, I am happy!
translation.yo: Mo gba àmì-ẹyẹ "àwòrán-àtohùn orin tí mùṣèmúṣè rẹ̀ dá múṣé jùlọ" àti “Olórin ọkùnrin tí mùṣèmúṣè rẹ̀ dá múṣé jùlọ” nínú ìdíje àmì-ẹyẹ Pantene Golden Butterfly ẹlẹ́ẹ̀kẹrìndínláàádọ́ta irú rẹ̀, Inú mi dùn!

translation.en: Thanks to all my dear listeners!
translation.yo: Ẹ ṣé gan ẹ̀yin olùgbọ́ mi gbogbo.

translation.en: I would like to extend my thanks to Erhan Arık and DOP Meryem Yavuz, the precious directors of [my song]
translation.yo: Màá fẹ́ láti dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Erhan Arik àti DOP Meryem Yavuz, àwọn tí wọ́n darí àwòrán-àtohùn [orin mi]

translation.en: "I Have a Red in My Wipe" clip.
translation.yo: "I Have a Red in My Wipe" clip tẹ́lẹ̀.

translation.en: Workers’ Day Celebration: House Speaker tasks Nigerian workers on productivity
translation.yo: ---Àjọ̀dún òṣìṣẹ́: Abẹnugan ilé-ìgbìmọ̀ as̩ojú rọ òṣìṣẹ́ láti tẹramọ́ iṣẹ́ fún àbájáde rere.

translation.en: The Speaker of the Nigerian House of Representatives Mr Femi Gbajabiamila has congratulated the Nigerian workers for marking this year’s International Workers’ Day.
translation.yo: Abẹnugan ilé-ìgbìmọ̀ aṣ̣ojú ti Nàìjíríà, Fẹ́mi Gbàjàbíàmílà, ti kí àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ orílẹ̀-èdè yìí kú orííre fún ti àjọ̀dún àyájọ́ àwọn òsìsẹ́ lágbàáyé.

translation.en: Mr Gbajabiamila said although the day is being marked quietly across the globe as a result of the lockdown necessitated by the COVID-19 pandemic, there is much to remember about the sacrifices made by Nigerian workers.
translation.yo: Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Gbàjàbíàmílà ní bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ayẹyẹ yìí wáyé láìsí ariwo ní gbogbo àgbáyé nítorí àṣe̩ kónílé–gbélé látàrí ìtànkálẹ̀ aàrun COVID-19, ohun tí a lè rántí pọ̀ nípa àwọn ìrúbọ ti àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ Nàìjíríà̀ ṣe.

translation.en: In a statement marking the Workers’ Day signed by his Special Adviser on Media and Publicity, Lanre Lasisi, the Speaker commended the Nigerian workers for their commitment and dedication to work over the years, which he said has shaped the country tremendously.
translation.yo: Nínú àtẹ̀jáde tó ń sàmì ọjọ́ àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ èyí tí Olùdámọ́ràn rẹ̀ Pàtàkì lórí ìròyìn àti ìkéde fo̩wó̩sí, Láńre Làsísì, Abẹnugan gbóṣùbà fún àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ Nàìjíríà nítorí ìfarajìn àti ipa ribiribi tí wọ́n kó fún ọ̀pọ̀ ọdún sẹ́yìn, èyí tó mú ìyípadà rere bá Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: He, however, called on Nigerian workers to be more productive now and always, saying no matter what was achieved before now must be sustained and improved upon for the country to achieve more.
translation.yo: Síbè̩, ó ro̩ àwọn òṣìṣé Nàìjíríà kí wọ́n túnbọ̀ máa so èso rere nísisìnyí àti gbogbo ìgbà, nítorí àṣeyorí àná nílò ìtẹ̀síwájú kí a ṣiṣẹ́ síi kí ọrílẹ̀-èdè yìí leè ní àṣeyọrí síi.

translation.en: “I want to salute the courage of Nigerian workers, who have over the years given their best to their work.
translation.yo: ‘Mo fẹ́ kí àwọn òṣìṣé Nàìjíríà fún ọkàn-akin, àwọn tí wọ́n ti fi gbogbo ipá wọn ṣiṣé.

translation.en: Indeed Nigeria and Nigerians are proud of you.
translation.yo: Nítòótọ́, Nàìjíríà àti àwọn ọmọ Nàìjíríà fi yín yangàn.

translation.en: I urge the Nigerian workers to redouble their efforts at this time of our national development.
translation.yo: Mo rọ àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ Nàìjíríà láti fikún okun wọn ní irú àkókò ìdàgbàsókè orílẹ̀ èdè wa yìí.

translation.en: They must continue to put in their best in the work that they do for the betterment of the country.”
translation.yo: Wọ́n gbọ́dọ̀ tẹ̀síwájú láti fi gbogbo agbára wọn ṣe iṣé tí wọ́n ń ṣe fún àǹfààní orílẹ̀ èdè’

translation.en: --- May Day: Senate President felicitates with Nigerian workers
translation.yo: --- Àyájọ́ àwọn Òṣìṣẹ́: Olóri ilé-ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin àgbà kí àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ Nàìjíríà

translation.en: President of the Nigerian Senate, Ahmad Lawan, has felicitated with Nigerian workers as they join their counterparts the world over to mark the Workers’ Day.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ ilé-ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin àgbà ti Nàìjíríà, Ahmad Lawan, kí àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ orílẹ̀-èdè yìí bí wọ́n ṣe sowó̩pò̩ pè̩lú àwọn akẹgbẹ́ wọn lágbàáyé láti s̩e àjọ̀dún o̩jó̩ àwọn òṣìṣẹ́.

translation.en: Senator Lawan also congratulated Nigerian workers for sustaining their heroic struggle for the liberation of the country from poverty and underdevelopment even in the face of the daunting challenges at various workplaces.
translation.yo: Aṣòfin Lawan tún gbóṣùbà fún àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ fún gudugudu méje, yàyà mẹfà tí wọ́n ń ṣe láti mú orílẹ̀-èdè kúrò nínú òṣì àti àìní idàgbàsókè àti kíkojú àwo̩n ìpèníjà amúnibè̩rù lẹ́nu iṣẹ́ onírúurú.

translation.en: He acknowledged the role of workers as the creator of wealth in society and stressed that it is for this reason that they should be appreciated at all times.
translation.yo: Ó mọ rírì ipa àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ gẹ́gẹ́ bíi ẹni tó ń mú ọrọ̀ wá sí àwùjọ, ó tẹnumọ wípé èyí ni a ṣe gbọ́dọ̀ mo rírì wọn ní gbogbo ìgbà.

translation.en: The best way to appreciate the enormous contributions of the Nigerian workers is to always consider their welfare as of utmost importance.
translation.yo: Ó tẹ̣̀síwájú pé "ọ̀nà tó dára jùlọ̣ láti mọ̣ rírì ipa ribiribi tí àwọ̣̣n òṣìṣẹ́ kó ní láti mójútó ètò ìgbáyé-gbádùn wọ̣̣n.

translation.en: "As a legislature, we are ever ready to work in collaboration with the organised labour Unions to rid our statute books of any anti-labour laws," Lawan said.
translation.yo: Lawan sọ wípé, "Gẹ̣́gẹ́ bí ilé-ìgbìmọ̀ aṣ̣òfin, a ti ṣ̣etán láti fọwọ̣́sowọ̣́pọ̀ pẹ̣̀lú ẹ̣̣gbẹ̣́ àwọ̣̣n òṣ̣ìṣ̣ẹ́ láti ṣòfin tó lòdì sí ìwà ìbàjẹ́ sí òṣìṣẹ lẹ́nu iṣẹ́".

translation.en: The Senate President said as part of the effort of the 9th National Assembly to strengthen the economy and improve the standard of living of the people, it is determined to make the country’s financial year predictable through the timely passage of the 2020 budget.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ ilé-ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin àgbà sọ wípé, gégẹ́ bíi ara akitiyan ilé-ìgbìmọ aṣòfin kẹsàn-án láti fi okun fún ètò ọrọ̀ ajé àti láti mú ìgbé-ayé àwọn ènìyàn dára síi, ti pinu láti mú kí ètò ìsúúná ọdún yìí ṣee dáadáa nípa títètè bu ọwọ́ lu ìwé ètò ìsúná ọdún 2020.

translation.en: According to Senator Lawan, the National Assembly has in the same respect made critical amendments to some laws to ensure smooth implementation of the budget.
translation.yo: Nínu ọ̀rọ̀ Aṣòfin Lawan, ilé-ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin àgbà bakan náà ti ṣe àtúnṣe sí àwọn òfin kò̩ò̩kan láti ri wípé ìmúlò ètò ìsúná náà lo̩o̩ bí ó ti yẹ.

translation.en: He said the Legislature would continue to move relentlessly in that direction, despite the unforeseen challenges posed by the COVID-19 pandemic.
translation.yo: Ó sọ wípé àwọn Aṣòfin yóò máa lọ ní ìlànà yìí láìwo àwọn ìpèníjà àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn COVID-19.

translation.en: The Senate President noted that this year’s celebration of Workers’ Day comes at a time the entire world is facing the health emergency brought about by the Coronavirus pandemic.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ ilé-ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin ṣe àkíyèsí wípé ayẹyẹ ọjọ́ àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ti ọdún yìí wáyé lásìkò tí gbogbo orílẹ̀ èdè àgbáyé ń kojú àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn òjiijì COVID-19.

translation.en: "It is the resilience and never-die spirit of the Nigerian people that will boost the efforts of the government to overcome the pandemic," he stated.
translation.yo: Ó wípé "Ọkàn akínkanjú àti ẹ̀mí tí kìí kú tí àwọn ènìyàn Nàìjíríà níí ni yóò ran iṣẹ́ ìjọba lọ́wọ́ láti leè borí àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn náà"

translation.en: The Senate President urged the Nigerian workers, as they mark their day, to adhere strictly to all the prescribed public health protocols of social distancing, wearing of face mask, use of hand sanitizer, observance of personal hygiene, and to endeavour to stay at home and stay safe.
translation.yo: ”Ààrẹ ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin wá rọ àwọn òṣìsẹ́ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà bí wọ́n ṣe ń sàmì ọjọ́ wọn, láti máa tẹ́lé ìlànà ètò ìlera láwùjọ, fífi ààyè sáàrín ara wa, kí a máa wọ ìbòjú, kí a máa lo oun èlò ìfọwọ́ apakòkòrò, kí a máa ṣe ìmọ́tótó ara wa àti láti máa dúrọ sílé kí a sì dáàbò bo ara wa.

translation.en: --- COVID 19: another twenty four (24) people were tested positive in Nigeria.
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: Àwọn ènìyàn mẹ́rìnlélógún (24) mìíràn tún jẹyọ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà

translation.en: Another twenty-four (24) people were tested positive for corona virus (COVID 19) in Nigeria this made the total of infected people to be one thousand, nine hundred and thirty-two (1932) when three hundred and nineteen (319) have been discharged, and fifty-eight (58) are dead. The Nigeria centre for disease control (NCDC) announced this on their twitter handle @NCDC.gov.
translation.yo: Àwọn ènìyàn mẹ́rìlélógún (24) mìíràn tún ti jẹyọ tí wọ́n ní ààrùn Corona (COVID 19) lórílé̩èdè Nàìjíríà, èyí tó jẹ́ kí iye àwọn tó ní ààrùn Corona jẹ́ o̩gbò̩nlélé̩è̩dé̩gbàá lé méjì (1932), nígbà tí àwọn ènìyàn bí mọ́kàndínlógúnlélọ́ọ̀dúnrún (319) ti gba ìwòsàn, tí àwọn ènìyàn méjìdínlọ́gọ́ta (58) sì ti jẹ́ Ọlọ́run nípè. Àjọ tó ń gbógun ti àjàkálẹ̀ aàrùn ti Nàìjíríà (NCDC) ló kéde yìí lórí ẹ̀rọ Twitter wọn, @NCDC. gov.

translation.en: --- COVID 19 : We have received some news about the happening in Kano – Dr. Osagie
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: A ti gba ìròyìn díẹ̀ lórí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ní Kánò- Dókítà Osagie

translation.en: The Minister for health in Nigeria Dr. Osagie Ehanire has said they have received some news on the happening in Kano state.
translation.yo: Mínísítà fún ètò ìlera ti Nàìjíríà, Dókítà Osagie Ehanire ti ní àwọn ri ìròyìn díẹ̀ gbà nípa ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ onírúurú ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kánò.

translation.en: The minister said this in a daily interview of the federal Government in charge of fighting against COVID 19 with journalist in Abuja.
translation.yo: Mínísítà sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lásìkò ètò ìfọ̀rọ̀wánilẹ́nuwò ojoojúmó tí ìgbìmọ̀ ìjọba àpapọ̀ tó ń mójútó gbígbógun ti aàrùn COVID-19 ń ṣe pẹ̀lú àwọn akọ̣̣̣̣̣̀ròyìn nílùú Àbújá.

translation.en: He continued that they are expecting the news about the sudden death in Kano state, and this help them to take step of providing the instrument, the professionals and the training to help stop COVID- 19 in Kano state.
translation.yo: Ó tún tẹ̀síwájú pé àwọ̣n ṣí ń retí gbogbo ìròyìn nípa ìṣẹ̣̀lẹ̀ ikú òjijì tó wáyé ní ìpínlẹ̣̀ Kánò, eléyìí yóò ràn ìgbéṣẹ̀ pípèsè ètò ìrànwọ́  ìrìnsẹ̀ , àwọn  onímọ̀ àti ètò ẹ̣̀kọ́ tí wọn yóò  fún ìpínlẹ̀ Kánò láti dẹ́kun aàrùn  COVID-19.

translation.en: Dr Ehanire, now appealed health workers to follow the line of programmes to protect themselves always so that they will not be infected by COVID -19 or endanger themselves.
translation.yo: Dókítà Ehanire , wá rọ̣ àwọ̣n òṣìṣẹ̣́ ètò ìlera làti maa tẹ̀ḷé ètò ìlànà láti dáàbò bò ara wọn nígbà gbogbo  kí wọ̣n máa bàa lùgbàdì aàrùn COVID-19 tàbí fi ara wọ̣n sínú ewu.

translation.en: --- Nigeria confirms 204 cases of COVID-19
translation.yo: --- Nàìjíríà ṣàwárí àwọn alárùn COVID-19 mé̩rìnlélúgba

translation.en: Nigeria has recorded 204 cases of the novel Coronavirus known as COVID-19, bringing the total number of the confirmed cases to 1932.
translation.yo: Nàìjíríà ti ní àkosílẹ̀ ènìyàn mẹ́rìnlélúgba tí wọ́n ní ààrun kòrónà tí a mọ̀ sí COVID – 19, èyí tó mú gbogbo akárùn náà jé̩ o̩gbò̩nlélé̩è̩dé̩gbàá lé méjì (1932).

translation.en: There are 319 Discharged and 58 Deaths.
translation.yo: Okòóléló̩ò̩dúnrún dín ò̩kan (319) gba ìwòsàn, méjìdínlọ́gọ́ta sì kú.

translation.en: On its official Twitter handle @NCDCgov, the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control, NCDC, showed the breakdown of the new cases;
translation.yo: Àjo̩ a-gbógun-ti-àjàkálẹ̀-ààrun ti Nàìjíríà (NCDC) ló so̩ èyí lórí ẹ̀rọ abẹ́yẹfò @NCCDCgov;

translation.en: 204 new cases of #COVID19 reported;
translation.yo: Alárùn COVID-19 mé̩rìnlélúgba ti farahàn;

translation.en: 80-Kano 45-Lagos 12-Gombe 9-Bauchi 9-Sokoto 7-Borno 7-Edo 6-Rivers 6-Ogun 4-FCT 4-Akwa Ibom 4-Bayelsa 3-Kaduna 2-Oyo 2-Delta 2-Nasarawa 1-Ondo 1-Kebbi 11:50pm 30th April- 1932 confirmed cases of #COVID19 in Nigeria  Discharged.
translation.yo: Ọgọ́rin-Kano, márùndínláàdọ́ta-Èkó, méjìlá-Gombe, mẹ̩́sàn-án-Bauchi, mé̩sàn-án-Sokoto, méje-Borno, méje-Edo, méfà-Rivers, méfà-Ògùn, mẹ́rin-Àbújá, mẹ́rin-Akwa Ibom, mẹ́rin-Bayelsa, mẹ́ta-Kaduna, méjì-Òyó, méjì-Delta, méjì-Nasarawa, Ò̩kan-Òǹdó, Ò̩kan-Kebbi.  Ní agogo méjìlá ku ìṣéjú mẹ́wàá, ọgbọ̀n ọjo oṣú igbe – 1932 alárùn Covid-19 farahàn ní Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: --- COVID-19: Ministerial Task Team on Kano submits interim report
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: Ikò̩ òṣìṣé mínísítà ti Kano s̩àgbékalè̩ ìròyìn gbà-á-gbè̩

translation.en: The Ministerial Task Team on fact-finding mission to Kano has submitted an interim report to the Federal Ministry of Health, on the needs, strengths and weaknesses of the Kano response system.
translation.yo: Ikò̩ ọ̀ṣìṣẹ́ mínísítà lóri is̩é̩ ìwádìí sí Kano, ti s̩e àgbékalè̩ ìròyìn gbà-á-gbè̩  fun ilé-iṣẹ́ ìjọba àpapọ̀ ti ìlera, lórí ìdí, okun àti àìlera ọ̀nà tí ìpínlẹ̀ Kano ṣe ń dáhùn.

translation.en: The Minister of Health, Dr Osagie Ehanire said this at the daily joint press briefing by the Presidential Task Force on Covid-19, in Abuja, Nigeria.
translation.yo: Mínísítà fún ìlera, Dókítà Osagie Ehanire sò̩yí nínú ìpàdé àpapọ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn oníròyìn èyí tí ìgbìmọ̀ ìjọba àpapọ tó ń mójútó COVID-19 ní Àbújá ṣe.

translation.en: He said while the Ministry awaits a full report, the interim report will be a guide in supporting Kano State COVID-19 Task force with necessary material, training and human resources.
translation.yo: Ó ní bí ilé-iṣé ìjọba àpapọ s̩e ń retí ìròyìn kíkún, ìròyìn gbà-á-bè̩ yìí yóò jẹ́ ató̩nà nínú ìrànwọ́ fún ikò̩ agbógunti Covid-19 ti Kano pèlú èròja to ye̩, ìdánilé̩kò̩ó̩ àti àwo̩n ènìyàn araniló̩wó̩.

translation.en: “They will include assembling and dispatching a technical team from FMOH and virus Infectious disease specialists from Irrua Specialist hospital to join a technical team from Lagos Ministry of Health that is already on ground in Kano at the request of the Governor of Kano State” he said.
translation.yo: “ Lára àwọn ohun ìrànwọ́ ni  kíkó àti rírán àwọn ẹgbẹ́ onímọ̀  láti FMOH àti àwọn onímọ̀ nípa kòkòrò ààrùn láti ilé-ìwòsàn Irrua Specialist Hospital láti darapọ̀ mọ́ ẹgbẹ́ onímọ̀ ilé-iṣẹ́ ètò ìlera ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó  tí ó ti ń ṣiṣẹ́ ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kano nítorí Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Kano”

translation.en: He said there will also be a good pool of experienced hands-on experts to support the leading role of Kano State in the response.
translation.yo: Gé̩gé̩ bi ìdáhùn, ó tún so̩ pé àwọn onímọ̀ onírìírí yóò pò̩ jaburata ní ìkàlè̩ láti kin àwo̩n òs̩ìs̩é̩ ìs̩áájú lé̩yìn ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kano.

translation.en: “An emergency medical team from FHOH has left Abuja with ambulances, five of which were kindly donated by FRSC, on their way to Kano to provide emergency response in view of movement restrictions arising from the lockdown.”
translation.yo: “E̩gbẹ́ oníṣègùn tó ń dáhùn ìpè pàjáwìrì lati FMOH ti kúrò ní Àbújá pẹ̀lú àwo̩n áḿbúlàǹsì, márùn-ún ni àjọ ẹ̀ṣọ́ ojú pópó (FRSC) fi to̩re̩, lọ́nà láti lọ sí ìpínlẹ̀ Kano fún ìdáhùn pàjáwìrì látàríi àṣẹ kónílégbélé.

translation.en: Dr Ehanire restated the need for health workers to stringently follow laid down standard infection prevention and control measures at all times and not to take risks.
translation.yo: Dókítà Ehanire tún sọ̀dí tí àwọn òṣìṣé ìlera ṣe gbọ́dọ̀ tẹ̀lé àwọn ìlànà ìpara-ẹni-mọ́ fún ààrùn ní gbogbo ìgbà, kí wọ́n máa sì fi ẹ̀mí wọn wéwu.

translation.en: “We cannot afford to lose the service of essential manpower at this time; every client should be treated with a high index of suspicion for COVID-19, but treat every client with fairness so that persons suffering from other ailments do not suffer neglect or treatment refusal.”
translation.yo: “A kò leè gbà láti pàdánù àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ pàtàkì nírú àkókò báyìí; gbogbo ènìyàn ni wọ́n gbọ́dọ̀ tó̩jú pẹ̀lú ìfura tó ga fún COVID-19 sùgbọ́n kí wọ́n tójú gbogbo ènìyàn láì s̩ojús̩àájú kí àwọn elòmíràn pẹ̀lú àìsàn má baà jìyà àìdásí tàbí kí wọ́n má tó̩jú wọn.”

translation.en: “It is not ethical to turn clients away without, at least a medical advice, neither should a person in distress be refused care in emergency situation” he said.
translation.yo: Ó wípé, “Ó jẹ́ ohun àìdára láti lé àwọn ènìyàn lọ láìsí ìmọ̀ràn nípa ètò ìlera tàbí kí á fi ìtọ́jú du ẹni tí ó nílò ìtọ́jú ní pàjáwìrì.”

translation.en: --- Re-opening of schools not yet in view – Minister
translation.yo: --- S̩ís̩í àwo̩n ilé-è̩kó̩ kò tíì farahàn - Mínísítà

translation.en: The Minister of State for Education, Emeka Nwajiuba says he cannot for-see or immediately tell when schools will be reopened.
translation.yo: Mínísítà ìpínlẹ̣̀ fún ètò ẹ̣̀kọ̣́, Emeka Nwajiuba ní òun kò leè sọjọ́ tàbí ìgbà tí wọn yóò padà ṣí ilé-è̩kó̩.

translation.en: The Minister also said re-opening of schools will be in tandem with President Muhammadu Buhari’s gradual ease of the lockdown put in place to curb the spread of COVID-19.
translation.yo: Mínísítà tẹ̣̀síwájú pé ṣíṣí àwọn ilé-è̩kó̩ yóò jẹ́ ní sísẹ̀-n-tẹ̀lé pẹ̀lú bí Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari ṣe ń gbẹ́sẹ̀ kúrò lórí àṣẹ kónílé–gbélé tí ó wà láti kápá ààrùn kòrónà.

translation.en: Nwajiuba who had earlier during the daily briefing said that the government is not ready to put the lives of children at risk, warned that no school should engage students except when a formal date of resumption is announced by the government.
translation.yo: Nwajiuba, nínú ọ̀rọ̀ rẹ̀ lójojúmọ́ ti sọ s̩áájú wípé ìjọ̣̣ba kò ṣetán láti fi ẹ̣̀mí àwọ̣̣̣̣n o̩mo̩ wéwu, ó wá kìlọ̀ wípé ilé-è̩kó̩ kọkan kò gbọdọ̀ bẹ̀rẹ̀ ètò ẹ̀kọ́ nílé-è̩kó̩ wọ̣̣n àyàfi ọjọ́ tí ìjọ̣̣ba bá kéde rẹ̀ pé kí ilé-è̩kó̩ wọlé.

translation.en: ” In anyway none of these schools can function outside the society”.
translation.yo: “Ní kúkurú, kò sí èyíkèyí nínú àwo̩n ilé-è̩kó̩ yìí tó le s̩í lé̩yìn odi.

translation.en: The Minister also said that all entrance examinations that had been postponed will hold when the government is satisfied that the students have understood the syllabus as planned.
translation.yo: Mínísítà tún so̩ pé gbogbo àwọ̣̣n ìdánwò ìgbaniwọlé tí wọ́n ti sún síwájú ni yóò di ṣíṣe nígbà tí ìjọba bá ri dájú pé gbogbo ètò-ẹ̀kọ́ tí wó̩n gbékalè̩ ló yé àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ó̩.

translation.en: The Minister clarified that both the West African Examination Council for Senior School Students and other National Examinations including NABTEB are not cancelled but only postponed.
translation.yo: Mínísítà ṣe àlàyé pé ìdánwò àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ oníwèémẹwàá (WAEC) àti àwọn ìdánwò àpapọ̀ (NECO) pẹ̀lu NABTEB ni kò ì di fífagilé sùgbọ́n tí wó̩n sún síwájú.

translation.en: He acknowledged challenges in the deployment of the e-learning policy hence the engagement of the State Universal Basic Education Boards.
translation.yo: Ó sọ̀rọ̀ nípa ìpèníjà tí ẹ̀kọ́ orí ayélujára tí a ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ mú wọlé àti bí a ṣe mú ètò ẹ̀kọ́ gbogboogbò ní ìpínlẹ̀ lò.

translation.en: According to him,” we know some are limited by access and the access is limited by device, some can only get on the continuation of their academic program via radio, some at the television level, some are using computer online system, so we are doing this in partnership with states meaning that every gap we intend to bridge as regards the education of these children nationwide, we had to pass through every state Governor through their SUBEBS”
translation.yo: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ṣe sọ, “A mọ̀ wípé àwọn kan kò ni àǹfààní àti àìkò ní àǹfààní yìí nítorí àìkò ní ẹ̀rọ tó kún ojú òsùwọ̀n, àwọn kan le tẹsíwájú nínú ẹ̀kọ́ wọn lórí rédíò, àwọn kan lórí te̩lifís̩àn, àwọn kan sì ń lo ẹ̀rọ ayára-bí-àsá pẹ̀lú ayélujára, nítorí náà à ń ṣe èyí pẹ̀lú àjọṣiṣẹ́pọ̀ ìjọba ìpínlẹ, èyí túmọ̀ sí pé gbogbo àlàfo tí a fe̩ dí tó nííṣe pẹ̀lú ẹ̀kọ́ àwọn ọmọ jákèjádò orílẹ̀-èdè yìí, a nílò láti gba ọ̀dọ̀ Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ kọ̀ọ̀kan nípaṣè àjọ ẹ̀kọ́ alákọ̀ọ́bẹ̀rẹ̀ káríayé SUBEBS”

translation.en: “Presently we have time table for 31 states out of 36 states, which means via Radio or T.v, teaching and learning are ongoing, these are time tables that suit each state but the federal government has only provided guideline via online content”
translation.yo: "Ní báyìí a ti ní ètò ìlànà ẹ̣̀kọ̣́ fún àwọ̣̣n ìpínlẹ̀ mọ̣́kànlélọ̣́gbọ̀n nínú ìpínlẹ̀ mẹ̣̣́rìndínlógóji, èyí túmọ̀ sí wípé láti orí rédíò tàbí te̩lifís̩àn, ìkọ́ni àti ìkẹ́kọ̀ọ́ n lọ, èyí jẹ́ àwo̩n ìlànà ìkẹ́kò̩ọ́ tó dára fún ìpínlẹ kọ̀ọ̀kan sùgbọ́n ìjọba àpapọ̀ ti ṣe ìlànà láti orí ayélujára.”

translation.en: “Using these SUBEBs ,the same way we share their interventions with them is the same way this teaching and learning online content is been shared and the FG informed that they could use state media that is appropriate in their areas”. Nwajiuba said.
translation.yo: Nwajiuba sọ wípé “Lílo àwo̩n SUBEB, ọ̀nà tí à ń gbà momi o̩gbó̩n wo̩n ni a ṣe fi pín kíkọ́ àti mímọ̀ yìí lórí ẹ̀rọ ayélujára. Ìjọba àpapọ̀ sì sọ wípé wọ́n leè lo àwọn ilé-iṣẹ́ ìgbóhùn sáfẹ́fẹ́ ti ìpínlẹ̀ wo̩n tó dára fún un”.

translation.en: The Minister added that the COVID 19 pandemic has helped all stakeholders to retool and has also helped everybody to get on board.
translation.yo: Mínísítà s̩àfikún pé àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn COVID-19 ti ran àwọn olókoòwò gbogbo lọ́wọ́ láti túnramú, ó sì ti ran ẹnìkọ̀ọ̀kan láti bọ́ sójú iṣẹ́.

translation.en: Speaking on the Sustainability of the e-learning policy, the Minister said the government will further engage master teachers that will perfect the system that will transcend its use after the Coronavirus health challenge facing the world.
translation.yo: Nígbà tó ń sọ̀rọ̀ lórí ìmúdúró ẹ̀kọ́ lórí ayélujára, mínísítà sọ wípé ìjọba yóò túnbọ̀ ṣàmúlò àwọn olùkọ́ akọ́ṣẹ́mọṣẹ́ tí yóò ṣàṣepé ètò náà tí yóò leè mú u wúlò lẹ́yìn ìpèníjà ààrun kòrónà tó kojú àgbááyé.

translation.en: Meanwhile the Education Secretariat of the Federal Capital Territory Administration FCTA, has issued a warning to some private Schools disseminating information to parents and students indicating the resumption of the 2019/2020 3rd term calendar online.
translation.yo: Bákan náà, ilé-iṣẹ́ ẹ̀kọ́ tó ń ṣàmójútó àwọn ilé-è̩kó̩ ní olú-ìlú FCTA, ṣe ìkìlọ̀ fún àwọn ilé-è̩kó̩ aládàáni tí wọ́n ń dájọ́ ìwọlé táàmù kẹta fún 2019/2020 lórí ẹ̀rọ ayélujára fún àwọn òbí àti akẹ́kọ̀ọ́.

translation.en: The FCTA Education Secretary, Umaru Marafa said in a statement released on Tuesday that no academic activities in all Schools in any form should commence until a notice to reopen is approved and conveyed by the Secretariat”
translation.yo: Akọ̀wé ilé-iṣẹ́ àjọ tó ń mójútó ilé-è̩kó̩, Umaru Marafa sọ nínú àtẹ̀jáde ọjọ́ ìṣẹ́gun wípé kò sí iṣẹ́ ìkẹ́kọ̀ọ́ kọ̀kan ní ilé-è̩kó̩ kọ̀ọ̀kan lọ́nàkọnà tó gbọ́dọ̀ bẹ̀rẹ̀ títí di ìgbà tí àṣẹ s̩ís̩í ilé ìwé bá jáde.

translation.en: “The Implication of this is that when the Schools will be reopened, adequate notice of the fact that 2nd term was inconclusive will be factored into the academic calendar which will dovetail into the 3rd term accordingly. Any action taken otherwise is likely to negatively distort the academic calendar of the schools involved” Marafa said.
translation.yo: Marafa so̩ pé, “Ìtumò̩ èyí ni pé nígbà tí àwọn ilé-è̩kó̩ yóò bá di s̩ís̩í padà, ìfilọ̀ tí ó yé̩ ni yóò ti wà lórí táàmù kejì tí kò parí, àti ò̩nà àti runmó̩ táàmù kẹta bí ó ti yẹ. Ìgbésè̩ tó bá lòdì sí èyí ṣeéṣe kó kóbá ètò ẹ̀kọ́ àwọn ilé-è̩kó̩ tó kàn.

translation.en: School proprietors are therefore, advised to maintain the status quo and keep their schools closed and not re-open in any form while they await further directives from the FCTA.
translation.yo: Wó̩n ro̩ àwọn ọ̀gá ilé-è̩kó̩ aláàdáni láti sowé-agbéjé̩-mó̩wó̩ kí ilé-è̩kó̩ wò̩n sì wà látìpa, kí wọ́n má s̩e si ní ọ̀nàkọnà títí ìjò̩ba yóò fi sohun mìíràn.

translation.en: Violators of this directive will face the full wrath of the law.
translation.yo: Àwọn tí wọ́n bá ṣe lòdì sí àṣẹ yìí yóò dojúkọ ìdájọ́ òfin pó̩nńbélé;

translation.en: Marafa further disclosed that the FCTA Education Secretariat has concluded plans to introduce e-learning platforms to include lessons on radio and television channels to keep the students constructively engaged while the lockdown lasts.
translation.yo: Marafa tún sọ wípé ilé-iṣẹ́ ẹ̀kọ́ ìjọba àpapọ̀ ti parí gbogbo ètò láti leè mú ètò ẹ̀kọ́ lórí ayélujára w̩onú èto ẹ̀kọ́ yálà lóri rédíò tàbí te̩lifís̩àn kí àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ leè máa ṣiṣẹ́ nígbogbo ìgbà tí kónílé gbélé bá fiwà.

translation.en: --- No private school must start work –  Minister FCT
translation.yo: --- Kò gbọ̣̣̣̣̣dọ̣̀ ṣí ilé-ìwé aládàáni kankan tó gbọ̣́dọ̣̀ bẹ̣̀rẹ̣̀ isẹ̣́ – Mínísítà FCT

translation.en: The Minister for the Federal capital territory (FCT), Alhaji Muhammad Musa Bello has warned the proprietors of private schools in Abuja that have started informing parents and students that very soon they will start work for the third term for the present 2019/2020 academic session, to be careful so that they will not face the wrath of government law.
translation.yo: Mínísítà fún olú-ìlú Nàìjíríà, Alhaji Muhammad Músá Bello ti ṣ̣èkìlọ̀ fún gbogbo àwọ̣̣n olùdarí ilé-ìwé aládàáni tó wà nílùú Àbújá tí wọ́n ti ń sọ̣̣ fún gbogbo àwọ̣̣n òbí àti akẹ̣̣́kọ̣̀ọ́ pé wọ̣̣n kò ní pẹ́ bẹ̣̀rẹ̣̀ iṣ̣ẹ́ láìpẹ̣́ fún sáà kẹ̣̣ta fún ti ọ̣dún 2019/2020 tí a wàyìí láti ṣ̣ọ̣̣́ra, kí wọ̣̣́n máa ba fojụ winá òfin ìjọ̣̣ba.

translation.en: Senior secretary for education in the federal capital territory, Umaru Marafa said this in a statement released on Tuesday that no academic activities in all Schools in any form should commence until a notice to reopen is approved and conveyed by the Secretariat”
translation.yo: Akọ̣̣̀wé àgbà fún ètò ẹ̣̣̀kọ́ nílùú Àbújá, Umaru Máráfá  ló sọ̣̣̀rọ̣̣̀ yíì nínú àtẹ̀jáde kan tí ó gbé jáde lọ̣̣́jọ́ ìṣ̣ẹ̣̣́gun pé ètò ẹ̣̣̀kọ́  kò ní tíì bẹ̣̣̀rẹ̀ nílé ìwé kankan tó wà nílùú Àbújá báyìí àyàfi ọjọ́ tí ilé-iṣ̣ẹ́  akọ̀wé àgbà fún ètò ẹ̣̣̀kọ́ bá fọ̣̣wọ̣̣́si.

translation.en: “We are appealing to private school proprietors to allow all their schools to remain closed, they must not try to open the school except there is a  notice or guideline from ministry of FCTA”
translation.yo: "À ń rọ̣̣ gbogbo àwọ̣̣n olùdarí ilé-è̩kó̩ aládàáni láti jẹ́ kí ilé-è̩kó̩ wà ní títìpa, wọn kò gbọ̣̣̣dọ̣̣̀ gbìyànjú láti ṣí ilé-è̩kó̩ náà àfi tí àṣ̣ẹ̣̣ tàbí ìlànà bá wá láti ọ̀dọ̀ ilé-iṣ̣ẹ́ FCTA."

translation.en: All those that go against this rule shall face the wrath of law.
translation.yo: Gbogbo àwọ̣̣n tó bá tàpá ṣófin yìí ni yóò fojú winá òfin ìjọ̣̣ba.

translation.en: Marafa continued that Ministry of FCTA in charge of education has planned to start teaching by using the knowledge of internet, the use of television to teach the students in the period of lockdown.
translation.yo: Máràfá tẹ̀síwájú pé ilé-iṣ̣ẹ́ FCTA tí ó ń mójútó ètò ẹ̣̀kọ́ ti s̩e ètò láti bẹ̀rẹ̀ ètò ẹ̀kọ́ nípa lílo ìmọ̀ ayélujára, àti s̩ís̩e àmúlò te̩lifís̩àn láti fi kọ̣́ àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ní àkókò kónílé-gbélé.

translation.en: --- FULL TEXT OF PRESIDENT MUHAMMADU BUHARI’S NATIONWIDE BROADCAST
translation.yo: --- Ọ̀RỌ̀ ÀÀRẸ MUHAMMADU BUHARI LÓRI TE̩LIFÍS̩ÀN SỌ́MỌ NÀÌJÍRÍÀ

translation.en: ADDRESS BY H.E. MUHAMMADU BUHARI, PRESIDENT OF THE FEDERAL REPUBLIC OF NIGERIA ON THE CUMULATIVE LOCKDOWN ORDER OF LAGOS AND OGUN STATES AS WELL AS THE FEDERAL CAPITAL TERRITORY ON COVID- 19 PANDEMIC AT THE STATE HOUSE, ABUJA, MONDAY, 27th APRIL, 2020
translation.yo: Ọ̀RỌ̀ ÀÀRẸ ORÍLẸ̀-ÈDÈ NÀ̀ÌJÍRÍÀ, MUHAMMADU BUHARI, NÍPA ÒFIN KÓNÍLÉ-GBÉLÉ NÍ ÌPÍNLẸ̀ ÈKÓ, ÒGÙN ÀTI ÌLÚ ÀBÚJÁ, FCT, LÓRI  ÌTÀNKÁLẸ̀ ÀÀRÙN COVID- 19, NÍ ÈYÍ TÍ Ó WÁYÉ NÍ ÌLÚ ÀBÚJÁ LỌ́JỌ́ AJÉ, ỌJÓ̩ KẸTÀDÍNLỌ́GBỌ́N, OSÙ KẸRIN ,ỌDÚN 2020 (MONDAY, 27th APRIL, 2020).

translation.en: 1. Fellow Nigerians
translation.yo: 1.O̩mọ Nàìjíríà

translation.en: 2. I will start by commending you all for the resilience and patriotism that you have shown in our collective fight against the biggest health challenge of our generation.
translation.yo: 2.Màá bẹ̀rẹ̀ pè̩lú gbígbós̩ùbà fun yín nítorí ìwà akínkanjú àti ìjólóòótọ́ yín èyí tẹ s̩àfihàn nínú ìjà àjùmò̩jà sí ìpèníjà ìlera tó gajù, tó ń kojú ìran wa.

translation.en: 3. As at yesterday, 26th April 2020, some 3 million confirmed cases of COVID-19 have been recorded globally with about 900,000 recoveries. Unfortunately, some 200,000 people have passed away as a result of this pandemic.
translation.yo: 3.Níwòyí àná, 26th April 2020, àgbáyé s̩àwárí àwo̩n alárùn Covid-19 míĺiọ̣́nù mẹ́ta, tí ẹ̀ẹ́dẹ́gbààrún ló̩nà e̩gbè̩rún ènìyàn sì ti gbàwòsàn. Ó ṣeni láàánú pé igba ló̩nà e̩gbè̩rún ènìyàn ló tipasè̩ ààrùn náà papò̩dà.

translation.en: 4. The health systems and economies of many nations continue to struggle as a result of the coronavirus pandemic.
translation.yo: 4.Ètò ìlera àti ọrọ̀ ajé ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ orílẹ̀ èdè ni ó sì ń tiraka látàrí àjàkálẹ́ ààrùn kòkòrò kòrónà.

translation.en: 5. Nigeria continues to adapt to these new global realities on a daily basis. Today, I will present the facts as they are and explain our plans for the coming months fully aware that some key variables and assumptions may change in the coming days or weeks.
translation.yo: 5.Nàìjíríà ń tẹ̀síwájú láti máa mọ àwọn òótọ́ titun tó ń súyo̩ lágbàáyé lójoojúmó̩. Lónìí, n ó sọ àwọn òtítọ́ bó ṣe jẹ́, n ó sì ṣàl̀àyé àwọn ètò wa fún àwọn oṣu tó ń bọ̀ nígb̀atí a tí mọ̀ wípé àwọn ohun kan lè yípadà láwọn ọjọ́ àtọ̀sẹ̀ tó ń bọ̀.

translation.en: 6. Exactly two weeks ago, there were 323 confirmed cases in 20 States and the Federal Capital Territory.
translation.yo: 6.Ní déédé ọ̀sẹ̀ méjì sẹ́yìn, oníkòrónà okòóléló̩ò̩dúnrún lé mé̩ta ni wó̩n s̩àwárí nípìnínlè̩ ogún àti olú-ìlú.

translation.en: 7. As at this morning, Nigeria had recorded 1,273 cases across 32 States and the FCT. Unfortunately, this includes 40 deaths.
translation.yo: 7.`Lówùúrọ̀ yìí, Nàìjíríà ti lákọsílẹ̀ àádó̩rinlélè̩é̩gbé̩fà-lé-mé̩ta alárùn nípìnínlè̩ méjìlélọ́gbọ̀n àti olú-ìlú. Ó ṣeni láànú pé ogójì ló ti papòdà.

translation.en: 8. I am using this opportunity to express our deepest condolences to the families of all Nigerians that have lost their loved ones as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic. This is our collective loss and we share your grief.
translation.yo: 8.Mò ń lo àǹfààní yìí láti fi ìbánikẹ́dùn wa hàn pẹ̀lú àwọn ẹbí ọmọ orílè̩-èdè Nàìjíríà gbogbo tí wọ́n pàdánù àwọn olólùfẹ́ wọn látàrí àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn COVID-19. Èyí jẹ́ àdánù wa papọ̀, a sì pín nínú ìbànújẹ́ yín.

translation.en: 9. Initial models predicted that Nigeria will record an estimated 2,000 confirmed cases in the first month after the index case.
translation.yo: 9.Àwòye ìbè̩rè̩ ni pé Nàìjíríà máa ní e̩gbàá àko̩sílè̩ alárùn ní oṣù àkọ́kọ́ lé̩yìn tí wọ́n rí alárùn àkó̩kó̩.

translation.en: 10. This means that despite the increase in the number of confirmed cases recorded in the past two weeks, the measures we have put in place thus far have yielded positive outcomes against the projections.
translation.yo: 10.Èyí ni pé bí iye àwọn tí àyẹ̀wò so̩ pé wọ́n ní ààrùn kòrónà ní ọ̀sẹ̀ méjì sẹ́yìn ti pọ̀ tó, àwọn ohun ta ti ṣàgbékalè̩ ti mú èso rere jáde lòdì síwòye àná.

translation.en: 11. The proportion of cases imported from other countries has reduced to only 19% of new cases, showing that our border closures yielded positive results. These are mostly fellow Nigerians returning through our land borders. We will continue to enforce land border arrival protocols as part of the containment strategy.
translation.yo: 11.Iye alárùn kòrónà tó tòkè òkun wá ti dínkù sìdá mó̩kàndínlógún nínú o̩gó̩rùn-ún àwo̩n alárùn titun, èyí fihàn pé títi e̩nubodè sèso rere. Ò̩pò̩lo̩pò̩ ni àwo̩n o̩mo̩ Nàìjíríà  tó ń padabò̩ wálé. A ó tẹ̀síwájú nínú títe̩pe̩le̩ mó̩ ìlànà gbígba àwo̩n as̩è̩s̩è̩dé gé̩gé̩ bi ọ̀nà láti gbógun tààrùn yìí.

translation.en: 12. Today, the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) has accredited 15 laboratories across the country with an aggregate capacity to undertake 2,500 tests per day across the country.
translation.yo: 12.Lónìí, àjọ amójútó àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà ti fi ọwọ́ sí àwọn ilé ìyẹ̀wò mẹ́ẹ̀dógún tó lè ṣe àyẹ̀wò fún ènìyàn tó tó è̩é̩dé̩gbè̩tàlá lójúmọ́ jákèjádò orílẹ̀ èdè.

translation.en: 13. Based on your feedback, Lagos State Government and the FCT with support from NCDC have established several sample collection centers. They are also reviewing their laboratory testing strategy to further increase the number of tests they can perform including the accreditation of selected private laboratories that meet the accreditation criteria.
translation.yo: 13.Látàrí èsì yín, ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó àti ìlú Àbújá pẹ̀lú àtìlẹ́yìn àjọ agbógun ti àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn ti ṣe àgbékalẹ̀ ibùdó ìgbàyèwò onírúúurú. Wọ́n tún ṣàgbéyẹ̀wò ète ìs̩àyè̩wò ní àwo̩n yàrá àyè̩wò láti lè mú kí àyè̩wò s̩ís̩e pò̩ sí pè̩lú ibùdó àyè̩wò aládàáni tí ó kojú òs̩ùnwò̩n tí wó̩n fo̩wó̩sí.

translation.en: 14. Several new fully equipped treatment and isolation centres have been operationalised across the country thereby increasing bed capacity to about three thousand.
translation.yo: 14.Ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn ilé-ìtójú gidi àti ìbùdó ìyàsọ́tọ̀ titun tìbè̩rè̩ iṣẹ́ jákèjádò orílẹ̀-èdè yìí, èyí sì mú kí iye ìbùsùn fé̩ tó ẹgbẹ̀é̩dógún.

translation.en: 15. I commend the State Governors for the activation of State-level Emergency Operation Centres, establishment of new treatment centres and the delivery of aggressive risk communication strategies.
translation.yo: 15.Mo yin àwo̩n Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ fúndàásílẹ̀ ibùdó ìdásí ní pàjáwìrì nípìnínlẹ̀, ìdásílẹ̀ àwọn ibùdó ìtójú tuntun àti ète bíba àwo̩n ènìyàn sò̩rò̩ gidigidi lórí ewu tó wà.

translation.en: 16. Over 10,000 healthcare workers have been trained. For their protection, additional personal protective equipment have been distributed to all the states.
translation.yo: 16.E̩gbẹ̀rún mẹ́wàá òṣìṣẹ́ ìlera lé, la ti kọ́. Fún ààbò won, àwọn èlò ìdáàbòbò mìíràn la ti fi s̩o̩wó̩ sáwo̩n ìpínlẹ̀.

translation.en: 17. Although we have experienced logistical challenges, we remain committed to establishing a solid supply chain process to ensure these heroic professionals can work safely and are properly equipped.
translation.yo: 17.Nítòótọ́ a ti ní ìrírí àwọn ìpèníjà kan, a dúró digbi lóri s̩ís̩àgbékalè̩ ìpèsè tí ó múnádoko kí àwo̩n òs̩ìs̩é̩ yìí s̩is̩é̩ láìsí ewu pè̩lú ìs̩o̩ra pípé.

translation.en: 18. In keeping with our Government’s promise to improve the welfare of healthcare workers, we have signed a memorandum of understanding on the provision of hazard allowances and other incentives with key health sector professional associations.
translation.yo: 18.́Ni mímú ìlérí ìjọba wa ṣe láti mú kí ìgbé ayé àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ìlera wa dára si, a ti fi ọwọ́ sí ìwé àdéhùn olóye fún ìpèsè owó ìfẹ̀míwewu àti àwọn owó mìíràn pẹ̀lú àwọn ẹgbẹ́ akọ́ṣẹ́mọṣẹ́ ẹ̀ka ètò ìlera tí ó ṣe kókọ.

translation.en: 19. We have also procured insurance cover for 5,000 frontline health workers. At this point, I must commend the insurance sector for their support in achieving this within a short period of time.
translation.yo: 19.A ti s̩ètò ìdójútòfò fún àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ìlera tó ń léwájú bíi ẹgbẹ̀rún márùn-ún. Níkòóríta yìí mo gbọ́dọ̀ kí àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ adójútòfò fún àtìlẹyìn wọn ní ṣíṣe èyí láàrín àkókò díè.

translation.en: 20. Nigeria has also continued to receive support from the international community, multilateral agencies, the private sector and public-spirited individuals. This support has ensured that critical lifesaving equipment and materials, which have become scarce globally, are available for Nigeria through original equipment manufacturers and government-to-government processes.
translation.yo: 20.Nàìj́iríà sì ń gbàrànlọ́wọ́ láti àwọn orílẹ̀ àgbáyé láti àwọn ilé-iṣẹ́ káàkiri, ẹgbẹ́ aládàáni àti ẹnìkọ̀ọ̀kan. Àtìlẹyìn yìí ti jẹ́ káwọn irinṣẹ́ àtohun èlò ta fi ń dóòlà ẹ̀mí, èyí tó sò̩wọ́n ní àgbáyé ti wà fún Nàìjírị́à látipaṣẹ̀ àwọn àjọ tó ń ṣe irinṣẹ́ gidi àtètò ìjọba-sí-ìjọba.

translation.en: 21. The distribution and expansion of palliatives which I directed in my earlier broadcast is still on-going in a transparent manner. I am mindful of the seeming frustration being faced by expectant citizens. I urge all potential beneficiaries to exercise patience as we continue to fine tune our logistical and distribution processes working with the State Governments.
translation.yo: 21.Pínpín àti ìgbòòrò àwọn ohun ìtura lásìkò kónílé -gbélé tí mo sọ nínú ìkéde ìs̩áájú sì ń tẹ̀síwájú láìléèérú nínú. Mo mọ ìsúni tí àwọn ọmọ orílẹ-èdè yìí tó ń retí rẹ̀ ń kojú. Mo ṛo̩ gbogbo ẹ̀yin anípìn-ín nínú rẹ̀ láti ni ́sùúrù bí a ti ń wá ọ̀nà tó dára láti pín pẹ̀lu àwọn ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀.

translation.en: 22. Our Security Agencies continue to rise to the challenge posed by this unusual situation. While we feel deeply concerned about isolated security incidents, I want to assure all Nigerians that your safety and security remain our primary concern especially in these difficult and uncertain times.
translation.yo: 22.Àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ alábòò wa tẹ́síwájú láti dìde sípèníjà àsìkò ajo̩nilójú yìí. Bó tilè̩ jé̩ pé ìs̩è̩lè̩ ààbò ibùdó ìyàsó̩tò̩ dùn wá gan-an, mo fẹ́ fiyé ọmọ Nàìjíríà pé ààbò àti è̩s̩ó̩ yín jé̩ àkó̩kó̩ sí wa, pàápàá jùlọ ní àkókò líle òun àìmò̩ yìí.

translation.en: 23. As we focus on protecting lives and properties, we will not tolerate any human rights abuse by our security agencies. The few reported incidences are regrettable, and I want to assure you that the culprits will be brought to justice.
translation.yo: 23.Bá ṣe ń bójútó ààbò è̩mí àti dúkìá a kò ní fààyè gba ì-tẹ-ẹ̀tọ́-ọmọnìyàn mólẹ̀ láti ọ̀dọ̀ òṣìṣẹ́ aláàbò. Àwọn ìròyìn ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ díẹ̀ tá a gbọ́ jẹ́ èyí tó ṣeni láàánú, mo sì fẹ́ fi dáa yín lójú pé a ó mú àwọn ọ̀daràn náà láti kojú ìdájọ òfin.

translation.en: 24. I urge all Nigerians to continue to cooperate and show understanding whenever they encounter security agents. Furthermore, for their protection, I have instructed that the personnel of all the security agencies be provided with the necessary personal protective equipment against infection.
translation.yo: 24.Mo rọ gbogbo ọmọ Nàìjíríà láti tẹ̀síwájú nínú ìfọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ àti ìfòyehàn nínú ìpàdé wo̩n àti òṣìṣẹ́ aláàbò. Síwájú si, fún ààbò wọn, mo ti pàṣẹ pé kí wó̩n fún àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ aláàbò wọ̀nyí ní irinṣẹ́ ìdáàbòbò ara wo̩n lọ́wọ́ àkóràn ààrùn yìí.

translation.en: 25. As we continue to streamline our response in the centres of Lagos and the FCT, I am gravely concerned about the unfortunate developments in Kano in recent days. Although an in-depth investigation is still on-going, we have decided to deploy additional Federal Government manpower, material and technical resources to strengthen and support the State Government’s efforts, with immediate effect.
translation.yo: 25.Bá ti ń tẹ̀síwájú láti mú àdínkùn bá ìdáhùn wa láwọn ibùdó tÈkó àtÀbújá, ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ní Kánò láìpẹ́ yìí tún bàmí-nínú-jẹ́. Bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ìwá̀díi kíkún ń tẹ̀síwájú, a ti pinnu láti s̩àfikún òṣìṣẹ́ ìjọba àpapọ̀, ohun èlò àti ìrànwó̩ peléke láti kín àti s̩àtìlẹ́yìn akitiyan ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀, ní ló̩gán.

translation.en: 26. In Kano, and indeed many other States that are recording new cases, preliminary findings show that such cases are mostly from interstate travel and emerging community transmission.
translation.yo: 26.Ní Kánò, àti ìpínlẹ̀ yòókù tó ń s̩àkọsílẹ̀ alárùn tuntun, ìwádìí àkọ́kọ́ so pé àwọn èsì àyẹ̀wò yìí níí s̩e pè̩lú ìrìnàjò ìpínlẹ̀sípìnínlẹ̀ àti ìtànkálè̩ ààrùn nílùú kan.

translation.en: 27. Drawing from these, I implore all Nigerians to continue to adhere strictly to the advisories published by the Presidential Task Force and the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control.
translation.yo: 27.Lati inú èyí, mo rọ gbogbo ọmọ Nàìjíríà kí wọ́n ó tẹ̀síwájú láti máa tẹ̀lé ìmọ̀ràn àwọn ikọ̀ amúṣẹ́ṣe ààrẹ àti àwọn àjo tí ó ń mójútó ààrùn

translation.en: 28. These include regular hand washing, physical distancing, wearing of face masks/coverings in public, avoidance of non-essential movement and travels and avoidance of large gatherings.
translation.yo: 28.Àwọn èyí ni, fífọwọ́ lóòrèkóòrè, jíjìnà síra e̩ni, lílo ìbomú nígbangba, yíyàgò fún òde ìwò̩fún pè̩lú ìrìnàjò àti yíyàgò fún ìpéjọpọ̀ elérò púpọ̀.

translation.en: 29. Fellow Nigerians, for the past four weeks, most parts of our country have been under either Federal Government or State Government lockdown. As I mentioned earlier, these steps were necessary and overall, have contributed to slowing down the spread of COVID-19 in our country.
translation.yo: 29.Ẹ̣̣̀yin ọmo Nàìjíríà, fún bí ọ̀sẹ̀ mẹ́rin sẹ́yìn lọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ibì lórílẹ̀èdè wa lábẹ àṣẹ kónílégbélé ti ìjọba àpapọ̀ tàbí ti ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀. Bí mo s̩e sọ ṣáájú, àwọn ìgbésẹ̀ yìí ṣe pàtàkì àti pé ó tún kópa nínu mímú àdínkù bá ìtànkálè̩ Kòrónà lórílẹ̀èdè wa.

translation.en: 30. However, such lockdowns have also come at a very heavy economic cost. Many of our citizens have lost their means of livelihood. Many businesses have shut down. No country can afford the full impact of a sustained lockdown while awaiting the development of vaccines.
translation.yo: 30.Síbẹ̀síbẹ̀, irú àṣẹ kónílé gbélé náà ti wà pẹ̀lú ètò ìsúnná tó pọ̀. Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ọmọ orílẹ̀èdè wa ti pàdánù ọ̀nà ìjẹun. Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ iṣẹ́ ló ti dúró. Kò sí orílẹ̀èdè tó lè gba gbogbo àkóbá kónílé-gbélé se nígbà à ń retí èsì ayò̩ lórí abẹ́rẹ́ àjẹsára.

translation.en: 31. In my last address, I mentioned that Federal Government will develop strategies and policies that will protect lives while preserving livelihoods.
translation.yo: 31.Nínú ọ̀rọ̀ àsọkẹ́yìn, mo ní ìjọba àpapọ yóò ṣàgbékalẹ̀ ète àti òfin tí yóò dáàbòbò è̩mí á sì ló̩ràá ìgbé-ayé.

translation.en: 32. In these two weeks, the Federal and State Governments have jointly and collaboratively worked hard on how to balance the need to protect health while also preserving livelihoods, leveraging global best practices while keeping in mind our peculiar circumstances.
translation.yo: 32.Láàrín ọ̀sẹ̀ méjì yìí, ìjọba àpapọ àti ìpínlẹ̀ ti ṣiṣẹ́ takuntakun papọ̀ lóríi ọ̀nà láti ṣe ìdó̩ó̩gba dídábòòbò ìlera àti tító̩jú ìgbé ayé, ní ìdó̩gba pẹ̀lu bí wọ́n ti ń ṣe ní gbàáyé pẹ̀lu ìrántí awon ohun ìyàtọ̀ wa.

translation.en: 33. We assessed how our factories, markets, traders and transporters can continue to function while at the same time adhering to NCDC guidelines on hygiene and social distancing.
translation.yo: 33.A ṣàgbéyẹ̀wò bí àwọn ilé-iṣẹ, ọjà, oníṣòwò àti àwọn awakọ̀ wa ṣe leè tèsíwájú nínú ṣiṣẹ́ bákan náà kí wọ́n tèlé ìlànà àjo̩ amójútó ààrùn lórílèèdè yìí làkalè̩ lórí ìmó̩tótó àti jíjìnnà síra e̩ni.

translation.en: 34. We assessed how our children can continue to learn without compromising their health.
translation.yo: 34.A ṣe àgbéyẹ̀wò ìtẹ̀síwájú ìké̩kò̩ó̩ àwo̩n o̩mo̩ wa láì s̩e àkóbá ìlera wo̩n.

translation.en: 35. We reviewed how our farmers can safely plant and harvest in this rainy season to ensure our food security is not compromised. Furthermore, we also discussed how to safely transport food items from rural production areas to industrial processing zones and ultimately, to the key consumption centres.
translation.yo: 35. A yiiri ò̩nà tí àwo̩n àgbè̩ wa s̩e lè gbìn kí wó̩n sì kórè ní àkókò òjò kí á lè rip é ìpèsè oúnje̩ kò ní àkóbá. Síwájú sí, a tún sò̩rò̩ lóri ìgbóúnje̩ aláìléwu láti ìgbèríko lo̩ sí àwo̩n ilé-iṣẹ́ ìs̩ááyan rẹ̀ àti ibùdó ìje̩un gbòógì.

translation.en: 36. Our goal was to develop implementable policies that will ensure our economy continues to function while still maintaining our aggressive response to the COVID-19 pandemic. These same difficult decisions are being faced by leaders around the world.
translation.yo: 36.Àfojúsùn wa ni ká wá ò̩nà tá á lò ti yóò jé̩ kí o̩rò̩ ajé wa máa tè̩síwájú nígbà tí à ń wá ìdáhùn atè̩wò̩n sájàákálè̩ ààrùn kòrónà. Ìpinnu líle yìí làwo̩n olórí gbogbo lágbàááyé ń dojúko̩.

translation.en: 37. Based on the above and in line with the recommendations of the Presidential Task Force on COVID-19, the various Federal Government committees that have reviewed socio-economic matters and the Nigeria Governors Forum, I have approved a phased and gradual easing of lockdown measures in FCT, Lagos and Ogun States effective from Monday, 4th May, 2020.
translation.yo: 37.Nítorí èyí àti ìyànjú àwọn ikọ̀ ààrẹ lórí COVID-19, orísirísi ìgbìmọ̀ ìjọba àpapọ tó ti gbé ọ̀rọ̀ ìsúnná yẹ̀wò àti ìgbìmọ̀ àwọn gómìnà Nàìjíríà, mo ti fọwọ́ sí kí òfin kónílé-gbélé nílùú Àbújá, Èkó, àti ìpínlẹ̀ Ògùn kí ó máa lọlẹ̀ díẹ̀díẹ̀ kí ó sì bè̩rè̩ láti ọjọ́ ajé, ọjọ́ kẹrin, oṣù karùn-ún, 2020.

translation.en: 38. However, this will be followed strictly with aggressive reinforcement of testing and contact tracing measures while allowing the restoration of some economic and business activities in certain sectors.
translation.yo: 38.Síbè̩, àyè̩wò s̩is̩é àti s̩ís̩àwárí àwo̩n alábàápàdé alárùn kòrónà yóò máa lo̩ ní kánkán, a ó sì mú ìpadàbòsípò bá ètò ọrọ̀ ajé àtokòòwò láwo̩n ibì kan.

translation.en: 39. Furthermore, new nationwide measures are to be introduced as follows;
translation.yo: 39.Síwájú síi, òfin tuntun táa s̩àgbékalè̩ káàkiri orílèèdè nìwọ̀nyí;

translation.en: a. There will be an overnight curfew from 8pm to 6am. This means all movements will be prohibited during this period except for essential services;
translation.yo: a.Àkókò àìjáde wà láti 8am si 6am. Èyí túmọ̀ sí wípé rírìn káàkiri yóò di èèwọ̀ láàrin àkókò yìí àfi àwọn òs̩ìs̩é̩ pàtàkì.

translation.en: b. There will be a ban on non-essential inter-state passenger travel until further notice;
translation.yo: b.Kò ní sááyè fún ìrìnàjò aláìs̩epàtàkì láarin ìpínlẹ̀síìpínlẹ̀ títí di àkókò àìmò̩.

translation.en: c. Partial and controlled interstate movement of goods and services will be allowed for the movement of goods and services from producers to consumers; and
translation.yo: c.Gbígbé ẹrù alámòójútó láàrin ìpínlẹ̣̀síìpínlẹ̀ yóò wà díẹ̀ láti leè máa gbé àwọn ẹrù láti ilé-iṣé lọ sọ́dọ̀ àwọn tí yóò lò wọn.

translation.en: d. We will strictly ensure the mandatory use of face masks or coverings in public in addition to maintaining physical distancing and personal hygiene. Furthermore, the restrictions on social and religious gatherings shall remain in place. State Governments, corporate organisations and philanthropists are encouraged to support the production of cloth masks for citizens.
translation.yo: d.A ó ri dájú wípé a fi dandan sí lílo ìbòjú ní ìta pẹ̀lú bí a ṣe ń fi ààyè sáàrín ara wa àti ìmọ́tótó. Ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀, àwọn onílé iṣẹ́ ńlá àti àwọn ẹlẹ́yinjú àánú la rọ̀ láti ṣe ìrànwọ ní pípèsè àwọn aso ìbòmú fún àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè yí.

translation.en: 40. For the avoidance of doubt, the lockdown in the FCT, Lagos and Ogun States shall remain in place until these new ones come into effect on Monday, 4th May 2020.
translation.yo: 40.Nítorí iyèméjì, òfin kónílé-gbélé nílùú Àbújá, ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó àti Ògùn yóò wà títí di ìgbà tí àwọn òfin mìíràn yóó fi bẹ̀ẹ̀rẹ̀ lỌ́jọ́ ajé, ọjọ́ kẹrin oṣù karùn-ún, 2020.

translation.en: 41. The Presidential Task Force shall provide sector specific details to allow for preparations by Governments, businesses and institutions.
translation.yo: 41.Àwọn ikọ̀ ààrẹ yóò pèsè àwọn àlàyé kan fún ìmúra sílẹ̀ ìjọba, àwọn olókoòwò àti ilé iṣẹ́.

translation.en: 42. In respect to the above guidelines, State Governors may choose to adapt and expand based on their unique circumstances provided they maintain alignment with the guidelines issued above.
translation.yo: 42.Níbàámu àwọn ìlànà òkè wò̩nyí, ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ leè yàn láti faramọ́ àti láti fẹ̀ẹ́ lójú sii lórí onírúurú ìs̩è̩lè̩ àrò̩ò̩tò̩ tó bá súyo̩ kí wọ́n sáà ti wà níbàámu pẹ̀lú ìlànà àgbékalè̩ yìí.

translation.en: 43. To support our businesses and traders, the monetary and fiscal authorities shall deploy all the necessary provisions needed for production to continue and thus, jobs restored.
translation.yo: 43.Láti s̩èrànwó fún olókoòwò àtàwọn ọlọ́jà wa, àwọn tó wà nídìí owó yóò darí ìpèsè tó yẹ kíṣẹ́ leè tẹ̀síwájú, ká sì múṣẹ́ padàbò̩ sípò.

translation.en: 44. These revised guidelines will not apply to Kano State.
translation.yo: 44.Àwọn ìlànà wọ̀nyí kò ní kan ìpínlẹ̀ Kano.

translation.en: 45. With regards to Kano, I have directed the enforcement of a total lockdown for a period of two weeks effective immediately. The Federal Government shall deploy all the necessary human, material and technical resources to support the State in controlling and containing the pandemic and preventing the risk of further spread to neighboring States.
translation.yo: 45.Níti ìpínlẹ̀ Kano, mo ti pàṣẹ kónílé-gbélé pátápátá fún òṣẹ̀ méjì ní kíákíá. Ìjọba àpapọ̀ yóò kó àwọn ènìyàn, ohun èlò àti àwọn irinṣẹ́ tí wọ́n nílò láti ran ìpínlẹ̀ náà lọ́wọ́ ní kíkápá àti bíborí àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn kòrónà yìí pè̩lú dídènà rè̩ láti máa ràn lọ sí àwọn ìpínlẹ̀ tó múlé tìí.

translation.en: 46. I wish to once again, commend the frontline workers across the country who, on a daily basis, risk everything to ensure we win this fight. For those who got infected in the line of duty, rest assured that Government will do all it takes to support you and your families during this exceedingly difficult period. I will also take this opportunity to assure you all that your safety, wellbeing and welfare remain paramount to our Government.
translation.yo: 46.Léèkan si, mo fẹ́ káwọn òṣìṣẹ́ tó ń léwájú jákèjádò orílèèdè yìí, àwọn tí wọ́n ń fi ohun gbogbo wéwu lójojúmọ́ láti borí ìjà yìí. Sáwọn tó kó ààrùn lójú iṣẹ́ wọn, ẹ fọkànbalẹ̀ wípé ìjọba yóò ṣohun gbogbo tó gbà láti ràn ẹ̀yin àti ẹbí yín lọ́wọ́ lákòókò tó le rékọjá yìí. Mo tún fẹ́ lo àǹfàní yìí láti fi dáa yín lójú wípé ààbò àti ìgbé-ayé àlàáfíà yín ló jẹ ìjọba yìí lógún.

translation.en: 47. I will also recognize the support we have received from our traditional rulers, the Christian Association of Nigeria, the Nigerian Supreme Council for Islamic Affairs and other prominent religious and community leaders. Your cooperation and support have significantly contributed to the successes we have recorded to date.
translation.yo: 47.Mo tún mo rírì àtìlẹyìn ta ti rígbà láti ọ̀dọ̀ àwọn Ọba wa, àwọn ẹgbẹ́ ọmọlẹ́yìn Krístì ní Nàìjíríà, àjọ tó gajù tó ń rí sí Islam àti àwọn àjọ ẹlẹ́sìn pẹ̀lú àwọn olórí agbègbè. Ìfọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ àti àtìlẹyìn yín  ti ran àseyọrí tí a ní lọ́wó

translation.en: 48. I will urge you all to please continue to create awareness on the seriousness of the coronavirus among your worshippers and communities while appealing that they strictly comply with public health advisories.
translation.yo: 48.Màá rọ gbogbo yín láti jọ̀wọ́ tẹ̀síwájú láti máa sọ̀rọ̀ lórí ààrùn Kòrónà ní àárín àwọn olùjọ́sìn àti àwọn olùgbé agbègbè yín wípé kí wọ́n kíyèsí gbogbo ìmọ̀ràn àti ìmọ́tótó láwùjọ.

translation.en: 49. I also thank the Nigeria Governors’ Forum and the Presidential Task Force for all their hard work to date. Through this collaboration, I remain confident that success is achievable.
translation.yo: 49.Mo dúpẹ̣́ lọ̣́wọ́ ẹ̣̣gbẹ̣́ àwọ̣n gómìnà, ikò̩ ìgbìmọ̀ ìjọba àpapọ̀ amójútó ààrùn COVID-19 fún iṣ̣ẹ́ ribiribi títí dòní. Pẹ̣̀lú ìfọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ yìí, mo ní ìdánilójú pé, àseyọrí yóò wà.

translation.en: 50. I also wish to thank corporate organizations, philanthropists, the UN system, the European Union, friendly nations, the media and other partners that have taken up the responsibility of supporting our response.
translation.yo: 50.Mo tún fẹ́ dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ àwọ̣̣n ilé-iṣ̣ẹ́ ńlá, aláàánú, àjọ̣ ìṣ̣ọ̣̣kan àgbáyé, àjọ̣ aláwọ̀ funfun, ọ̣̀rẹ́ orílèèdè yìí, akọ̣̣ròyìn àtàwọ̣̣n olùrànlọ̣́wọ́ wa fún àtìlẹ́yìn tí wọ̣̣n ń ṣ̣̣e fún wa.

translation.en: 51. And finally, I will thank all Nigerians again for your patience and cooperation during this difficult and challenging period. I assure you that government shall continue to take all necessary measures to protect the lives and livelihoods of our citizens and residents.
translation.yo: 51.Nípàárí, màá tún dúpẹ́ lọ̣́wọ́ gbogbo àwọ̣̣n ọ̣̣mọ̣ Nàìjíríà lé̩è̩kan si fún sùúrù àti ìfọ̣̣wọ̣́sowọ̣́pọ̀ lásìkò ìpèníjà yìí. Mo fi da yín lójú pé ìjọ̣̣ba yóò sa gbogbo ipá rẹ̀ láti gbégbèésẹ̀ nípa dídáàbò bò ẹ̀mí àtìwàláàyè gbogbo tonílé-tàlejò orílèèdè yìí.

translation.en: 52. I thank you for listening and may God bless the Federal Republic of Nigeria
translation.yo: 52.Mo dúpẹ́ pé ẹ fetí sílẹ̀ fún mi, kỌ̣lọ́run bùkún fún orílèèdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: --- Security of Nigerians remains a primary concern – President Buhari
translation.yo: --- Ààbò ọ̣̣mọ̣ Nàìjíríà ló jẹ̣ mí lógún jùlọ – Ààrẹ Buhari

translation.en: The Nigerian President, Muhammadu Buhari has stated that the safety and security of Nigerians remains a primary concern of his administration “especially in these difficult and uncertain times”.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ orílèèdè Nàìjíríà, Muhammadu Buhari ti sọ pé ètò ààbò ọmọ orílèèdè Nàìjíríà ló jẹ òun lógún jùlọ "pàápàá jùlọ̣ ní àsìkò tí ìpèníjà àti àìròtẹ́lẹ̀ wọ̀nyí wà".

translation.en: The President stated this in his nationwide broadcast to Nigerians on Monday the 27th of April, 2020.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ̣ sọ̀yí lórí te̩lifís̩àn lásìkò tó ń bá ọ̣̣mọ̣ Nàìjíríà sọ̣̀rọ̀ lọ̣́jọ́ Ajé, 27th of April, 2020.

translation.en: President Buhari stated that even as his administration focuses on protecting lives and properties, it would not tolerate any human rights abuse by security agencies.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Buhari níjọ̀ó̩ba òun rí sáàbò ẹ̣̀mí àti dúkìá àwọ̣̣n ènìyàn, ìjọba òun kò sì ní fààyè gba ìwà títẹ̣ ẹ̣̀tọ́ọ̣̣́mọ̣̣nìyàn lójú látọ̣wọ́ àwọ̣̣n agbófinró.

translation.en: “The few reported incidences are regrettable, and I want to assure you that the culprits will be brought to justice,” the President vowed.
translation.yo: "Ìròyìn tí mo gbọ́ banújẹ́ lọ̣̣́pọ̣̀lọ̣̣pọ̣̀, mo fi ń dá ọmọ orílèèdè Nàìjíríà lójú pé, àwọn ẹ̣̣lẹ̣́sẹ̀ kò ní lọ̣ láìjìyà lábẹ́ òfin."

translation.en: The President urged Nigerians to continue to cooperate and show understanding whenever they encounter security agents.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ wá rọ̣ gbogbo ọ̣̣mọ̣ orílèèdè Nàìjíríà láti fọ̣̣wọ̣́sowọ̣́pọ̣̀ pẹ̣̣̀lú àwọ̣̣n agbófinró lásìkò ìpàdé pè̩lú wọ̣̣n.

translation.en: --- COVID-19: President Buhari orders total lockdown of Kano
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: Ààrẹ Buhari pàṣ̣ẹ ètò kónílé-gbélé nípìnínlẹ̀ Kánò

translation.en: Nigerian President Muhammadu Buhari has ordered the total lockdown of Kano State North West Nigeria following the mysterious deaths recorded in the state.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ̣ Nàìjíríà, Muhammadu Buhari ti pàṣ̣ẹ kétò kónílé-gbélé bẹ̣̀rẹ̀ nípìnínlẹ̀ Kánò, Àríwá Ìwọ̣̀-Oòrùn Nàìjíríà látàrí báwọ̣̣n ènìyàn se ń kúkú òjijì nípìnínlẹ̀ náà.

translation.en: The President who announced this in a nationwide broadcast added that the lockdown would be in place for two weeks with immediate effect.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Buhari so̩ ọ̣̀rọ̣̀ yíi lórí ẹ̣̀rọ̣ a-móhùn-máwòrán pé ètò kónílé-gbélé ọ̣̀hún yóò wà fún ọ̣̀sẹ̀ méjì gbáko ní kánkán, ní ìpínlẹ̣̀ Kánò.

translation.en: “The Federal Government shall deploy all the necessary human, material and technical resources to support the State in controlling and containing the pandemic and preventing the risk of further spread to neighboring States” President Buhari stated.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ̣ tún sọ̣ pé "Ìjọ̣̣ba àpapọ̀ yóò fàwọ̣̣n irinṣ̣ẹ́ àti òṣ̣ìṣ̣ẹ́ ránsẹ́ sí ìpínlẹ̀ Kánò láti ran ìpínlẹ̀ ọ̀hún lọ̣́wọ̣́, lọ̣́nà àtidẹ̣́kun ààrùn Kòrónà, kó má baà tàn lọ̣ sí ìpínlẹ̀ mìíràn tó sún mọ́ wọ̣̣n."

translation.en: He explained that preliminary findings in Kano and other states show that new cases are mostly from interstate travel and emerging community transmission,
translation.yo: Ààrẹ̣ tún sọ̣ pé àwọ̣̣n arìnrìnàjò láti ìpínlẹ̀ kan lọ̣ sí ìpínlẹ̀ mìíràn ló fa ìtànkálẹ̀ ààrùn tí ó wáyé ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kánò.

translation.en: --- NIS receives 13 Nigerian returnees from Togo
translation.yo: --- NIS gbo̩mọ̣̣̣̣ Nàìjíríà mẹ́tàlá tó ń ti Tógò bò̩

translation.en: The Nigeria Immigration Service (NIS) says it had received 13 Nigerians that arrived from Lome, Togo at Seme-Krake joint border post.
translation.yo: Ile-iṣ̣ẹ́ amójútó arìnrìnàjò Nàìjíríà (NIS) ní àwọ̣̣n ọ̣̣mọ̣ orílèèdè yìí mẹ́tàlá làwọ̣̣n ti rí gbà láti orílèèdè Lòmè, Tógò àti Seme-Krake.

translation.en: The Spokesman, NIS, Mr Sunday James who disclosed this in a statement on Sunday in Abuja said that the returnees were technicians that went to install Industrial Machines in Togo.
translation.yo: Agbẹnusọ̣ NIS náà, ọ̣̀gbẹ́ni Sunday James ló sọ̣̣̀yí nínú àtẹ̣̀jáde kan lọ̣́jọ́ Àìkú nílùú Àbújá, láwọ̣̣n tó padà wá sílé jẹ́ akọ́sẹ́mọsẹ́ tí wọ̣̣n lọ̣ ṣ̣iṣ̣ẹ́ nílées̩ẹ́ kan ni Tógò.

translation.en: According to James, the 13 returnees have been handed over to officials of the Ministry of Health in Lagos for medical test.
translation.yo: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọ̣̀gbẹ́ni James ṣ̣e ṣ̣ọ, ó làwọ̣̣n ènìyàn mẹ́tàlá ọ̣̀hún ni wọ̣́n ti fà fún eléètò ìlera Èkó fún àyẹ̣̀wò Corona.

translation.en: “Also for isolation in line with NCDC directives on medical procedures for new arrivals into the country to curtail the spread of Corona Virus,” he said.
translation.yo: Ó ní, "Bákan náà la tún sọ̣ fún wọ̣̣n pé kí wọ̣̣́n wà nígbèèélé gẹ́gẹ́ bílànà àjọ̣ agbógun tàjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn (NCDC) ṣ̣̣e làá sílẹ̀ fún àwọ̣̣n tí wọ̣́n bá ṣ̣ẹ̣̀ṣẹ̀ dé láti ilẹ̀ òkèèrè, lèyí láti dẹ́kun ààrùn Corona."

translation.en: James said that Seme-Krake was a major entry-exit point into and out of Nigeria, bordering Benin Republic, adding that NIS was not taking chances in enforcing strict border patrol.
translation.yo: James lẹ́nubodè Seme-Krake jẹ́ ojú ọ̀nà tó gba Nàìjíríà wọ̣̣lé tàbí jáde, tó sì tún pààlà pẹ̀lú orílèèdè Benin. Ó ní NIS kò káàrẹ́ láti mójútó àwọ̣̣n ẹ̣nubodè wọ̀nyí.

translation.en: He said that the service would apprehend anyone that wanted to circumvent the approved routes, hence the numbers that have been turning up through the Seme-Krake border post since the border closure.
translation.yo: Ó ní NIS máa mú àwọ̣̣̣n tí ó bá fẹ́ gba ọ̀nà ẹ̀bùrú láti wọ̣̣̣lé sí orílè̩ èdè Nàìjíríà, nítorí náà iye àwo̩n tó ń gba e̩nu ibodè Seme-Krake ti peléke si.

translation.en: He said that the NIS Comptroller General, Mr Muhammad Babandede has advised the returnees to avoid following bush paths to avoid the experience of suffering in the hands of criminals in an effort to follow unrecognized routes risking.
translation.yo: Ó ní adarí NIS gbogboòògbò, ìye̩n ọ̀gbẹ́ni Muhammad Bàbándédè ti rọ̣ àwọ̣̣n arìnrìnàjò tó ń padabò̩ wá sí orílèèdè Nàìjíríà láti ṣ̣ọ̣́ra nípa gbígba ọ̀nà ẹ̀bùrú, nítorí àwọ̣n ọ̀daràn àti oníṣẹ́-ibi tí ó leè ṣe wọ̣̣̣́n ní ìjàmbá.

translation.en: --- President Buhari to address the nation at 19:00hrs GMT
translation.yo: --- Ààrẹ Buhari yóò bọ́mọ orílèèdè sọ̀rọ̀ lágogo mẹ́jọ àsálẹ́.

translation.en: President Muhammadu Buhari will address the nation today  Monday, April 27, at 19:00hrs GMT (8pm local time).
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari yóò bá o̩mo̩ orílèèdè Nàìjíríà sọ̣̀rọ̣̀ lónìí Mó̩ńdè, April 27, ni aago mé̩jo̩ alé̩.

translation.en: Television, radio and other electronic media stations are enjoined to hook up to the network services of the Nigerian Television Authority (NTA) and Federal Radio Corporation of Nigeria (FRCN) respectively for the broadcast.
translation.yo: Àwo̩n ilé-is̩é̩ Te̩lifís̩àn, Rédíò àti àwọn ẹ̀rọ agbóhùnsáfé̩fé̩ mìíràn ni wó̩n rò̩ láti darapọ̀ mọ́ ẹ̀rọ alátagbà amóhùnmáwòrán ti àkó̩kó̩ ní orílè̩ èdè Nàìjíríà (NTA) àti asọ̀rọ̀mágbèsì ìjọba àpapọ̀ (FRCN) fún ìkéde yìí.

translation.en: Voice of Nigeria will also live-tweet the broadcast.
translation.yo: Ohun Nàìjíríà náà yóò gbesáfé̩fé̩ lórí ẹ̀rọ abẹ́yẹfò.

translation.en: Follow for updates on VON Social Media handles:
translation.yo: Ẹ tèlé wa lórí VON Social Media handles:

translation.en: --- President Buhari will address Nation today: will the president call put an end to the lockdown or add more days.
translation.yo: --- Ààrẹ Buhari yóò bá Nàìjíríà ṣ̣ọ̣̀rọ̀ lónìí: Ǹjẹ́ ààrẹ yóò fòpin ṣí òfin kónílé -gbélè tàbí yóò tún fi ọjọ́ kún un

translation.en: The president of Nigeria Muhammadu Buhari will address Nigerians today by 8pm, Monday 27th of April, 2020.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Nàìjíríà, Muhammadu Buhari yóò máa bá orílèèdè Nàìjíríà sọ̣̀rọ̣̀ lónìí yìí, Monday, April 27, 2020 ni 8pm.

translation.en: All Nigerians want to listen to what the President wants to say about the lockdown.
translation.yo: Gbogbo ọ̣mọ̣̣ Nàìjíríà ni wọ̣́n fẹ́ gbọ́ ohun tíi ààrẹ Buhari yóò sọ̣ nípa ètò kónílégbélé.

translation.en: The assistant to the president on media announce this.
translation.yo: Olùrànlọ̣́wọ́ ààrẹ lórí ìròyìn àti ìkéde ló kéde yìí.

translation.en: --- Reps to resume plenary April 28
translation.yo: --- Ilé-ìgbìmọ̀ aṣ̣ojú yóò padà sẹ̣́nusẹ́ ní April 28

translation.en: The Nigerian House of Representatives is to resume plenary on Tuesday after over one month suspension over the Covid-19 pandemic in the country.
translation.yo: Ilé-ìgbìmọ̀ aṣ̣ojú Nàìjíríà yóò padà ṣ̣ẹ̣́nuṣ̣ẹ́ ló̩jó̩ ìs̩e̩gun lẹ̣́yìn ìsinmi oṣ̣̣ù kan tí wọ̣́n wà látàrí ààrùn Covid-19 tó ṣ̣ẹ̣̣lẹ̀ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: The Lawmakers had on March 24th suspended plenary for two weeks to allow the management of the National Assembly put safety measures that would prevent the spread of the deadly disease in the Complex, but one week later government impose a lock down on Abuja the Nation’s capital and two other States, worst hit by the disease to curb its spread.
translation.yo: Lọ̣́jọ́ kẹ̣̣rìnlélógún, oṣ̣ù kẹ̣̣ta nilé ìgbìmọ̀ asojú kọ́kọ́ bẹ̣̣̀rẹ̀ ìsinmi ọlọ́sẹ̀ méjì wọ̣́n láti leè jẹ́ kígbìmọ̀ tó ń mójútó ilé –asòfin pèsè ààbò tó múnádóko tí yóò dẹ̣́kun ìtànkálẹ̀ ààrùn COIVD-19 nilé-asòfin ọ̀hún sùgbọ̣́n lẹ̣́yìn ọ̣̀sẹ̀ kan tí wọ́n bẹ̀rẹ̀ ìsinmi nìjọba àpapọ̀ pàsẹ pé kí ètò kónílé-gbélé bẹ̣̀rẹ̀ nílùú Àbújá àtàwọ̣n ìpínlẹ̀ méjì táàrùn COIVD-19 ń bá wọ̀yá ìjà.

translation.en: A statement from the Clerk to the House of Representatives, Mr. Patrick Giwa advised members to take note and abide by the Covid-19 Guidelines approved by the Federal Government and the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) and additional Guidelines developed by the House which will be sent to Members.
translation.yo: Nínú àtẹ̀jáde kan tákọ̀wé ilé-ìgbìmọ̀ asojú ọ̀hún, ọ̀gbẹ́ni Patrick Gíwá gbéjáde láti gbàwọ̣̣n ọ̣̣mọ̣̣ ìgbìmọ̀ aṣ̣ojú náà nímọ̀ràn láti tẹ̣̣̀lé ètò ìlànà tíjọ̣̣ba àpapọ̀ àtàjọ̣̣ tó ń gbógun tàjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn ní Nàìjíríà là sílẹ̀ àtètò ìlànà tílé-ìgbìmọ̀ aṣ̣ojú làà sílẹ̀, léyìí táwọ̣̣n yóò fi ránṣ̣ẹ́ sáwọ̣̣n ọ̣̣mọ̣̣ ilé-ìgbìmọ̀ asojú ọ̣̣̀hún.

translation.en: However the statement directed that Members’ aides and Staff of the National Assembly to work from home and “will be notified when needed in the office for any special assignment.”
translation.yo: Àtẹ̣̣̀jáde náà ní káwọ̣̣n olùrànlọ̣̣́wọ̣̣́ àtòṣ̣ìṣ̣ẹ́ ilé-ìgbìmọ̀ aṣ̣òfin sì dúró sílé láti máa ṣ̣iṣ̣ẹ́ wọ̣̣n àti pé "a ó pè wọ̣̣́n ta bá nílò ìrànlọ́wọ́ wọ̣̣n fúnsẹ́ pàtàkì kan níléesẹ́."

translation.en: On resumption, the lawmakers are expected to focus on measures to strengthen the fight against the pandemic as well as its impact on the Nation’s economy.
translation.yo: Táwọ̣n ọ̣̣mọ̣̣ ilé –ìgbìmọ̀ aṣ̣ojú ọ̀hún bá wọ̣̣lé, wọ̣̣n yóò máa jíròrò lórí ìgbésẹ̀ láti gbógun ti ààrùn Corona àti lórí ètò ọ̣̀rọ̣̀ ajẹ́ orílèèdè yìí.

translation.en: --- Federal government had been studying the case in Kano State- Minister
translation.yo: --- Ìjọba àpapọ̣̣̀ ń ṣe ìwádìí alárùn kòrónà ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kánò- Mínísítà

translation.en: Minister for health in Nigeria, Osagie Ehanire said the federal government and Kano state government had been studying the case in Kano State with their authorities, adding that the ministry would be sending high ranking fact finding missions there.
translation.yo: Mínísítà fún ètò ìlera ní orílè̩ èdè Nàìjíríà, Osagie Ehanire, ti sọ pé ìjọ̣̣ba àpapọ̣̣̀ àti ìjọ̣̣ba ìpínlẹ̀ Kánò ti ń s̩e ìwádìí ní Kano pè̩lú às̩e̩ wo̩n, ó ní ilé-is̩é ò̩hún yóò rán àwo̩n adarí awérìí nínú ìwádìí.

translation.en: Ehanire said that the fact finding mission would meet with the governor to be able to diagnose the situation, adding it was not really clear if they were COVID-19 related.
translation.yo: Ehanire ní ikò̩ tó ń s̩is̩é̩ ìwé̩rìí nínú ìwádìí yóò ṣ̣e ìpàdé pẹ̣̣̀lú gómìnà Kánò láti so̩ irú ìs̩è̩lè̩ ọ̀hún, ó sì fi kún-un pé kò dájú pé kòrónà ni.

translation.en: Ehanire said that the fact finding mission would also looked at if there would be room for improvement in the state’s response activities on COVID-19, like surveillance, testing, case finding, contact tracing and isolation.
translation.yo: Ehanire tún láwọ̣̣n ikọ̀ náà yóò máa ṣàyẹ̀wò, ìyàsọ̣́tọ̀, ìtọpinpin àwọ̣̣n alárùn ọ̀hún, láti mọ̀nà tí wọ̣̣n yóò gbà láti métò ìdàgbàsókè báwọ̣̣n ètò ìlànà àti yàrá àyẹ̀wò tó ti wá ní ìpínlẹ̀ náà.

translation.en: “Kano does not have experience with COVID-19 and the rate it has exploded should be of concern to all.
translation.yo: "Kánò kò nírìírí nípa ààrùn COVID-19 tẹ̣́lẹ̣̀rí, ìyàlẹ̣̣́nu ló sì ye̩ kó jẹ́ fún wa báàrùn COVID-19 se tànkálẹ̀."

translation.en: ”It is possible to be able to contain it, if the right processes are followed and the right resources are brought in.
translation.yo: Ó se é se, kí a leè dẹ́kun ààrùn yìí tí a bá lo àwọ̣̣n irinṣẹ́ àti àwọ̣̣n ènìyàn tó múná-dóko.

translation.en: The minister said Lagos which is more populated like Kano has efficient instruments and that Lagos state act fast in fighting corona virus because of the experience during Ebola crisis in 2014.
translation.yo: Mínísítà ní Èkó tó lérò bíi ìpínlẹ̀ Kánò láwọ̣̣n irinṣ̣ẹ́ tó múnádóko àti pé ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó tètè dojúkọ̣̣ ààrùn Corona nítorí ìrírí tí wọ̣̣́n ní nípa ààrùn Èbólà tó ṣ̣ẹ̣̣lẹ̀ lọ́dún 2014.

translation.en: Minister continued that the materials and instrument that Kano state have, though  they are trying their best, Lagos state cannot be compared with Kano state, because the workers and the instrument that Lagos have, Kano does not have such.
translation.yo: Mínísítà tẹ̣̣̀síwájú pé àwọ̣̣n èròjà àti irinṣ̣ẹ́ típìnínlẹ̀ Kánò ní, bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé wọ̣́n ń gbìyànju, a kò le fi ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó wé ìpínlẹ̀ Kánò, nítorí pé àwọ̣̣n òṣ̣ìṣ̣é àtirinṣ̣ẹ́ tí ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó ní, ìpínlẹ̀ Kánò kò níi.

translation.en: Ehanire said forty (40) health workers have been infected with corona virus in Nigeria, but they were not infected on duty.
translation.yo: Ehanire ní ogójì òṣ̣ìṣ̣ẹ́ ètò ìlera ni wọ̣̣̣́n ti láárùn kòrónà ní Nàìjíríà, s̩ùgbó̩n ibi-is̩é̩ kó̩ ni wó̩n ti kó o.

translation.en: --- President Buhari will determine when to lift lockdown – Minister
translation.yo: --- Ààrẹ Buhari ló lè yóhùn padà lórí ètò kónílégbélé – Mínísítà

translation.en: The Nigerian Minister of Health, Dr Osagie Ehanire, on Sunday said President Mohammadu Buhari would determine when to lift the lockdown occasioned by the novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic in the country.
translation.yo: Mínísítà fún ètò ìlera lórílèèdè Nàìjíríà, Osagie Ehanire ti sọ̣̣̀rọ̀ lọ̣̣́jọ́ Àìkú pé, ààrẹ̣̣ Mohammadu Buhari nìkan ló leè sọ̣̣ ìgbà tétò kónílé-gbélé  táárùn Corona (COVID-19) dásílẹ̀ lórílèèdè Nàìjíríà yóò parí.
