translation.en: The minister said that the decision to extend COVID-19 lockdown was tailored according to the needs of every country.
translation.yo: Mínísítà tún tẹ̀síwájú pétò kónílé-gbélé tó ń lọ̣ lọ̣̣́wọ́ yìí wà nípa bétò ìlànà tí gbogbo orílẹ̀ àgbáyé làsílẹ̀.

translation.en: “The President in his wisdom will decide if the lockdown will be lifted,” he said.
translation.yo: Ó ní, "Ààrẹ̣̣ yóò lọ̣̣gbọ̣̣́n rẹ̀ láti sọ̣̣ bétò kónílé-gbélé yóò se dópin lórílèèdè yìí.

translation.en: ---  Another eighty seven (87) people have been tested positive in Nigeria.
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: Àwọ̣̣n ènìyàn mẹ̣́tàdínláàdọ̣̣́rùn ún (87) míràn tún jẹ̣̣yọ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà

translation.en: Nigeria has recorded 87 new cases of the novel Coronavirus known COVID-19 pandemic, bringing the total number of the confirmed cases to 1182.
translation.yo: Àwọ̣̣n ènìyàn mẹ̣̣́tàdínláàdọ́rùn ún (87) míràn tún ti jẹyọ tí wọ̣̣́n ní ààrùn Corona (COVID 19 )  lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà ní èyí tí ó jẹ́ kí iye àwọ̣̣n tó ní ààrùn Corona jẹ́ méjìlélọ̣̣́gọ̣̣́sànánlélẹ́gbẹ̣̣̀rún (1182), nígbà tí àwọ̣̣n ènìyàn bi ọ̣̀kànlénígba àti méjí (222 )  ti gba ìwòsàn , tí àwọ̣̣n ènìyàn márùndínlógójì (35) sì ti jẹ́ Ọlọ́run nípè.

translation.en: On its official Twitter handle @NCDCgov, the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control, NCDC, reported ”33 of the new cases in Lagos, 18 in Borno, 12 in Osun, 9 in Katsina, 4 in Kano 4 in Ekiti, 3 in Edo, 3 in Bauchi and 1 in Imo with 222 Discharged and 35 Deaths.”
translation.yo: Àjọ̣ tó ń gbógun ti àjàkálẹ̣̀ ààrùn  lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà (NCDC) ló kéde yìí lórí ẹ̀rọ Twitter wọ̣̣n, @NCDC. gov. Nínú ènìyàn mẹ́tàdínláàdọ̣̣́rùn ún (87)   tí wọ̣́n ṣ̣ẹ̣̣̀ṣ̣ẹ̀ jẹ̣̣yọ̣̣ ọ̣̣̀hún , mẹ̣̣́tàlélọ̣̣́gbọ̣̣̀n ( 33) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Eko , méjìdínlógún (22) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Borno , méjìlá ( 12) ìpínlẹ̀  Ọ̀sun,  mẹ́sàn án (9) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Katsina,  ẹ̣yọ̣  mẹ́rin  (4) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kánò àti Èkìtì , ẹ̣̣yọ̣̣  mẹ́ta (3) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Edo ati Bauchi , ẹ̣̣yọ̣ kan (1) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Imo.

translation.en: --- WHO appoints Okonjo-Iweala as COVID-19 Special Envoy
translation.yo: --- Àjọ̣̣ WHO yan Okonjo-Iweala láti jẹ́ aṣ̣ojú ikọ̀ tó ń gbógun ti ààrùn COVID-19

translation.en: The World Health Organisation, WHO, has appointed Nigeria’s former Finance Minister, Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala as Special Envoy for the newly inaugurated Access to COVID-19 Tools (ACT) Accelerator.
translation.yo: Àjọ àgbáyé fún ètò ìlera , (World Health Organisation, WHO) ti yan mínísítà fún ètò ìnáwó tẹ̣́lẹ̣̀rí lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala gẹ̣̣́gẹ́ bí aṣ̣ojú ikọ̀  tuntun tí yóò máa mójútó irinsẹ́ àti ohun èlò fún ìtọ́jú ààrùn  COVID-19.

translation.en: Dr Okonjo-Iweala is to serve alongside British Business Executive, Sir Andrew Witty in the same capacity, to mobilise international commitment to the initiative.
translation.yo: Ọ̣̣̀mọ̣̣̀wé Okonjo-Iweala ni yóò máa ṣ̣iṣ̣ẹ́ pọ̀ pẹ̣̀lú onísòwò ará ilẹ̀ Britain, Andrew Witty, láti máa darí àwọ̣̣n iṣ̣ẹ́ àkànṣ̣e láti fi gbógun ti ààrùn COVID-19  fún àjọ̣̣ àgbáyé.

translation.en: This was made known by Director-General of the organisation, Dr. Tedros Ghebreyesus, during the launch of the ACT Accelerator — via webinar from Geneva.
translation.yo: Olùdarí  àjọ̣̣ náà,Tedros Ghebreyesus, ló sọ̣̣̀rọ̀ yìí lórí ẹ̣̀rọ̣ ayélujára lásìkò tí wọ̣̣́n ṣe ìdásílẹ̀ ikọ̀ ọ̀hún ní Geneva.

translation.en: “I would especially like to thank Sir Andrew Witty and Dr. Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala for agreeing to act as Special Envoys for the ACT Accelerator,” Ghebreyesus said in his remarks.
translation.yo: Ghebreyesus  sọ pé “Mo fẹ́ dúpẹ́ púpọ̀ lọ̣̣́wọ̣̣́ Andrew Witty àti Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala  láti  jẹ́ adarí ikọ̀ tí yóò máa mójútó àwọ̣̣n irinsẹ̣̣́ àti ohun èlò fún gbígbógun ti ààrun COIVD-19.

translation.en: According to him, ”the initiative is an international collaboration aimed at accelerating the development, production, and equitable distribution of COVID-19 drugs, test kits, and vaccines around the world.”
translation.yo: Ó tún ní , "Iṣ̣ẹ́ àkànṣ̣e yìí jẹ́ ìfọ̣̣wọ̣̣́sowọ̣̣́pọ̣̣̀ àjọ̣̣ àgbáyé  láti pèsè àwọ̣̣n irinsẹ́, òògùn ,  abẹ́ṛ̣ẹ́ àjẹsára  , ohun ìtọ́jú  fún gbígbógun ti ààrùn  COVID-19  àti láti máa pín káàkiri gbogbo orílẹ̀ èdè  àgbáyé. "

translation.en: The former Finance Minister had this month been named a member of the External Advisory Group constituted by the Managing Director of the International Monetary Fund (IMF), Kristalina Georgieva.
translation.yo: Lọ̣́sẹ̀ tó kọ̣̣já ni adarí àjọ ètò àgbáyé lórí ọ̀rọ̀ owó yíyá, Kristalina Georgieva, tún yan Ngozi Okonjo Iweala gẹ̣̣́gẹ̣́ bí ọ̀kan  lára ikọ̀ tí yóò máa ṣ̣àmójútó ètò ìnáwó fún àjọ̣̣ náà.

translation.en: The group is to meet a few times a year, to provide perspectives on key developments and policy issues.
translation.yo: Ikọ̀ náà yóò máa ṣ̣èpàdé lóòrè-kóòrè ḷ̣ọ̣̣́dún láti máa sàlàyé nípa ìdàgbàsókè àti ètò ìlànà tí wọ́n ti sẹ.

translation.en: --- COVID-19: President Buhari’s Wife distributes medical items
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: Ìyàwó ààrẹ Buhari pín àwọn ohun ilé-ìwòsàn

translation.en: Nigeria’s First Lady, Mrs Aisha Buhari has donated medical items to support the fight against the spread of the deadly Coronavirus disease known as COVID-19.
translation.yo: Ìyàwó ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, ìyáàfin Aisha Buhari ti pín àwọn ohun èlò ilé-ìwòsàn fún ìrànwọ́ láti gbógun ti ìtànkálẹ̀ ààrùn  Corona ìyẹn COVID-19.

translation.en: Mrs Buhari has shown deep concern over the spread of the dreaded COVID-19 across Nigeria and has activated her Get Involved Initiative in order to gather donations to support the fight.
translation.yo: Ìyáàfin Bùárí fi àìdùnú rẹ̀ hàn sí bí ààrùn aṣekúpani COVID 19 ṣe ń tàn kálẹ̀ káàkiri tìbú tòòró orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà èyí sì ti mú kí ó dìde sí à ti kó àwọn ohun ìrànwó jọ láti kojú ààrùn náà.

translation.en: She expressed appreciation to those who donated to the course, saying “the nation will benefit from their donations.’’
translation.yo: Ìyáàfin Buhari wá fi ìdùnnú rẹ̀ hàn sí gbogbo àwọn tó pèsè ìrànwọ̣̣́ fún gbígbógun ti ìtànkálẹ̀ ààrùn ọ̣̣̀hún náà, Ó ní, “orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà yóò jẹ̣̣̀gbádùn àwọ̣̣n ètò ìrànwọ̣̣̣́ tí ẹ pèṣ̣̣è.

translation.en: A call to stay safe Mrs Buhari therefore called on Nigerians to stay safe and practice social distancing in order to defeat the pandemic.
translation.yo: Ìyáàfin Bùárí wá pe àwọn ọmọ Nàìjíríà láti wà láìléwu kí wọn sì máa fi ààyè sílẹ̀ láàrín ara wọn láti leè borí àjàkálẹ̀ àrùn yìí.

translation.en: She also urged “the benefitting states to ensure that the items donated were used judiciously.’’
translation.yo: Ó tún rọ “àwọn ìpínlẹ̀ tí wọ́n jẹ àǹfààní ohun ìrànwọ́ wọ̀nyí láti lò wọ́n dáradára”

translation.en: Mrs Buhari’s Senior Special Assistant on Administration and Women Affairs, Dr Hajo Sani represented her during the distribution ceremony in Abuja.
translation.yo: Olùrànlọ́wọ́ pàtàkì fún ìyáàfin ààrẹ Buhari  lórí ètò ìlànà iṣẹ́ ati ìgbáyé-gbádùn àwọn obìnrin, Hajo Sani ló ṣojú ìyàwó ààrẹ Buhari lásìkò ayẹyẹ láti pín àwọn ohun èlò ọ̀hún nílùú Àbújá.

translation.en: The items distributed include; cartons of assorted hand sanitisers, pharmaceutical drugs, personal protection equipment including disposable gowns and overalls.
translation.yo: Lára àwọn ohun èlò tí wọ́n pín ọ̀hún ni; àwọn ọṣẹ ìfọwọ́ á-pa kòkòrò, àwọn òògùn òyìnbó, ohun èlò ìdáàbò bo ara, irinsẹ́, ìbọ̀wọ́ àti aṣọ ìdáàbò bò.

translation.en: Other items include disposable and surgical masks, gloves, protective goggles, regular and ICU beds with beddings, and automatic dispensers.
translation.yo: Àwọn ohun míràn tún ni aṣọ ìbọ̀wọ́, gíláásì ìbòjú, àwọn ohun ìbùsùn abbl.

translation.en: The items were distributed to three states of Bauchi, Gombe and the Federal Capital Territory (FCT).
translation.yo: Àwọn ìpínlẹ̀ mẹ́ta ni wọ́n fún ní àwọn ohun èlò wọ̀nyí, àwọn ìpínlẹ̀ náá ní Bauchi, Gombe àti ìlú Àbújá, Federal Capital Territory (FCT).

translation.en: Appreciation Receiving the items on behalf of FCT, the Director, Special Duties, FCT Health and Human Services Secretariat, Dr Mathew Ashikeni, expressed gratitude to the first lady for the gesture.
translation.yo: Adarí ẹ̀ka tó ń mójútó isẹ́ àkànse fún ètò ìlera àti ìgbáyé –gbádùn àwọn ènìyàn, nílùú Àbújá ,Mathew Ashikeni, ló tẹ́wọ́gba àwọn ohun èlò ọ̀hún fún mínísítà ìlú Àbújá.

translation.en: Dr Ashikeni said; “the donation would go a long way in supporting the fight against COVID-19 pandemic in the nation’s capital.’’
translation.yo: Dókítà Ashikeni ní; “Àwọ̣n ohun èlò ìrànwọ́ náà yóò wúlò láti gbógun ti ààrun COVID-19 ní olú-ìlú orílẹ̣̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, tó wà nílùú Àbújá.

translation.en: He assured the delegation that the items would be used judiciously.
translation.yo: Ó wá fi àwọn aṣojú ọ̀hún lójú pé àwọn yóò  lo ohun  èlò náà  bó se tọ́ àti bó se yẹ.

translation.en: --- Nigeria’s COVID-19 cases up by 114, total now 1095
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: Àwọn ènìyàn mẹ́rìnléláàdọ́fà (114) míràn tún jẹyọ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, iye àwọn tó ní ààrun Corona jẹ́ márùndínlọ́gọ́rùńlélẹ́gbẹ̀rún (1095)

translation.en: Nigeria on the 24th of April recorded 114 new cases of persons who tested positive to COVID-19 taking the total number of confirmed cases to the four digits for the first time.
translation.yo: Àwọn ènìyàn mẹ́rìnléláàdọ́fà (114) míràn tún ti jẹyọ tí wọ́n ní ààrun Corona (COVID 19 )  lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà ní èyí tí ó jẹ́ kí iye àwọn tó ní ààrun Corona jẹ́ márùndínlọ́gọ́rùńlélẹ́gbẹ̀rún (1095), nígbà tí àwọn ènìyàn bí méjídínláàdọ́fà (208 )  ti gba ìwòsàn , tí àwọn ènìyàn méjìlélọ́gbọ̀n (32) sì ti jẹ́ Ọlọ́run nípè.

translation.en: The Nigeria Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) in a tweet released at 11: 35 Pm late Friday night 24th April, 2020 records that
translation.yo: Àjọ tó ń gbógun ti àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn  lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà (NCDC) ló kéde yìí lóríẹ̀rọ Twitter wọn, @NCDC. gov ní déédé aago méjìlá kọjá ìsẹ́jú márùndínlọ́gbọ̀n,lọ́jọ́  Ẹtì ,ọjọ́ kẹrìnlélógún, Osù kẹrin,ọdún, 2020.

translation.en: 114 new cases of #COVID19 have been reported; 80 in Lagos 21 in Gombe 5 in FCT 2 in Zamfara 2 in Edo 1 in Ogun 1 in Oyo 1 in Kaduna 1 in Sokoto
translation.yo: Nínú ènìyàn mẹ́rìnléláàdọ́fà (114)  tí wọn sẹ̀sẹ̀ jẹyọ ọ̀hún , ọgọ́rin ( 80) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó , mọ́kànlélógún (21) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Gombe , márùn ún  ( 5) ní ilu Àbújá, Federal Capital Territory (FCT),  méjì (2) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Zamfara àti Edó,  ẹyọ kan (1) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Ògùn, Ọ̀yọ́, Kàdúná àti ìpínlẹ̀ Sókótó.

translation.en: --- Abba Kyari was a faithful man to president Buhari and a good spokesman for America government:
translation.yo: --- Abba Kyari jẹ́ olóòótọ́ fún ààrẹ Buhari àti agbẹnusọ rere fún Amẹ́ríkà: Ìjọba Amẹ́ríkà

translation.en: The government of America has described late Abba Kyari as a good chief of staff for president Buhari and good spokesman for America government.
translation.yo: Ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Amẹ́ríkà ti ṣàpéjúwe olóògbé Abba Kyari gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ṣe jẹ̣̣́  olóòótọ́ adarí òṣìṣẹ́ ìjọba fún ààrẹ Buhari àti agbẹnuṣọ rere fún ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Amẹ́ríkà.

translation.en: In his condolence message to president Muhammad Buhari, the state assistant senior secretary in charge of Africa, Tibor Nagy, was commending the brave life lived by late Kyari most especially through which America refund a sum of three hundred million dollars that late Sani Abacha looted to America back to Nigeria.
translation.yo: Nínú ọ̀rọ̀ ìbánikẹ́dùn  rẹ̣̀ sí ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari, igbákejì akọ̀wé àgbà ìpínlẹ̀ tó ń mójútó ètò ilẹ̀ Áfíríkà, Tibor Nagy, ló gbósùbà fún ìwà akínkanjú tí olóògbé  Kyari,wù pàápàá jùlọ, nípa bí orílẹ̀ èdè Amẹ́ríkà ṣe dá owó tí iye rẹ̀ jẹ́ ọ́ọ̀dúnrún mílíọ̀nù dọ́là ($300 million) tí olóògbé Sani Abacha jígbé lọ sí orílẹ̀ Amẹ́ríkà  padà fún orílẹ̀ Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: Nagy said was a faithful chief of staff to president Buhari and a good spokesman for America government most especially a good leader to our representative in Abuja.
translation.yo: Nagy sọ pé Kyari jẹ́ olóòótọ́ adarí òṣìṣẹ́ ìjọba fún ààrẹ Buhari àti agbẹnuṣọ rere fún ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Amẹ́ríkà pàápàá jùlọ adarí rere fún ikọ̀ wa tó wà nílùú Àbújá.

translation.en: We are delighted to work with late Kyari especially how they refunded three million dollars that late Sani Abacha looted to America back to Nigeria.
translation.yo: Inú wa dùn láti bá olóògbé Kyari ṣe àwọn  iṣ̣ẹ́ gidi-gidi  papọ̀ pàápàá jùlọ, nípa bí wọ́n ṣe dá  ọ́ọ̀dúnrún mílíọ́nù dọ́là ($300 million) tí olóògbé Sani Abacha jígbé lọ sí orílẹ̀ èdè Amẹ́ríkà  padà fún orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: He advised that the money be divided into three to do some important projects in order to establish unity and the economy of Nigeria.
translation.yo: Ó dábàá pé kí wọ́n pín owó ọ̀hún sí ọ̀nà mẹ́ta láti fi ṣe àwọn iṣẹ́ àkànṣe ohun amáyédẹrùn, ní èyí láti lèè jẹ́ kí ìsọ̀kan àti ètò ọrọ̀ ajé túbọ̀ fẹsẹ̀ múlẹ̀ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: Nangy spoke when he was condoling with government and citizen of Nigeria and Kyari’s family, he also said that America government has promised to support Nigeria in fighting Corona virus.
translation.yo: Nagy sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lásìkò tó ń kẹ́dùn pẹ̀lú ìjọba àti àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà àti ẹbí Kyari , ó ní ìjọba ̀orílẹ̀ èdè Améríkà ti ṣèlérí láti dúró ti orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà láti gbógun ti ìtànkálẹ̀ ààrun Corona.

translation.en: President also received a condolence letter from minister of Niger Delta, Usani Uguru Usani, the businessman from Kano, Alhaji Sabiu Bako and the head of civil service.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ tún rí ìwé ìkẹ́dùn gbà láti ọwọ́ mínísítà fún Niger Delta, Usani Uguru Usani, olókoòwò láti ìlú Kánò, Alhaji Sabiu Bàkó àti adarí àwọn òṣìṣẹ́,

translation.en: --- Nigeria records 108 new cases of COVID-19
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: Àwọn ènìyàn méjìdínláàdọ́fà (108) míràn tún jẹyọ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà

translation.en: One hundred and eight new cases of the novel Coronavirus known as COVID-19 pandemic have been reported in Nigeria.
translation.yo: Àwọn ènìyàn méjìdínláàdọ́fà (108) míràn tún ti jẹyọ tí wọ́n ní ààrun Corona (COVID 19)  lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: The latest brings the total number of the confirmed cases to 981.
translation.yo: Ní èyí tí ó jẹ́ kí iye àwọn tó ní ààrùn Corona jẹ́ mọ́kàndílógúndínlẹ́gbẹ̀rún (981)

translation.en: On its official Twitter handle @NCDCgov, the Centre for Disease Control reported;
translation.yo: Àjọ tó ń gbógun ti àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn  lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà (NCDC) ló kéde yìí lórí ẹ̀rọ Twitter wọn, @NCDC. gov.

translation.en: Out of the 981, 78 of the new cases in Lagos, 14 in the FCT, 5 in Ogun, 4 in Gombe, 3 Borno, 2 in Akwa Ibom, 1 in Kwara and 1 in Plateau.
translation.yo: Nínú ènìyàn mọ́kàndílógúndínlẹ́gbẹ̀rún (981) tí wọ́n ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ jẹyọ ọ̀hún , méjìdínlọ́gọ́rin (78) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó , márùn ún (5) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Katsina , mẹ́rìnlá ( 14) ní ìlú Àbújá, Federal Capital Territory (FCT), márùn ún (5) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Ògùn, mẹ́rin (4) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Gombe, mẹ́ta (3) ní ìpínlẹ̀  Borno, méjì  (2) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Akwa Ibom, ẹyọ kan (1 )ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kwara  ati ẹyọ kan (1 ) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Plateau.

translation.en: --- NAF trains flight Nurses, Aircrew for effective aeromedical evacuation
translation.yo: --- Ilé-iṣẹ́ ológun òfúrufú ṣe ìdánilẹ́kọ̀ọ́ fún àwọn nọ́ọ̀sì rẹ̀ nípa ṣíṣe ìtọ́jú àwọn tó bá farapa

translation.en: The Nigerian Air Force NAF has conducted a training for some of its flight nurses and aircrew.
translation.yo: Ilé-iṣẹ́ ológun òfúrufú orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà (NAF) ti ṣ̣e ìdánilẹ́kọ̀ọ́ fún àwọn nọ́ọ̀sì ọkọ̀ òfúrufú àti àwọn awakọ̀ òfúrufú.

translation.en: The training is in furtherance of efforts to build the capacity of its personnel for the effective and efficient conduct of Aeromedical Evacuation missions to airlift wounded soldiers from various theatres of operation to appropriate treatment facilities.
translation.yo: ìdánilẹ́kọ̀ọ́ yìí wà lára àwọn ètò ìlànà tí ilé-iṣẹ́ ológun òfúrufú là sílẹ̀ fún àwọn ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun wọn nípa bí wọn yóò ṣe máa kó àti ṣe ìtọ́jú àwọn ọmọ ogun tó bá farapa lójú ogun.

translation.en: The Director of Public Relations and Information, NAF Air Commodore Ibikunle Daramola said the week-long training, has ended with a simulation exercise at the flight line of the 307 Executive Airlift Group, Nnamdi Azikwe International Airport, Abuja using the C-130H aircraft, was aimed at enhancing the knowledge of participants to enable them ensure that wounded personnel are stabilized and provided necessary life support from point of enplaning until they arrive at the destination facility.
translation.yo: Adarí ẹ̀ka ìròyìn àti ìbáṣepọ̀ tí ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun òfúrufú ọ̀hún (NAF) Air Commodore Ìbíkúnlé Dáramólá sọ pé ìdánilẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ọlọ́sẹ̀- kan parí nípa lílo ọkọ òfúrufú  C-130H tó wà ní pápá ọkọ̀ òfúrufú Nnamdi Azikwe tó ń mójútó írínájó ilẹ̀ òkèèrè tó wà nílùú Àbújá, ní èyí láti jẹ́ kí àwọn ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun  ọ̀hún ní ìmọ̀ tó gbóhúnjẹ-fẹ́gbẹ́, gbàwobọ̀ nípa ṣíṣe ìtọ́jú nínú ọkọ̀ òfúrufú  fún àwọn ọmọ ogun tó bá farapa lójú ogun láti du ẹ̀mí  wọn títí tí wọn yóò fi gbé wọn dé ilé-ìwòsàn.

translation.en: Daramola noted that a NAF C-130H aircraft has been configured to carry specialized stretchers for the patients along with necessary life support equipment, including patient monitors and ventilators
translation.yo: Dáramólá ní wọn ti se ọkọ̀ òfúrufú NAF C-130H lọ́nà tí àwọn ohun èlò tí àwọn tó bá farapa tàbí aláìsàn leè lò láti gba ìtọ́jú pàjáwìrì.

translation.en: The Chief of the Air Staff CAS, Air Marshal Sadique Abubakar, expressed satisfaction with the conduct of the training and simulation exercise of the nurses that are part of the crew members.
translation.yo: Adarí ilé-iṣẹ́ ológun ọkọ̀ òfúrufú lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, ọ̀gágun Sadique Abubakar, wá fi ìdùnnú rẹ̀ hàn nípa ìdánilẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ọ̀hún  bí àwọn nọ́ọ̀ṣì tí yóò máa wà nínú ọkọ̀ òfúrufú  náà ṣe fakọyọ.

translation.en: He noted that the capability, which would reduce the risk to wounded personnel and enhance their chances of survival, could also be deployed for the emergency movement of COVID-19 patients, if so required.
translation.yo: Ó tẹ̀síwájú pé  wọ́n tún leè lo àwọn irinṣẹ́ àti ohun èlò ọ̀hún fún gbígbé àwọn aláìsàn  ààrun  COVID-19  tó bá nílò ìtọ́jú ní kíákíá.

translation.en: The CAS disclosed that the NAF had, over the past four and half years, made concerted efforts to build the capacity of its Medical personnel to not only ensure the provision of qualitative healthcare services to personnel and their families but also to ensure effective care for personnel wounded in action.
translation.yo: Adarí ọ̀hún tún ní láti bí ọdún mẹ́rin àti ààbọ̀ sẹ́yìn ní ilé-iṣẹ́ ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun òfúrufú ti ń gbìyànjú láti ṣètò ìdálẹ́kọ́ọ̀ fún ikọ̀ òṣìṣẹ́ elétò ìlera tó jẹ́ ọmọ ogun ọkọ̀ òfúrufú nípa pípèsè ìtọ́jú ètò ìlera fún àwọn ikọ̀ omọ ogun, ẹbí wọn àti àwọn tó bá farapa lójú ogun.

translation.en: --- Military destroys compound housing terrorists in Borno
translation.yo: --- Ilé-iṣẹ́ ológun run agbègbè ti ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun ọlọ̀tẹ̀ fi ń ṣe ibùgbé ní ìpínlẹ̀ Borno

translation.en: The Armed Forces of Nigeria, through the Air Task Force of Operation LAFIYA DOLE, has destroyed compounds housing boko haram terrorists’ leaders at Bulawa on the fringes of the Sambisa Forest in Borno State.
translation.yo: Ilé-isẹ́ ológun orí afẹ́fẹ́, ìyẹn Air Task Force of Operation LAFIYA DOLE, ti run gbogbo àwọn agbègbè tí adarí ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun ọlọ̀tẹ̀ Boko Haram fi ń ṣe ibùgbé ní  Bulawa nínú igbó Sambisa tó wà ní ìpínlẹ̀ Borno pátápátá.

translation.en: The Coordinator, Defence Media Operations, Major General John Enenche said “the air strikes were executed based on credible human intelligence reports as well as Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance missions that led to the identification of the target compounds within the settlement”.
translation.yo: Agbẹnusọ fún ẹ̀ka ìròyìn ilé-iṣẹ́ ọ̀hún, ọ̀gágun John Enenche sọ pé“ ọkọ̀ ogun òfúrufú bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní máa ju àdó olóró sí  àwọn agbègbè tí adarí ikọ̀ ọlọ́tẹ̀ Boko Haram  wà nípaṣẹ̀ ìròyìn tí àwọn gbọ́ pé agbègbè náà ni ó farapamọ́ sí.

translation.en: Enenche stated that fighter jets dispatched by the Air Task Force to take out the compounds scored accurate hits in the target area, leading to the destruction of some of the structures as well as the neutralisation of some of the terrorists occupying the compounds.
translation.yo: Ọ̀gágun John Enenche tún ní kí ó tó di pé ikọ̀ ọlọ̀tẹ̀ Boko Haram tó máa gbáradì láti kojú ìjà pẹ̀lú ikọ̀ ọmọ -ogun òfúrufú tó ń ju àdó olóró ní kíkan-kíkan sí agbègbè, ni àwọn  ti fi àdó olóró ṣe wọ́n bí ọṣẹ́ ṣe ń ṣojú.

translation.en: April 24, 2020 --- President Buhari felicitates with Muslims as Ramandan begins
translation.yo: --- Ààrẹ Bùhárí fi ìkíni ránṣẹ́ sí àwọn Mùsùlùmí bí Ramandan ṣe bẹ̀rẹ̀

translation.en: President Muhammadu Buhari has sent his best wishes to Muslims in the country and all over the world as they begin this year’s 30-day fast, following the sighting of the moon.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, Muhammadu Buhari ti fi ìkíni rẹ̀ ránṣẹ́ sí gbogbo àwọn mùsùlùmí tó wà lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí àti ni gbogbo àgbáyé látàrí bí wọ́n ṣe rí òṣùpá láti bẹ̀rẹ̀ ààwẹ̀ ọgbọ̀njọ́.

translation.en: “I congratulate all Muslims as they commence this year’s Ramadan fast which is depicted by self-denial, universal brotherhood, austerity and helping relatives and needy people,”  President Buhari said.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Buhari ní ó ṣeni láàànù pé ààwẹ̀ ọdún yìí wáyé lásìkò tí gbogbo àgbáyé ń kojú

translation.en: He described this year’s Ramadan as a challenge, as it is in the period of the global pandemic, which has spread to more than 200 nations, with virtually all countries advising citizens to avoid large gatherings and have their prayers and meals (suhoor and iftar) individually or with family at home.
translation.yo: ìpèníjà àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn COIVD-19, ní èyí tí ó ti tàn ká igba (200) orílẹ̀ èdè tó wà lágbàáyé, tí gbogbo orílẹ̀ èdè sì ń pariwo pé kí àwọn ènìyàn yàgò fún ìpéjọpọ̀, kí wọ́n sì máa dá gbàdúrà àti ìsírun wọn tàbí pẹ̀lú ẹbí wọn.

translation.en: “In this Ramadan period, the kind of socializing you are used to now risks spreading the Coronavirus,” the President cautioned Muslims, while enjoining them to refrain from those Ramadan rituals and traditions such as group meals and congregational prayers that have been put on hold by Muslim religious authorities all over the world.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ tún tẹ̀síwájú pé "Lásìkò  Ramadan yìí, ìbásepọ̀ tí ẹ máa ń ṣe tẹ́lẹ̀ ti di ohun tí ààrun Corona ṣọ di ewu báyìí," ààrẹ wá rọ gbogbo àwọn mùsùlùmí láti sọ́ra , kí wọ́n sì yàgò fún àwọn ìpéjọpọ̀ nípa oúnjẹ àti gbígbàdúrà papọ̀, ní èyí tí àwọn adarí ẹlẹ́sìn ti fòpin si báyìí ní gbogbo àgbáyé.

translation.en: President Buhari urged Muslims to endure and not to use the Coronavirus as an excuse not to participate in the Ramadan fast, unless such abstention is warranted by the excuses clearly outlined by health and religious authorities.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ  Buhari tún wá rọ gbogbo àwọn mùsùlùmí láti farada ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ààrun Corona tó ń jà lórílẹ̀ èdè yíí sùgbọ́n kí wọn máa ṣe lo  ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ ọ̀hún láti fi yẹra nípa kíkópa nínú ààwẹ̀ Ramadan  àyàfi tí wọ́n bá ní ìdí kan pàtàkì tó ní ṣe pẹ̀lú ètò ìlera tàbí èyí tí adarí ẹ̀sìn bá là sílẹ̀ láti máa kópa nínú ààwẹ̀ ọ̀hún.

translation.en: He wished Muslims in the country and the world over all the blessings of the holy month.
translation.yo: Ó wá kí gbogbo àwọ̣n mùsùlùmí lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí àti ní gbogbo àgbáyé pé gbogbo ìbùkún inú ààwẹ̀ mímọ́ yìí yóò jẹ́ ti wọn.

translation.en: --- COVID-19: Nigeria confirms 91 new cases
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: Àwọn ènìyàn mọ́kànléláàdọ́rùn ún (91) míràn tún jẹyọ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà

translation.en: Nigeria has confirmed 91 new cases of the novel coronavirus also known as COVID-19.
translation.yo: Àwọn ènìyàn mọ́kànléláàdọ́rùn ún (91) míràn tún ti jẹyọ tí wọ́n ní ààrùn Corona (COVID 19 )  lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: With the latest addition, the number of confirmed cases has hit 873 in the country with 197 discharged and 25 deaths. There are 26 states with confirmed cases in Nigeria.
translation.yo: Ní èyí tí ó jẹ́ kí iye àwọn tó ní ààrùn Corona jẹ́ mẹ́tàléláàdọ́rinléníẹgbẹ̀rin(873), nígbà tí àwọn ènìyàn bí mẹ́tàdínnígba (197 )  ti gba ìwòsàn , tí àwọn ènìyàn márùndínlọ́gbọ̀n (25) ṣì ti jẹ́ Ọlọ́run nípè.

translation.en: 91 new cases of #COVID19 have been reported; 74 in Lagos 5 in Katsina 4 in Ogun 2 in Delta 2 in Edo 1 in Kwara 1 in Oyo 1 in FCT 1 in Adamawa.
translation.yo: Nínú ènìyàn mọ́kànléláàdọ́rùn ún (91) tí wọ́n ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ jẹyọ ọ̀hún , mẹ́rìnléláàdọ́rin ( 74) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó , márùn ún (5) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Katsina ,ẹyọ kan ( 1) ní ìlú Àbújá, Federal Capital Territory (FCT), mẹ́rin   (4) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Ògùn, méjì (2) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Delta ati Edo ,ẹyọ kan (1) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́, Kwara  àti Adámáwá.

translation.en: --- Lagos state house of assembly appeals for the endurance of covid 19 lockdown .
translation.yo: --- Ilé igbimo Aṣ̣òfin ti ìpínlè̩ Èkó bẹ̀bẹ̀ fún ìfaradà ìpèníjà sísémó̩lé látàrí ààrùn Kòrónà.

translation.en: Lagos state house of assembly has appealed to the people of Lagos to please endure the challenge as a result of the lockdown to stop the spread of corona virus.
translation.yo: Ilé Ìgbìmọ̀ Aṣ̣òfin ti ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó ti rọ̣ àwọn olùgbé ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó láti jọ̀wọ́ farada ìpèníjà tí ó wáyé látàri ìgbélé tó wáyé láti fi òpin sí ìtànkálè̩ ààrùn Kòrónà.

translation.en: The committee in charge of health and the committee in charge of news in the house of assembly made this appeal when talking with the journalist on their observation at the visit to the materials prepared for the treatment of COVID-19 in Lagos state.
translation.yo: Ìgbìmọ̀ tó ń mójútó ètò ìlera àti Ìgbìmọ̀ tó ń mójútó ètò ìròyìn nínú ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin rawọ́ ẹ̀bẹ̀ nígbàtí wọ́n ń bá àwọn oníròyìn sọ̀rọ̀ lórí àkíyèsí wọ̣n níbi àyẹ̀wò àwọn ohun èelò tí wọn pèsè fún ìtọ́jú àrùn ‘COVID-19’ ní Ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó.

translation.en: The chairman of the committee on health at the Lagos state house of assembly, Honorable Hakeem, that lead the crew said it is important that people of Lagos follow the lockdown barn made by the government to curb the spread of this corona virus.
translation.yo: Alága Ìgbìmọ̀ tó ń mójútó ètò ìlera nínú ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin ti ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó, aṣòfin Hakeem, tí ó ṣáájú ikọ̀ náà sọ pé ó ṣe pàtàkì kí àwọn ará ìlú tẹ̀lé òfin kónílé-gbélé tí ìjọba ṣe yìí láti leè dẹ́kun ìtànkálẹ̀ àrùn kòrónà yìí.

translation.en: Another member of the state house of assembly present was the chairman committee on news and politics at the house of assembly Honorable Tunde Braimoh; Honorable Desmond Elliot, Honorable Temitope Adewale.
translation.yo: Àwọn ọmọ ilé ìgbìmọ̀ Aṣòfin tó wà níbẹ̀ ni Alága ìgbìmọ̀ tó ń mójútó ètò ìròyìn àti ètò òṣ̣èlú nínú Ilé Ìgbìmọ̀ Aṣòfin náà, aṣòfin Túndé Braimoh; aṣòfin Desmond Elliot, aṣòfin Tèmítọ́pẹ́ Adéwálé.

translation.en: The committee pays a visit the hospital treating the pandemic at Yaba; waiting hall for testing around Mobolaji Johnson at Onikan; waiting hall for testing alongVitiria Island at Eti-Osa Local government area and the general hospital  at Gbagada.
translation.yo: Àwọn ìgbìmọ̀ náà ṣe àbẹ̀wò sí Ilé-ìwòsàn àjàkálẹ̀ àrùn ní agbègbè Yaba; gbọ̀ngàn ìdánidúró fún àyẹ̀wò ní àgbègbè Mobọ́lájí Johnson ní Oníkàn; gbọ̀ngàn ìdánidúró fún àyẹ̀wò ní àgbègbè Victoria Island ní Ìjọba Ìbílẹ̀ Etí-Ọ̀sà àti Ilé-Ìwòsàn gbogboògbò ní Gbàgádà.

translation.en: The committee perceived that the material for treatment and the services there were of good standing to fight the spread of corona virus in Lagos state, which the federal government support
translation.yo: Ìgbìmọ̀ náà wòye pé àwọn ohun èèlò fún ìtọ́jú àrùn náà àti iṣẹ́ wọn níbẹ̀ dúró dáradára láti kojú ìtànkálẹ̀ àrùn kòrónà ní Ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó, tí ìjọba àpapọ̀ ṣe àtìlẹyìn fún.

translation.en: They promised that to find a solution to the little challenges faced at these hospitals immediately, which have to do with the insufficiency of materials with which the workers protect themselves
translation.yo: Wọ́n ṣe ìlérí pé àwọn ìpèníjà díẹ̀díẹ̀ tí wọ́n ń kojú ní àwọn ilé-ìwòsàn yìí tó níi ṣ̣e pẹ̀lú àìtó àwọn ohun èèlò tí àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ náà fi ń dáàbò bo ara wọn.

translation.en: The government is trying all their effort in fight this virus, but we the citizen have to support the government for the success of this .
translation.yo: Àti pé gbogbo ipá ni ìjọba ń sà láti gbógun ti ààrùn yìí, ṣùgbọ́n àwọn ará ìlú ní láti ṣàtìlẹyìn fún àṣeyọrí èyí.

translation.en: Honorable Shokunle in his statement  said one important way to stop the spread of this virus is the lockdown.
translation.yo: Nínú ọ̀rọ̀ tí Aṣòfin Shókúnlè so̩, ò̩nà kan pàtàkì tí ó rò láti dènà ìtànkálẹ̀ ààrùn yìí ni ìkéde kónílé-gbélé.

translation.en: I know this is not possible, but sometimes if we consider the effect of this kind of corona virus we will see that it is important to do do this
translation.yo: Mo mọ̀ pé eléyìí kò rọrùn, sùgbọ́n nígbà miíràn, tí a bá ní kí á wo ìpalára irú ààrùn "Coronavirus", a ó rii pé ó ṣe pàtàkì làti ṣe èyí.

translation.en: Honorable Tunde Bramoh also appeal the people in the state to be more patient, in so much that all these happened unexpectedly and it need to be handled with a serious hand.
translation.yo: Aṣòfin Túndé Bramoh náà rọ àwọn ará ìlú láti túnbọ̀ ní sùúrù díẹ̀, níwọ̀n tó jẹ́ pé àìròtẹ́lẹ̀ ní gbgbo ọ̀rọ̀ yìí ṣẹlẹ̀, ó sì nílò ọwọ́ kunkun láti fi mú u. Ó ní:

translation.en: We appeal because of COVID-19is one issue and the convenience of the people is another.
translation.yo: A rọ àwọn ènìyàn wa, nítorí ọ̀rọ̀ ààrùn COVID-19, ọ̀rọ̀ ìrọ̀rùn àwọn ará ìlú náà wà lọ́tọ̀.

translation.en: We should also know that the case of corona virus deals with human life, that is why it is important to settle the case of the virus first.
translation.yo: Ó yẹ kí á mọ̀ pé ọ̀rọ̀ ààrùn kòrónà yìí níí ṣe pẹ̀lú ẹ̀mí ẹ̀dá, ni ó fi ṣe pàtàkì kí á kọ́kọ́ yanjú ọ̀rọ̀ ààrùn yìí ná.

translation.en: The committee visited the four treatment halls for corona virus in Lagos state, where they provided the necessary materials and the necessary workers and the hall is  bed space
translation.yo: Ìgbìmọ̀ Aṣòfin náà s̩e àbẹ̀wò sí àwọn gbọ̀gàn ìtọ́jú Kòrónà mẹ́rẹ̀ẹ̀rin nípìnínlẹ̀ Èkó, wọ́n sì pèsè àwọn èèlò pẹ̀lú àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ tó yẹ, tí ààyè ìbùsùn síì fè̩ dáadáa.

translation.en: --- Oyo Governor mourns former Attorney-General
translation.yo: --- Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́ dáròo onídàjọ́ àgbà tẹ́lẹ̀rí– Mákindé

translation.en: The Oyo State Governor, Seyi Makinde, has mourned the Second Republic Attorney-General of the Federation and Minister of Justice, Chief Richard Akinjide (SAN), describing his demise as the end of an era and a huge loss to Oyo State, the legal profession, the Federal Republic of Nigeria and indeed, the world at large.
translation.yo: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́, Sèyí Mákindé ti fi ikú olóògbé onídàájọ́ àgbà, Richard Akínjídé tó ti fìgbà kan jẹ́ Mínísítà fún ètò ìdájọ́ ní orílẹ̀ èdè Nàí̀íríà wé àdánù ńlá fún ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́, orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà àti àgbáyé lápapọ̀.

translation.en: The Governor, in a condolence message made available through his Chief Press Secretary, Mr Taiwo Adisa, said he was saddened by the demise of the foremost legal luminary, noting that Akinjide was an exemplary indigene of Ibadan and Oyo State and a detribalised Nigerian, who served his state and country to the best of his ability.
translation.yo: Gómìnà Sèyí Mákindé, ẹni tí ó tún fi àìdùnnú rẹ̀ hàn sí ikú onídàájọ́ àgbà Akínjídé hàn nínú ọ̀rọ̀ ìbánikẹ́dùn rẹ̀,  eléyìí tí ó fi sọwọ́ sí ẹbí olóògbé ọ̀hún láti ọwọ́ amúgbálẹ́gbẹ́ rẹ̀ lórí ọ̀rọ̀ ìròyìn, Táíwò Àdìsá, ló sọọ́ di mímọ̀ pé olóògbé Akínjídé ti fi ìgbà ayé rẹ̀ sin orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà tọkàn -tọkàn.

translation.en: The Governor said, “The news of the death of our father, leader and one of the last men standing among the foremost politicians of the country, Chief Richard Akinjide, came to us as a shock”.
translation.yo: Mákindé tún tẹ̀síwájú  pé, ikú olóògbé náà wá lásìkò tí ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà nílò láti mu nínú omi ọgbọ́n rẹ̀ eléyìí tó ti fihàn nínú onírúurú ọ̀nà bí i ,  ìṣèjọba àti ẹ̀ka òfin eléyìí tó le tan ìmọ́lẹ̀ fún wọn láti jẹ́ adarí tó ṣeé mú yangàn lágbàáyé.

translation.en: He maintained that the former Minister’s death came at a period that his wealth of experience and robust versatility in history, politics and law was needed to offer direction to the current generation of Nigerian leaders.
translation.yo: Mákindé tún sàlàyé pé: "Ìròyìn ikú bàbá wa, adarí ati ẹnìkanṣoṣo tó tayọ lara àwọn olóṣèlú orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, Olóyè Richard  Akínjídé jẹ́ ìyàlẹ́nu ńlá nítorí pé,  bàbá kò fẹ́ kí  ẹnikẹ́ni lára mọ̀ pé ọlọ́jọ́ ti dé, títí ó fi mí èémì ìkẹyìn, bàbá sì ń sọ̀rọ̀ lórí àwọn ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ tó ń lọ, tó sì ń gba ìjọba nímọ̀ràn ní oríṣiríṣi ọ̀nà,   bàbá dúró gẹ́gẹ́ bí òpómúléró nínú òṣèlú àti ọ̀rọ̀ òfin. "

translation.en: Makinde noted, “This is because Baba, for those who know him or has seen him in recent time, did not show any sign of slowing down; he continued to lead intelligent and history-laden conversations, offered golden advice on governance and leadership and remained a great pillar of experience in politics and law.”
translation.yo: "Ikú rẹ̀ jẹ́ àdánù ńlá fún ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́, orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà àti àgbáyé lápapọ̀, nítorí ó jẹ́ asíwájú rere tí se ọmọ bíbí ilẹ̀ Ìbàdàn ní ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́,  tí kò fi ẹlẹ́yàmẹ̀yà ṣe,  tó fi ọjọ́ ayé rẹ̀ sin orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà pẹ̀lú agbára rẹ̀ "

translation.en: “I commiserate with my sister and Chieftain of our Party, the People’s Democratic Party PDP, Oloye Jumoke Akinjide and the rest of Baba’s biological and political children.
translation.yo: Gómìnà wá fi àsìkò ọ̀hún bá àwọn ọmọ olóògbé náà tó tún jẹ́ ògbóǹtarìgì nínú ẹgbẹ́ òṣèlú Peoples Democratic Party (PDP),  olóyè Jùmọ̀ké Akínjídé àti gbogbo ọmọ bíbí inú bàbá yòókù láìyọ ẹnìkankan sílẹ̀ àti  nínú òṣèlú kẹ́dùn.

translation.en: The Governor further condoled with all indigenes of Oyo State and Nigerians on the exit of a giant of Akinjide’s standing.
translation.yo: Ó wá tún fi àsìkò náà bá gbogbo ọmọ bíbí ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́ àti ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà kẹ́dùn lórí ikú ẹ̣ni rere tó dágbére fáyé. olóògbé Richard Akínjídé jẹ́ ẹni ọdún Méjìdínláàdọ́rùń kí ó tó jáde láyé.

translation.en: --- Military troops neutralise 21 bandits in Zamfara
translation.yo: --- Ilé-isẹ́ ológun gbẹ̀mí àwọn ọmọ-ogun ọlọ̀tẹ̀ mọ́kànlélógún ní ìpínlẹ̀  Zamfara

translation.en: Military troops of Operation Hadarin Daji have killed no fewer than 21 armed bandits in an encounter at Zurmi in Zurmi Local Government Area of Zamfara.
translation.yo: Ilé-isẹ́ ọmọ ogun orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, Operation Hadarin Daji ti gbẹ̀mi àwọn ọmọ ogun ọlọ̀tẹ̀ tí kò dín ní mọ́kànlélógún tí wọ́n bá wọ̀yá ìjà ní Zurmi ní ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ Zurmi ní ìpínlẹ̀  Zamfara.

translation.en: The Coordinator, Defence Media Operations, Maj.-Gen. John Enenche, who disclosed this in a statement on Wednesday in Abuja, said four soldiers died during the encounter.
translation.yo: Agbẹnusọ fún ilé-isẹ́ ìròyìn ,ọ̀gágun John Enenche, ló sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lọ́jọ́rú nílùú Àbújá,pé ọmọ ogun orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà mẹ́rin ló kú níbi ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ọ̀hún.

translation.en: Enenche said that more details would be provided after the exploitation operation in the area.
translation.yo: Enenche tẹ̣̀síwájú pé àwọn yóò tún máa sọ bí ìgbésẹ̀ tí ó kàn nípa ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ọ̣̀hún ní àgbègbè náà ṣ̣e ń lọ sí.

translation.en: He added that the troops had begun aggressive patrols in the area for domination and confidence building among the locals.
translation.yo: Ó tún ní ikọ̣̀ ọmọ ogun náà yóò tún tẹ̀síwájú láti máa gbogún ti ikọ̀ ọḷọ̀tẹ̀ tó wà ní àgbègbè náà.

translation.en: --- COVID-19: Kano to begin distribution of food to residents
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: ìpínlẹ̀ Kánò bẹ̀rẹ̀ oúnjẹ pínpín fụ́n àwọn ará ìlú

translation.en: Kano State Government is to commence distribution of foodstuff as palliatives to residents to cushion the effect of the lockdown due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
translation.yo: Ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ Kánò yóò bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní máa pín oúnjẹ láti fi ṣe ètò ìrànwọ́ fún àwọn ọmọ ìpínlẹ̀ náà, kí ó le dín wàhálà tí wọ́n ń kojú lásìkò ètò kónílé-gbélé kù nípasẹ̀ ààrùn COVID-19

translation.en: Special Adviser to the Governor on Media, Salihu Tanko Yakasai announced this on his verified Twitter handle on Sunday night.
translation.yo: Olùrànlọ́wọ́ ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ náà lórí ìròyìn, Salihu Tanko Yakasai ló kéde lórí ẹ̀rọ twitter rẹ̀ láásálẹ́ ọjọ́ Àìkú.

translation.en: He said the distribution would cut across all the 44 local government areas of the State to the vulnerable.
translation.yo: Ó tẹ̀síwájú pé àwọn yóò máa pín ouńjẹ náà káàkiri gbogbo ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ méjìlélógójì tó wà ní ìpínlẹ̀ ọ̀hún.

translation.en: The one-week lockdown order issued by the state governor, Dr Abdullahi Ganduje commenced on Thursday by 10.00 pm and will last till Wednesday.
translation.yo: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Kánò, Abdullahi Gàndújè ló ti kọ́kọ́ kéde ètò kónílé-gbélé fún ọ̀sẹ̀ kan gbáko lọ́jọ́bọ̀ ní déédé aago mẹ́ẹ́wá àsálẹ́ pé ètò kónílé-gbélé yóò bẹ̀rẹ̀ ní Ọjọ́rú.

translation.en: Ganduje said the order is subject to review.
translation.yo: Àmọ́ṣá Gàndújè ní ó se é se kí àtúnṣe bá ètò ọ̀hún.

translation.en: The Kano state COVID-19 Fundraising Committee headed by Prof. Muhammad Yahuza Bello recently said the committee has received about 15 types of food items and equally raised close to N400 million naira.
translation.yo: Ìgbìmọ̀ ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ Kánò tó ń sètò owó ìrànwọ́ fún ààrùn COVID-19, ní èyí tí ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Muhammad Yahuza Bello  jẹ́ alákòóso rẹ̀ sọ pé ìgbìmọ̀ náà ti rí owó tó lé ní irinwó mílíọ́nù gbà àti orísi oúnjẹ mẹ́ẹ̀dógún.

translation.en: --- Nigeria confirms 86 new cases of Coronavirus
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: Àwọn ènìyàn mẹ́rìndínláàdọ́rùn ún (86) míràn tún jẹyọ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà

translation.en: Nigeria, on the  19th of April, confirmed 86 new cases of persons with COVID 19.
translation.yo: Àwọn ènìyàn mẹ́rìndínláàdọ́rùn ún (86) míràn tún ti jẹyọ tí wọ́n ní ààrùn Corona (COVID 19 )  lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà

translation.en: In a tweet released by the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) at 11.50 PM, Sunday night,  70 of these new cases were recorded in Lagos, 7 in the FCT, 3 in Katsina, 3 in Akwa Ibom and 1 each from Jigawa, Bauchi and Borno States.
translation.yo: Ní èyí tí ó jẹ́ kí iye àwọn tó ní ààrùn Corona jẹ́ mẹ́tàdínlọ́gbọ̀nléníẹgbẹ̀ta(627), nígbà tí àwọn ènìyàn bí àádọ́sàn án (170 )  ti gba ìwòsàn , tí àwọn ènìyàn mọ́kànlélógún  (17) ṣì ti jẹ́ Ọlọ́run nípè. Àjọ tó ń gbógun ti àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn  lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà (NCDC) ló kéde yìí lórí ẹ̀rọ Twitter wọn, @NCDCgov ní déédé aago méjìlá ku ìsẹ́jú mẹ́wàá àṣálẹ́ ọjọ́ kọkàndínlógún , osù kẹrin , ọdún 2020.

translation.en: Eighty-six new cases of #COVID19 have been reported; 70 in Lagos 7 in FCT 3 in Katsina 3 in Akwa Ibom 1 in Jigawa 1 in Bauchi 1 in Borno
translation.yo: Nínú ènìyàn mẹ́rìndínláàdọ́rùn ún (86) tí wọ́n sẹ̀sẹ̀ jẹyọ ọ̀hún , àádọ́rin ( 70) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó ,mẹ́ta (3) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Katsina ,méje ( 7) ní ìlú Àbújá, Federal Capital Territory (FCT)  ẹyọ  mẹ́ta (3) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Akwa Ibom, ẹyọ kàn (1) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Bauchi, Jigawa àti Borno.

translation.en: --- Abba Kyari: President Buhari commiserates with Borno State
translation.yo: --- Abba Kyari: Ààrẹ Buhari bá ìpínlẹ̀ Borno kẹ́dùn

translation.en: President Muhammadu Buhari on Sunday called Borno State Governor, Prof. Babagana Zulum and some leading traditional rulers of Borno State, including District Head of Banki and elder brother of late Chief of Staff to the President, Mallam Abba Kyari, Zanna Baba Shehu Arjinoma, to offer his condolences.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari ti bá ìpínlẹ̀ Borno kẹ́dùn , nígbà tí ààrẹ pe gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ ọ̀hún, ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Babagana Zulum, olórí agbègbè Banki, àwọn ọba ìpínlẹ̀ ọ̀hún àti ẹ̀gbọ́n olóògbé Mallam Abba Kyari, Zanna Baba Shehu Arjinoma, lọ́jọ́ Àìkú.

translation.en: In a telephone conversation, the President commiserated with the head of the family and members;  Shehu of Borno, Shehu Abubakar Ibn Umar Garbai El-Kanemi; Shehu of Bama, Shehu Kyari ibn Umar ibn Ibrahim Elkenemi.
translation.yo: Nínú ọ̀rọ̀ tí ààrẹ ń bá àwọn sọ lórí ẹ̀rọ̀ ìbánisọ̀rọ̀, ààrẹ bá olórí ẹbí àti àwọn ẹbí  rẹ̀ ;  Shehu ti Borno, Shehu Abubakar Ibn Umar Garbai El-Kanemi; Shehu ti Bama, Shehu Kyari ibn Umar ibn Ibrahim Elkenemi kẹ́dùn ikú olóògbé ọ̀hún.

translation.en: President Buhari described the death of the late Chief of Staff as a shared loss, and urged the government and people of Borno State, members of the family to take solace in the fact that Mallam Kyari lived a life worthy of example.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Buhari  ṣàpèjúwe olóògbé ọ̀hún gẹ́gẹ́ bí àdánù ńlá fún orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, ó wá rọ ìjọba ,àwọn ọmọ ìpínlẹ̀  Borno àti ẹbí olóògbé náà láti máa ṣe bọkànjẹ́ nítorí olóògbé Mallam Kyari lo ìgbé ayé tó dára.

translation.en: He said, “Abba was the very best of us.
translation.yo: Ó ní, Abba jẹ́ ẹni tí a fẹ́ràn jùlọ.

translation.en: He was made of the stuff that makes Nigeria great.”
translation.yo: Ó ṣe ǹkan tí ó jẹ́ kí orílẹ̣̀ èdè Nàìjíríà di ńlá.

translation.en: The President continued to receive messages from far and wide, condoling him and the nation following the demise of his Chief of Staff.
translation.yo: Àwọ̣n ènìyàn láti orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà àti nílẹ̣̀ òkèèrè sì ń pe ààrẹ láti báa kẹ́dùn lórí ikú adarí òsìsẹ́ rẹ̀.

translation.en: Among those who called or sent letters are: former President, General Ibrahim Babangida; Governors of Rivers, Nyesom Wike, Enugu, Ifeanyi Ugwuanyi, Yobe, Mai Mala Buni, Taraba, Darius Dickson Ishaku and the President’s classmates who enrolled in 1953 into the Katsina Middle School, through their leader Sen.  Abba Ali.
translation.yo: Lára àwọn tí ó fìwé ìkíni ránsẹ́ sí  ààrẹ ni: ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà tẹ́lẹ̀rí , ọ̀gágun Ibrahim Bàbáńgídá; Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Rivers, Nyesom Wike, Enugu, Ifeanyi Ugwuanyi, Yobe, Mai Mala Buni, Taraba, Darius Dickson Ishaku àti àwọn akẹẹgbẹ́ rẹ̀ tí wọ́n jọ lọ sí ilé ẹ̀kọ́ lọ́dún 1953.

translation.en: The President also received messages from the President of the United Nations General Assembly, Ambassador (Prof.) Tijjani Muhammad-Bande, the global network of Editors, the International Press Institute, IPI, the President of the Nigerian Guild of Editors, Mustapha Isa, the Emir of Kano, Aminu Ado Bayero, the patriarch of the Dantata family in Kano, Alhaji Aminu Dantata, the leader of the Izala religious movement in Nigeria, Alhaji Bala Lau and Deputy Majority Leader of the Senate, Bala Ibn Na’Allah.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ tún rí ìwé gbà láti ọ̀dọ̀ ààrẹ ìgbìmọ̀ àjọ àgbáyé, Ambassador (Prof. ) Tijjani Muhammad-Bande,  ẹgbẹ́ àwọn akọ̀ròyìn àgbáyé (the global network of Editors, the International Press Institute, IPI, ààrẹ àwọn ẹgbẹ́  Nigerian Guild of Editors, Mustapha Isa,  Emir ti ìpínlẹ̀  Kánò, Àmínù Ado Bayero, olórí ẹbí àwọn Dantata ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kánò, Alhaji Àmínù Dantata, adarí  ẹgbẹ́ Izala religious movement  lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, Alhaji Bala Lau àti igbákejì adarí ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin àgbà, Bala Ibn Na’Allah.

translation.en: Others are: Nigerian Ambassador to the USA, Justice Sylvanus Adiewere Nsofor, Emir of Zamfara, His Royal Highness, Alhaji Attahiru Muhammad Ahmad, Senator Umaru Kurfi, Burhan Karabult, Nigeria’s Turkish partner in the Defence Industries Corporation, DICON, Professor James Momoh, Vice Chairman of the Nigerian Electricity Regulatory Commission and renowned Kano preacher, Ustashi Tijjani Bala Kalarawi.
translation.yo: Àwọn mííràn tún ni : Aṣojú orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà fún orílẹ̀ èdè Amẹ́ríkà (USA), adájọ́ Sylvanus Adiewere Nsofor, Emir ti Zamfara, ọba  Alhaji Attahiru Muhammad Ahmad, aṣòfin Umaru Kurfi, Burhan Karabult, Nigeria’s Turkish partner in the Defence Industries Corporation, DICON, ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n  James Momoh, igbákejì alága fún ilé-isẹ́ tó ń mójútó iná mọ̀nà-mọ́ná( Nigerian Electricity Regulatory Commission) àti ajíhìnrere láti ìpínlẹ̀  Kánò, Ustashi Tijjani Bala Kalarawi.

translation.en: --- Fourty seven people loss their lives in an attack in Kastina
translation.yo: --- Àwọn ènìyàn mẹ́tàdínláàdọ́ta pàdánù ẹ̀mí wọn lórí ìkọlù tó ṣẹlẹ̀ ní ìpínlẹ̀ katsina

translation.en: President Muhammadu Buhari has shown his displeasure over the attack in three local government areas in Kastina state where forty seven people loss their lives.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari ti fi àìdùnnú rẹ̀ hàn lórí ìkọlù tó ṣẹlẹ̀ ní ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ mẹ́ta kan ní ìpínlẹ̀ katsina níbi tí àwọn ènìyàn mẹ́tàdínláàdọ́ta ti pàdánù ẹ̀mí wọn.

translation.en: President Buhari said this when he answering question about the evil incidence that happened on Sunday. President said he was sad about the attack.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Buhari ṣọ̀rọ̀ yìí lásìkò tó ń dáhùn ìbéèrè nípa ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ burúkú tó wáyé lọ́jọ́ Àìkú. Ààrẹ ní inú òun bàjẹ́ nípa ìkọlù ọ̀hún.

translation.en: He then appealed all Nigerians to be at rest that this government has purposed to fight and to punish all criminals that use the time of lockdown to harm the innocent.
translation.yo: Ó wá rọ gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà láti fọkànbalẹ̀ pé "ị̀jọba yìí ti pinnu láti gbógun àti fìyà jẹ gbogbo àwọn ọ̀daràn tí wọ́n bá ń lo àsìkò kónílé-gbélé láti fi hu ìwà ìbàjẹ́ sí àwọn aláìsẹ̀ ".

translation.en: President Buhari said he will not agree with the way criminals are killing the innocents and “according to my decision to see to the safety of the citizen, we shall see that we fight this attacks”.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Buhari ní òun kò ní faramọ́ bí àwọn ọ̀daràn ṣe ń pa àwọn aláìsẹ̀ àti pé “gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìpinnu mi láti mójútó ètò ààbò àwọn ará ìlú,àwọn ìkọlù yìí ni a óò ri pé a gbógun tìì. ”

translation.en: The president then command all the law enforcement agents not to relent in fighting the criminal and make them scape goats.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ wa pàsẹ fún gbogbo àwọn agbófinró láti máa ṣe káárẹ̀ nípa gbígbógun ti  àwọn ọ̀daràn kí wọ́n sì fi wọ́n jófin.

translation.en: President mourn with the families of those that loss their lives, he appeal to all to be watchful and to report to the law enforcement agents if they suspect criminals in their environment.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ wa bá àwọn ẹbí tó pàdánù ènìyàn wọn kẹ́dùn , ó wá rọ gbogbo àwọn ènìyàn láti jẹ́ ojú ni alákàn fi ń ṣọ́rí , kí wọ́n sì máa fi tó gbogbo àwọn agbófinró létí, tí wọ́n bá fura sí àwọn ọ̀daràn  ní àgbègbè wọn.

translation.en: --- House Speaker, others mourn Abba Kyari
translation.yo: --- Ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣojú kẹ́dùn ikú Abba Kyari

translation.en: The Speaker of Nigeria’s House of Representatives Mr. Femi Gbajabiamila has described the death of the Chief of Staff to the President, Malam Abba Kyari as shocking and sad.
translation.yo: Abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣojú lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, ọ̀gbẹ́ni Fémi Gbàjàbíàmílà ti sàpèjúwe ikú adarí òṣìṣẹ́ ààrẹ̣, Malam Abba Kyari gẹ́gẹ́ bi èyí tó bani lọ́kànjẹ́.

translation.en: In a condolence message signed by Special Adviser to the Speaker on Media and Publicity, Mr. Lanre Lasisi, Mr. Gbajabiamila said it was unfortunate that Abba Kyari died as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic, which is now ravaging countries all over the world.
translation.yo: Nínú ọ̀rọ̀ ìkíni tí olùrànlọ́wọ́ rẹ̀, Láńre Làsísì fọwọ́sí, abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣojú, Gbàjàbíàmílà sọ pé, ó se ni láàánú pé  ààrùn COVID-19  tí ó ń jà káàkiri gbogbo àgbáyé ni ó pa Abba Kyari

translation.en: He said Abba Kyari would be remembered for his selfless and dedicated service to Nigeria right from his days as a private citizen through the time he served as the Chief of Staff to the President .
translation.yo: Ó tẹ̀síwájú pé orúkọ̣ Abba Kyari yóò wà nínú ìwé ìrántí orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà gẹ́gẹ́ bí akínkanjú àti olùfọkànsì ènìyàn sí ààrẹ Buhari àti orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: The Deputy Speaker of the House, Alhaji Idris Ahmed Wase in his message condoled with President Muhammadu Buhari over the death of his Chief of Staff, Mallam Abba Kyari.
translation.yo: Nínú ọ̀rọ̀ ìkíni tirẹ̀, igbákejì abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣojú, Alhaji Idris Ahmed Wase wá kẹ́dùn pẹ̀lú  àarẹ  Muhammadu Buhari lórí ikú adarí òṣìṣẹ́ rẹ̀, Mallam Abba Kyari.

translation.en: He has also extended his heartfelt condolences to his immediate family and the people and government of Borno State on the loss of their illustrious son.
translation.yo: Ó wá fi ọ̀rọ̀ ìkẹ́dùn rẹ̀ ránsẹ́ sí àwọn ẹbí olóògbé ọ̀hún àti ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ Borno.

translation.en: The Minority Leader of the House of Representatives, Mr. Ndudi Elumelu, in a statement described Mallam Abba Kyari’s death as a huge loss to the nation, particularly at this critical time.
translation.yo: Adarí ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ tó kéré jùlọ nílé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣojú, Ndudi Elumelu, náà wá sàpèjúwe ikú Abba Kyari gẹ́gẹ́ bí àdánù ńlá fún orílẹ̀ Nàìjíríà pàápàá jùlọ ní irú àsìkò tí a wà yìí.

translation.en: --- Chief of Staff to Nigerian President dies of COVID-19
translation.yo: --- Erín wó! Ààrùn Corona(COVID-19) pa adarí òṣìṣẹ́ ààrẹ  Buhari

translation.en: The Chief of Staff to the Nigerian president Abba Kyari is dead.
translation.yo: Adarí òṣìṣẹ́ fún ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, Abba Kyari ni ààrùn (COVID-19) ti pa báyìí.

translation.en: Special Adviser to President Buhari on Media and Publicity, Femi Adesina who made the announcement in the early hours of Saturday stated that Mallam Kyari died on Friday, April 17, 2020.
translation.yo: Olùrànlọ́wọ́ ààrẹ Buhari lórí ìròyìn àti ìkéde, Fémi Adésínà ló kéde yìí ní òwúrọ̀ ọjọ́ Àbámẹ́ta pé Mallam Kyari dágbére fáyé lọ́jọ́ Ẹtì (Friday) ọjọ́ kẹtàdínlọ́gbọ̀n ,oṣù kẹrin, ọdún, 2020.

translation.en: It would be recalled that the deceased had earlier tested positive to the ravaging COVID-19, and had been receiving treatment.
translation.yo: Tí a ò bá gbàgbé pé Mallam Kyari ni wọ́n rí ààrùn COVID-19 lára rẹ̀, tí ó sì ń gba ìwòsàn , kí ó tó di pé ó dágbére fún ayé pé ò dìgbòóse.

translation.en: Adesina said funeral arrangements will be announced shortly and prayed to God to  rest his soul.
translation.yo: Adésínà ni àwọn yóò kéde ètò ìsìnkú  láìpẹ́, Ó wá gbàdúrà pé kí Ọlọ́run tẹ̣́ olóògbé náà sí afẹ́fẹ́ ire.

translation.en: --- COVID-19: Nigeria confirms 51 new cases
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: Àwọn ènìyàn mọ́kànléláàdọ́ta (51) míràn tún jẹyọ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà

translation.en: Nigeria has confirmed 51 new cases of the novel coronavirus also known as COVID-19.
translation.yo: Àwọn ènìyàn mọ́kànléláàdọ́ta (51) míràn tún  ti jẹyọ tí wọ́n ní ààrùn Corona (COVID 19 )  lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà

translation.en: Fifty-one new cases of #COVID19 have been reported;
translation.yo: Àwọn ìpínlẹ̀ mọ́kàndínlógún ní ààrùn COIVD-19 tí jẹyọ báyìí.

translation.en: --- COVID-19: Minister urges Nigerians to report illegal entry from borders
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: Mínísítà ro̩mo̩ Nàìjíríà láti s̩àfihàn àwo̩n a-lo-ò̩nà-àìtó̩ wo̩ e̩nubodè.

translation.en: The Minister of Interior, Ogbeni Rauf Aregbesola, has urged Nigerians to promptly report any perceived illegal entry into the country through the nation’s borders to the Nigeria Immigration Service (NIS).
translation.yo: Mínísítà fún ètò ọ̀rọ̀ abẹlé, ọ̀gbé̩ni Rauf Aré̩gbé̩ṣolá, ti rọ ọmọ Nàìjíríà láti tú àṣírí àwo̩n a-lo-ò̩nà-àìtó̩ wo̩ ẹnubodè sí Nàìjíríà fún àjọ amójútó ètò ẹnu ibodè ní orílèèdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: Aregbesola said this while answering questions at the Presidential Taskforce on COVID-19 on Thursday in Abuja.
translation.yo: Arégbésolá sọ̀yí lásìkò táwọn ikò̩ ìjọba àpapọ̀ amójútó ààrùn COIVD-19 ń dáhùn ìbéèrè lọ́wọ́ àwọn akọròyìn nílùú Àbújá lọ́jọ́bọ̀.

translation.en: He said that it was illegal for anybody to import COVID-19 into the country by any means in spite of the huge sacrifices the citizenry made with the stay-at-home order by the Federal Government.
translation.yo: Ó ní ó lòdì sí òfin pé kí ẹnikẹ́ni kó ààrùn COVID-19 wọ orílẹ̀ èdè kan, lásìkò tí àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè ọ̀hún sì ń kojú ìpèníjà òfin kónílé-gbélé tí ìjọba àpapọ̀ ṣe.

translation.en: “Nigerians have sacrificed a lot to curtail COVID-19 and we should be alert to any illegal entry, this gain came at high price and it has taken toll on our economy, spiritual and social lives.
translation.yo: “Nàìjíríà ti s̩e làálàá púpò̩ láti kápa COVID-19 a sì gbo̩dò̩ kíyèsára ìwo̩lé-àìtó̩, èrè yìí wá pè̩lú ìdojúko̩ ńlá ó sì ti ní ipá lórí ètò o̩rò̩ ajé, ìbás̩epò̩ pè̩lú O̩ló̩run àti ìbás̩epò̩ láwùjo̩ wa.

translation.en: “We must support the country to keep our nation secure, our hospitality and sense of compassion which is the hallmark of Nigeria should not be taken for granted,” he said.
translation.yo: “A gbó̩dò̩ kín orílèèdè wa lé̩yìn láti dáàbòbò ìlú wa, ìkónimó̩ra àti ìfé̩ni wa èyí tí ó je̩ orílè̩ èdè Nàìjíríà lógún jùlo̩ kò gbo̩dò̩ dí ohun àtè̩mó̩lè̩,” Ó so̩.

translation.en: Prisoner Amnesty Speaking on the released prisoners by the Federal Government, Aregbesola said that 70 Federal offenders were to benefit from the amnesty, while 2,600 were state offenders.
translation.yo: Sísò̩rò̩ lórí ìdárìjì ìjo̩ba àpapò̩ sí àwo̩n e̩lé̩wò̩n tí wó̩n tú ú lè̩, Aré̩gbé̩s̩o̩lá ni àádó̩rin e̩lé̩wò̩n ìjo̩ba àpapò̩ ló jàǹfààní ìyò̩nda yìí, tí e̩gbè̩tàlá sì jé̩ tìpínlè̩.

translation.en: Aregbesola said President Muhammadu Buhari had ordered the Attorney General for the Federation to liaise with states to free the 2,600 offenders.
translation.yo: Aré̩gbé̩s̩o̩lá ní Ààre̩ Muhammadu Buhari tin í kí adájó̩ tó ń rísí èyí sowó̩pò̩ pè̩lú àwo̩n ìpínlè̩ láti yò̩nda àwo̩n e̩lé̩wò̩n e̩gbè̩tàlá.

translation.en: He said that the federal government was committed to decongesting the correctional centres.
translation.yo: Ó ní pé ìjo̩ba àpapò̩ ń wá ò̩nà láti s̩e àdínkù o̩gbà è̩wò̩n.

translation.en: The minister commended the endurance and resilience of Nigerians and front line health workers to curtail the spread of COVID-19.
translation.yo: Mínísítà wá gbós̩ùbà fún àwo̩n o̩mo̩ Nàìjíríà, pàápàá jùlo̩ àwo̩n àjo̩ elétò ìlera fún ìgbìyànjú wo̩n láti dé̩kun ààrùn COVID-19.

translation.en: He called on states like Lagos, Sokoto, Cross Rivers and Niger who share borders with other countries to ensure that the borders were closely monitored so as not to allow aliens into the country at this period.
translation.yo: Ó ké sí àwọn ìpínlẹ̀ bíi Èkó, Sókótó, Cross Rivers áti Niger tó ní ààlà pẹ̀lú àwọn orílẹ̀ èdè mííràn láti ri pé wó̩n ń s̩o̩ e̩nu ibodè dáadáa kí àjèjì má baà wo̩ orílè̩ èdè Nàìjíríà ní àkókò yìí.

translation.en: --- COVID-19 Lockdown: FCTA releases new guidelines on cessation of movement
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: FCTA gbé ìlànà tuntun jáde lásìkò òfin kónílé-gbélé

translation.en: The Federal Capital Territory Administration, FCTA has released new guidelines on cessation of movement aimed at containing the continuous spread of COVID-19 virus within the FCT.
translation.yo: Ìjọba ìlú Àbújá (The Federal Capital Territory Administration, FCTA) ti gbé ètò ìlànà tuntun jáde lásìkò òfin kónílé-gbéle yìí láti dẹ̣́kun ìtànkálẹ̀ ààrùn COVID-19 nílùú Àbújá.

translation.en: According to information on the FCTA official twitter account, this became necessary following a review of the effect and level of compliance of the cessation of movement within the FCT.
translation.yo: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí àtẹ̀jáde kan tí ilé-isẹ́ tí ó ń mójútó ìlú Àbújá gbé jáde lórí ẹ̀rọ twitter wọn  pé àwọn ti ṣètò ìlànà tuntun lórí ètò kónílé-gbélé ọ̀hún.

translation.en: Some of the new directives issued by the FCT COVID-19 Security committee chaired by the FCT Minister, Malam Muhammad Musa Bello include:
translation.yo: Lára àwọn ètò ìlànà tuntun tígbìmọ̀ elétò ààbò ìlú Àbújá alámòójútó ààrùn COVID-19, tí mínísítà FCT, Malam Muhammad Musa Bello jólùdarí ní:

translation.en: Market days now Wednesday and Saturdays only.
translation.yo: Àwo̩n o̩jó̩ o̩jà ni o̩jó̩rú àti àbámé̩ta nìkan. Ra nǹkan ló̩jà tó súnmó̩ re̩.

translation.en: Patronize Markets Close To Your Neighborhood
translation.yo: Ìdádúró ò̩kadà ní Kubwa àti Dutse.

translation.en: Motorcycles banned in Kubwa and Dutse.
translation.yo: Ìdásílè̩ ilé-e̩jó̩ alágbèéká láti dájó̩ àwo̩n arúfin.

translation.en: --- President Buhari rejoices with British PM Johnson for overcoming Coronavirus
translation.yo: --- Ààrẹ Buhari bádarí ìjọba Gè̩é̩sì, Johnson yọ̀ fún bíborí Corona

translation.en: President Muhammadu Buhari has congratulated British Prime Minister, Boris Johnson following his discharge from the hospital over COVID-19.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Nàìjíríà Muhammadu Buhari kí adarí ìjọba Gè̩é̩sì, Boris Johnson kóorííre lé̩yìn tí wó̩n yò̩nda rè̩ níléèwòsàn nítorí kòrónà.

translation.en: In a congratulatory letter dated April 14, 2020, to Mr Johnson, President Buhari said, “I received with great relief the news of your discharge from hospital after being successfully treated for COVID-19.”
translation.yo: Nínú lé̩tà ìkíni rẹ̀ tó fi ránsẹ́ ní April 14, 2020, sí ọ̀gbẹ́ni Johnson, ààrẹ̀ Buhari ní, “Inú mi dùn lásìkò tí mo gbọ́ròyìn ayọ̀ pé ó kúrò nílé-ìwòsàn àìlárùn kòrónà mó̩.”

translation.en: President Buhari also wished the Prime Minister full recovery and good health in the coming days.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Buhari gbàdúrà fún adarí ọ̣̀hún, pé kỌlọ́run fun lálàáfíà pípé ní gbogbo ọjọ́ ayé rẹ̀.

translation.en: --- COVID-19: China is fighting corona virus not Nigerians or Africans in China. – Minister
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: China ló báààrùn kòrónà jà kì í s̩e o̩mo̩ Nàìjíríà tàbí aláwò̩dúdú ní China – Mínísítà

translation.en: Nigeria government have said that China government is fighting corona virus not that they hate or did wrong to the Nigerians or the Africans living in Guangzhou in China.
translation.yo: Ìjọba orílèèdè Nàìjíríà ní ìjo̩ba China ló ń kojú ààrùn kòrónà kìí s̩e pé wó̩n kórìíra tàbí s̩àìda sí o̩mo̩ Nàìjíríà tàbí aláwò̩dúdú tó ń gbe Guangzhou ní China.

translation.en: The minister for foreign affairs, Mr. Geoffrey Onyeama, and the china ambassador in Nigeria, Zhou Pingjian, said this to journalist in Abuja.
translation.yo: Mínísítà fún ètò ọ̀rọ̀ ilẹ̀ òkèèrè, ọ̀gbẹ́ni  Geoffrey Onyeama, àti aṣojú orílẹ̀ èdè China ní Nàìjíríà, Zhou Pingjian,ní wọn sọ̀rọ̀ yìí fún àwọn akọ̀ròyìn nílùú Àbújá.

translation.en: The cause was the video clip that the Nigerians are sending about the wrong deeds to the Nigerians living in China.
translation.yo: Okùnfà ni fídíò kan tí àwo̩n o̩mo̩ Nàìjíríà fihàn káàkiri, tó ń s̩àfihàn ohun búburú tí àwo̩n o̩mo̩ China fojú wa rí ló̩hùn-ún.

translation.en: The minister continued that a woman selling food in  Guangzhou in China that is COVID 19 positive in 2019 with the Nigerians that were buying food from her and were infected are the ones to be isolated but it went other way through disobedience.
translation.yo: Mínísítà tẹ̀síwájú pé arábìnrin kan tó ń ta oúnjẹ nílùú Guangzhou, ní China, alárùn COVID-19 lọ́dún 2019 pẹ̀lú àwọn ọmọ Nàìjíríà tí wọ́n ra oúnjẹ ló̩dò̩ rè̩ fara káása ààrùn kòrónà, wó̩n fé̩ fi wó̩n sí ìgbélé s̩ùgbó̩n tí ò̩rò̩ gbabòmíràn nípasè̩ àìgbó̩nràn.

translation.en: Minister said again that a relationship is between China and Nigeria, the two nations have collaborated to settle the problem.
translation.yo: Mínísítà tún ní ìbásepọ̀ tó mọ́nyán lórí wà láàrín orílẹ̀ èdè China àti orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, orílẹ̀ èdè méjèèjì yìí sí ti ń fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ láti yanjú wàhálà ọ̀hún.

translation.en: --- COVID-19: President Buhari hails Media, Security and Health workers
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: Ààrẹ Buhari gbósùbà fún akọ̀ròyìn, àjọ elétò ààbò àti ì̀lera

translation.en: President Muhammadu Buhari has thanked the Nigerian media, health workers and security agencies for working so hard as the country tries to contain the COVID-19 pandemic.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari ti dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ àwọn akọ̀ròyìn, àjọ tó ń mójútó ètò ìlera, àwọn ilé-isẹ́ ètò ààbò fún gudu gudu méje yàyà mẹ́fà tí wọ́n ń ṣe lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí láti dẹ́kun ìtànkalẹ̀ ààrùn COVID-19.

translation.en: The president in a nationwide broadcast to citizens on Monday evening said:
translation.yo: Lákòókò ìgbóhùnsáfẹ́fẹ́ sí àwo̩n ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ló̩jó̩ ajé, Ààre̩ ní:

translation.en: “I must recognise the incredible work being done by our healthcare workers and volunteers across the country especially in frontline areas of Lagos and Ogun States as well as Abuja.
translation.yo: Mo gbó̩dò̩ mo̩ rírì àwọn òṣìsẹ́ ètò ìlera àti àwọn tí ó fara wọn jìn ní jákèjádò orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, pàápàá jùlọ ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó, Ògùn àti ní olú ìlú Nàìjíríà, ìye̩n Abuja.

translation.en: “You are our heroes and as a nation, we will forever remain grateful for your sacrifice during this very difficult time.
translation.yo: “Ẹ̀yin ni akọni wa gẹ́gẹ́ bí orílẹ̀-èdè, fún o̩jó̩ ayé wa gbogbo lá máa dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ yín fún ìfarajìn yin lásìkò ìpèníjà yìí.

translation.en: More measures to motivate our health care workers are being introduced which we will announce in the coming weeks.
translation.yo: A máa pèsè ohun amóríwú fún àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ètò ìlera, léyìí táa kéde lọ́sẹ̀ tó ń bọ̀.

translation.en: “I must also thank the media houses, celebrities and other public figures for the great work they are doing in sensitizing our citizens on hygienic practices, social distancing and issues associated with social gatherings.
translation.yo: Mo tún dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ gbogbo ilé-isẹ́ ìròyìn , àwọn gbajú-gbajà òṣ̣èré àti àwọn ènìyàn pàtàkì láwùjọ fún iṣẹ́ ribi-ribi wọn láti máa la àwọn ènìyàn lọ́yẹ̀ nípa ìmọ́tótó, yìyẹra àti ohun tó ní ṣe pẹ̀lú ìpéjọ.

translation.en: As a result of the overwhelming support and cooperation received, we were able to achieve a lot during these 14 days of initial lockdown.
translation.yo: Látàrí àwọn àtìlẹyìn àti ìfọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ yìí, ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn àseyọrí ni a ti ṣe lásìkò ètò kónílé-gbélé ọjọ́ mẹ́rìnlá tí a ṣe.

translation.en: “The Security Agencies have risen to the challenges posed by this unprecedented situation with gallantry and I commend them.
translation.yo: Àwọn ẹ̀ṣọ́ ètò ààbò àti agbófinró náà kò gbẹ́yìn láti kojú ìpèníjà yìí, mo kan sáárá sí wọn.

translation.en: I urge them to continue to maintain utmost vigilance, firmness as well as restraint in enforcing the restriction orders while not neglecting statutory security responsibilities.”
translation.yo: Mo rọ̀ wọ́n láti túbọ̀ máa ṣ̣e ojúṣe wọn bíi iṣẹ́ lásìkò ètò kónílé-gbélé yìí, kí wọ̣́n sì tún máá gbàgbé ojúṣe wọn.

translation.en: The Nigerian leader expressed optimism that as a nation, Nigeria is on the right track to win the fight against COVID-19.
translation.yo: Àwọn adarí orílẹ̀ èdè yìí nígbàgbọ́ pé ìgbésẹ̀ tí wọ́n ń gbé yìí ní láti dẹ́kun ìtànkálẹ̀  ààrùn COVID-19.

translation.en: --- the police arrest the criminal that kill Evangelist Grace Ajibola in Ibadan
translation.yo: --- Ọwọ́ ọlọ́pàá tẹ ọ̀daràn tó pa ajíhìnrere Grace Ajíbọ́lá nílùú Ìbàdàn

translation.en: The Nigeria police force in Oyo state has paraded a criminal suspect, Abegunde Olaniyi which have a hand in the killing of Miss Grace Ajibola who is an Evangelist in a Christian church around Oluyole in Ibadan, southwest of Nigeria on seventeen of march, 2020.
translation.yo: Ilé- iṣẹ ọlọ́pàá ní ìpínlẹ̀  Ọ̀yọ́ ti se àfihàn afurasí ọ̀daràn kan, Abégúndé Oláníyì tó lọ́wọ́ nínú ikú Abilékọ Grace Ajíbọ́lá tí ṣe ajíhìnrere ní ilé ìjọsìn ọmọlẹ́yìn Kristi kan ní agbègbè  Olúyọ̀lé ní ìlú Ìbàdàn tó wà ní ẹkùn Gúsù ìwọ̀ oòrùn orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjiríà ní ọjọ́ kẹtàdínlógún oṣù kẹta ọdún 2020 yìí.

translation.en: In his explanation, the commissioner of police, Shina Olukolu made it known that criminal suspect killed Miss Grace Ajibola after collected a sum of two million naira from her bank account.
translation.yo: Nínú àlàyé rẹ̀, kọmísọ́nà ọlọ́pàá, Shínà Olúkólù jẹ́ kí ó di mímọ́ pé afurasí ọ̀daràn yìí pa abilékọ Grace Ajíbọ́lá lẹ́yìn tí ó gba owó tó lé ní mílíọ́nù méjì náírà nínú àpò ìfowópamọ́ rẹ̀.

translation.en: But the suspect was caught when the Nigeria police force in Oyo state arrested him and was charged.
translation.yo: Sùgbọ́n ọwọ́ pálábá afurasí yìí ségi nígbà tí ọ̣wọ́ ilé-isẹ́ ọlọ́pàá ìpínlẹ̣̀ Ọ̀yọ́ gbáa mú, tí wọ̣́n sì fi kélé òfin gbé e.

translation.en: The Nigeria police force also took from him about three ATM cards, a techno cellular phone, different cloth and stick with which he killed the woman.
translation.yo: Ilé- iṣẹ ọlọ́pàá tún rí àwọn nǹkan bíi oríṣi káádì ilé –ìfowópamọ́ mẹ́ta tí wọ́n fi ń gba owó lẹ́nu ẹ̀rọ pọwó-pọwó (ATM) gbà, ẹ̀rọ ìléwọ́ ìbáraẹni sọ̀rọ̀ Techno, orísiirísii aṣọ àti igi tí ó fi pa arábìnrin náà gbà.

translation.en: Also Nigeria police force in Oyo state paraded some suspected kidnappers and suspected armed robbers in some areas in Oyo state.
translation.yo: Bákan náà, ní Ilé- isẹ́ ọlọ́pàá ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́ tún ṣe àfihàn àwọn afurasí mọ́kàndínlógún míràn tí wọ́n lọ́wọ́ nínú onírúurú ìwà ọ̀daràn bíi ìjínigbé, ìjínipa àti ìdigunjalè ní àwọn àgbègbè kan ní ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́.

translation.en: Part of what the Nigeria police force in Oyo state collected from this suspects are two pistols; ammunitions, six motor cycle  and some other things like knife; one cutlass
translation.yo: Lára àwọn ohun tí Ilé-isẹ́ ọlọ́pàá tún rí gbà lọ́wọ́ àwọn afurasí wọ̀nyí ni ìbọn- ìléwọ́ méjì; ohun ìjà mẹ́ta; kẹ̀kẹ́ alùpùpù tí a mọ̀ sí ọ̀kadà mẹ́fà àti àwọn ohun mìràn bíi: ọ̀bẹ kan; àdá ẹyọ kan; àti owó tó lé díẹ̀ ní ọ̀kẹ́ Mẹ́rìndínlógún àti ààbọ̀ náírà.

translation.en: The commissioner of police, Shina Olukolu added in his words that the people of Oyo state should not be afraid because the Nigeria police is ready to provide safety for live and properties most especially in the period of lockdown going on because of the COVID-19 pandemic the whole world is fighting.
translation.yo: Kọmísánà Ilé- iṣẹ ọlọ́pàá, Shínà Olúkólù wá fi kún ọ̀rọ̀ rẹ̀ pé kí àwọn ènìyàn ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́ máṣe fòyà nítorí Ilé- isẹ́ ọlọ́pàá tí setán láti pèsè ètò ààbò tó péye fún ẹ̀mí àti dúkìá wọn ní pàtàkì jùlọ ní àsìkò ìkéde kónílé- ó- gbélé tó ń lọ lọ́wọ́ látàrí ìtànkálẹ̀ àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn COVID-19 tó ń bá gbogbo orílẹ̀ èdè àgbáyé wọ̀yá ìjà.

translation.en: --- COVID-19. We will not forgive anyone that go against the law of lockdown. Oyo state Commissioner of police.
translation.yo: --- COVID-19. A ò ní foríjin ẹni tó bá tàpá sófin kónílé-gbéle- Kọmísọ́nà ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́

translation.en: Commissioner of police in Oyo state, Shina Olukolu has made the public notice that they will not forgive anyone go against he law of lockdown in Oyo state.
translation.yo: Kọmísọ́nà àwọ̣n ọlọ́pàá ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́, Shina Olúkolú ti fi ìpè síta pé àwọn kò ní foríjin ẹni tó bá tàpá sófin kónílé-gbélé ní ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́.

translation.en: He continued that anyone that do against will face the wrath of the law.
translation.yo: Ó tẹ̀síwájú pé ẹ̣ni tó bá fọwọ́ pa idà ìjọba lójú yóò fojú ba ilé-ẹjọ́ láti jẹ ìyà tó bá tọ́ lábẹ́ òfin.

translation.en: Commissioner of police open this up when he paraded suspected criminals that are not less than twenty at the police headquarters in Oyo state around Eleyele in Ibadan southwest Nigeria.
translation.yo: Kọmísánà àwọn ọlọ́pàá ló ṣíṣọ lójú ọ̀rọ̀ yí lásìkò tí ó ń se àfihàn àwọn afurasí ọ̀daràn tí kò dín ní ogún ní olú- ilé isẹ́ ọlọ́pàá ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́ tó wà ní agbègbè Ẹlẹ́yẹlé ní ìlú Ìbàdàn tó wà ní ẹkùn gúsù ìwọ̀ oòrùn orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: In his explanation, the commissioner of police made it known that Governor of Oyo state Seyi Makinde made the law for lockdown in a way to stop the spread of corona virus known as COVID-19
translation.yo: Nínú àlàyé rẹ̀ komísánà jẹ́ kí ó di mímọ̀ pé Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́,  Sèyí Mákindé se àgbékalè òfin kónílé ó gbélé ní ara ọ̀nà láti dènà ìtànkálẹ̀ àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn Corona virus tí a mọ̀ sí COVID-19.

translation.en: The governor of Oyo state inert lockdown law from twenty nine of March, 2020, in which the government barn anyone from going out from 7pm till 6am the following day.
translation.yo: Òfin kónílé ó gbélé yìí ní Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́ ti fi múlẹ̀ láti ọjọ́ kọkàndínlọ́gbọ̀n osù kẹta ọdún 2020 yìí, nínú èyí tí ìjọba fi òfin de ẹnikẹ́ni láti máse jáde síta láti aago méje alẹ́ títí di aago mẹ́fà àárò ọjọ́ kejì.

translation.en: This law does not allow anyone under any circumstances to do anything after 7pm daily.
translation.yo: Òfin yìí kò fi ààyè gba ẹnikẹ́ni lábẹ́ bó ti wù kórí láti se ohunkóhun lẹ́yìn aago méje alẹ̣́ lójoojúmọ́.

translation.en: But the commissioner show his displeasure to the disobedience act of some people to fight the police to the extent that they were hospitalized.
translation.yo: Sùgbọ́n komísánà wá fi àìdùnnú rẹ̀ hàn sí ìwà àìgbọràn tí àwọn kan ń hù láti máa bá àwọn ọlọ́pàá wọ̀yá ìjà tó bẹ́ẹ̀ tí wọ́n fi di èrò ilé- ìwòsàn.

translation.en: --- COVID-19: Another five (5) people were discovered in Nigeria.
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: Àwọn ènìyàn márùn ún (5) míràn tún jẹyọ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà

translation.en: Another five (5) people were discovered to be COVID-19 positive in Nigeria, which make the total number of those positive to be three hundred and twenty three (323), when eighty five (85) people are discharged, ten (10) people are dead. Nigeria center for disease control (NCDC) announced this on their Twitter handle @NCDC.gov
translation.yo: Àwọn ènìyàn márùn ún (5) míràn tún jẹyọ tíwọ́n ní ààrùn Corona (COVID 19 )  lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, ní èyí tí ó jẹ́ kíiye àwọn tó ní ààrùn Corona jẹ́ mẹ́tàlélógúnlélọ́ọ̀dúnrún (323), nígbà tí àwọn ènìyàn bíi márùndínláàdọ́rùnún (85)  ti gba ìwòsàn , tí àwọn ènìyàn mẹ́wàá (10) ṣì ti j́ẹ Ọlọ́run nípè. Àjọ tó ń gbógun ti àjàkálẹ ààrùn  lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà (NCDC) ló kéde yìí lórí ẹ̀rọ Twitter wọn, @NCDCgov,.

translation.en: Out of the new eight (8) people discovered,  two (2) from Lagos state, one (1) from Kastina. The states in which corona virus has been discovered in Nigeria are nineteen (19) states. Ademola Adepoju
translation.yo: Nínú àwọn mẹ́jọ tí wọ́n ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ jẹyọ ọ̣̀hún ,méjì ( 2) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kwara ,méjì (2) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó ,ẹyọ kan   ( 1 ) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Katsina. Ìpínlẹ̀ tí ààrùn Corona ti jẹ yọ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà  ti jẹ́ ìpínlẹ̀ mọ́kàndínlógún (19) báyìí. Adémọ́lá Adépọ̀jù.

translation.en: --- COVID-19: do not use politics in the effort against corona-IBB
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: Ẹ máa lo òṣèlú fún akitiyan ìjọba nípa ààrùn Corona-IBB

translation.en: A Former Military President of Nigeria, Ibrahim Badamasi Babangida, has commended the Nigerian government on the efforts so far made towards managing the spread of COVID 19 in the Country.
translation.yo: Ajagunfẹ̀yìntì , tó tún jẹ́ ààrẹ tẹ́lẹ̀rí  fún orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà , Ibrahim Badamasi Babangida ti rọ gbogbo àwọn tí ọ̀rọ̀ láti máá ṣe fi lo òṣèlú fún akitiyan ìjọba nípa ààrùn Corona.

translation.en: While equally commending the states Governors in the Country, General Ibrahim Babangida, mentioned that despite the rising numbers of the Covid-19 in the Country, the situation is still being kept at manageable levels within the limits of the health care system . He gave the commendation on Sunday, in Minna, the Niger State Capital.
translation.yo: Ó wá gbósùbà fún àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ìjọ̣ba  lórí akitiyan wọn láti dẹ́kun ààrùn Corona. Ajagunfẹ̀yìntì, Ibrahim Bàbángídá sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lọ́jọ́ Àìkú nílùú Minna, ní ìpínlẹ̀ Niger, ó tún wá gbósùbà fún àwọn gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀, àwọn àjọ elétò ìlera  fún ipa pàtàkì tí wọ́n ń kó láti dẹ́kun ààrùn Covid-19  lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà , bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé iye àwọn tó ní ààrùn ọ̀hún sì ń pọ̀ si lójoojúmọ́.

translation.en: He however urged Nigerians to collectively observe all recommendations of the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) and adhere strictly to directives of government on basic hygiene to prevent spread of the COVID 19”.
translation.yo: Ó wá rọ gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà láti máa tẹ̀lé gbogbo ìlànà tí àwọn àjọ elétò ìlera àti àjọ tó ń gbógun ti ìtànkálẹ̀ ààrùn (NCDC) bá là sílẹ̀ láti dẹ́kun ààrùn COIVD-19.

translation.en: --- Easter: Osun Speaker urges Nigerians to keep hope alive
translation.yo: --- Easter: Abẹnugan ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀ṣun rọ Nàìjíríà láti ní ìrètí nínú Ọlọ́run

translation.en: Mr Timothy Owoeye, the Speaker of Osun House of Assembly, has urged the Christians and Nigerians to keep hope alive in spite the ravaging COVID-19 pandemic in the country.
translation.yo: Abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin ti ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀sun, ọ̀gbẹ́ni Timothy Owóèye,ti rọ gbogbo àwọn ọmọ lẹ́yìn Krísít̀i àti orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà láti mú ìrètí wọn dúro ṣinṣin  bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé àjàkálẹ̀ wà lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: Owoeye in an Easter message on Saturday said that the end of the world was not yet here with the outbreak of Coronavirus.
translation.yo: Owóèye sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lọ́jọ́ Àbámẹ́ta nínú àtẹ̀jáde rẹ̀ fún àjọ̀dún Ọjọ́ Àjíǹde , ó ní  kì í ṣe ààrùn Corona ni yóò jẹ́ kí òpin ayé dé.

translation.en: He urged well meaning individuals in the country not to leave the gesture of bringing succour to lives of the vulnerable Nigerians.
translation.yo: Ó wá rọ̣ àwọn ojúlówó ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà láti ṣèrànwọ́ ohun ìdẹ̀rùn fún àwọn tó nílò ìrànlọ́wọ́.

translation.en: He added: “We should let the significance of Easter reflect in our relationship with one another.
translation.yo: Ó tẹ̀síwájú pé: A gbọdọ̀ jẹ́ kí àjọ̀dún Àjíǹde ti Krísítì yìí ní ipa pàtàkì nínú ìbásepọ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn ẹlòmíràn.

translation.en: “We should not leave or limit the provision of palliatives to cushion in the effect of COVID-19 to government and politicians alone.
translation.yo: A kò gbọdọ̀ dá ètò ìrànwọ́ fún àwọ̣n ènìyàn lásìkò ààrùn COVID-19 yìí dá ìjọba àti àwọn olósèlú nìkan.

translation.en: “There is no doubt that these are tough times, but we must keep hope alive that life will be better and that this trying period too shall pass.”
translation.yo: Kò sí àríyànjiyàn pé  àsìkò tí a wà yìí le púpọ̀ sùgbọ́n a gbọdọ̀ mú ìgbàgbọ́ wa dúró sinsin nínú Ọlọ́run, kí a sì ní ìrètí pé,bó tilẹ̀ wù kí ó le tó, ìgbà  sì ń bọ̀ wá dẹ̀ .

translation.en: --- COVID-19 pandemic
translation.yo: --- Ààrùn COVID-19

translation.en: COVID-19 is a deadly disease, that make the economy of the whole world collapsed.
translation.yo: Ààrun COVID-19 jẹ́ ààrùn asekúpani , tó tún jẹ́ kí gbogbo ètò ọrọ̀ ajé orílẹ̀ èdè àgbáyé dojúbolẹ̀.

translation.en: This was why the government of Nigeria took the step to declare a lockdown in Lagos state, Ogun state and Abuja to protect the lives of all in Nigeria.
translation.yo: Èyí ló mú kí ìjọba àpapọ̀ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà gbé ìgbéṣẹ̀ láti sòfin kónílé-gbélé ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó, Ògùn àti Àbújá, láti dáàbò bò ẹ̀mí tonílé-tàlejò tó wà lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: In following the guidelines given by the ministry of health and to adhere to this guidelines only can make us overcome.
translation.yo: Nípa títẹ̀lé ètò ìlànà tí àjọ tó ń mójútó ètò ìlera là sílẹ̀ àti ìgbọràn sí òfin ìgbélé nìkan ló leè mú wa borí.

translation.en: --- Easter: Oyo Governor, Seyi Makinde calls for increased faith despite COVID-19
translation.yo: --- Easter: Ẹ jẹ́ kí ìgbàgbọ́ yín duro ṣinṣin – Sèyí Mákindé, Oyo State Governor

translation.en: The Governor of Oyo State, Seyi Makinde, has called on Christians in the State to be full of faith in the power of the resurrection at Easter, particularly when the whole world is faced with the Coronavirus pandemic.
translation.yo: Góm̀inà ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́ , Sèyí Mákindé ti rọ àwọn ọmọ lẹ́yìn Krísítì láti mú ìgbàgbọ́ wọn dúró  ṣiniṣin nínú agbára Àjíǹde Krísítì páàpáà jùlọ lásìkò tí gbogbo àgbáyé ń kojú ìpèníjà ààrùn Corona.

translation.en: The Governor stated this in his Easter message to the people of the State.
translation.yo: Góm̀inà ṣọ̀rọ̀ yìí nínú ọ̀rọ̀ Àjíǹde tí ó fi ránṣẹ́ sí àwọn ọmọ ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́.

translation.en: Makinde noted that, “At Easter, we Christians are reminded about the basis of our faith, Faith in the power of the resurrection.
translation.yo: Mákindé tún sọ pé, “Ayẹyẹ Àjíǹde,  máa ń ran àwa ọmọ lẹ́yìn Kristi létí nípa ìgbàgbọ́ wa, Ìgbàgbọ́ nínú agbára Àjíǹde.

translation.en: And at this time, when the world is thrown into COVID-19 turmoil, we have faith, the assurance of things yet unseen. We believe.”
translation.yo: A gbọ́dọ̀ nígbàgbọ́ nípa ohun tí a kò fojúrí ,pàápàá jùlọ lásìkò tí gbogbo àgbáyé wà nínú ewu ààrùn COVID-19.

translation.en: He added that despite the fact that the partial lockdown in the State necessitated by the Coronavirus has prevented many citizens from providing for their families as they used to.
translation.yo: Ó tẹ̀síwájú pé bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn Corona ti jẹ́ kí àwọn ọmọ ìpínlẹ̀ náà wà nínú ìgbélé , tí kò sì leè jẹ́ kí wọ́n lọ sí ibi iṣẹ́ òòjọ́ wọn, tí ó tún jẹ́ kí ó nira fún púpọ̀  àwọn ọmọ ìpínlẹ̀ náà láti pèsè fún àwọn ẹbí wọn  gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìṣe wọn.

translation.en: Governor Makinde affirmed that his administration would always make the welfare of the citizens a priority.
translation.yo: Gómìnà Mákindé wá ṣèlérí pé ìjọba yóò mú ìgbáyé-gbádùn àwọn ará ìpínlẹ̀  náà lọ́kùńkúndùn.

translation.en: The Governor further encouraged the people of the State to stay home and stay safe.
translation.yo: Gómìnà wá rọ àwọn ọmọ ìpínlẹ̀ náà láti dúró sínú ilé wọn, kí wọ́n sì wà ní àlàáfíà.

translation.en: --- FULL TEXT OF PRESIDENT MUHAMMADU BUHARI’S 2020 EASTER MESSAGE TO NIGERIANS
translation.yo: --- Ọ̀RỌ̀ ÀÀRẸ MUHAMMADU BUHARI FÚN AYẸYẸ ỌJỌ́ ÀJÍǸDE KRISTI FÚN ỌDÚN 2020 SÍ GBOGBO ỌMỌ ORÍLẸ̀ ÈDÈ NÀÌJÍRÍÀ

translation.en: I rejoice with our Christian brothers and sisters as well as all Nigerians on the occasion of the celebration of this year’s Easter.
translation.yo: Mo bá àwọn arákùnrin, arábìnrin ọmọ lẹ́yìn kristi àti gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjirià yọ̀ lórí ayẹyẹ ọjọ́ Àjíǹde Kristi ti ọdún yìí.

translation.en: This year’s commemoration of Easter comes amid the grip with which COVID-19 has held the entire world.
translation.yo: Ìrántí Àjíǹde ọdún yìí wáyé lásìkò tí ìtànkálẹ̣̀ ààrùn COVID-19 jẹyọ ní gbogbo àgbáyé.

translation.en: Unprecedented in living memory, majority of Christians have found themselves marking Easter in a subdued manner, away from the usual congregation in churches.
translation.yo: Bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé gbogbo àwọn ọmọ lẹ́yìn Kristi ní wọn bá ara wọn láti ṣe ayẹyẹ ọjọ́ Àjíǹde ní ọ̀nà ìrẹ̀lẹ̀ yàtọ̀ si bí wọ́n ṣẹ máa ń ṣe ayẹyẹ ọ̀hún nílé-ìjọ́sìn wọn.

translation.en: This is unusual and very unfortunate.
translation.yo: Eleyìí jẹ́ kàyéfì àti ìbànújẹ́ púpọ̀.

translation.en: However, I wish to enjoin our Christian compatriots to rekindle their faith in Christ who overcame persecution, sufferings and displayed endurance, steadfastness and above all piety.
translation.yo: Síbẹ̀síbẹ̀, Mo fẹ́ rọ gbogbo àwọn ọmọ lẹ́yìn kristi láti mú ìgbàgbọ́ wọn dúró ṣinṣin nínú Kristi, tí ó borí inúnibíni, àwọn ìjìyà àti ìfaradà, àti ju gbogbo rẹ̀ lọ, ìwà-bí-Ọlọ́run.

translation.en: Jesus Christ represented man’s ability to withstand temporary pains in the hope of everlasting glory.
translation.yo: Jésù Kristi dúró fún agbára ènìyàn láti farada àwọn ìrora ìgbà díẹ̀ ní ìrètí ògo ayérayé.

translation.en: I urge you to imbibe and live the values of humility, discipline, perseverance, sacrifice and obedience which Jesus Christ demonstrated during His stay on earth.
translation.yo: Mo rọ̀ yín láti gbé ìgbé ayé ìrẹ̣̀lẹ̀, ìbáwí, ìfaradà, ìrúbọ àti ìgbọràn, ní èyí tí Jésù Kristi ṣe àfihàn rẹ̀ lákòókò tó wà nílé ayé.

translation.en: There is no better opportunity than now for all Christians in particular, and Nigerians in general, to remain faithful and hopeful that with intensified prayers backed by personal and collective responsibility, the nation shall pull through this most difficult trial.
translation.yo: Kò sí ànfààní tí ó dára ju eléyìí lọ fún gbogbo àwọn Krìstìẹ́nì, ní pàtàkì jùlọ, gbogbo àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà lápapọ̀, láti jẹ́ olóòtítọ́, kí wọ́n tún ní ìrètí pé, pẹ̀lú àdúrà gbígbà àti nípasẹ̀ ìdúróṣinṣin yálà lọ́kọ̀ọ̀kan tàbí lápapọ̀, ó di dandan kí orílẹ̀-èdè wá borí awọn ìpèníjà wọ̀nyí.

translation.en: I have no doubt that if all stakeholders – individuals and groups – play their part to the fullest as advised by our scientists and medical experts in confronting COVID-19, the inherent resilience and determination of our people will enable us to pull through.
translation.yo: Èmi kò ní iyèméjì pé tí gbogbo àwọn alábàṣepọ̀, ẹnì-kọ̀ọ̀kan àti àwọn ẹgbẹ́, ba sa ipá wọn ní kíkún, tí a sì tẹ̀lé ìmọ̀ràn láti ọ̀dọ̀ àwọn onímọ̀-ìjìnlẹ̀ àti àwọn tó ní òye nípa ìṣòògùn tó lè dẹ́kun ààrùn COVID-19, ó dájú pé ìpinnu tí àwọn ènìyàn wá ní, yóò jẹ́ kí a borí.
