translation.en: As I stated in my national broadcast on Sunday, March 29, 2020, since there is currently no known vaccine against the virus, “the best and most efficient way to avoid getting infected is through regular hygiene and sanitary practices as well as social distancing.”
translation.yo: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí mo ti ṣàlàyé  sẹ́yìn nínú  ìgbóhùnsáfẹ́fẹ́ tí mo ṣe  fún orílẹ̀-èdè yìí lọ́jọ́ Àìkú, Ọjọ́ kọkàndínlọ́gbọ̀n, ọdún  2020, pé , níwọ̀n ìgbà tí kò sí  abẹ́rẹ́ àjẹsára tí a mọ̀ lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́  tó lè gbógun ti ààrùn náà, ọ̀nà tí ó dára jùlọ àti tí ó múnádóko ni  láti yàgò fún ààrùn ọ̀hún  nípasẹ̀ ṣíse  ètò ìmọ́tótó déédé àti nípa yíyẹra fún ìpéjọ àpapọ̀.

translation.en: May I use this opportunity to commend the encouraging containment and ameliorating strategies put in place by members of the Presidential Task Force on COVID-19.
translation.yo: Mo tún ń lo ànfààní yìí láti gbósùbà fún ìgbìmọ̀ ìjọba àpapọ̀ fún àwọn ìlànà tí wọ́n ń gbé láti dẹ́kun ààrùn COVID-19.

translation.en: I am very much aware of the personal and collective inconveniences suffered by our people due to measures such as restriction of movements and closure of business premises.
translation.yo: Mo mọ̀ nípa àwọn ìníra àti ìjìyà tí ẹnìkọ̀ọ̀kan àti àwọn ènìyàn ń dojúkọ nípasẹ̀ ìgbésẹ̀ bíí ìgbélé àti bí a kò ṣe jẹ́ kí wọ́n lọ síbi isẹ́ òòjọ́ wọn.

translation.en: Being “a matter of life and death,” these sacrifices are in everybody’s interest to save our country from calamity.
translation.yo: Bó se jẹ́ pé ó níí ṣe pẹ̀lú “ọ̀rọ̀ ìyè àti ikú,” àwọn ìpèníjà wọ̀nyí la ní láti kojú fún ìfẹ́ ara wa láti gba orílẹ̀-èdè yìí lọ́wọ́ àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn.

translation.en: The welfare of our people is paramount.
translation.yo: Ìgbáyé-gbádùn àwọ̣n ènìyàn mi ló jẹ mí lógún jùlọ.

translation.en: Accordingly, the most economically vulnerable in our communities will continue to be uppermost in our plans, and efforts will be made to supply them with basic means of survival.
translation.yo: Nítorí náà, ìdàgbàsókè ètò ọrọ̀ ajé orílẹ̀ èdè yìí ṣe pàtàkì nínú èròǹgbà wa, A ó sì tún gbìyànjú láti pèsè àwọn ohun tí ẹnu ń jẹ fún àwọn ènìyàn.

translation.en: While we see the COVID-19 pandemic as a global challenge, this administration is not oblivious of the constant threat posed to our national security by terrorists and insurgents.
translation.yo: Lákòókò tí a rí àjàkálẹ̀-ààrùn COVID-19, tó jẹ́ ìpèníjà káríayé, ìjọba yìí kò saláìmọ̀ gbogbo wàhálà tí àwọn oníjàgídíjàgan àti ọlọ̀tẹ̀ ń fà lórí ètò ààbò orílẹ̀-èdè wa.

translation.en: They may take this opportunity to perpetrate attacks.
translation.yo: Wọ́n le loo àǹfààní yìí láti ṣe àwọn ìkọlù kan sí orílẹ̀ èdè wa.

translation.en: But our armed forces and other security and intelligence services will remain vigilant and continue to contain these threats and consolidate efforts to eradicate them completely.
translation.yo: Ṣùgbọ́n àwọn ikọ̣̀ olóógun, àwọn àjọ elétò ààbò àti àjọ tó ń ṣe ìtọpinpin sì dúró ṣinṣin láti máa gbógun ti gbogbo ìkọ̣lù tó bá fẹ́ sẹlẹ̀.

translation.en: As we mark this year’s Easter, whatever the circumstances, I encourage you to make the most of the situation and to keep safe.
translation.yo: Bíi a ṣe ń sàmì sí ọjọ́ Àjíǹde ti ọdún yìí, ohunkóhun tó bá wù kó jẹ́, Mo gbà yín  níyànjú làti ṣàmúlo ipò tí a wà yìí , kí a sì gbiyànjú láti sètọ́jú ara wa , kí a sì wà ní àìléwu.

translation.en: I wish you all a Happy Easter.
translation.yo: Mo kí gbogbo  yín  kú àjọ̀dún ọjọ́ àjíǹde Kristi.

translation.en: Muhammadu Buhari, President, Federal Republic of Nigeria
translation.yo: Muhammadu Buhari Ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjirià

translation.en: --- Breaking: Nigeria’s Treasury House on fire
translation.yo: --- Ó gbóná fẹli-fẹli:Ìjàm̀bá iná ṣẹlẹ̀ nílé-iṣẹ́ ìsirò –owó

translation.en: Nigeria’s Treasury House, which is the office building of the Accountant General of the Federation is currently on fire, in the capital, Abuja.
translation.yo: Ilé-isẹ́ paná-paná ti ní àwọn ti pa iná tó ń jó ilé- iṣẹ́ ìṣirò –owó  orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà (Accountant General of the Federation).

translation.en: --- COVID-19: Nigeria confirms six new cases
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: Àwọn ènìyàn mẹ́fà (6) míràn tún jẹyọ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà

translation.en: Nigeria has confirmed six new cases of the novel coronavirus also known as COVID-19.
translation.yo: Àwọn ènìyàn mẹ́fà (6) míràn tún jẹyọ tí wọ́n ní ààrùn Corona (COVID 19 )  lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà

translation.en: With the latest addition, the number of confirmed cases has hit 238 in the country with 35 discharged and five deaths.
translation.yo: Ní èyí tí ó jẹ́ kí iye àwọn tó ní ààrùn Corona jẹ́ òjìlénígba dín méjì (238), nígbà tí àwọn ènìyàn bí márùndínlógójì(35)  ti gba ìwòsàn , tí àwọn ènìyàn márùn ún (5) sì ti jẹ́ Ọlọ́run nípè.

translation.en: --- President Buhari orders distribution of seized rice to Nigerians
translation.yo: --- Ẹ pín ìrẹsì tí ẹ gbà lọ́wọ́ àwọn fàyàwọ́ fún ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíría-Buhari

translation.en: President Muhammadu Buhari has ordered distribution of 150 trucks of rice seized by Nigeria Customs Service (NCS) to the 36 states of the federation.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ̣ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíría, Muhammadu Buhari ti pàṣẹ pé kí ilé-iṣẹ́ aṣọ́bodè pín ọkọ̀ àádọ́jọ (150) ìrẹsì tí wọ́n gbá sílẹ̀ lọ́wọ́ àwọn fàyàwọ́ fún gbogbo ìpínlẹ̀ tó wà lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíría.

translation.en: The Minister of Finance, Budget and National Planning, Mrs Zainab Ahmed disclosed this while fielding questions from journalists at a news conference in Abuja on Monday.
translation.yo: Mínísítà fún ètò ìnáwó, ìsúná àti ètò ìlànà , abilékọ Zainab Ahmed ló sọ̀rọ̀ yìí pẹ̀lú àwọn akọ̀ròyìn , nílùú Àbújá.

translation.en: Ahmed said the seized trucks of rice had been handed over to the Ministry of Humanitarian Affairs and Disaster Management for onward distributions to Nigerians.
translation.yo: Ahmed tún sọ pé gbogbo àwọ̣n ọkọ̀ ìrẹsì ọ̀hún ni wọ́n ti fi ránsẹ́ sí àjọ tó ń mójútó ètò ọmọnìyàn àti ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ pàjáwìrì láti pín àwọn ìrẹsì náà káàkiri.

translation.en: She added that in addition to this, the president had also approved distribution of grains from strategic grain reserves across the country.
translation.yo: Ahmed ní ààrẹ tún ti fọwọ́sí àwọn ètò ìrànwọ́ irúgbìn tí wọn yóò kó lọ sí àwọn apá ibìkan lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: The minister stated that as part of the effort to support the farmers, the president also approved reduction of the price of fertilizer from N5,500 to N5,000 per bag.
translation.yo: Mínísítà tún tẹ̀síwájú pé ìjọba ti dín owó tí àwọn àgbẹ̀ máa ń fi ra ajílẹ̀ láti ẹgbẹ̀rún márùn ún ààbọ̀ sí ẹgbẹ̀rún márùn ún náírà fún báàgì ajílẹ̀ kan.

translation.en: According to her, more measures will be taken to provide broader benefits to the citizens.
translation.yo: Ó tún sọ̣ pé àwọn ètò ìrànwọ́ míiràn yóò tún wá fún gbogbo àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: --- Easter: Nigerian Government declares Friday, Monday Public Holidays
translation.yo: --- Ọjọ́ Àjíǹde kristi: Ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà pàṣẹ ọjọ́ Ẹtì, Ajé fún ìsinmi

translation.en: The Nigerian Government has declared Friday, April 10 and Monday 13, as public holidays to mark the 2020 Easter Celebration.
translation.yo: Ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà ti pàṣẹ pé kí ọjọ́ Etì, ọjọ́ kẹwàá, oṣù kẹrin (April 10) àti ọjọ́ kẹtàlá , ọjọ́  Aje ́ jẹ́ ìsinmi láti  fi sayẹyẹ àjọ̀dún Àjíǹde ti krisiti.

translation.en: The Minister of Interior, Rauf Aregbesola made the declaration on behalf of the Federal Government on Monday in Abuja.
translation.yo: Mínísítà fún ètò abẹ̣́lé, ọ̀gbẹ́ni Rauf Arégbéṣọlá ló kéde yìí nípasẹ̀ ìjọba àpapọ̀ lọ́jọ́ Ajé, nílùú Àbújá.

translation.en: Aregbesola urged Christians in the country to emulate the outstanding characteristics of Jesus Christ amongst which were tolerance, love, peace and compassion.
translation.yo: Arégbéṣọlá wá rọ gbogbo àwọn ọmọlẹ́yìn kristi láti máa ṣàwòkọ́ṣẹ ìwà àti àbùdá Jésù kristi nípa fífi ẹ̀mí ìfẹ́, àlááfìa àti àànú hàn nínú ìwà àti ìṣe wọn.

translation.en: Aregbesola called on Christians to use the occasion of this year’s Easter celebration to pray for Nigeria and the entire world at this time of the global emergency of COVID-19 pandemic.
translation.yo: Arégbéṣọlá tún wá gbogbo ọmọ lẹ́yìn kristi láti lo àsìkò ayẹyẹ ọ̀hún fi gbàdúrà fún orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà àti gbogbo àgbáyé lápapọ̀ páàpáà jùlọ lásìkò àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn COVID-19 tó gba gbogbo ayé kan.

translation.en: The Minister appealed to all Nigerians to continue to support the efforts of Government towards fighting the Coronavirus Disease.
translation.yo: Mínísítà tún rọ̣ gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà láti máa sàtìlẹyìn fún gbogbo ìgbìyànjú ìjọ̣ba àpapọ̀ nípa gbígbógun ti ààrùn Corona.

translation.en: He reminded Nigerians of the need to adhere strictly to the measures put in place by relevant authorities towards preventing the spread of the virus in the country, particularly, through the observance of social distancing, in addition to regular personal hygiene and sanitary practices.
translation.yo: Ó wá rán gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà létí nípa àwọn ètò ìlànà tí àwọn aláṣẹ ti là sílẹ̀ lọ́nà àti dẹ́kun ìtànkálẹ̀ ààrùn Corona lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí pàápàá jùlọ nípa yíyẹra fún ènìyàn àti ṣíṣe ìmọ́tótó lásìkò ayẹyẹ ọ̀hún.

translation.en: Aregbesola wished Christians a peaceful Easter celebration.
translation.yo: Arégbéṣọlá wá kí gbogbo àwọn omọ lẹ́yìn kristi kú ayẹyẹ àjọ̀dún Àjíǹde.

translation.en: --- COVID-19: Oyo Governor tests negative, resumes work today
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́ yege àyẹ̀wò, yóò bẹ̀rẹ̀ iṣẹ́ lónìí

translation.en: Oyo State Governor, Seyi Makinde says he has tested negative for the coronavirus in a second test and promised to resume work on Monday.
translation.yo: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̣̀ Ọ̀yọ́, Ṣ̣èyí Mákindé ti ní òun yege níbi àyẹ̀wò kejì tí wọ́n ṣe fún òun nípa ààrùn Corona, ó wá ṣèlérí láti bẹ̣̀rẹ̀ iṣẹ́ rẹ̣̀ lónìí, tó jẹ̣́ ọjọ́ Ajé.

translation.en: Makinde confirmed this on Sunday night through his twitter handle after he received the result of his second test.
translation.yo: Mákindé sọ̀rọ̀ yìí láṣàálẹ́ ọjọ́ Àìkú lórí ẹ̀rọ Twittre rẹ̀ lásìkò tí o gba àbájáde èsì àyẹ̀wò kejì ọ̀hún.

translation.en: The governor had on March 30 through his twitter handle confirmed that he tested positive for COVID-19.
translation.yo: Ọgbọ̀ọjọ́ oṣù kẹta ni gómìnà Mákindé sọ̀rọ̀ lórí ẹ̀rọ Twitter rẹ̀ pé, òuń ní ààrùn Conona, ìyẹn COVID-19.

translation.en: He had since gone into isolation after which his second test result on Sunday confirmed him negative for the virus.
translation.yo: Láti ìgbà yẹn ni gómìnà ọ̀hún ti wà nínú ìgbélé, kí ó tó di pé ó gba àbájáde èsì kejì nípa ààrùn Corona, ní èyí tí ó sọ pé kò ní ààrùn yìí.

translation.en: --- COVID-19: NCDC confirms 8 new cases, total 232
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: Àwọn ènìyàn mẹ́jọ (8) míràn tún jẹyọ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà

translation.en: Eight new cases of COVID-19 infections have been confirmed in Nigeria by The National Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) bringing the total to 232.
translation.yo: Àwọn ènìyàn mẹ́jọ (8) míràn tún jẹyọ tí wọ́n ní ààrùn Corona (COVID 19 )  lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, ní èyí tí ó jẹ́ kí iye àwọn tó ní ààrùn Corona jẹ́ òjìlénígbadínmẹ́jọ (232).

translation.en: The agency announced this via its Twitter handle, @NCDCgov, on Sunday 5th April at 09:30 pm (Local Time).
translation.yo: Àjọ tó ń gbógun ti àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà (NCDC) ló kéde yìí lórí ẹ̀rọ̀  Twitter wọn, @NCDCgov,ní àṣálẹ́  ọjọ́ Àìkú,ọjọ́ karùn ún, oṣù kẹrin (Sunday 5th April ) ní déédé aago Mẹ́sàn án ààbọ̀( 9:30 P. m,Local Time).

translation.en: Of the eight new cases, 5 were reported in Lagos State, 2 in the Federal Capital Territory (FCT) and 1 in Kaduna State.
translation.yo: Nínú àwọn mẹ́jọ tí wọ́n ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ jẹyọ ọ̀hún ,márùn ún ( 5) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó ,ẹyọ kan  ( 1 ) ní ìlú Àbújá, Federal Capital Territory (FCT) àti ẹyọ kan  (2) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kàdúná.

translation.en: --- COVID-19: Lagos State Governor rolls out more palliative measures
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: Gómìná ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó yóò tẹ̀síwájú nípa ètò ìrànwọ́

translation.en: Lagos State Governor, Mr. Babajide Sanwo-Olu, has announced more palliative measures for vulnerable residents who might be affected by the ongoing 14-day lockdown directive of the Federal Government.
translation.yo: Gómìná ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó,ọ̀gbẹ́ni  Babájídé Sanwó-Olú, ti kéde pé àwọn kò ní dáwọ́ ètò ìrànwọ́ tí wọ́n ń pèsè fún àwọn tó kù díẹ̀ fún àti àwọn tí kò rọ́wọ́ họrí tí òfin ìgbélé ọjọ́ mẹ́rínlà tí ìjọba àpapọ̀ kéde rẹ̀  leè pa wọ́n lára.

translation.en: Speaking after the weekly Security Council Meeting at State House, Marina, Sanwo-Olu said that medical bills incurred by patients admitted into public secondary and tertiary healthcare facilities for the duration of the lockdown will be offset by the Lagos State government.
translation.yo: Sanwó-olú sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lẹ́yìn ìpàdé ìgbìmọ̀ aláákóso fún ètò ààbò tó wáyé ní ilé-gomínà ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó, pé gbogbo gbèsè tí àwọn aláìsàn, aláboyún àwọn tó wà nínú ewu pàjáwìrì, àwọn tí wọ́n fẹ́ ṣe iṣẹ́ abẹ fún tí wọ́n wà nílé-ìwòsàn alábọ́dé tàbí tí ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ lásìkò òfin ìgbélé yìí ni àwọn ti san gbogbo owó tí wọ́n jẹ nílé ìwòsàn.

translation.en: Sanwo-Olu asserted that the decision was taken to ameliorate the difficulty encountered by patients whose regular business has been affected by the restriction order imposed to curtail the spread of COVID-19.
translation.yo: Sanwó-Olú ní àwọn gbé ìgbésẹ̀ yìí láti jẹ́ kí ara tu àwọn aláìsàn , tí òfin ìgbélé ọ̀hún pa iṣẹ́ wọn lára lásìkò ààrùn COVID-19.

translation.en: Appealing to residents for more patience with the government, Sanwo-Olu said the restriction order has facilitated quicker movement by officials of the Ministry of Health and the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) in tracing contacts of patients already being treated at the Infectious Diseases Hospital, Yaba.
translation.yo: Ó wá rọ̣ àwọn ọmọ ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó láti túnbọ̀ mú sùúrù fún ìjọba, Sanwo-Olu ní òfin ìgbélé náà tí ń so èso rere, ní èyí tí ó jẹ́ kí àjọ ètò ìlera àti àjọ tó ń gbógun tí ààrùn lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí leè máa tọpinpin   àwọn tó ní ààrùn Corona, tí wọ́n tì si ń gba ìtọ́jú ní ilé –ìtọ́jú àwọn aláìsàn tó wà ní, Yaba.

translation.en: Sanwo-Olu reiterated his government’s commitment to the security of lives and property.
translation.yo: Sanwó-Olú wa tẹpẹlẹ mọ́ ìgbesẹ̀ ìjọba láti túbọ̀ máa dáàbò bo ẹ̀mí àti dúkìá àwọn ará ìlú.

translation.en: He warned hoodlums to desist from taking advantage of the restriction order to disturb the peace as the security agencies have been instructed to ensure 24-hour security surveillance across the State.
translation.yo: Ó wá kìlọ̀ fún àwọn jàǹdùkú tí wọ́n leè fẹ́ máa lo àsìkò yìí láti da omi àlàáfíà rú, pé àwọn ti sọ fún agbófinró láti pèsè ètò ààbò fún ìpìnlẹ̀ náà fún wákàtí mẹ́rìnlélógún.

translation.en: --- COVID-19: NCDC confirms 10 new cases, total 224
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: Àwọn ènìyàn mẹ́wàá (10) míràn tún jẹyọ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà

translation.en: The National Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) has confirmed ten new cases in Nigeria bringing the total to 224.
translation.yo: Àwọn ènìyàn mẹ́wàá (10) míràn tún jẹyọ tí wọ́n ní ààrùn Corona (COVID 19 )  lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, ní èyí tí ó jẹ́ kí iye àwọn tó ní ààrùn Corona jẹ́ okòólénígba àti mẹ́rìn (224).

translation.en: Of the ten new cases, 6 were reported in Lagos State, 2 in the Federal Capital Territory (FCT) and 2 in Edo State.
translation.yo: Nínú àwọn mẹ́wàá tí wọ́n ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ jẹyọ ọ̀hún ,mẹ́fà ( 6) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó ,méjì ( 2 ) ní ìlú Àbújá, Federal Capital Territory (FCT) àti méjì (2) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Edó.

translation.en: --- COVID-19: Another five were discovered in Nigeria
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: Àwọn ènìyàn márùn ún míràn tún jẹyọ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà

translation.en: Other five people were discovered to be positive of corona virus (COVID-19) in Nigeria, which make total to be two hundred and fourteen (214).
translation.yo: Àwọn ènìyàn márùn ún míràn tún jẹyọ tí wọ́n ní ààrùn Corona (COVID 19 )  lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, ní èyí tí ó jẹ́ kí iye àwọ̣n tó ní ààrùn Corona jẹ́ okòólénígba dín mẹ́fa (214).

translation.en: Nigeria Centre for disease control announced this on their twitter handle @NCDCgov, on Saturday night by 10:10p.m  localtime.
translation.yo: Àjọ tó ń gbógun ti àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn  lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà (NCDC) ló kéde yìí lórí ẹ̀rọ  Twitter wọn, @NCDCgov,lásàálẹ́ ọjọ́ Àbámẹ́ta ní déédé aago Mẹ́wàá kọjá ìsẹ́jú mẹ́wàá( 10:10 p. m,Local Time).

translation.en: Out of the five new people discovered, three (3) in Bauchi (Northeast) and two (2) in Abuja, Federal Capital Territory (FCT).
translation.yo: Nínú àwọn márùn ún tí wọn ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ jẹyọ ọ̀hún, mẹ́ta ( 3) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Bauchi  (Àríwá ìlà oòrùn ) àti méjì ( 2 ) ní ìlú Àbújá, Federal Capital Territory (FCT).

translation.en: --- we will try our best to fight corona virus in Nigeria - Chikwe Ihekweazu
translation.yo: --- A ó sa ipá wa láti gbógun ti ààrùn Corona ní Nàìjíríà- Chikwe Ihekweazu

translation.en: The presidential Task force on COVID-19 has urged the director in government parastaters and private organizations to follow all the guidelines and the test to stop the corona virus.
translation.yo: Ìgbìmọ̀ ìjọba àpapọ̀ tó ń mójútó gbígbógun ti ààrùn Covid-19 ti rọ̣ àwọn olùdarí ilé-iṣẹ́ ìjọba àti aládàáni láti máa tẹ̣̀lé gbogbo ìlànà àti àyẹ̀wò tó ní ṣe nípa dídẹ́kun ààrùn Corona.

translation.en: Secretary General for the federal government of Nigeria (SGF) and the chairman presidential task force on COVID-19, Boss Mustapha said this in Abuja with the Journalist on Thursday.
translation.yo: Akọ̀wé àgbà fún ìjọba àpapọ̀ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà (SGF) àti alága ìjọba àpapọ̀  tó ń mójútó  gbígbógun ti ààrùn Covid-19 , Boss Mustapha ló sọ̀rọ̀ yìí nílùú Àbújá pẹ̀lú àwọn akọ̀ròyìn lọ́jọ́bọ̀.

translation.en: Mr. Mustapha said this corona virus is powerful to endanger the lives of people and economy.
translation.yo: Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Mustapha ní ààrùn Corona yìí lágbára láti fi ẹ̣̀mí àwọn ènìyàn àti ètò ọrọ̀ ajé, ètò ààbò orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà sínú ewu.

translation.en: He now urge the people of Nigeria to see all the steps that the committee took as a means to protect everyone in Nigeria.
translation.yo: Ó wá rọ̣ gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè yìí pé kí wọ̣n rí gbogbo ìgbésẹ̀ tí ìgbìmọ̀ ọ̀hún ń gbé gẹ́gẹ́ bíi ọ̀nà láti dáàbò bo ìgbésí ayé tẹrú-tọmọ tó wà lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: The minister for health in Nigeria, Osagie Ehanire one of the committee said:
translation.yo: Mínísítà fún ètò ìlera lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, Osagie Ehanire, tó jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára ìgbìmọ̀ ọ̀hún sọ pé:

translation.en: We urge all Nigerians to stay at home, and take care of their health, by following the line of program that the health sectors gave except for those that just returned from  that have the opportunity to get to their houses.
translation.yo: "A rọ gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà láti dúró sínú ilé wọn, kí wọ́n sì mójútó ètò ìlera wọn, nípa títẹ̀lé ètò ìlànà tí àjọ ètò ìlera làà sílẹ̀ àyàfi ẹni tí ó bá ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ dé láti ìrìnàjò nìkan ló ní àǹfààní láti rìn padà lọ sínú ilé rẹ̀ ".

translation.en: The director National center for disease control (NCDC) in Nigeria Chikwe Ihekweazu said:
translation.yo: Olùdarí àjọ tó ń gbógun tí ààrùn kòkòrò lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, (National Center for Disease Control, NCDC), Chikwe Ihekweazu ní:

translation.en: Every day we send workers and materials to the state where covi-19 is discovered, and we are trying our best in a way that we will see that we eradicate it in Nigeria , though they need money, material and helpers, and some other things.
translation.yo: Lójoojúmọ́ ni à ń fi àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ àti ohun èlò ránṣẹ́ sí ìpínlẹ̀ tí ààrùn Corona bá gbé jẹyọ ,a sì ń gbìyànjú láti sa ipá  wa lọ́nà tí a óò  fi dẹ́kun ààrùn Corona lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé àwọn nílò owó, irinsẹ̀,àwọn olùrànlọ́wọ́ ,ohun èlò àti àwọn nǹkan míràn.

translation.en: This efforts are not easy, but we are assuring all the states in Nigeria that we will not relent in stopping corona virus in the states where it is discovered.
translation.yo: Ìgbìyànjú yìí kò rọrùn rárá, sùgbọ́n a fi ń dá gbogbo ìpínlẹ̀ tó wà lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjírìá lójú pé , a ò ní káá àárẹ̀ láti sa ipá wa nípa dídẹ́kun ààrùn Corona ní àwọn ìpínlẹ̀ tí ààrùn yìí bá ti gbé ń jẹyọ.

translation.en: --- COVID-19: FG extends conditional cash transfers to Anambra, two other states
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: Ìpínlẹ̀ Anambra àti ìpínlẹ̀ míràn ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ gbígba owó ìrànwọ́

translation.en: In a bid to lessen the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic, the Nigerian government through the Ministry of Humanitarian Affairs, Disaster Management and Social Development, has extended its conditional cash transfer (CCT) to the most indigent and vulnerable in Anambra, Katsina and Nasarawa states.
translation.yo: Ìjọba àpapọ̀ ti ní ìpínlẹ̀ Anambra,Katsina àti Nasarawa yóò bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní máa gba owó ìrànwọ́ láti ọ̀dọ̀ àjọ tó ń mójútó ètò ọmọnìyàn, ìjàm̀bá pàjáwìrì àti ìdàgbàsókè àyíká.

translation.en: The Minister of Humanitarian Affairs, Disaster Management and Social Development, Sadiya Umar Farouq  explained that the programme was part of the immediate palliatives promised by President Muhammadu Buhari to cushion the effect of the partial lockdown of the country as part of measures to contain the Covid-19.
translation.yo: Mínísítà fún àjọ tó ń mójútó ètò ọmọnìyàn, ìjàm̀bá pàjáwìrì àti ìdàgbàsókè àyíká lorilẹ èdè Nàìjíríà, ọ̀dọ̀ àjọ tó ń mójútó ètò ọmọnìyàn, ìjàm̀bá pàjáwìrì àti ìdàgbàsókè àyíká , Sadiya Umar Farouq  ṣàlàyé pé ètò tí ìrànwọ́ owó tí àwọn ń ṣe ọ̀hun wà lára ìlérí tí ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari ṣe láti pèsè ètò ìrànwọ́ lásìkò ìgbélé lọ́nà àtidẹ́kun ààrùn Covid-19.

translation.en: The conditional cash transfer payments in Anambra State, South Eastern Nigeria started with Anyamelum LGA (Wards Anaku 1 & 2; Omor 1 & 2; Umerum Umumbo; Igbakwu; Ifite Ogwari 1 & 2; Umueje and Omasi).
translation.yo: Ètò ìrànwọ́ náà wáyé ní ìpínlẹ̀  Anambra , ní ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ Anyamelum  (Wọọdu Anaku 1 & 2; Omor 1 & 2; Umerum Umumbo; Igbakwu; Ifite Ogwari 1 & 2; Umueje ati Omasi).

translation.en: Similar payments to more beneficiaries of the programme were carried out in three centers of Wamba East, Wayo and Nakere in Nasarawa State, North Central Nigeria.
translation.yo: Ètò ìrànwọ́ owó ọ̀hún tún wáyé ní àwọn ibi mẹ́ta kan ní Wamba, Wayo àti Nakere ní ìpínlẹ́ Nasarawa ,tó jẹ́ ààrin gbùngbùn orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: Also payments were made in eleven of the 34 local government areas of Katina State.
translation.yo: Bákan náà, wọ̣n tún rí ìrànwọ́ owó yìí gba ní ìjọ̣ba ìbílẹ̀ mẹ́tàlélọ́gbọ̀n ní ìpínlẹ̀ Katsina.

translation.en: The local government areas are Bakori, Bindawa, Baure, Batagarawa, Dandume and Ingawa,  Kaita, Mani, Musawa, Rimi and Kankara.
translation.yo: Àwọn ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ náà ni Bakori, Bindawa, Baure, Batagarawa, Dandume, Ingawa, Kaita, Mani, Musawa, Rimi ati Kankara.

translation.en: --- COVID-19: President Buhari directs prompt payment of salaries
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: Ẹ máa san owó oṣù àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ lásìkò – ààrẹ Buhari

translation.en: President Muhammadu Buhari has directed the Ministry of Finance and National Planning to promptly pay salaries of workers in the country.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Nàìjíríà, Muhammadu Buhari ti pàṣẹ fún àjọ amojuto ètò ìnáwó àti ètò ìlànà lórílèèdè láti máa sanwó oṣù àwọn òṣìṣẹ́.

translation.en: He gave the directive during a meeting with the Presidential Committee on the Impact of COVID-19 on the Nigerian economy at the Presidential Villa, Abuja on Thursday.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ sọ̀rọ̀ yìí nílé ààrẹ tó wà nílùú Àbújá lásìkò tó ń ṣèpàdé pẹ̣̀lú ìgbìmọ̀ ààrẹ tó ń mójútó ààrùn COVID-19, nípa ètò ọrọ̀ ajé orílẹ̀èdè yìí.

translation.en: The President also directed the ministry to ensure that critical infrastructure like roads and rails are protected and as much as possible, use local inputs so that the country retains value within its economy.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ tún wá pàṣẹ fún àjọ ọ̣̀hún láti mójútó ètò amáyédẹrùn bíi àwọn ojú pópó ọkọ̀ àti ojú ọkọ̀ irin, kí wọ́n ṣì máa ṣe àmúlò àwọn irinsẹ́ orílẹ̀ èdè yìí.

translation.en: Chairman of the committee and Minister of Finance, Budget and National Planning, Zainab Ahmed, said these while fielding questions from State House Correspondents after the meeting.
translation.yo: Alága ìgbìmọ̀ ọ̀hún, mínísítà fún ètò ìnáwó, ìsúná àti ìlànà orílẹ̀èdè, Zainab Ahmed, lásìkò tó ń báwọn akọ̀ròyìn ilé ààrẹ sọ̀rọ̀, lẹ́yìn ìpàdé náà.

translation.en: Ahmed who heads the presidential committee stated that ”the President further directed the committee to ensure that measures that protect the poor and the vulnerable are in place.”
translation.yo: Ahmed alága ìgbìmọ̀ náà ní "Ààrẹ tún pàsẹ pé kí ìgbìmọ̀ náà rí i pé wọ́n ṣètò ìlànà tí yóò leè dáàbò bò àwọn akús̩è̩é̩ àti abarapá láwùjọ. "

translation.en: Briefing She told Journalists that the committee briefed the President on current happenings around the world due to COVID-19 and the impact on the nation’s economy.
translation.yo: Nínú àlàyé rè̩ sí àwo̩n akò̩rò̩yìn, ó nígbìmò̩ náà ti so̩ ìs̩è̩lè̩ ló̩wó̩ló̩wó̩ káàkiri àgbáyé fún ààre̩ nítorí COVID-19 àti ipa tó ní ló̩rò̩ jé wa.

translation.en: She said: “Well, he has directed that we should make sure that salaries are paid, make critical infrastructures like roads, rails are protected, as much as possible use local inputs so that we retain value within our economy.
translation.yo: Ó ní, “lóòótó ni Ààre̩ ti ní kí wó̩n sanwó os̩ù àwo̩n òs̩ìs̩é̩, kí wó̩n sì mójútó àwo̩n ètò amáyéde̩rùn bíi àwo̩n ojú pópó o̩kò̩, àti ojú o̩kò̩ irin kí wó̩n sì s̩àmúlò irins̩é̩ orílèèdè yìí

translation.en: And also make sure that we put in place measures that protect the poor and the vulnerable.”
translation.yo: Kí iyì wa má baà so̩nù. Bákan náà, kí wó̩n s̩ètò ìrò̩rùn fún aláìní àti abarapá láwùjo̩.

translation.en: On the purpose of the meeting, she said, “This meeting was just to brief Mr. President as the situation we are in keeps evolving on a daily basis.
translation.yo: Lórí ìdí abájo̩ ìpàdé náà, ó ní, “èrèdí ìpàdé náà ni láti sò̩rò̩ s̩ókí fún ààre̩ lórí bí ìs̩è̩lè̩ àsìkò yìí s̩e ń gbóhun tuntun yo̩ lójoojúmó̩.

translation.en: As the health crisis gradually expands, affecting States and also the lockdown that has been ordered to help curtail expansion of the health crisis.
translation.yo: Bí ìpèníjà ìlera s̩e ń gbòòrò si, ó sì ń s̩àkóbá fún ìpínlè̩ gbogbo àti ìgbélé tó wà láti kápa gbígbòòrò ìpèníjà ìlera yìí.

translation.en: “The consequences of the lockdown are the additional slowing down of the economy and the measures that we need to take to mitigate the negative consequences of the slow trade and businesses.”
translation.yo: “Ìjìyà ìgbélé ni mímú ò̩rò̩ ajé náà fà bí ìgbín àti ìgbésè̩ tí ó ye̩ ní gbígbé láti lè dènà okùnfà búburú lórí fífà bíi ìgbín àwo̩n o̩jà òun òkòwò.”

translation.en: Another member of the committee, the Minister of State Petroleum Resources, Timipre Sylva, said the economy is not in the best of shapes, due to COVID-19 and oil prices are collapsing every day, hence the need for the President to be constantly briefed.
translation.yo: Ọ̀kan lára ìgbìmọ̀ ọ̀hún, ìye̩n mínísítà ìpínlẹ̀ fún ètò epo rọ̀bì lórílẹ̀èdè yìí, Timipre Sylva, ní ètò ọrọ̀ ajé orílẹ̀ èdè yìí kò fararọ nítorí ààrùn COVID-19, àti pé, owó epo ń jábó̩ lójoojúmó̩, èyí ló s̩e okùnfà ìso̩nís̩ókí fún ààre̩ lóòrèkóòrè.

translation.en: The Governor of the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN), Godwin Emefiele, said the economy is not looking as simple as everybody thought it would be.
translation.yo: Aláákóso ilé-ìfowópamọ́ tìjọba àpapọ̀ (CBN), Godwin Emefiele, ní ètò ọ̣rọ̀ ajé orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà kò rẹ́ẹ́rìń rárá yàtọ̀ sí báwọn ènìyàn ṣe rò ó lọ́kàn.

translation.en: He said: “The global economy naturally like we all know at this time will naturally suffer growth problems and may even lead to recession globally.
translation.yo: Ó ní,”ètò o̩rò̩ ajé lágbàáyé gan-an, báa s̩e mò̩, yóò jìyà àwo̩n ìs̩òro ìdàgbàsókè ó sì tún lè mú àkùdé bá ètò o̩rò̩ ajé lágbàáyé.

translation.en: So, we are trying to see what we can do as a country to rescue our own situation so we don’t go the direction many will go.
translation.yo: Nítorí náà, à ń gbìyànjú láti rí ohun tá lè s̩e gé̩gé̩ bíi orílèèdè láti borí ìs̩òro ló̩wó̩ló̩wó̩ ká má ba ko̩rí só̩nà àìda tó̩pò̩ lo̩.

translation.en: “It is not going to be easy but we can only assure our people that we are on top of it and that we will resolve it and Nigerians will still be better for it.”
translation.yo: “Kò ní ro̩rùn s̩ùgbó̩n a kàn le fi da àwo̩n ènìyàn wa lójú pé à ń s̩is̩é̩ gan-an lórí rè̩ àti pé a óò wa ojútùú si, àwo̩n o̩mo̩ orílè̩-èdè Nàìjíríà á sì s̩e rere síi.

translation.en: Other members of the committee are the Minister of State, Budget and National Planning, Clement Agba and the Group Managing Director of the Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation (NNPC), Mela Kyari.
translation.yo: Àwọn tó wà níbi ìgbìmọ̀ ọ̀hún náà ni mínísítà ìpínlẹ̀ fún ètò ìsúná àti ètò ìlànà orílẹ̀ èdè, Clement Àgbà àti aláà́kóso ilé-iṣẹ́ epo rọ̀bì (NNPC), Mela Kyari.

translation.en: --- Customs boss commends officers on essential duties
translation.yo: --- Alákóso àwọn asọ́bodè gbósùbà fún àwọn òsìsẹ́ rẹ̀

translation.en: The Comptroller-General of the Nigeria Customs, Colonel Hameed Ali has commended Officers and Men of the service who are on essential duties despite the risks in their respective locations as lockdown entered day three.
translation.yo: Alákóso àwọn asọ́bodè lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà ti gbósùbà fún àwọn òṣìsẹ́ rẹ̀ bí wọ́n ṣe fakọyọ àti ìwà akínkanjú tí wọ́n ń hù lásìkò ti òfin ìgbélé láti dẹ́kun ààrùn Corona ti wọ ọjọ́ mẹ́ta báyìí.

translation.en: Mr Ali said reports reaching the Headquarters from the Commands indicate that, Customs operatives have been rising to the challenge of their professional calling by keeping the Seaports functional.
translation.yo: Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Àlí ní àwọn ìròyìn tí òun ń gbọ́ nípa àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ rẹ̀ nípa ìwà akínkanjú tí wọ́n ń hù lásìkò ìpèníjà tó ń dojúkọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà nípasẹ̀ ààrùn Corona, pàápàá jùlọ láti dáàbò bo àwọn ibùdó ọkọ̀ ojú omi.

translation.en: He advised the operatives to maintain person to person distancing, wash hands regularly, sanitise their hands and comply with all other recommendations by medical experts.
translation.yo: Ó wá rọ àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ rẹ̀ láti máa tẹ̀lé ìlànà tí àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ètò ìlera là sílẹ̀ nípa fífọ ọwọ́ wọn, yíyẹra fún àwọn ènìyàn  àti nípa lílo ọsẹ a-pa kòkòrò lóòrè-kóòrè.

translation.en: He prayed for the quick recovery for those undergoing COVID-19 treatment and for the Almighty God to heal Nigeria and the world generally.
translation.yo: Ó wá gbàdúrà pé kí Ọlọ́run wo àwọn tí ààrùn COVID-19 mú fún ìwòsàn kíákíá, kí Ọlọ́run sì tún wo orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà  àti àgbáyé sàn.

translation.en: --- COVID-19 lockdown: Nigeria Armed Forces denounces misleading viral videos
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: ilé-iṣẹ́ ológun ní irọ̣́ ni fídíò tí wọ́n ń gbé káàkiri

translation.en: The Nigeria Defence Headquarters on Wednesday, said its attention has been drawn to some video clips circulating in the media with the intention of deliberately smearing the image of the Nigeria Army.
translation.yo: Ilé-iṣẹ́ ológun ti ní irọ́ ni fídíò tí àwọn ènìyàn ń gbé káàkiri lórí ẹ̀rọ ayélujára àti ní ilé-iṣẹ́ ìròyìn láti ba ilé-isẹ́ ọ̀hún lórúkọ jẹ́.

translation.en: The Coordinator, Defence Media Operations, Major General John Enenche stated that the videos which were old clips of past incidences that took place in 2012 and 2013 respectively, were being used by some mischievous elements to mislead the public about military engagement towards lockdown declared by the Federal Government in some states to curtail the spread of COVID-19.
translation.yo: Olùdarí ẹ̀ka ìròyìn àti ìkéde fún ilé-isẹ́ náà, ọ̀gágun John Enenche ló sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lọ́jọ́rú pé ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ tó wà nínú fídíò tí àwọn ènìyàn ń gbé káàkiri náà wáyé lọ́dún 2012 àti 2013, ní èyí tí àwọn ẹni ibi ń lò lásìkò tí ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè yìí pàṣẹ pé kí àwọn ọmọ ogun wà lára àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ elétò ààbò láti ràn wọ́n lọ́wọ́ lásìkò òfin ìgbélé, láti dẹ́kun ìtànkálẹ̀ ààrùn COVID-19.

translation.en: According to John Enenche, the Nigerian Armed Forces sees those clips as calculated attempts to tarnish its professional integrity.
translation.yo: Ọ̀gágun John Enenche ni  Mo wá rọ gbogbo àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà láti rí  fídíò tí wọ́n ń gbé káàkiri gẹ́gẹ́ bí iṣẹ́ ọwọ́ àwọn ẹni ibi láti ba ilé-isẹ́ ológun lórúkọ jẹ́.

translation.en: The Armed Forces of Nigeria remains undaunted and would not be distracted from their constitutional role in ensuring the protection of Nigeria’s territorial integrity and securing the lives and property of the general public.
translation.yo: Ilé-iṣẹ́ ológun kò ní ká à árẹ̀ nípa ojúṣe rẹ̀ láti máa tẹ́lẹ̀ òfin orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà áti láti máa dáàbò bo àwọn omọ orílẹ̀ èdè yìí.

translation.en: --- COVID-19: Nigeria confirms 23 new cases
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: Àwọn mẹ́tàlélógún(23) mìíràn tún jẹyọ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà

translation.en: Nigeria has confirmed 23 new cases of the novel coronavirus also known as COVID-19.
translation.yo: Àwọn mẹ́tàlélógún (23) mìíràn tó jẹ́ ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà ni wọ́n tún ní ààrùn Corona, (COVID-19) báyìí.

translation.en: The new cases were confirmed in Lagos, FCT, Akwa Ibom, Kaduna and Bauchi.
translation.yo: Àwọn kan tó ní ààrùn Corona tún jẹyọ ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó, ìlú Àbújá, Akwa Ibom, Kaduna ati Bauchi.

translation.en: According to Nigerian Centre for Disease Control, NCDC, 9 of the cases were confirmed in Lagos, 7 in the FCT, 5 in Akwa Ibom, 1 in Kaduna and 1 in Bauchi State.
translation.yo: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí  àjọ tó ń gbógun tí ààrùn kòkòrò (Nigerian Centre for Disease Control, NCDC,)ṣe sọ pé , wọ́n rí mẹ́sàn án( 9) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó,méje (7)ní ìlú Àbújá, FCT, márùn ún (5) ní ìpínlẹ̀  Akwa Ibom, ẹyọ kan (1) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kàdúná àti ẹyọ kan (1) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Bauchi.

translation.en: This brings the total confirmed cases of Coronavirus in Nigeria to 174 with nine discharged and two deaths.
translation.yo: Gbogbo àwọn tó ti ní ààrùn Corona lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà wá jẹ́ mẹ́rìnléláàdọ́sàn án (174) tí àwọn mẹ́sàn án yege àti àwọn méjì sì ti gbẹ́mì  mìì.

translation.en: --- COVID-19: See as the federal capital territory was so quite
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: Ẹ wo ìlú Àbújá bó se pa lọ́lọ́

translation.en: If it was a priest or an herbalist that gave a warning to all Nigerians that a disease is coming that will cause everybody to sit at home.
translation.yo: Tó bá jẹ́ pé al̀ùfáà tàbí babaláwo tó mọfá-mọ̀pẹ̀lẹ̀ ló jíṣẹ́ fún gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà pé, ààrun kan ń bọ̀ , tí yóò jẹ́ kí tẹrú-tọmo, tonílé, tàlejò fìdìí mọ́lẹ́ wọn.

translation.en: That a disease is coming that will cause business men to lock up their shops, that a disease is upcoming that will cause all that travel abroad because of headache or a brief illness refuse to go as usual, that they will sit at home, I’m so sure that all Nigerians will say the priest or the herbalist oracle does not a speak good thing.
translation.yo: Pé ààrùn kan ń bọ̀, tí yóò jẹ́ kí onísòwò ti sọ́ọ̀bù rẹ̀ pa, pé ààrùn kan ń bọ̀ tí yóò jẹ́ kí gbogbo àwọn tó máa ń tẹkọ̀ létí lọ sí ilẹ̀ òkèèrè nítorí ẹ̀fọ́rí tàbí àìsàn ráńpẹ́, kọ̀ láti sálọ bíi ìṣe wọn, pé wọn yóò  jókòó sílé , mo mọ̀ dájú pé gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà ni wọn yóò sọ pé kí  onítọ̀hún tàbí  fún babaláwo ọ̀hún pé ifá rẹ̀ kọ̀ fọ rere.

translation.en: But, God does as he pleases him, COVID-19 disease called corona virus enter Nigeria, all of us kept quit, this virus that respect not the rich, poor, even the virus does not regard its source, China.
translation.yo: Àmọ́sá, ṣé bó ṣe wu olúwa ló ń ṣọlá, bó ṣe wu aṣẹ̀dàá  ló ń hùwà. Ààrùn COVID-19, ààrùn Corona wọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, gbogbo wa pa lọ́lọ́, ààrùn tí kò mọ olówó, tálákà, kó dà ààrùn tí kò mọ ibi tó ti wá, lórílẹ̀ èdè China.

translation.en: One thing that is certain is that under any circumstances, Nigeria will succeed, Nigeria will be free from corona virus.
translation.yo: Ohun tí ó dá mi lójú ni pé, lábẹ́ bó ti wù kó rí, orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà yóò yege, orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà yóò bọ́ lọ́wọ́ ààrùn Corona.

translation.en: Its compulsory that she be free from corona virus.
translation.yo: Ó di dandan ká bọ̣́ lọ́wọ́ ààrùn corona.

translation.en: When corona will leave Nigeria, all Nigerians should learn one or two lessons from it that there is no one too big for God to arrest or capture.
translation.yo: Tí ààrùn Corona bá kúrò lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, ó yẹ kí gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ́ èdè Nàìjíríà kọ́ ọgbọ́n kan tàbí ìkejì níbẹ̀ pé, ẹni tí Ọlọ́run kò leè mú, ó dájú pé Ọlọ́run kò tíì dá onítọ̀hún.

translation.en: We all in Nigeria should learn a lesson that there is no place like home.
translation.yo: Ó yẹ kí gbogbo wa lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà kọ́ ọgbọ́n pé, àjò kò dà bíi ilé, bí ọkọ̀ sì ròkun, rọ̀sà, ilé náà sì ni àbọ̀simi oko.

translation.en: If we have equipped all our hospitals be it federal government hospitals  or the state government hospitals, all the health care center either small or the university teaching hospitals in Nigeria are standard, equivalent to all other hospitals abroad where the rich men go when they have a brief illness, if all  our hospitals are standard, the  problem and trouble of corona virus will be minimal in Nigeria.
translation.yo: Tó bá jẹ́ pé, a ti tún gbogbo ilé-ìwòsàn ìjọba yálá ti ìjọba àpapọ̀ tàbí ti ìpínlẹ̀, gbogbo ilé ìtọ́jú yálà alábọ́dé tàbí gbogbo àwọn ilé-ìwòsàn fásitì tó wà lórílẹ̀ èdè wa jẹ́ ojúlówó, jẹ́ èyí tó wà ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú gbogbo àwọn ilé-ìwòsàn tó wà nílẹ̀ òkèèrè, tí àwọn olówó wa máa ń sálọ lásìkò tí wọ́n bá ní àìsàn ráńpẹ́,tó bá jẹ́ pé  gbogbo àwọn ilé-ìwòsàn wa gbóuńjẹ fẹ́gbẹ́ gbàwobọ̀, ìwọ̀nba ni wàhálà àti ìdààmú tí ààrùn Corona kó wa sí lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà ìbá jẹ́.

translation.en: My advise is that we should all come together in cooperation to bridge all the gaps in Nigeria either on our hospitals or our economy that our nation may grow.
translation.yo: Ìmọ̀ràn mi ni wí pé, kí gbogbo wa forí-korí, fikùn lukùn, nítorí pé àgbájọwọ́ la fi ń sọ̀yà, ọwọ́ kan kò gbẹ́rù dórí, Kí á gbìyànjú láti yanjú gbogbo àwọn kùdìẹ̀-kudiẹ tó wà lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí, yálà nílé ìwòsàn wa gbogbo, tàbí nípa ètò ọrọ̀ ajé, kí orílẹ̀ èdè wa leè gòkè àgbà.

translation.en: A word is enough to the wise, thanks so much.
translation.yo: Àbọ̀ ọ̀rọ̀ là ń sọ fọ́mọlúàbí, tó bá dénú tán, yóò di odidi. ẹ sẹ́ púpọ̀.

translation.en: --- Lockdown: the federal government start the sharing of twenty thousand naira in Abuja.
translation.yo: --- Títìpa: ìjọba àpapọ̀ bẹ̀rẹ̀ pínpín ogún ẹgbẹ̀rún náírà nílùú Àbújá

translation.en: In a way to bring relief the people at the federal capital territory through the lockdown that the president Muhammadu Buhara announced, the government of Nigeria have starred the sharing of twenty thousand naira as palliative to those that lives in Kwali local government area.
translation.yo: Lọ́nà àtimú ìrọ̀rùn bá àwọn ènìyàn tó ń gbé nílùú Àbújá nípasẹ̀ òfin ìgbélé ti ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhara kéde rẹ̀, ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ń pín ogún ẹgbẹ̀rún náírà owó ìrànwọ́ fún àwọn tó ń gbé ní ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ Kwali.̀

translation.en: The Minister of Humanitarian Affairs, Disaster Management and Social Development, Sadiya Umar Farouq  said this when giving out the cash on Wednesday morning.
translation.yo: Mínísítà fún ètò ọmọnìyàn, ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ pàjáwìrì àti ìdàgbàsókè àwùjọ, Hajiya Sadiya Umar Farouq ló sọ eléyìí lásìkò tí wọ́n ń pín owó ọ̣̀hún ní òwúrọ̀ ọjọ́rú.

translation.en: The media house in Nigeria said, about one hundred and ninety people benefited from twenty thousand in Kwali local government area.
translation.yo: Ilé akéde Nàìjíríà sọ pé, àwọn ènìyàn tí iye wọn jẹ́ àádọ́wàá (190) ni wọ́n ti jẹ àǹfààní ogún ẹgbẹ̀rún (N20,000 ) ni ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ Kwali báyìí.

translation.en: Farouk said the beneficiaries usually take a cash of five thousand monthly and were given twenty thousand naira for four month payment.
translation.yo: Hajiya Farouk ní àwọn ènìyàn tí wọ́n jẹ àǹfààní owó ọ̀hún ló jẹ́ pé ẹgbẹ̀rún ún márùn ún, ni wọ́n máa ń gbà tẹ́lẹ̀, lóṣooṣù, tí wọ́n wá fún wọn ní ogún ẹgbẹ̀rún lásìkò yìí fún owó oṣù mẹ́rin lẹ́èkan náà fún wọn.

translation.en: She continued that five thousand people will benefit from the cash in Abuja.
translation.yo: Ó tẹ̀síwájú pé ẹgbẹ̀rún márùn ún àwọn ènìyàn ni yóò jẹ àǹfààní owó ìrànwọ́ ọ̀hún nílùú Àbújá.

translation.en: --- Nigerian Government further reduces PMS price to N123.50
translation.yo: --- Owó epo ọkọ̀ ayọ́kẹ́lẹ́ tún ti dínkù sí N123.50

translation.en: The Nigerian Government has approved the further reduction of Premium Motor Spirit (PMS) pump price to N123.50 per Litre.
translation.yo: Ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà tún ti fọwọ́sí àdínkù owó epo ọkọ̀ ayọ́kẹ́lẹ̀ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà sí  náírà mẹ́tàlélọ́gọ́fà ààbọ̀ (N123. 50, per Litre) fún líta kan.

translation.en: The Executive Secretary, Petroleum Products Pricing Regulatory Agency Abdulkadir Saidu, announced the reduction on Tuesday night,
translation.yo: Alákòóso àgbà fún ilé-iṣẹ́ tó ń ṣàmójútó owó orí epo ọkọ̀ ayọ́kẹ́lẹ́ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà,(Petroleum Products Pricing Regulatory Agency) Abdulkadir Saidu, ló kéde yìí láṣàálẹ́ ọjọ́ Ìsẹ́gun.

translation.en: Saidu stated that the guiding price takes effect from April 1 2020, and shall apply at all retail outlets nationwide for the month of April, 2020.
translation.yo: Sàídù ní àdínkù owó epo ọ̀hún yóò bẹ̀rẹ̀ ní ọjọ́ kíńní, oṣù kẹrin, Ọdún 2020 (April 1 2020), gbogbo ilé-iṣẹ́ tí wọ́n gbé ń ta epo ọkọ̀ ayọ́kẹ́lẹ́ ní jákè-jádò orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà ló gbọdọ̀ tẹ̀lé ìfilọ̀ yìí.

translation.en: --- COVID-19 : Àwọn méjìlá míràn tún jẹyọ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà
translation.yo: --- COVID-19 : Àwọn méjìlá míràn tún jẹyọ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà

translation.en: The confirmed cases of COVID-19 have risen to 135 in Nigeria.
translation.yo: Àwọn alárùn kòrónà ní Nàìjíríà (COVID-19 ) ti di mọ́kànléláàdọ́jọ ( 151)  lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà báyìí.

translation.en: On its official Twitter handle @NCDCgov, the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control, NCDC, confirmed 4 new cases, 9 in Osun State and 1 in Edo State, 1 in Ekiti
translation.yo: Àjọ tó ń mójútó àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà tún tikéde lórí ẹ̀ro Twitter wọn  @NCDCgov, , pé àwọn mẹ́sàn án (9) mìíràn tún ti jẹyọ ní ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀sun, méjì (2) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Ẹdó,  ẹyọ kan(1) ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkìtì.

translation.en: --- COVID-19: President Buhari thanks individuals, companies for support
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: Ààrẹ Buhari dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ àwọn ènìyàn, ilé-iṣẹ́ fún àtìlẹ́yìn

translation.en: President Muhammadu Buhari has acknowledged with deep appreciation, the kind gestures of captains of industries, corporate entities, missionaries, music artistes and individuals who have consistently supported the fight at mitigating the COVID-19 pandemic ravaging the global economy.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari ti fi ìdúpẹ́ àtinúwá rẹ̀ hàn sí ìs̩e rere àwọn olúdarí ilé-iṣẹ́, àwọn ajíhìnrere, àwọn olórin àti ẹnìkọ̀ọ̀kan tó ṣàtìlẹ́yìn fún ìjọba láti gbógun ti àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn  COVID-19 tó kọlu ètò ọrọ̀ ajé àgbáyé.

translation.en: The President thanked the group of oil companies, who partnered with the Nigerian National Petroleum Cooperation (NNPC) to donate $30 million, while appreciating contributions from the All Progressives Congress National leader, Asiwaju Bola Tinubu, Dr Mike Adenuga, Mrs Folorunsho Alakija of Famfa Oil, and Dr Emeka Offor, who joined a list of other public-spirited Nigerians in contributing health and educational facilities.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ ilé-iṣe tó ń ta epo rọ̀bì to fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ pẹ̀lú ilé-isẹ́ (NNPC) láti fun won ni ọgbọ́n mílíọ́nù dọ́là, ó tún dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ ọ̀kan lára àgbà ẹgbẹ́ (APC), Asíwájú Bólá Tinubu, Dr Mike Adénúgà, ìyáàfin  Fólórunshó Alákijà tó ti ilé-epo  Famfa , àti Dr Emeka Offor, tí ò darapọ̀ mọ́ àwọn ọmọ Nàìjíríà  láti ṣèrànwọ́ ètò ìlera àti ilé-ẹ̀kọ́.

translation.en: The President also welcomed the generous donations announced by Zenith Bank PLC, which was committed to the public health care system. He welcomed donations also from Keystone bank, First Bank Plc and the Senior Pastor of Dunamis International Gospel Centre, Dr Paul Enenche, and his wife, Dr Becky Enenche.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ tún fi inú dídùn dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ àwọn onínú rere wọ̀nyí, ilé-ìfowópamọ́ Zenith Bank PLC, tí ó pèsè  ìrànwọ́ níbi ètò ìlera. Ààrẹ tún dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ ilé –ìfowópamọ́  Keystone bank, First Bank Plc àti olùdarí ilé-ìjọ́sìn Dunamis International Gospel Centre, Dr Paul Enenche, àti ìyàwó rẹ̀, Dr Becky Enenche.

translation.en: President Buhari equally appreciated the efforts of Stallion Empowerment Initiative of the Stallion Group and the entertainment industry, particularly renowned musician, Innocent Idibia Tuface for their contributions.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ tún dúpẹ́ gidigidi lọ̣́wọ́ ilé-iṣẹ́ Stallion Group àti àjọ̣ tó mójútó ètò ìgbafẹ́ àti ìdárayá pàápàá jùlọ akọrin ìlú mọ̀-ọ́n-ká, Innocent Idibia Tuface fún ìrànlọ́wọ́ wo̩n.

translation.en: Repositioning health care
translation.yo: Ìtúns̩e ètò ìlera

translation.en: The President assured Nigerians that the funds will be properly utilized to fight the spread of COVID-19 and reposition the health care system.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Buhari wá fi dá gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà lójú pé, àwọn yóò lo owó náà bó se tọ́ láti fi gbogun ti ìtànkálè̩ COVID-19 àti fúntùnúns̩e ilé-ìwòsàn.

translation.en: He urged all intending donors to channel their contributions through the Presidential Task Force for the Control of the Coronavirus (COVID-19).
translation.yo: Ó ro̩ gbogbo afúnni láti fowó náà ráns̩é̩ sí ikò̩ ààre̩ amójútó ààrùn kòrónà (COVID-19).

translation.en: President Buhari urged Nigerians to follow the guidelines provided by the Ministry of Health, State governments and the National Centre for Disease Control (NCDC), whose officials have been toiling day and night to keep everyone in the country safe.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ tún wá rọ̣ àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà kí wó̩n tè̩lé ìlànà tí ilé-is̩é̩ ìlera, ìjo̩ba ìpínlè̩ àti ikò̩ amújótó ààrùn lóríléèdè (NCDC), tí òs̩ìs̩é̩ rè̩ ń s̩is̩é̩ ló̩sàn-án lóru kí gbogbo ènìyàn lórílèèdè le wà ní àlááfíà.

translation.en: He noted that the situation facing the country, and others across the world, would certainly need the financial, technical and material support of companies and individuals, and the collective efforts of Nigerians to bring the pandemic under control.
translation.yo: Ó ní ìpèníjà tí ó ń dojúko̩ orílè̩ èdè wa, àti àwo̩n orílè̩ èdè yòókù lágbàáyé, yóò nílò àtile̩yìn owó, ìrònú ati èròjà látò̩dò̩ ilé-is̩é̩ àti ènìyàn, pè̩lú ìfo̩wó̩sowó̩pò̩ o̩mo̩ Nàìjíríà láti lè kápa ìtànkálè̩ ààrùn kòrónà náà.

translation.en: --- Covid-19: the committee will follow the guidelines before assisting during lockdown
translation.yo: --- Covid-19: Ìgbìmọ̀ yóò tẹ̀lé ìlàna kí wọ́n tó ṣèrànwọ́ lásìkò ìgbélé

translation.en: The secretary General to the federal government, Boss Mustapha has said the committee will soon give the guidelines they will follow to assist.
translation.yo: Akọ̀wé àgbà ti ìjọba àpapọ̀, Boss Mustapha ní ìgbìmọ̀ kò ní pẹ́ s̩e àgbéjáde ètò ìlànà tí wọn yóò tẹ̀lé láti ṣe ìrànwọ́.

translation.en: President Muhammadu Buhari has approved the appointment of committee that will be in charge of the economy in Nigeria, which will be head by the vice president, Yemi Osinbajo.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari ti fọ̣wọ́sí yíyan ìgbìmọ̀ tí yóò máa ṣe àmojútó ètò okòòwò ní orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, ní èyí tí igbákejì ààrẹ, Yemí Òsínbàjò yóò máa darí rẹ̀.

translation.en: The Secretary General to the federal government , Boss Mustpha said this during the inauguration of the committee in Abuja.
translation.yo: Akọ̀wé àgbà fún ìjọba àpapọ̀, Mr Boss Mustapha ló sọ̀rọ̀ eléyìí lásìkò ìfilọ́lẹ̣̀ ti ìgbìmọ̀ náà ní ìlú Àbújá.

translation.en: The Secretary General also said the government appoint the committee to give the less privileged during the lockdown in Abuja, Lagos state and Ogun state so that it can stop the spread of COVID-19 in Nigeria.
translation.yo: Akọ̀wé àgbà náà tún sọ pé ìjọba yan ìgbìmọ̀ ọ̀hún láti lee máa fún àwọn ènìyàn tára ń ni nílùú Àbújá, Èkó àti Ògùn  lásìkò ìgbélé yìí, kí ó lè dẹ́kun ìtànkálẹ̀ ààrùn Covid-19 ní Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: We are just starting, we don’t know when the pandemic will be over, but I believe that we will start the program soon, the program of guidelines.
translation.yo: A ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ bẹ̀rẹ̀ ni, a ò tíì mọ ìgbà tí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ yìí máa tán, sùgbọ́n mo nígbàgbọ́ pé, a ó bẹ̀rẹ̀ ètò náà láìpẹ́, àwọn ètò ìlànà

translation.en: He the committee will soon announce the guidelines they will follow.
translation.yo: Òun, ìgbìmọ̀ náà yóòọ̀ kéde láìpé̩ ìlànà tí wọn yóò tẹ̀lé.

translation.en: --- COVID-19 Lockdown: Governors pledge seamless movement of essential commodities
translation.yo: --- Ìgbélé COVID-19: Àwo̩n Gómìnà s̩èlérí mímójútó ìlo̩kiri e̩rù pàtàkì

translation.en: The Nigeria Governors’ Forum (NGF) has pledged its commitment to ensuring the seamless movement of essential commodities throughout the country during the period of lockdown declared in some states.
translation.yo: Ẹgbẹ́ àwọn gómìnà Nàìjíríà (NGF) ti ṣèlérí pé àwọn yóò mójútó bí àwọn ẹrù tó ṣe pàtàkì yóò ṣe máa lo̩kiri lóríléèdè Nàìjíríà lásìkò ìgbélé láwọn ìpínlẹ̀ kò̩ò̩kan wò̩nyí.

translation.en: The forum made the pledge in a communiqué issued after its first teleconference meeting held on Sunday and signed by the NGF Chairman, Governor Kayode Fayomi of Ekiti State.
translation.yo: Nínú àtẹ̀jáde kan tí ẹgbẹ́ náà kọ pé lásìkò ìpàdé tí wọ́n ṣe lórí ẹ̀rọ ayélujára lọ́jọ́ Àìkú, ní èyí tálága ẹgbẹ́ ọ̀hún, Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Èkìtì, Káyòdé Fáyẹmí fọwọ́ṣí.

translation.en: The communiqué made available to reporters on Monday in Abuja noted that the governors through the teleconference meeting deliberated on the COVID-19 pandemic in the country.
translation.yo: Àtẹ̀jáde ọ̀hún tó te̩ àwọn akò̩ròyìn ló̩wó̩ lójó̩ ajé ní Abuja so̩ pé àwo̩n gómìná s̩èpàdé lórí è̩ro̩ ayélujára, sò̩rò̩ lórí ìtànkálè̩ kòrónà káàkiri orílèèdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: The communiqué read in part: “Governors are committed to ensuring that there is seamless movement of essential commodities throughout the country during this period of the lockdown.
translation.yo: Nínú abala àtè̩jáde náà, ó so̩ pé: “àwo̩n gómìnà ti s̩e ìlérí láti rí i dájú pé àwo̩n è̩rù pàtàkì lo̩ káàkiri orílè̩ èdè yìí ní àkókò ìgbélé.

translation.en: “Through the NGF Secretariat, a protocol for the movement of essential services will be developed and shared with all state governments.
translation.yo: Ní Se̩kitáríàtì NGF, òfin gbígbé àwo̩n e̩rù pàtàkì káàkiri yóò jáde wo̩n á sì fi fún gbogbo ìjo̩ba ìpínlè̩ ní orílè̩-èdè.

translation.en: “To strengthen private-sector-led support for the COVID-19 pandemic, the NGF Secretariat will serve as the coordination mechanism by tracking the COVID-19 essential needs of all states including equipment for contact tracing/sample collection, diagnosis and treatment.
translation.yo: E̩gbé̩ tó s̩e àte̩numó̩ ìdí fún fo̩wó̩sowó̩pò̩ láàrin ètò ìlèra ìjo̩ba àpapò̩, àjo̩ amójútó ààrùn ní Nàìjíríà (NCDC) àti àwo̩n ilé-is̩é̩ ní ìpínlè̩ láti kí́n ìgbésè ìdènà ìtànkálè̩ ààrùn náà.

translation.en: The governors also agreed to hold weekly teleconference meetings to receive regular updates from all states and maintain a coordinated response to the pandemic.
translation.yo: Àwọn gómìnà tún fẹnukò láti máa ṣèpàdé pọ̀ lóòrè-kóòrè àti lọ́sẹ̀-ọ̀sẹ̀ lórí ẹ̀rọ̣ ayélujára lórí ààrùn corona àti ìgbésẹ̀ tí wọn ń gbé lórí rẹ̀.

translation.en: Fayemi briefed the governors on various state-level coordination with the Presidential Task Force on COVID-19 and the private sector through the Food, Beverages and Pharmaceuticals Association led by the Manufacturers Association of Nigeria (MAN).
translation.yo: Fáyemí sọ fún àwọn gómìnà nípa ìgbésẹ̀ tÍkò̩ ìjọba àpapọ̀ amójútó ààrùn Korona ń gbé àti àwọn ilé-iṣẹ́ aládàáni, nípasè̩ ìpèsè oúnje̩, ohun mímú àti e̩gbé̩ olóògùn èyí té̩gbé̩ a-sohun-títà ti Nàìjíríà (MAN) darí.

translation.en: The other private sector bodies included the MTN Foundation and the donor group led by Aliko Dangote and Herbert Wigwe.
translation.yo: Àwo̩n Ilé-iṣẹ́ aládàáni yòókù ni MTN Foundation àti àwo̩n e̩gbé̩ a-fi-nǹkan lè̩ èyí tí Aliko Dangote àti Herbert Wigwe darí.

translation.en: The communique stated that the governors also received an update from the Minister of Health, Dr Osagie Ehanire, and the Director-General of the NCDC, Dr Chikwe Ihekweazu, on the Federal Government’s efforts to stop the spread of COVID-19.
translation.yo: Àtẹ̀jáde náà ní àwo̩n gómìnà tún gba ìròyìn láìpé̩ láti ò̩do̩ mínísítà fún ètò ìlera, Dr Osagie Ehanire, àti olùdarí àjọ NCDC, Dr Chikwe Ihekweazu, lórí ìgbésẹ̀ tí ìjọba àpapọ̀ ń gbé láti dẹ́kun ìtànkálè̩ ààrùn COVID-19 lórílèèdè.

translation.en: It added that the duo also updated the governors on plans to increase the capacity of states to improve testing and care for COVID-19 cases.
translation.yo: Ó fikún-un pé àwo̩n méjéèjì fún àwo̩n gómìnà níròyìn lóòrèkóòrè lórí ètò láti mú ibi àyè̩wò àti ìtó̩jú alárùn kòrónà ní àwo̩n ìpínlè̩ gbòòrò si.

translation.en: --- COVID-19: Chief of Staff to President Buhari speaks on his status
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: Olùdarí òs̩ìs̩é fún Ààre̩ Bùhárí sò̩rò̩ lórí ipò rè̩

translation.en: The Chief of Staff to President Buhari, Abba Kyari, says he feels well but will be transferred to Lagos for additional tests and observation following his testing positive to COVID-19.
translation.yo: Olùdarí òṣìṣẹ́ fún ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, Abba Kyari, ti ní kò sí ohun tó ṣe ìlera òun sùgbọ́n òun yóò lọ fún àyẹ̀wò ààrùn Corona mìíràn ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó.

translation.en: The chief of Staff who disclosed this Sunday via twitter @NGRPresident said he made his own care arrangements to avoid further burdening the health system that is already under much pressure.
translation.yo: Adarí ọ̀ún sọ̀rọ̀ lọ́jọ́ Àìkú lórí ẹ̀rọ twitter rẹ @NGRPresident sọ pé òun ti ṣètò ìtọ́jú fún ara òun láti leè dín wàhálà àwọn òṣ̣ìṣ̣ẹ́ elétò ìlera tí wó̩n bò kù.

translation.en: “I have made my own care arrangements to avoid further burdening the public health system, which faces so many pressures,” Kyari said.
translation.yo: “Mo ní àwo̩n alábòójútó tèmi nítorí àtilè dín wàhálà èto ìlera ìlú kù, tí wó̩n ń kojú ìpèníjà,” Kyari ló so̩ èyí.

translation.en: Kyari said he has feels well and has neither experienced high fever nor other symptoms associated with the virus.
translation.yo: Kyari ní ara òun balè̩ àti pé òun kò ní ìrírí gbígbóná àti àwo̩n ohun àìléra mìíràn tó rò̩ mó̩ àrùn ò̩hún.

translation.en: “Like many others that will also test positive, I have not experienced high fever or other symptoms associated this new virus and have been working from home.
translation.yo: “Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ènìyàn tó jé̩ alárùn kòrónà, èmi kò tíì ní ìrírí ìgbónára tàbí àwọn ohun àìléra mííràn tó níí ṣe pẹ̀lú ààrùn Corona.

translation.en: I hope to be back at my desk very soon.
translation.yo: Mo ń ṣe iṣẹ́ mi láti ilé, mo sì ní ìrètí pé màá tètè padà sẹ́nuuṣ̣ẹ́.

translation.en: I have a team of young, professional, knowledgeable and patriotic colleagues, whose dedication has been beyond the call of duty, who continue to work seven days a week, with no time of the day spared.
translation.yo: Mo láwọn ọ̀dọ́ , onímò̩,  ọló̩gbó̩n àti afìfé̩s̩is̩é̩ alábàás̩is̩é̩pò̩ , tí wọ́n sì ń  s̩iṣẹ́ lọ́jọ́ méje láàrín ọ̀sẹ̀ , tí kò sọjọ́ kan fún ìsinmi.

translation.en: We will continue to serve the president and people of Nigeria, as we have for the past five years,” Kyari added.
translation.yo: A ó tún tẹ̀síwájú bí a ti ń ṣe láti bí ọdún márùnún sẹ́yìn láti máa sin ààrẹ àti àwọn ènìyàn orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà.” Kyari s̩àfikún.

translation.en: Statement by Chief of Staff to the President, on his health status:
translation.yo: Ò̩rò̩ láti e̩nu Olùdarí àwo̩n òs̩ìs̩é̩ ti Ààre̩, nípa ipò ìlera rè̩:

translation.en: He’s stable & feels well —Transferring to Lagos for additional tests & observation — “I have made my own care arrangements to avoid further burdening the public health system, which faces so many pressures.”
translation.yo: Ara rè̩ balè̩ o sì wàpa– Lílo̩ sí Èkó fún àyè̩wò àti ìtó̩jú si – “Mo ní àwo̩n alábòójútó tèmi nítorí àtilè dín wàhálà èto ìlera ìlú kù, ti wó̩n ń kojú ìpèníjà.”

translation.en: He thanked health workers who are working across the country who put their lives on the line for the citizens of Nigeria. He also praised Nigerians for looking out for the vulnerable in their midst.
translation.yo: Ó tún dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ àwọn òṣ̣ìṣ̣ẹ́ elétò ìlera tó ń s̩is̩é̩ jákè-jádò Nàìjíríà, tí wọ́n ń fẹ̀mí ara wọn wéwu fún o̩mo̩ Nàìjíríà gbogbo. Ó tún gbós̩ùbà fun ọmọ Nàìjíríà nítorí ìtọ́jú tí wọn fun aláìní.

translation.en: Kyari appealed for calm while advising Nigerians to observe proper hygiene, listen to advice from good authorities, ignore fake news and obey instructions on social distancing.
translation.yo: Kyari ro̩ o̩mo̩ Nàìjíríà fún sùúrù nígbà ìgbaninímò̩ràn lórí ìmó̩tótó ara, gbigba ìmò̩ràn rere látò̩dò̩ àwo̩n adarí, ko̩tíikún sí àwo̩n ìròyìn oníró̩ àti títèlé ìtó̩só̩nà ìjìnnà-síra-e̩ni.

translation.en: --- COVID-19: those that tested positive for corona virus in Nigeria are now one hundred and eleven (111)
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: Àwọn tí wón s̩àyèwò fún tó sì ní ààrun corona ni Nàìjíríà ti di mọ́kànléláàdọ́fà (111)

translation.en: Center for disease control in Nigeria (NCDC) has announced that another fourteen people have tested positive for corona virus (COVID-19) in Nigeria. Nine (9) from Lagos state and five (5) from the federal capital territory, Abuja.
translation.yo: Ilé- iṣẹ́ tó ń gbógun ti àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn (NCDC) lórílèèdè Nàìjíríà ti kéde pé àwọn mẹ́rìnlá mìíràn ti ní ààrùn Corona (COVID-19) lórílèèdè yìí. Àwọ̣n mẹ́sàn án ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó àti márùn ún ní FCT, Àbújá.

translation.en: From half past nine (9:30) on 29th those that have corona virus are one hundred and eleven, with one death, but Lagos state is still leading with sixty (68) people infected.
translation.yo: Láti aago mẹ́sàn-án ààbọ̀, lọjọ́ kọkàndínlọ́gbọ̀n, àwọn tó ní ààrùn Corona ti di mọ́kànléláàdọ́fà, ò̩kán kú, s̩ùgbó̩n ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó ló sì ń gbégbá orókè báyìí pẹ̀lú alárùn ènìyàn tó jẹ́ méjìdínláàdọ́rín.

translation.en: --- COVID-19: President Buhari orders lockdown of Lagos, Ogun and FCT
translation.yo: --- COVID-19:Àar̀ẹ Buhari pàsẹ pé kí wọ́n ti Èkó, Ògùn àti Àbújá (FCT) pa

translation.en: In a bid to contain the spread of the novel coronavirus also known as COVID-19, the Nigerian President, Muhammadu Buhari has ordered the total lockdown of Lagos State, Ogun State and the Federal Capital Territory.
translation.yo: Lọ́nà àti dẹ́kun ààrùn Corona , tí a mọ̀ ṣí COVID-19 , ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, Muhammadu Buhari ti pàsẹ pé kí ó máa sì wíwọlé tàbí jíjáde  yálà àwọn ènìyàn tàbí ọkọ̀ nílùú Èkó , Ògùn àti Àbújá.

translation.en: The President, who gave the order in a nationwide broadcast on Sunday evening, stated that the lockdown would take effect from 11pm on the 30th of March 2020.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lásìkò tó ń se ìgbóhùnsáfẹ́fẹ́, lááṣáálẹ́ ọjọ́ Àìkú, pé òfin wíwọlé tàbí jíjáde  yóò bẹ̀rẹ̀ ní aago mọ́kànlá, ọgbọ̀ọjọ́, oṣù kẹta, ọdún 2020.

translation.en: “Based on the advice of the Federal Ministry of Health and the NCDC, I am directing the cessation of all movements in Lagos and the FCT for an initial period of 14 days with effect from 11pm on Monday, 30th March 2020.
translation.yo: Nípa ìmọ̀ràn láti ọ̀dọ̀ àwọn àjọ tó ń mójútó ètò ìlera àti àjọ tó ń mójútó gbígbógun ti ààrùn lórílẹ́ èdè Nàìjíríà, nítorí náà mo pàṣẹ, pé kó ní sí wíwọlé tàbí jíjáde nílùú Èkó, Ògùn àti FCT Àbújá fún odidi ọjọ́ mẹ́rìnlá gbáko bẹ̀rẹ̀ láti  aago mọ́kànlá, ọgbọ̀ọjọ́, oṣù kẹta,ọdún 2020.

translation.en: This restriction will also apply to Ogun State due to its close proximity to Lagos and the high traffic between the two States”.
translation.yo: Ohun tó fàá ti ìpínlẹ̀ Ògùn ni pé ìpínlẹ̀ náà súnmọ́ ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó àti bí àwọn ọkọ̀ ṣe pọ̀ ní àwọn ìpínlẹ̀ méjèèjì náà.

translation.en: “All citizens in these areas are to stay in their homes. Travel to or from other states should be postponed.
translation.yo: Gbogbo àwọ̣n tó wà ní àwọn ìpínlẹ̀ wọ̀nyí gbọ́dọ̀ wà nínú ìgbélé. Kò ní sí ètò ìrìnnà láti ìpínlẹ̀ kan ṣí èkejì.

translation.en: All businesses and offices within these locations should be fully closed during this period,” he stated.
translation.yo: Gbogbo ilé-iṣẹ́ àti ọ́fíísì tó wà ní àwọn agbègbè yìí gbọ́dọ̀ wà ní títì pa lásìkò yìí.

translation.en: President Buhari noted that Governors of Lagos and Ogun States as well as the Minister of the FCT have been notified.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Buhari ní àwọn gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó, Ògùn àti mínísítà ìlú Àbújá ti mọ̣̀ nípa ìgbélé yìí.

translation.en: “Furthermore, heads of security and intelligence agencies have also been briefed”.
translation.yo: Bákan náà, gbogbo àwọn adarí ilé-iṣẹ́ elétò ààbò àti ìtọpinipin ti mọ̀ nípa ètò ọ̀hún.

translation.en: He said his administration would use the containment period to identify, trace and isolate all individuals that have come into contact with confirmed cases.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ ní ìjọba òun yóò lo àsìkò ìgbélé ọ̣̀hún láti ṣe ìtọpinpin àwọ̣n tí wọ́n ti ṣalábàápàdé àwọn tó ní ààrùn Korona náà.

translation.en: The Nigerian leader added that the order does not apply to hospitals and all related medical establishments as well as organisations in health care related manufacturing and distribution.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ ní òfin náà kò mú àwọn ilé-ìwòsàn àti àwọn elétò ìlera àti ilé-iṣẹ́ epo àti pín egbòogi òyìnbó.

translation.en: “Furthermore, commercial establishments such as; food processing, distribution and retail companies; petroleum distribution and retail entities, power generation, transmission and distribution companies; and private security companies are also exempted” he clarified.
translation.yo: Bákan náà, gbogbo àwọn ilé-iṣẹ́ tó ń pèṣè àti àwọn tó ń ta ouńjẹ, ilé-epo rọ̀bì àti ilé-iṣẹ́ tó ń ta epo ọkọ̀ ayọ́kẹ́lẹ́, ilé-iṣẹ́ mọ̀nà-mọ́ná àti ilé-iṣẹ́ aládàáni alámòójútó ètò ààbò.

translation.en: He added that although the above mentioned establishments are exempted, access will be restricted and monitored.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ ní bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé òfin ètò ìgbélé kò mú àwọn ilé-iṣẹ́ wọ̀nyí síbẹ̀ ètò yóò wà nípa ibi tí wọn leè lọ.

translation.en: “Workers in telecommunication companies, broadcasters, print and electronic media staff who can prove they are unable to work from home are also exempted”.
translation.yo: Àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ilé-iṣẹ́ tó ń mójútó ẹ̀rọ ìbáraẹni-sọ̀rọ̀ àti ìpè, ilé-iṣẹ́ ìròyìn yálà rédíò, móhùn-máwòrán tábi lórí ẹ̀rọ ayélujára tí kò bá leè ṣe iṣẹ́ láti ilé rẹ̀, ni wọn yóò gbà láàyè láti rìn, sùgbọ́n irúfẹ́ àwọn ènìyàn báyìí gbọdọ̀ leè fi káàdì ìdánimọ̀ wọn hàn.

translation.en: --- We have 60-days fuel sufficiency – NNPC
translation.yo: --- O̩gọ́ta ọjọ́ lepo lè dé -NNPC

translation.en: Nigerian National petroleum Corporation (NNPC) has urged Nigerians not to engage in panic buying of Premium Motor Spirit (PMS), as the country has adequate stock of the products to last for over 60-days.
translation.yo: Ilé–iṣẹ́ a-tepo-rọ̀bì lórílẹ̀èdè Nàìjíríà (NNPC) ti rọ àwọn ọmọ Nàìjíríà láti máa ṣe bẹ̀rù nípa ríra epo ayọ́kẹ́lẹ́, nítorí pé ilé-iṣẹ́ náà ni epo tí Nàìjíríà leè lò fún oṣù méjì gbáko.

translation.en: Mr Mele Kyari, Group Managing Director of the corporation, gave the assurance while briefing newsmen on Sunday in Abuja.
translation.yo: Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Mele Kyari, tó jẹ́ aláákóso ilé –iṣẹ́ ọ̀hún, ló sọ ọ̀rọ̀ ìdánilójú lásìkò tó bá àwon akọ̀ròyìn sọ̀rọ̀ lọ́jọ́ Àìkú, nílùú Àbújá.

translation.en: Kyari assured that the NNPC had the support of all stakeholders to ensure adequate supply of petroleum products in the country.
translation.yo: Kyari wá rọ̣ gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà láti yàgò fún títò lẹ́sẹsẹ nílé- ìtajà epo, bí omíyalé.

translation.en: He said: “There is absolutely no scarcity anywhere; our supply is robust, we have fuel that will last this country even for 60-days if assuming we do not import any.
translation.yo: Ó ní: “kò sí àìní níbì Kankan; o̩ja wa kún, a ní epo tí yóò tó orílèèdè fún os̩ù méjì láì repo.

translation.en: “Of course people because of the pandemic, stay at home, may try to conserve fuel, there is no need to do this.
translation.yo: “Lóòótó̩, è̩yin ènìyàn, nítorí ìtànkálè̩ ààrùn, a dúró sílé, e lè gbìyànjú láti s̩e epo kù, e kò nílò láti s̩e èyí.

translation.en: He appealed to Nigerians not to flood fuel stations as there was no need for that.
translation.yo: Ó ro̩ àwo̩n o̩mo̩ Nàìjíríà láti má bo ilé-epo gbogbo nítorí kò sí ìdí fún èyí.

translation.en: Commenting on National Association of Road Transport Owners (NARTO) order to petrol tankers drivers to vacate the depots, Kyari said that the corporation would continue to engage them.
translation.yo: Sísò̩rò̩ lóri às̩e̩ NARTO fún àwo̩n oló̩kò̩ agbépo kí wó̩n kúrò nísò̩ wo̩n, Kyari ní ilé-is̩é̩ ò̩hún a túnbò̩ máa rán wó̩n káàkiri.

translation.en: “No restrictions; as we speak now loading is going on, trucks are moving around, no action like that will come to fruition,’’ he added.
translation.yo: Ó tè̩síwájú pé, "Bí a ṣe ń sọ̀rọ̀ báyìí, kò sí ìdíwọ́ fún àwọn awakọ̀ epo ọkọ̀ ayọ́kẹ́lẹ́, nítorí pé wọ́n rí epo wọn gbà déédé, kò sí nínú èròǹgbà ilé –iṣẹ́, láti dá iṣẹ́ dúró".

translation.en: --- President Buhari to address Nigerians on Sunday
translation.yo: --- Ààre̩ Buhari yóò bá Nàìjíríà sò̩rò̩ ní Súńńdè

translation.en: President Muhammadu Buhari will broadcast to the nation today Sunday, March 29 at 7pm local time.
translation.yo: Ààre̩ Muhammadu Buhari yóò bá o̩mo̩ Nàìjíríà sò̩rò̩ lónìí Súnńdè, March 29 ní aago méje alé̩.

translation.en: Special Adviser to the President on Media and Publicity, Femi Adesina disclosed this in a statement.
translation.yo: Olùgbanímò̩ràn sí Ààre̩ orílèèdè Nàìjíríà ti Ìròyìn àti ìpolongo, Fé̩mi Adés̩ìnà so̩ èyí nínú ò̩rò̩ rè̩.

translation.en: He advised television, radio and other electronic media outlets to hook up to the network services of the Nigerian Television Authority (NTA) and Federal Radio Corporation of Nigeria (FRCN) for the broadcast.
translation.yo: O gba àwo̩n ilé-is̩é̩ telifís̩àn, àti ilé-is̩é̩ rédíò pè̩lú ò̩nà ìsò̩rò̩yìn mìíràn níyànjú láti darapò̩ mó̩ Ilé-is̩é̩ Telifís̩àn àkó̩kó̩ (NTA) àti Ilé-is̩é̩ Rédíò Àpapò̩ ti Nàìjíríà (FRCN) fún ò̩rò̩ Ààre̩ ò̩hún.

translation.en: Voice of Nigeria would also be live tweeting on our Twitter handle @voiceofnigeria.
translation.yo: Ohun Nàìjíríà yóò máa já geere ní ààyè lóri è̩ro̩ Twitter wa @voiceofnigeria.

translation.en: -- COVID-19: Ekiti Governor orders lockdown, shuts borders
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: Gómìnà Èkìtì pàsẹ ìgbélé, ti gbogbo e̩nuubodè

translation.en: Governor Kayode Fayemi of Ekiti on Sunday announced a lockdown in the state, directing residents to stay at home from Monday.
translation.yo: Gómìnà Káyòdé Fáyemí ti kéde lọ́jọ́ Àìkú pé wọ̣n yóò ti ìpínlẹ̀ Èkìtì pa, kí ó le dẹ́kun ìtànkalẹ̀ ààrun Korona.

translation.en: The governor in a broadcast imposed a ban on all commercial activities as well as intra state travels, except for those bordering on essential services.
translation.yo: Gómìnà nínú ò̩rò̩ rè̩, pàs̩e̩ kí gbogbo okòwò gbogbo dúró gbo̩in bákan náà ni ti ìrìnàjò yòówù, àfi àwo̩n tó ń lokiri nítorí o̩jà pàtàkì.

translation.en: He said that anyone that violated the latest measures aimed at checking further spread of the coronavirus pandemic in the state, risked a six-month jail term.
translation.yo: Ó ní eni tí ó bá tàpá ṣi òfin tuntun ọ̀hún tí ó wà láti dé̩kun ìtànkálè̩ kòrónà ní ìpínlè̩ náà yóò fẹ̀wọ̀n oṣ̣ù mẹ́fà júra.

translation.en: The governor expressed regrets that past measures adopted by him to curtail the virus were being brazenly ignored.
translation.yo: Gómìnà fàìdùnnú rè̩ hàn sáwo̩n ìgbésè̩ ìs̩áájú láti kápá ààrùn yìí s̩ùgbó̩n àwo̩n ènìyàn mò̩-ó̩n-ò̩n ketí ikún si.

translation.en: He said: ”It is very disappointing that some of us have either been lukewarm, nonchalant or downright defiant in observing the simple but extremely effective preventive measures as well as maintaining social distancing to protect themselves from infection and curtail the spread of the virus in their communities.
translation.yo: O ní: “ó s̩eni láàánú gidgidi pé ìs̩esí àwo̩n kan tutu, àì-kobi-ara-si tàbí fífojú té̩ḿbé̩lú pípa àwo̩n ìlànà tí ó ro̩rùn àmó̩ tó kójú òs̩ùnwò̩n kíkápá kòrónà àti ìjìnnà sí ara e̩ni láwùjo̩ láti lè dáàbòbò ara wo̩n àti s̩e àdínkù ìtànkálè̩ àrùn náà ní àwo̩n ìgbéríkó wo̩n.”

translation.en: ” While I acknowledge our resilient nature, incurable optimism and spiritual activism as a people, it is critical that we balance these with pragmatic and urgent actions that can ensure the safety of lives for our families and communities
translation.yo: “Bí mo s̩e mo̩ rírí ìfàyàrán wa, ìrètí tí ò le ye̩ àti ìdúrós̩ins̩in nínú è̩mí gé̩gé̩ bi ènìyàn, ó s̩e pàtàkì ká dó̩gba èyí pè̩lú ìrònú àti ìgbésè̩ kíákíá tó lè dáàbòbò è̩mí e̩bí àti ìgbéríko wa.

translation.en: ” If we do not take steps necessary to contain this virus, it has the potential to overwhelm our health infrastructure, cripple our economy and devastate Ekiti in unimaginable proportions.
translation.yo: ”Tá ò bá gbégbèésẹ̀ tó ye̩ láti dẹ́kun ààrùn yìí, ó s̩eés̩e kó borí ilé-iṣẹ́ ètò ìlera wa, ṣètò ọrọ̀ ajé wa níjàm̀bá, kí ó sì ìjàm̀bá púpọ̀ bá Èkìtì.

translation.en: ” As you are aware, the state is under significant financial constraints especially as a direct consequence of the impact of the coronavirus on the global economy and the price of crude oil that has gone down considerably.
translation.yo: “Gé̩gé̩ bí a s̩e mo̩, ipò tí ìpínlè̩ yìí wa kò dára nítorí owó pò̩ lápò ìlú, èyí ti ipa ààrùn kòrónà kó níbè̩ àti sí o̩rò̩ ajé lágbàáyé pè̩lú owó epo rò̩bì tó ti lo̩lè̩ gan-an.

translation.en: ” So, we cannot afford a public health crisis.
translation.yo: “Nítorí náà, a kò le fààyè àìléra láwùjo̩.

translation.en: ” It is therefore in urgent public interest that, I hereby, in pursuant to Section 8 of the Quarantine Act, Laws of the Federation of Nigeria 2004 and the Constitution of the Federal Republic of Nigeria 1999 (as amended) impose a curfew of movement in Ekiti .
translation.yo: “Ìdí nìyí tí ó jé̩ àkíyèsí pàtàkì láwùjo̩ pé, nípasè̩ ojú ewé 8 ti ìs̩e ìsénimó̩lé, ofin ìjo̩ba àpapò̩ Nàìjíríà, o̩dún 2004 àti ìwé òfin ìjo̩ba àpapò̩ ti Nàìjíríà, o̩dún 1999 (pè̩lú àtúns̩e) so̩ ìgbélé láìrí ènìyàn kan tí ó ń rìnkiri di kànńpá ní ìpínlè̩ Èkìtì.

translation.en: ”The purpose of this curfew is to impose restrictions on the movement of persons and goods within Ekiti for an initial period of 14 days.
translation.yo: “Ìdí fún ìgbélé náà ni láti dẹ́kun bí wọn yóò ṣe máa kó àwọn ènìyàn àti ẹrù láàrín ìpínlẹ̀ ọ̀hún fún odidi ọjọ́ mẹ́rìnlá gbáko.

translation.en: ”Therefore, effective from 1:59pm on Monday, March 30, 2020 until 11:59pm on Monday, April 13, 2020, there shall be restriction of movement across the length and breadth of Ekiti, with all our borders closed.
translation.yo: “Nítorí náà, láti 1:59pm ló̩sàn-án lọ́jọ́ Ajé, March 30, 2020 dé 11:59pm lálé̩ lójọ́ Ajé, April 13, 2020, ènìyàn kankan kò gbọdọ̀ rìnkiri ní Èkìtì, kí gbogbo e̩nuubodè náà ṣì wà ní títì pa.

translation.en: ”That is a full and total shutdown of Ekiti, and a 12-hour dusk to dawn curfew in Ekiti  from 7:00pm – 7:00 am.
translation.yo: “Èyí ni ìsémó̩lé pátápátá ní ìpínlè̩ Èkìtì, àti ìgbélé fún wákàtí méjìlá láti aago méje alẹ́ titi di aago méje òwúrọ̀.

translation.en: All Ekiti residents are hereby directed to stay at home
translation.yo: Gbogbo o̩mo̩ ìpínlè̩ Èkìtì ní a rò̩ láti dúró sílé wo̩n.

translation.en: ”We are implementing the Quarantine Act to keep all Ekiti residents safe. So let me be clear.
translation.yo: “À ń s̩àmúlò ìs̩e ìsénimó̩lé láti dáàbòbò gbogbo o̩mo̩ ìlú Èkìtì. Nítorí náà, e̩ jé̩ só̩ kó yé yékéyéké.

translation.en: If you do not go home or stay home for at least 14 days as from Monday, 30 March, 2020, you can face serious fines or prison term.
translation.yo: Tí o kò bá lo̩ tàbí dúró sílé fún o̩jó̩ mé̩rìnlá bè̩rè̩ ló̩jó̩ ajé, 30 March, 2020, o lè sanwó ìtanràn re̩pe̩te̩ tàbí fè̩wò̩n júra.

translation.en: ”During this period, movement between local governments areas is prohibited; movement between towns, villages and communities is also prohibited; every person shall be confined to the place where he or she ordinarily resides in Ekiti,” he said.
translation.yo: Ó ní, “Lásìkò ìgbélé ọ̀hún, lílọ sí ìjọba ìbílẹ̀síbìílẹ̀, ìlúsíìlú, ìletò sí letò ti di èèwọ̀ ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkìtì; Bákan náà, gbogbo àwọn tó bá wà ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkìtì lásìkò ìgbà náà, ni ètò ìgbélé náà mú.”

translation.en: He emphasised that all businesses and other entities should cease operations during this period except those involved in the provision of essential goods or services.
translation.yo: Ó tún sọ pé gbogbo ilé-iṣẹ́ ni kó wà ní títì pa, àyàfi àwọn tó bá ń ṣe isẹ́ tó nííṣe pẹ̀lú ẹ̀mí àwọn ènìyàn.

translation.en: ”Markets, retail shops and shopping malls must be closed, except where essential goods are sold and with strict hygienic conditions to prevent the exposure of persons to COVID-19.
translation.yo: Àwọn ọjà, ilé –ìtajà ńlá àti kékeré ló gbọ́dọ̀ wà ní títìpa àyàfi ibi ì-ta-o̩jà-pàtàkì, wọ́n sì gbọdọ̀ wà ní ìmọ́tótó káàrùn COVID-19 má tàn mó̩ àwo̩n ènìyàn.

translation.en: ”Religious gatherings like worship and prayer services, night vigils, house fellowships and NASFAT meetings; social gatherings like  funerals, weddings, family meetings and parties of any kind in night clubs, bars, beer joints; and political gatherings like. rallies, congresses, ward meetings, all of these are prohibited activities under these regulations.
translation.yo: Gbogbo ilé ìjọ́sìn, bí i ibi àdúrà òun ìyìn, ìsọ́-òru, ìdàpò̩ ojúlé, àti ìpàdé NASFAT; àpéjo̩pò̩ ènìyàn bíi ayẹyẹ okú, ìgbéyàwó, ìpàdé ẹbí àti ilé-ijó, ilé-ọtí, ìpàdé òṣèlú, ìwọ́de, ìpàdé ẹgbẹ́ wọ́ọ̀dù àti àwọn ìpàdé àti ètò ayẹyẹ  lóríṣiríísi ni ó ti di èèwọ̀ báyìí pẹ̀lú ètò ìlànà yìí.

translation.en: ”Only gathering in respect of funeral will be allowed but the attendance shall be limited to 20 persons with no night vigil or party.
translation.yo: Ìpéjopọ̀ bíi ìsìnkú nìkan ni a ò gbà láàyè, sùgbọ́n ìpéjọpọ̀ náà kò gbọdọ̀ ju ènìyàn ogún lọ, kò gbọdọ̀ sí ìṣọ́-òru tàbí ayẹyẹ.

translation.en: ”All boundaries of Ekiti are closed during this period, except for transportation of fuel, food and drugs and other essential goods.
translation.yo: Gbogbo enubodè Èkìtì ni yóò wà ní títìpa lásìkò yìí àyàfi awakọ̀ epo rọ̀bì, àwọn olóúnjẹ, egbòogi òyìnbó àtàwọn ọjà aṣepàtàkì.

translation.en: ”All non-residents who arrive the state prior to, or after, the imposition of this restriction, and who remain in the state, must remain in their place of temporary residence in the state for the duration of the 14 days, as the case may be, and may be subjected to screening for COVID-19 and be quarantined or isolated if necessary.
translation.yo: Gbogbo àwọn tí kìí ṣe ọmọ ìpínlẹ̀ Èkìtì sùgbọ́n tí wọ́n dé sí ìpínlẹ̀ náà lásìkò tàbí lẹ́yìn òfin ìgbélé náà gbọdọ̀ wà níbi tí wọ́n ń gbé ní ìpínlẹ̀ ọ̀hún fún ọjọ́ mẹ́rìnlá ìkéde náà, wọn yóò sì tún ṣàyẹ̀wò ààrùn COVID-19, bákan náà ní wọn yóò tún wà ní ìgbélé, tí ó bá jẹ́ dandan fún wọn.

translation.en: ”All commuter transport services including bus services, taxi services, motor bikes (Okada) and tricycle services, are prohibited; except those for purposes of rendering essential services, obtaining essential goods, seeking medical attention, funeral services and to receive payment of social grants or food
translation.yo: “Gbogbo àwo̩n awakò̩ bíi bó̩ò̩sì, ayó̩ké̩lé, ò̩kadà àti kè̩ké̩ márúwá, ni kò gbo̩dò̩ s̩is̩é̩; àfi àwo̩n tí ó ń jáde nítorí is̩é̩e̩ kò̩s̩émás̩e, yí wó̩n ń gbà e̩rù pàtàkì, wíwá ìtó̩jú, aye̩ye̩ òkú àti gbígba owó ìrànwó̩ fun oúnje̩ àbí ohun mìíràn.

translation.en: ”Only those who are performing essential services will be allowed to move around, particularly health workers, but must be duly designated with an identity card by the head of their institutions.
translation.yo: Àwo̩n tó bá ń s̩e is̩é̩ pàtàkì ní wo̩n yóò fún láyè látì máa lokiri, pàápàá jùlo̩ àwo̩n òs̩ìs̩é̩ ètò ìlera, s̩ùgbó̩n olóri ilé-is̩é̩ wo̩n gbo̩dò̩ fún wo̩n ní káàdì ìdánimò̩.

translation.en: Fayemi clarified that only few category of individuals and institutions providing certain critical services were  exempted from the restrictions:
translation.yo: Fáye̩mí s̩àlàyé pé àwo̩n tófin ìgbélé ò mú kò ju àwo̩n ènìyàn kò̩ò̩kan àtilé-is̩é̩ tó ń pèsè ohun pàtàkì:

translation.en: They include members of the state Executive, Legislature and the Judiciary;
translation.yo: Àwọn ni ọmọ ilé – ìgbìmọ̀ aṣojú, ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ àti ilé-ẹjọ́.

translation.en: The list also included persons in production, distribution and marketing of food and beverages, pharmaceuticals, medicine, paper and plastic packages, environmental and sanitation activities, staff of electricity, water, telecommunications, e-commerce and digital service providers.
translation.yo: Àwọn mìíràn ni olùs̩e, olùpín àti olùta ouńjẹ àti ohun mímu, ilé-ìtajà egbòogi òyìnbó, ilé –ìtàwé àti abọ́, alámòjútó àyíká àti ìmọ́tótó, òṣìṣẹ́ mọ̀nà-mọ́ná, omi, ilé-ìbára-ẹni-sọ̀rọ̀, ilé-iṣẹ́ òǹtajà lóri ẹ̀rọ ayélujára àtàwọn olùpèsè ẹ̀rọ ayélujára.

translation.en: The rest were members of security agencies assigned on lawful duties; staff of banks and similar financial institutions and staff of fuel stations.
translation.yo: Àwọn mìíràn ní òṣìṣẹ́ elétò ààbò tí wó̩n gbés̩é̩ fún, òṣìṣẹ́ àwo̩n ilé-ìfowópamọ́, èyí tí ó jo̩ ó̩ àti òṣìṣẹ́ àwo̩n ilé-epo rọ̀bì.

translation.en: ”Any person who contravenes these regulations shall be guilty of an offence and, on conviction, liable to a fine or to imprisonment for a period not exceeding six months or to both  fine and imprisonment,”  the governor said.
translation.yo: Gómìnà ní, “e̩ni tó bá rúfin yìí yóò jè̩bi è̩sun náà, nígbà tí wó̩n bà sì dalé̩bi, ó lè sanwó ìtanràn tàbí lo̩ è̩wò̩n tí ò tó os̩ù mé̩fà tàbí sanwó ìtanràn kó sì lo̩ è̩wò̩n bákan náà”.

translation.en: Fayemi, who said he was aware of the negative consequences of the new development on businesses and families, said palliatives were being worked out for residents, especially high risk and vulnerable citizens.
translation.yo: Fáyemí, ní òun mọ̀ pé ìgbésẹ̀ yìí yóò mú ìníra dání fún okòwò àti mò̩lé̩bí, ó sì ní ohun ìrànwó ń lo̩ ló̩wó̩ fún àwo̩n ọ̣mọ ìpínlẹ̀ Èkìtì, pàápàá jùlọ àwọn abarapá.

translation.en: --- COVID-19: Nigeria’s confirmed cases rise to 97
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: Mé̩tàdínló̩gò̩rún lálàrún kòrónà dì ní Nàìjíríà

translation.en: Nigeria’s confirmed cases of the novel coronavirus COVID-19 has risen to 97.
translation.yo: Ó ti di ènìyàn mẹ́tàdínlọ́gọ́rùn tó ti ní ààrùn Corona báyìí ní Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: Confirming the latest eight cases, the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control explained that “As at 10:40 pm 28th March there are 97 confirmed cases of #COVID19 reported in Nigeria with 1 death”.
translation.yo: Àjọ agbógunti ààrùn ló kéde àwọn mẹ́jọ tó tún ṣ̣ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ jẹyọ pé “ní déédé 10:40am lóòórò̩, 28th, March làwọn àlárùn Korona lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí ti di mẹ́tàdínlọ́gọ́rùn, ò̩kan sì ti kú.

translation.en: “Currently; Lagos- 59 FCT- 16 Ogun- 3 Enugu- 2 Ekiti- 1 Oyo- 7 Edo- 2 Bauchi- 2 Osun-2 Rivers-1 Benue- 1 Kaduna- 1”
translation.yo: “Báyìí; Èkó- 59, FCT - 16 Ògùn- 3 Enugu- 2 Èkìtì- 1 Oyo- 7 Edo- 2 Bauchi- 2 Òṣun-2 Rivers-1 Benue- 1 Kaduna- 1”

translation.en: Eight new cases of #COVID19 have been reported in Nigeria; 2 in FCT, 4 in Oyo, 1 in Kaduna and 1 in Osun State
translation.yo: Àwo̩n alárùn kòrónà mé̩jo̩ tún ti je̩yo̩ lórílè̩ èdè Nàìjíríà; 2 ní FCT, 4 ní Ò̩yó̩, 1 ní Kàdúná àti 1 ní ìpínlè̩ Ò̩s̩un

translation.en: As at 10:40 pm 28th March there are 97 confirmed cases of #COVID19 reported in Nigeria with 1 death.
translation.yo: Ní déédé 10:40am lóòórò̩, 28th, March làwọn àlárùn Korona lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí ti di mẹ́tàdínlọ́gọ́rùn, ò̩kan sì ti kú.

translation.en: --- COVID-19: Nigerian President orders closure of air, land borders
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: Ààrẹ Nàìjíríà pàs̩e̩ títi pápá o̩kò̩ òfurufú àti e̩nuubodè
