translation.en: In a bid to curtail the spread of the deadly Coronavirus, the Nigerian President, Muhammadu Buhari has directed the immediate closure of Nigeria’s International Airports and Land Borders for four weeks.
translation.yo: Láti dẹ́kun ìtànkálè̩ ààrùn as̩ekúpani kòrónà, ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, Muhammadu Buhari  ti pàṣẹ títi pápá ọkọ̀ òfurufú ilẹ̀ òkèèrè ní Nàìjíríà àti e̩nuubodè ní kíákíá fún ọ̀sẹ̀ mẹ́rin gbáko.

translation.en: The President who made this known via his official Twitter handle @MBuhari on Thursday night, noted that the move was to enable the Government “put up the appropriate policies, processes and infrastructure to cope with suspected and confirmed cases at home, without risking a compounding of the situation with more imported cases”.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ so̩ èyí lórí Twitter rẹ @MBuhari lálé̩ o̩jó̩bò̩, ó ní ìgbésè̩ náà wà láti ran ìjo̩ba ló̩wó̩ nípa fífi gbogbo ìlànà tó ye̩, ìgbésè̩ ló̩ló̩kan-ò-jò̩kan, ohun amáyéde̩rùn láti lè kápá alárùn afunrasí àti èyí tí a ti s̩àwárí ní ilé, láì mu burú sí i pè̩lú èyí tó ń tòkèèrè wá.

translation.en: The President however regretted the inconvenience caused by flight and travel restrictions to Nigerians abroad who want to return home adding that “it is necessary for the greater good, and I thank you all for your understanding and cooperation”.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ fàìdùnnú hàn sí ìnira tí títí pápá ọkọ̀ òfúrufú àti e̩nuubodè ti fún àwọn ọmọ Nàìjíríà tó fé̩ wálé, ó sì fi kún un pé “ó pondandan fún àǹfààní wa, mo dúpé̩ fún ìfọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ àti ìgbó̩niye gbogbo yín.

translation.en: “I have also directed that only cargo vessels that have been at sea for more than 14 days be allowed to dock in our ports, after the crew have been tested and confirmed disease-free by the Port Health Authorities”.
translation.yo: Mo ti pàṣẹ pé ọkọ̀ ojú –omi e̩lé̩rù, o̩ló̩jó̩ mé̩rìnlá ó lé, lórí òkun nìkan, ni yóò dé sí ibùdókò wo̩n, lẹ́yìn tí àjọ elétò ìlera tolómi bá ti ṣàyẹ̀wò fún ikò̩ ọ̀hún tí wó̩n sì rárìídájú pé wo̩n ò lárùn.

translation.en: “This 14-day restriction however does not apply to vessels carrying oil and gas products as by their nature, there is minimal human contact,” he explained.
translation.yo: Ó s̩àlàyé pé, “ìgbélé o̩jó̩ - mé̩rìnlá yìí kò níí s̩e pè̩lú àwo̩n tó ń gbé epo rò̩bì àti afé̩fé̩ gáàsì níwò̩n tí ìfarakínra pè̩lú ènìyàn kéré.

translation.en: President Buhari also suspended the movement of commuter trains to limit the spread of the virus to other parts of the country.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Buhari tún dá ìlo̩kiri ọkọ̀ ojú-irin dúró láti lè s̩e àdínkù ìtànkálè̩ ààrùn náà sí è̩yà tí ó kù ní orílè̩-èdè.

translation.en: Intervention Fund President Buhari also ordered the immediate release of a 10 billion Naira grant to Lagos State, which he said remains the epicentre of the Covid-19 outbreak in Nigeria.
translation.yo: Owó ìrànwọ́ – Ààre̩ Buhari tún pàṣẹ kí wọ́n yò̩nǹda owó ìrànwó̩ bílíọ̣́nù mẹ́wàá náírà fún ìpínlè̩ Èkó, nítorí ibè̩ ni ibùdó ìtànkálè̩ Kòrónà ní Nàìjíríà, gé̩gé̩ bí ó s̩e so̩.

translation.en: “This grant will enable Lagos increase its capacity to control and contain the outbreak, while also supporting other States with capacity-building,” he explained.
translation.yo: Owó ìrànró̩ yìí máa mú Èkó láàyè sí láti kápá àti dènà ìtànkálè̩, yóò sì tún ránpìnlé̩ yòókù ló̩wó̩ nípa kíkó̩lé gbígbóòrò, ó s̩àlàyé.

translation.en: The President also ordered the immediate release of a 5 billion Naira special intervention fund to the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) to “equip, expand and provide personnel to its facilities and laboratories across the country”.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ tún wá pa às̩ẹ yíyó̩ǹda bílíọ́nù márùn-ùn owó ìrànwó̩ tí wó̩n ya só̩tò̩ fún àjo̩ amójúto ìtànkálè̩ ààrun (NCDC) fún ríra irinsẹ́, ìmúgbòòrò àti wíwá kún àwo̩n òs̩ìs̩é̩ sí ilé-is̩é̩ àti àwo̩n ibi-àyè̩wò wo jákèjádò orílè̩-èdè.

translation.en: “I have directed the NCDC to draft all its recent retirees back into service to beef up our manpower as we respond to the pandemic”.
translation.yo: “Mo ti pàs̩e̩ kí NCDC pé gbogbo òs̩ìs̩é̩ fè̩yìntì láìpé̩ padà sí e̩nuus̩é̩ láti lè kín àwo̩n òs̩ìs̩é̩ wa ló̩wó̩ ní ìfèsì sí ìtànkálè̩ náà”.

translation.en: “Furthermore, all NCDC staff and experts who are away on training or international assignments are to return immediately,” he directed.
translation.yo: Síwájú sí i, gbogbo àwo̩n òs̩ìs̩é̩ NCDC tó wà lé̩nu ìkó̩s̩é̩ àti lé̩nu is̩é̩ lókè òkun padà wá sílé ní kíákíá.

translation.en: Effective Response Nigerian President noted that the Nigerian Air Force is already making its fleet available to the Presidential Task Force on Covid-19, to enable a better coordinated and more effective response across the country.
translation.yo: Fún ìjáfáfá nínú is̩é̩ yìí, ààre̩ Nàìjíríà ní ikò̩ òfurufú ológun ti Nàìjíríà (NAF) ti ń s̩ètò àwo̩n o̩kò̩ wo̩n fún ikò̩ ààre̩ amójútó kòrónà, láti lè s̩àmúlò káàkiri orílè̩-èdè fún àmójútó tó yè kooro.

translation.en: “Already the Nigerian Air Force (NAF) is conducting an evacuation mission to bring back some of our specialists in Central Africa, to enable them support the national response,” he added.
translation.yo: “Ló̩wó̩ló̩wó̩, ikò̩ òfurufú ológùn Nàìjíríà (NAF) ń gbégbèésè̩ láti kó àwo̩n onímò̩ ìjìnlè̩ wa tó wà ní Central Africa wálé, láti fo̩wó̩ kún ètò tó ń lo̩ ló̩wó̩ló̩wó̩”, ó fikún-un.

translation.en: Fiscal Measures He commended the monetary policy authorities for their financial intervention to support entrepreneurs and companies as the country goes through “this difficult time”.
translation.yo: Ètò ìnáwó – “Ó gbóríyìn fún àwo̩n è̩ka tó ń mójútó owó fún ìrànló̩wó̩ tí wó̩n s̩e fún àwo̩n ilé-is̩é̩ aládàáni ”ní irú àkókò líle yìí”.

translation.en: The President noted that the government is also looking at fiscal measures to minimise the negative impact of this pandemic on the livelihood of millions of Nigerians.
translation.yo: Ààre̩ ní ìjo̩ba yóò wá ò̩nà láti pèsè owó ìtura fún aráàlú láti lè dín ipa búburú tí àjàkálè̩ yìí s̩e ní ìgbé-ayé ogunló̩gò̩ o̩mo̩ orílè̩-èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: “As you are aware we have begun the process of reviewing the federal budget. We shall communicate our fiscal interventions once the budget review process is concluded”.
translation.yo: Gé̩gé̩ bí e̩ s̩e mò pé ìgbésè̩ lórí àtúnyè̩wò ètò ìsúnná lóríléèdè ti bè̩rè̩. E̩ máa gbàbò̩ ò̩nà àbáyo̩ gbàrà tí àtúnyè̩wò ètò ìsúnná bá ti parí.

translation.en: “In the meantime, I have directed the Minister of Industry, Trade and Investment, to work with the Manufacturers Association of Nigeria (MAN), to ensure that all production of essential items such as food, medical and pharmaceutical products continues unhindered”.
translation.yo: Ní àkókò yìí, mo ti pàs̩e̩ fún Mínísítà alábòójútó ilé-is̩é̩ ìs̩òwò àti ìdókòwò, láti s̩is̩é̩ pè̩lú e̩gbé̩ olùs̩e-ohun-títà ti Nàìjíríà (MAN), láti rí i dájú pé pípèsè ohun pàtàkì bí i oúnje̩, onírúurú òògùn ń tè̩síwájú láì sí ìdíwó̩.

translation.en: Knowledge & Support President Buhari stated that the government was already engaging international friends and partners to share knowledge and to seek their support in response to the pandemic.
translation.yo: Ìmò̩ àti àtile̩yìn – Ààre̩ Buhari so̩ pé ìjo̩ba òun ti ń tàkurò̩so̩ pè̩lú ò̩ré̩ àti alábàás̩e òkèèrè láti pín ìmò̩ àti gbígba ìrànwó wo̩n lórí ìtànkálè̩ ààrùn yìí.

translation.en: “We are grateful for the show of support thus far – we have already started receiving goods and supplies intended to help us scale up our efforts”.
translation.yo: “A mo̩yì yín lórí àtìle̩yìn tí a ti rí gbà báyìí – A ti ń gba àwo̩n e̩rù kò̩ò̩kan tí ó wà fún ríran ìgbìyànjú wa ló̩wó̩”.

translation.en: “Let me specially thank and commend all of the hard and heroic work being done by our medical personnel, the NCDC, Port Health Authorities, Security Agencies, State Governments, and all ad-hoc staff and volunteers”.
translation.yo: “E̩ jé̩ n fi tò̩wò̩tò̩wò̩ dúpé̩ pè̩lú gbígbóríyìn fún is̩é̩ ako̩ni òun ribiribi tí òs̩ìs̩é̩ ìlera, NCDC, òs̩ìs̩é̩ ìlera olómi, àjo̩ elétò ààbò, ìjo̩ba ìpínlè̩, àti gbogbo òs̩ìs̩é̩ àrà pè̩lú òs̩ìs̩é̩ ò̩fé̩ ti s̩e”.

translation.en: Panic & Misinformation President Buhari urged all Nigerians to be mindful of those who seek to spread panic and misinformation, and sow confusion at this time.
translation.yo: Ìjayà àti Ìròyìn àhésọ - Ààrẹ Buhari rọ̣ àwọn ọmọ Nàìjíríà láti sọ́ra fún àwọn tó fẹ́ dá ìpayà àti àhéso̩ sílẹ̀ láti fàpòrúúru lásìkò yìí.

translation.en: “We must all pay attention only to the relevant government agencies working day and night to make accurate and useful information available to the public”.
translation.yo: “A gbó̩dò̩ té̩tí sí ohun pàtàkì tí àwo̩n as̩ojù-ìjo̩ba tí ó s̩is̩é̩ ló̩sàn-án lóru láti lè mú ìròyìn tí ó tè̩wò̩n fún arááyé gbó̩”.

translation.en: “I will also ask all of us to strictly obey all public health guidelines and instructions issued by the Federal and State health authorities, regarding personal hygiene and social distancing”.
translation.yo: “Mo máa tún ro̩ gbogbo wa láti tè̩lé gbogbo ìlànà àti ìtó̩só̩nà ìlera tí ìjo̩ba àpapò̩ àti ìjo̩ba ìpínlè̩ làkalè̩ lórí ìmó̩tótó ara àti jíjìnnà sí ènìyàn nílé àti lóko.

translation.en: “These guidelines will be updated from time to time as new information and treatments are obtained”.
translation.yo: “Àtúnṣe a máa je̩yo̩ lórí àwọn ìlànà wò̩nyí lóòrèkóòrè, bímọ̀ràn àtìtọ́jú tuntun bá s̩e ń wo̩lé.

translation.en: “In the meantime, I want to assure all Nigerians that the Federal Government remains committed to protecting all Nigerians.
translation.yo: “Ní báyìí, mo fé̩ fi dá gbogbo o̩mo̩ orílè̩-èdè Nàìjíríà lójú pé, ìjo̩ba àpapò̩ kò kè̩rè̩ láti dáàbò bò yín.

translation.en: We seek your full support and cooperation as we go through this very difficult time.
translation.yo: A nílò àtìle̩yìn àti ìfo̩wó̩sowó̩pò̩ yín lásìkò àìdè̩rùn yìí.

translation.en: Together we will triumph over this pandemic”.
translation.yo: Bí a bá fo̩wó̩sowó̩pò̩, ó dájú pé a ó borí ààrùn yìí”.

translation.en: --- COVID-19: Nigeria confirms 14 new cases
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: Nàìjíríà tún s̩àwárí ènìyàn mẹ́rìnlá

translation.en: The Nigeria Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) has confirmed 14 new cases of the novel coronavirus also known as COVID-19.
translation.yo: Àjọ amójútó ààrùn kòrónà lórílèèdè Nàìjíríà (NCDC) tún ti s̩àwárí ènìyàn alárùn kòrónà mẹ́rìnlá tí a tún mọ̀ sí COVID-19.

translation.en: Confirming the cases via its official Twitter handle, the NCDC noted that  one of the cases was confirmed in FCT, one in Bauchi and 12 in Lagos,
translation.yo: Àjọ NCDC ló gbé èyí jáde lòrì ẹ̀rọ Twitter wọn pé, wó̩n rí alárùn Kòrónà kan ní FCT, ẹyọ kan ní Bauchi àti méjìlá ni ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó.

translation.en: “Of the 14, six were detected on a vessel, three are returning travellers and two are close contacts of confirmed cases,” the NCDC explained.
translation.yo: “Nínú mé̩rìnlá, wó̩n s̩àwárí mé̩fà lórí omi, mé̩ta jé̩ arìnrìnàjò tó ń padàbò̩ àti méjì tó súnmó̩ ara wo̩n ni wó̩n s̩àwárí”, NCDC s̩àlàyé.

translation.en: This brings the total number of confirmed cases in Nigeria to 65, with three discharged and one death.
translation.yo: Èyí mú gbogbo alárùn kòrónà as̩àwárí ní Nàìjíríà jé̩ márùndínláàdọ́rin, pè̩lú mé̩ta tí wó̩n fiílè̩, ò̩kan sì papòdà.

translation.en: We noticed an error in our update at 8:35pm. It should be:
translation.yo: A rí às̩ìs̩e nínú ìròyìn wan í 8:35pm, ó ye̩ kó jé̩:

translation.en: 14 new cases of #COVID19 have been confirmed in Nigeria: 1 in FCT, 1 IN BAUCHI & 12 in Lagos
translation.yo: Wó̩n s̩e àwárí alárùn kòrónà mé̩rìnlá ní Nàìjíríà; ò̩kan ní FCT, ò̩kan náà ní Bauchi àti méjìlá ní ìlú Èkó.

translation.en: Of the 14, 6 were detected on a vessel, 3 are returning travellers & 2 are close contacts of confirmed cases pic.twitter.com/Pe6owiXBKB — NCDC (@NCDCgov) March 26, 2020
translation.yo: Nínú mé̩rìnlá, wó̩n s̩àwárí mé̩fà lórí omi, mé̩ta - arìnrìnàjò tó ń padàbò̩ àti méjì tó súnmó̩ ara wo̩n ni wó̩n s̩àwárí  – NCDC (@NCDCgov) March 26,2020.

translation.en: --- COVID-19: VP Osinbajo tests negative
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: Igbákejì ààrẹ, Ọ̀sínbàjò kò láàrùn Kòrónà

translation.en: Nigeria’s Vice President, Prof. Yemi Osinbajo, has tested negative to the coronavirus.
translation.yo: Igbákejì ààrẹ Nàìjíríà, ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Yemí Ọ̀sínbàjò, ti yege àyẹ̀wò ààrùn Kòrónà.

translation.en: This followed tests conducted to check his status.
translation.yo: Èyí hàn nínú àyẹ̀wò tí wọ́n ṣe fúngbàkejì ààrẹ.

translation.en: Spokesman to the Vice President, Laolu Akande, confirmed this in response to enquiries from the media.
translation.yo: Agbẹnusọ igbákejì ààrẹ, Láolú Àkàndé, ló fi ọ̀rọ̀ ọ̀hún múlẹ̀ lákòókò ìfèsì sí ò̩rò̩ akòrò̩yìn nípaa rẹ̀.

translation.en: In his response, Akande said: “Good morning Sirs and Ma: I have been inundated with calls on whether indeed the VP had undergone a COVID-19 test and the outcome.
translation.yo: Nínú èsì ti Àkàndé gbé jáde, ó ní: “Ẹ káàrọ́ọ̀ ẹ̀yin ọkùnrin àti obìnrin: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ìpè ni mo ti ń gbà bóyá igbákejì ààrẹ ṣàyẹ̀wò COVID-19 àti èsì àyẹ̀wò ọ̀hún.

translation.en: Yes, he has and the result is negative. An official tweet would follow. Thanks”
translation.yo: Bẹ́ẹ̀ni, igbákejì ààrẹ ṣàyẹ̀wò, sùgbọ́n kò ní ààrùn Kòrónà, Ẹ̣ sé”.

translation.en: Akande tweeted on Tuesday that the Vice President had isolated himself and was working from home.
translation.yo: Àkàndé sò̩rò̩ ló̩jò̩ó̩s̩é̩gun lórí Twitter pé igbákejì ààre̩ ti ń dágbé ó sì ń tilé s̩is̩é̩.

translation.en: --- COVID-19: VP Osinbajo goes into self-isolation
translation.yo: --- COVID-19: Igbákejì ààrẹ Òsínbàjò ń dágbé.

translation.en: Nigeria’s Vice President, Prof. Yemi Osinbajo, has gone into self-isolation in keeping with the advice of the National Centre for Disease Control,  NCDC.
translation.yo: Igbákejì ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Ye̩mí Òsínbàjò ti fi ara rẹ̀ sínú ìgbélé láti tẹ̀lé ìlànà àjọ tó ń sàmójútó ààrùn (NCDC).

translation.en: Spokesman to the Vice President, Laolu Akande, shared this on Tuesday via his twitter handle @akandeoj.
translation.yo: Agbẹnusọ igbákejì ààrẹ, Láolú Àkàndé, ló sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lọ́jọ́ Ìṣẹ́gun láti orí ẹ̀rọ twitter rẹ̀ @akandeoj.

translation.en: Akande said: “VP Osinbajo yesterday (Monday) at the office conducted his meetings via video conferencing while observing social distancing.
translation.yo: Àkàndé ní: “Igbákejì ààrẹ lánàá (Mó̩ńdè) s̩èpàdé nínú ọ́físìì rẹ̀ lórí fídíò akóyànjo̩ láti tè̩lé ìlànà yíye̩ra fún ènìyàn.

translation.en: “Today, he continues his work from the home office, as he is in self-isolation in accordance with NCDC protocols.”
translation.yo: “Ní òní, ó tè̩síwájú nínú is̩é̩ rè̩ láti ilé, nítorí ó wà ní ìgbélé ní ìlànà pè̩lú òfin NCDC”.

translation.en: Akande did not give further explanation about those who might have come into contact with the vice president before he decided to isolate himself.
translation.yo: Àkàndé kó sọ̀rọ̀ lé̩kùnúnré̩ré̩ nípa àwọn tí igbákejì ààrẹ̀ ti s̩e alábàápàdé pè̩lú kí ó tó di pé ó lo̩ ṣe ìgbélé araa rè̩.

translation.en: Vice President Osinbajo yesterday at the office conducted his meetings via video conferencing, while observing social distancing.
translation.yo: Igbákejì ààrẹ Osinbajo lánàá s̩e ìpàdé nínú ọ́físìì rẹ̀ lórí fídíò akóyànjo̩ láti tè̩lé ìlànà yíye̩ra fún ènìyàn.

translation.en: Today, he continues his work from the home office, as he is in self-isolation in accordance with NCDC protocols.
translation.yo: Lónìí, ó tè̩síwájú nínú is̩é̩ rè̩ láti ilé, nítorí ó wà ní ìgbélé ní ìlànà pè̩lú òfin NCDC”.

translation.en: On Monday, Prof Osinbajo was to inaugurate the National Traffic Radio at the headquarters of the Federal Road Saftey Corps, FRSC, Wuse, Abuja.
translation.yo: Ló̩jó̩ ajé, ò̩jò̩gbó̩n Òsínbàjò ye̩ kó s̩e ìfiló̩lè̩ National Traffic Road ní Olú ilé-is̩é̩ àjo̩ amójútó ò̩nà ti ìjo̩ba àpapò̩, FRSC, Wuse, Abuja.

translation.en: It was cancelled, but no official reason was given for the development.
translation.yo: Wó̩n fagi lée, wo̩n ò si so̩ ìdí kan pàtó fúnté̩sìwájú rè̩.

translation.en: ---Garkida attack is a sign of frustration – President Buhari
translation.yo: ---Ààmì ìpinlẹ́mìí ni ìkọlù t’ó wáyé ní Garkida – Ààrẹ Buhari.

translation.en: President Muhammadu Buhari has condemned the boko haram attack on Garkida in Adamawa State, Northeast Nigeria, saying the terrorists were frustrated.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari ti dá ikọ̀ ọlọ̀tẹ̀ Boko Haram lẹ́bi látàrí ìkọlù t’ó wáyé ní wáyé ní ìlú Garkida ní ìpínlẹ̀ Adamawa, Àríwá-ìlà-oòrùn orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: President Buhari said in a statement: “These attacks on soft targets by the terrorists are obvious signs of frustration because my administration has significantly weakened boko haram’s military capability to invade and hold Nigerian territory unchallenged.”
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Buhari sọ nínú àtẹ̀jáde kan: “Àwọn ìkọlù t’ó ń wáyé ní àwọn agbègbè kan láti ọwọ́ ikọ̀ Boko Haram jẹ́ àpẹẹrẹ pé ọkàn ikọ̀ Boko Haram kò balẹ̀ mọ́, nítorí pé ìjọba mi ti ṣẹ́ ìyẹ́ apá ikọ̀ ọmọ-ogun ọlọ̀tẹ̀ Boko Haram láti ya wọ agbègbè láì ní ìkọjú.

translation.en: He extended his sympathy to families of the victims and assured citizens that no part of Nigeria would be abandoned to their fate.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ wá bá àwọn ẹbí tó farapa nínú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà kẹ́dùn, ó sì ṣèlérí fún àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè wí pé kò sí agbègbè tí àwọn yóò dá dá kádàrá wọn.

translation.en: “Our gallant forces deserve our appreciation for repelling the attackers but they must go beyond this point.
translation.yo: “Ó yẹ kí a gbóṣùbà fún àwọn akínkanjú ikọ̀ ológun wa fún kíkojú ikọ̀ àwọn akọluni ṣùgbọ́n wọ́n gbọdọ̀ ṣe ju èyí lọ.

translation.en: They have our full support to go after the terrorists and have them pay a huge price.
translation.yo: Wọ́n ní àtìlẹyìn wa láti túbọ̀ kọlu ikọ̀ ọlọ̀tẹ̀ náa, kí wọ́n sì fimú wọn fọn fèrè.

translation.en: I want to assure the country that terrorists will continue to face the combined power of our military until they give up their mistaken ways.
translation.yo: Mò fẹ́ fọkàn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè náà balẹ̀ pé àwọn ọlọ̀tẹ̀ yóò túbọ̀ máa kọjú àpapọ̀ agbára ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun títí tí wọn yóò fi ronúpìwàdà níbi àṣìṣe wọn.

translation.en: President Buhari said since the coming of his administration, boko haram’s ability to invade and occupy Nigerian territories, let alone be able to hoist their flags, had been frustrated.
translation.yo: "Ààrẹ Buhari wá ní láti ìgbà tí ìjọba yìí ti dé orí àlééfà, akitiyan ikọ̀ Boko Haram láti dótì tàbí gba orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, k’á má sọ ti ríri asia wọn mọ́lẹ̀, ni ó ti já sí pàbo.

translation.en: ---Army thwarts Boko Haram attack in Adamawa
translation.yo: ---Ọmọ ogun bàbujá ìkọlù Boko Haram ní Adamawa.

translation.en: Army troops of 232 Battalion of 23 Armoured Brigade under Operation LAFIYA DOLE deployed in Garkida, Gombi LGA of Adamawa State thwarted a planned attack by Boko haram terrorists.
translation.yo: Ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun Ẹgbẹ́-ọmọ-ogun 232 ti Ẹgbẹ́-ológun Ìhámọ́ra 23 lábẹ́ LAFIYA DOLE tí wọ́n kó lọ sí Garkida, ní ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ Gombi ní ìpínlẹ̀ Adamawa ti ba ète ìkọlù Boko Haram jẹ́.

translation.en: According to a statement by the Assistant Director Army Public Relations 23 Brigade Yola, Major Haruna Mohammed Sani, the terrorists besieged the town in about 7 Gun Trucks and a number of motorcycles setting some buildings ablaze and causing unrest within the community.
translation.yo: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí àtẹ̀jáde kan ti Igbákejì Olùdarí Alukoro Ikọ̀ Ọmọ-ogun Ẹgbẹ́-ológun 23 ti  Yola, Major Haruna Mohammed Sani, ṣe sọ, àwọn ikọ̀ ọlọ̀tẹ̀ náà wá sí àgbègbè ọ̀hún pẹ̀lú àwọn Ọkọ̀ Ìbọn ìjagun t’ó tó méje, pẹ̀lú àwọn oríṣiiríṣii ọkọ̀ alùpùpù, tí wọ́n sì bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ń tiná bọ àwọn ilé kọ̀ọ̀kan, tí ó fa ìbẹ̀rù-bojo ní àárín ìlú náà.

translation.en: “The gallant troops mobilised and intercepted the criminals’ advance and engaged the marauding criminals unleashing high volume of fire leading to the elimination of several of the criminals while others withdrew in disarray, many of them with gunshot wounds as evident in the trails of blood along their withdrawal route” Major Sani explained.
translation.yo: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí Major Sani ṣe ṣ’àlàyé “àwọn ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun anígboyà yìí wọ̀yá ìjà pẹ̀lú àwọn ọ̀daràn awa-ìkógunkiri tí wọ́n sì daná bolẹ̀ gan-an tí púpọ̀ nínú àwọn ọ̀darànmọràn náà sì gbẹ́mìí mì tí àwọn kàn sì tún túká, tí ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ wọn f’arapa yánna-yànna pẹ̀lú ẹ̀ri ipa ẹ̀jẹ̀ lọ́nà ibi tí wọ́n sá gbà.”

translation.en: “Regrettably, one gallant soldier paid the supreme price while another soldier was wounded in action. The wounded in action soldier has since been evacuated to a military medical facility.
translation.yo: “Ó ṣ’eni láàánú, pé ọ̀kan nínú àwọn ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun anígboyà kan sọ ẹ̀mí rẹ nù, tí omiran f’arapa yánna-yànna lójú. Ọmọ ogun tí ó f’arapa náà sì ti ń gba ìwòsàn lọ́wọ́-lọ́wọ́ báyìí nílé ìwòsàn ológun.

translation.en: Consequently, following the successful repelling of the criminals, on the 22nd February 2020, the Commander 23 Armoured Brigade, Brigadier General Sani Gambo Mohammed visited the troops in Garkida.
translation.yo: Ní kété tí ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ náà wáyé ní ọjọ́ Kéjìlélógún oṣù kejì ọdún, 2020, ni Apàṣẹ ogun Ẹgbẹ́-ológun Ìhámọ́ra 23, Ọ̀gágun Sani Gambo Mohammed ti ṣe àbẹ̀wò sí ikọ̀ náà ní Garkida

translation.en: At the end of his tour, he congratulated the troops for their doggedness, vigilance and uncommon fighting spirit that led to the victory against the enemy.
translation.yo: Nígbà tí ó ṣe àbẹ̀wò rẹ̀ tán, t’ó sì gbóṣùbà fún ikọ̀ náà fún ìforítì, ìṣọ́ra àti ìjà fitafita tí ó mú wọn ṣẹ́gun ọta.

translation.en: He however admonished them to be more vigilant as the criminal elements may plan a reprisal attack due to the casualties they suffered.
translation.yo: Ó tún wá rọ ikọ̀ ọ̀hún náà láti má ṣe káàrẹ́ẹ̀ nítorí pé ó se é se, kí ikọ̀ ọlọ̀tẹ̀ náà tún fẹ́ padà wá sí àgbègbè ọ̀hún.

translation.en: Additionally, the Brigade Commander also solicited the citizens’ continuous cooperation in reporting to security agencies any suspicious persons or movement within and adjourning communities.
translation.yo: Láfikun, Ọ̀gágun náà tún wá rọ, àwọn tó ń gbé àgbègbè náà láti máa fi tó ikọ̀ ológun létí ní kété tí wọn bá gbúròó àwọn afurasí tàbí àwọn ènìyàn tí ọwọ́ wọn kò mọ́ ọn.

translation.en: He further reassured the good people of Garkida and indeed Adamawa State of the Brigade’s total commitment to protecting lives and properties within its Area of Responsibility.
translation.yo: Ó wá fi dá àwọn ènìyàn àgbègbè Garkida náà lójú pé ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà kò ní káàrẹ́ẹ̀ láti máa dáàbò bo dúkìá àti ẹ̀mí àwọn ará ìlu.

translation.en: ---President Buhari thanks ‘Doctors Without Borders’ for supporting Nigeria
translation.yo: ---Ààrẹ Buhari dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ àwọn ‘Dókítà Láìní Ààlà’ fún àtìlẹ́yìn wọn ní Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: President Muhammadu Buhari says the sacrifices of Medecins Sans Frontieres (Doctors Without Borders) in conflict areas in Nigeria are well appreciated.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari ti ní ìjọba mọ rírì ìfaradà àti ìgbìyànjú ẹgbẹ́ Medecins Sans Frontieres (Dokita Láìní Ààlà) ní àwọn agbègbè tí rògbòdìyàn ti ń wáyé l’órílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: Receiving Dr. Christos Christou, International President of the organization at State House, Abuja, on Friday, the President said the sacrifices as individuals and as a group was quite enormous, particularly on a non-profit basis.
translation.yo: Lásìkò tí ààrẹ Buhari ń tẹ́wọ́gba Dókítà Christos Christou, t’ó jẹ́ ààrẹ ẹgbẹ́ ọ̀hún nílé ààrẹ, nílùú Àbújá, lọ́jọ́ Ọjọ́bọ̀, Ààrẹ ní ìgbìyànjú àti ìfaradà tí ẹgbẹ́ náà ń se pàápàá jùlọ láìgba owó, jẹ́ èyí tí ó yanilẹ́nu.

translation.en: Commenting specifically on the situation in the North-East, President Buhari said despite criticisms, the government has made substantial progress.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Buhari ní ìjọba àpapọ̀ náà kò káàrẹ́ẹ̀ nínú ìgbìyànjú rẹ̀ bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé wọ́n ń sọ ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ọ̀rọ̀ àbùkù sí ìjọba òun.

translation.en: “We know the pathetic situation of children not knowing where their parents are, or the communities they come from, and that was why we established the new Ministry of Humanitarian Affairs, Disaster Management, and Social Development.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ ní “a mọ ipò tí àwọn ọmọdé tí kò mọ ibi tí àwọn òbí wọn wà, tàbí àwọn àgbègbè tí wọ́n ti wá, àti pé ìdí nìyí tí a fi dá Ilé-iṣẹ́ tó ń mójútó ọmọnìyàn, Ìṣàkóso àjálù, áti Ìdàgbàsókè àwùjọ sílẹ̀.

translation.en: This is to harness and channel resources to such deprived people.
translation.yo: Èyí ni láti ṣ’ètò ìrànwọ́ fún irú àwọn ènìyàn báyìí.

translation.en: The President promised that respite and succor would come to all the troubled areas, adding that many prominent and well-to-do organizations were also involved, along with international agencies.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ wá ṣèlérí pé ìjọba yóò fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn ògbóǹtarìgì ọmọ bíbí orílẹ̀ èdè yìí, àwọn ilé-iṣẹ́ ńlá àti àwọn ẹgbẹ́ ilẹ̀ òkèèrè láti pèsè ètò ìrànwọ́ fún àwọn àgbègbè tí rògbòdìyàn ti ṣe lọ́sẹ́.

translation.en: ---Nigeria’s Information Minister clears air on $500m China Loan
translation.yo: ---Mínísítà fún ètò ìròyìn ṣ’àlàyé nípa Ẹ̀yáwó Ẹ̀ẹ́dẹ́gbẹ̀ta mílíọ̀nù dọ́là láti China

translation.en: Nigeria’s Minister of Information and Culture, Alhaji Lai Mohammed has revealed that the 500 million dollar loan being sought from China is not for the Nigeria Television Authority (NTA) alone.
translation.yo: Mínísítà fún ètò ìròyìn àti àsà, Alhaji Lai Mohammed ti sọ pé ẹ̀ẹ́dẹ́gbẹ̀ta mílíọ̀nù dọ́là tí wọ́n fẹ́ yá láti orílẹ̀-èdè China kì í ṣe fún ilé-iṣẹ́ móhùn-máwòrán ti orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà (NTA) nìkan.

translation.en: The Country’s Information and Culture Minister made the clarification in Abuja, Nigeria’s capital, while briefing journalists on the controversies surrounding the proposed loan for the projects.
translation.yo: Mínísítà fún ètò ìròyìn àti àsà s’ọ̀rọ̀ náà nígbàtí ó ń bá akọ̀ròyìn s’ọ̀rọ̀ nílùú Àbújá, tí ṣe olú-ìlú orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà lórí àhesọ ọ̀rọ̀ lórí owó tí wọ́n fẹ́ yá ọ̀hún fún àwọn iṣẹ́ àkànṣe.

translation.en: Mohammed said the loan was for three major projects contrary to the hysteria created over it in a section of the media.
translation.yo: Mohammed ní ẹ̀yáwó náà wà fún iṣẹ́ àkànse pàtàkì mẹ́ta tí wọ́n ṣe l’órílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà tí ó yàtò sí awuyewuye ilé-iṣẹ́ akọ̀ròyìn.

translation.en: He said it was reported in some sections of the media while defending the loan before the National Assembly that the loan was for the upgrades of facilities to enable NTA compete with the likes of America’s Cable Network News, CNN.
translation.yo: Ó ní àwọn ilé-iṣẹ́ akọ̀ròyìn kan gbé àhesọ ọ̀rọ̀ náà jáde lásìkò tí òun wà nílé ìgbìmò aṣòfin láti sọ nípa ètò ẹ̀yáwó ọ̀hún, pé àwọn owó ọ̀hún láti leè jẹ́ kí ilé-iṣẹ́ NTA máa figa-gbága pẹ̀lú ilé-iṣẹ́ móhùn-máwòrán, America’s Cable Network News, CNN.

translation.en: The minister said the loan would be used to construct a headquarters complex and transmission network for Integrated Television Services (ITS), the Federal Government-owned signal distributor and a major component of the country’s Digital Switchover (DSO)
translation.yo: Mínísítà wá ṣ’àlàyé pé ètò ẹ̀yáwó náà yóò jẹ́ lílò fún kíkọ́ àwọn olú ilé-iṣẹ́ agbóhùn sáfẹ́fẹ́ (ITS), tí ó jẹ́ irinṣẹ́ apin-afẹ́fẹ́ ká ti Ìjọba Àpapọ̀ àti àwọn ohun-èlò ìbọ́sórí-ẹ̀rọ Ìgbóhùnsáfẹ́fẹ́ Ìgbàlódé (DSO).

translation.en: He said the fund would also be used to build an ultra-modern Media City in Ikorodu, Lagos State, to include Indoor/Outdoor shooting area, Animation Production Facility and Digital Media Training Centre.
translation.yo: Bákan náà, ó ní wọn yóò tún lo owó náà láti fi kọ́ ilé-iṣẹ́ ìgbàlódé fún ilé-ẹ̀kọ́ ìròyìn fún àwọn akọ̀ròyìn àti oníròyìn nílùú Ìkòròdú, ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó, tí ó ibi eré ìtàgé ilé/òde, Ìṣàwòrándààyè àti Ẹ̀kọ́ Ìmọ̀ Ẹ̀kọ́ Ìkọ̀ròyìn.

translation.en: Mohammed also hinted that other facilities in the city would include World Class Cinema, Four-Star Hotel, an Amusement Park and Amphi-theatre.
translation.yo: Mohammed tún pé wọn yóò tún lo owó náà fún pípèsè ilé-iṣẹ́ sinimá Ìgbàlódé, Ilé–ìtura Oníràwọ̀ Mẹ́rin, Gbọ̀ngàn eré- ìtàgé ńlá àti Ibi ìṣere.

translation.en: The minister further said the loan would also be used for acquisition of digital movie production equipment for rental as well as power system
translation.yo: Mínísítà tún tẹ̀síwájú pé àwọn yóò tún lo owó náà láti fi ra irinṣẹ́ ìgbàlódé fún ìyàwòràn fún yíyá àti ìpèsè iná mọ̀nà-mọ́ná.

translation.en: He disclosed that the Media City Training Academy was only the second of its type in Africa and the first is in Egypt.
translation.yo: Ó ní Ìlú Ilé-ẹ̀kọ́ Ìkọ́ròyìn ni ìkejì irú rẹ̀ tó wà ní Ilẹ̀-Adúláwọ̀ tí àkọ́kọ́ wà ní orílẹ̀ èdè Egypt.

translation.en: The minister also disclosed that the loan would be used for digitization of all NTA Stations at the Headquarters, 12 zonal stations, the 36 States and FCT as well as 78 community stations.
translation.yo: Mínísítà tún sọ pé àwọn yóò tún lo owó ọ̀hún láti fi pèsè irinṣẹ́ ìgbàlódé fún ilé-iṣẹ́ móhùn-máwòrán NTA tó wà nílùú Àbújá àti ẹkùn méjìlá àti ní gbogbo ibi tí ilé-iṣẹ́ náà wà ní gbogbo ìpínlẹ̀ tó wà l’órílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: ---President Buhari reassures Plateau State on peace, prosperity
translation.yo: ---Ààrẹ Buhari fọkàn ìpínlẹ̀ Plateau balẹ̀ lórí ètò àlàáfíà àti àṣeyọrí.

translation.en: President Muhammadu Buhari has reassured Plateau State government that the Federal Government will continue to support its efforts towards promoting a peaceful, prosperous and tolerant society.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, Muhammadu Buhari ti fọkàn àwọn ènìyàn ìpínlẹ̀ Plateau balẹ̀ pé ìjọba kò ní káàárẹ̀ láti túbọ̀ máa ṣètò ìránẁọ fún wọn nípa pípèsè ètò àlàáfíà, àṣeyọrí àti ìfọ̀kànbalẹ̀ fún wọn.

translation.en: Receiving Governor Simon Lalong and other stakeholders from Plateau State on Thursday, President Buhari appealed to residents and indigenes of the State to support the Governor’s development agenda.
translation.yo: Lásìkò tí ààrẹ Buhari ń tẹ́wọ́gba gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Plateau ọ̀hún, Simon Lalong àti àwọn tí ọ̀rọ̀ kàn ní ìpínlẹ̀ Plateau lọ́jọ́ Ọjọ́bọ̀, Ààrẹ Buhari wá rọ àwọn olùgbé àti ọmọ ìpínlẹ̀ náà láti máa sàtìlẹyìn fún ètò ìdàgbàsókè tí gómínáà náà dáwọ́lé lórí.

translation.en: ‘‘It is, therefore, our collective duty to ensure these potentials are fully harnessed by providing the right policy support,’’ the President said.
translation.yo: Gómìnà náà wá rọ ààrẹ Buhari láti ṣètò pópó ọ̀nà ọkọ̀ tí yóò máa gba àwọn ọkọ̀ púpọ̀, ìrànwọ́ fún àwọn tí ogun àti ìjà lé kúrò ní àgbègbè wọn, àtúnṣe lórí ilé –iṣẹ́ ìwádìí lórí ànàmọ́.

translation.en: President Buhari told the delegation he was very pleased with the progress made on security, provision of social services and infrastructure development under the leadership of the present Governor.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Buhari wá sọ fún àwọn aṣojú ọ̀hún pé, inú òhun dùn lórí ìdàgbàsókè tó wà nípa ètò ààbò àti ìdàgbàsókè àwùjọ tí gómìnà náà ń ṣe ní ìpínlẹ̀ náà

translation.en: The delegation comprised of the State Deputy Governor, Prof. Sonni Tyoden as well as political appointees and some illustrious sons and daughters of Plateau State.
translation.yo: Lára àwọn èníyàn t’ó wà pẹ̀lú gómìnà Lalong ní ìgbákejì gómìnà, ọ̀jọ̀gbọ̀n Sonni Tyoden àti àwọn ògbóntàrigìì olósèlú tó wá láti ìpínlẹ̀ náà

translation.en: ---Senate probes GSM operators over drop calls
translation.yo: ---Ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin yóò ṣe ìwádìí bí ilé-iṣẹ́ ẹ̀rọ ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ alágbèéká ṣe ń ja Nàìjíríà lólè lórí ìpè.

translation.en: A Senate panel on Wednesday held a public hearing to investigate telecommunications network operators in the country over increasing rate of drop calls.
translation.yo: Lọ́jọ́rú yìí n ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ ìwádìí lórí owó tí àwọn ilé-iṣẹ́ tó ń pèsè ẹ̀rọ ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ alágbèéká àti ìpè bí wọ́n ṣe ń ja àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè lólè lórí ìpè tí àwọn ènìyàn kò jẹ̀gbádùn rẹ̀ sùgbọ́n tí wọ́n ń gbà owó lọ́wọ́ oníbárà wọn.

translation.en: According to the chairman of the Senate Committee on Communications, Senator Oluremi Tinubu, the session was specifically “on the increasing rate of drop calls and other unwholesome practices by telecommunications network operators in Nigeria that have robbed Nigerians of their hard earned billions of naira.”
translation.yo: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí alága ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin tó ń mójútó ètò ìbánisọ̀rọ̀, aṣòfin Olúrèmí Tinubu, se sọ pé “Bí àwọn ilé-iṣẹ́ ẹ̀rọ ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ ṣe ń já owó lórí ìpè tí àwọn oníbàráà wọn kò lò àti àwọn ìwà mííràn tí wọ́n ń lò láti ja àwọn oníbàráà wọn lólè jẹ́ ìwà ìbàjẹ́.

translation.en: What MTN does in Nigeria, MTN doesn’t do that in South Africa.
translation.yo: Irú ìwà ti ilé-isẹ́ ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ MTN ń hu lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà kó leè ṣẹlẹ̀ lórílẹ̀ èdè South Africa.

translation.en: I think the committee should insist on what happens to all the money people in this country paid for no service.
translation.yo: Ó yẹ kí ìgbìmọ̀ ṣe ìwádìí sí gbogbo owó tí àwọn ilé-isẹ́ ẹ̀rọ ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ ń gbà lọ́wọ́ oníbàráà wọn láìjẹ́ pé wọ́n jẹ àǹfààní ohun tí wọ́n san owó náà fún.

translation.en: Other countries give money back.
translation.yo: Àwọn orílẹ̀ èdè mìíràn máa ń dá owó padà.

translation.en: But here you denied us and you don’t give one Kobo.
translation.yo: Sùgbọ́n níbí ẹ fi dùn wá ti ẹ sì ní fún wa ní Kọ́bọ̀.

translation.en: “And the kind of market that we have in Nigeria, is such that you don’t have this market anywhere in the world.
translation.yo: “Irú ọjá tó wà ní orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, kò sí irú rẹ̀ ní àgbáyé.

translation.en: When a Nigerian will have three lines, yet we don’t get the service that we paid for.
translation.yo: Nígbàtí àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà mìíràn yóò ní káàdì ìpè mẹ́ta, síbẹ̀ a kò tún ní jẹ àǹfààní sí ohun tí a sanwó fún.

translation.en: The Senate President also accused the regulatory authority, Nigerian Communications Commission (NCC) of not doing enough to check the sharp practices by the Service Providers.
translation.yo: Abẹnugan wá rọ ilé-iṣẹ́ tó ń mójútó gbogbo ẹ̀rọ ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà (NCC) láti mójútó ojúse wọn, pàápàá jùlọ bí àwọn ilé-isẹ́ tó ń pèsè ìpè àti ayélujára se ń já àwọn oníbàráà wọn lólè lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí.

translation.en: ---Coronavirus: Nigerian Government reiterates preparedness
translation.yo: ---Coronavirus: Ìjọba Nàìjíríà ti múra sílẹ̀.

translation.en: The Nigerian Government has said that it has further enhanced its preparedness level to contain the coronavirus also known as COVID-19 epidemic in case of any suspicious case in the country.
translation.yo: Ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà ti ní òhun ti múra sílẹ̀ láti gbógun tí ààrùn corona tí a mọ̀ sí COVID-19, lọ́gán tí wọ́n bá gb́uròó rẹ̀ lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí.

translation.en: Briefing Journalists in Abuja on Tuesday, after an inspection tour of the screening facility, the country’s Information and Culture Minister Mr. Lai Mohammed alongside his counterparts from other ministries stated that government was ready to prevent Corona spread.
translation.yo: Mínísítà fún ìròyìn àti àsà lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, Lai Mohammed ló sọ̀rọ̀ yìí pẹ̀lú àwọn akọ̀ròyìn lọ́jọ́ Ìsẹ́gun lásìkò tí wọ́n ń se àyẹ̀wò ohun èlò tí wọ́n pèsè sílẹ̀ láti fi gbógun ti àrùn corona.

translation.en: The Minister said that relevant ministries and agencies are working in synergy to achieve to tackle the virus should it come into the country.
translation.yo: Mínísítà tún sọ pé àwọn àjọ àti ilé-iṣẹ́ ìjọba tí ń bá ara wọn ṣiṣẹ́ papọ̀ láti gbógun ti àrùn corona ní kété tó bá wọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: He said that the team work and professionalism exhibited by the Task Force set up by the government has given the country a clean bill of health so far but this effort must be sustained.
translation.yo: Ó ní ìgbìmọ̀ tí ìjọba àpapọ̀ yàn ti fọkàn orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà balẹ̀ pé kò séwu lóko lóngẹ́ nípa ètò ìlera, àmọ́sá wọn kò ní dáwọ́ ìgbìyànjú náà dúró.

translation.en: Four Ministers the Minister of Aviation, Minister of State for Health, Minister of Humanitarian Affairs, Disaster Management and Social Development, all part of the Inter-Ministerial committee were present at the Inspection tour at the Abuja International Airport.
translation.yo: Àwọn mínísítà mẹ́rin orílẹ̀ èdè yìí ló wà níbi ètò àyẹ̀wò náà, Mínísítà fún ètò ọkọ̀ ojú òfuurufú, Mínísítà ìpínlẹ̀ fún ètò ìlera, Mínísítà fún ètò ọmọníyán, àjálù àti ìdàgbàsókè àwùjọ, ni wọ́n jọ wà ní pápá òfúrufú fún ètò àyẹ̀wọ̀ ọ̀hún.

translation.en: According to Lai Mohammed, all Media agencies of the Federal Ministry of Information, like the Nigerian Television Authority, Federal Radio Corporation of Nigeria, News Agency of Nigeria, Voice of Nigeria and the National Orientation Agency, are using their platforms to sensitise and enlighten the public on Coronavirus.
translation.yo: Lai mohammed tún ní àwọn ilé-iṣẹ́ ìròyìn ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè yìí, ilé-iṣẹ́ ìròyìn àti móhùn-máwòrán orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, ilé-iṣẹ́ agbóhùn sáfẹ́fẹ́ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, ilé-iṣẹ́ akọ̀ròyìn ti ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Ohùn Nàíjíríà àti ilé-iṣẹ́ elétò ìlanilọ́yẹ̀ náà kò gbẹ́yìn láti máa ṣe ìpolongo àti ìlanilọ́yẹ̀ fún àwọn ará ìlú lórí àrùn corona ọ̀hún.

translation.en: Adding that all sensitisation programmes are also being translated to the major indigenous languages.
translation.yo: Ó tún tẹ̀ síwájú pé ètò ìlanilọ́yẹ̀ ọ̀hún ni wọ́n tún ń sọ ní èdè abínibí.

translation.en: Nigeria, Iran to strengthen parliamentary ties
translation.yo: Ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin Nàìjíríà àti Iran yóò fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀

translation.en: The Nigerian House of Representatives has reiterated its commitment to strengthening relationship with the parliament of the Islamic Republic of Iran.
translation.yo: Ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà ti ní orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà yóò fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ pẹ̀lú ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin orílẹ̀ èdè Iran.

translation.en: The Speaker of the House Mr. Femi Gbajabiamila while receiving the Iranian Ambassador to Nigeria, Mr. Morteza Rahimi Zarchi, in Abuja, said a robust parliamentary relationship between the two countries would go a long way in boosting the relationship between the two countries.
translation.yo: Abẹnugan Fẹ́mi Gbàjàbíàmílà sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lásìkò tó ń gba aṣojú orílẹ̀ èdè Iran sí Nàìjíríà, ọ̀gbẹ́ni Morteza Rahimi Zarchi, lálejò nílùú Àbújá, ó sọ pé ìbásepọ̀ láàrin ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà àti Iran yóò túnbọ̀ gbilẹ̀ síi láàrin orílẹ̀ èdè méjèèjì ọ̀hún.

translation.en: “We’re always delighted when we receive eminent visitors from other countries. We’re always excited because it boosts the relationships between the two countries. I believe that diplomacy can be achieved through parliament.
translation.yo: Abẹnugan Gbàjàbíàmílà ní “Inú wa máa ń dùn láti tẹ́wógba àwọn àlejò láti ilẹ̀ òkèèrè, nítorí pé ó máa ń jẹ́ kí ìbásepọ̀ tó wà láàrín orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà àti orílẹ̀ náà tún túnbọ̀ múná-dóko.

translation.en: We look forward to having a good relationship between your parliament and our parliament,” Speaker Gbajabiamila said.
translation.yo: “Mo mọ̀ pé orílẹ̀ èdè Iran ń la ìpèníjà kọjá bíi orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: Earlier, Mr. Zarchi said besides the parliamentary friendship, it was also imperative for the two countries to have stronger economic and cultural ties.
translation.yo: "Sáájú èyí ni, ọ̀gbẹ́ni Zarchi sọ pé lẹ́yìn ìbásepọ̀ pẹ̀lú ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin orílẹ̀ èdè méjéèjì ọ̀hún, ó tún jẹ́ dandan pé kí orílẹ̀ èdè méjèèjì náà ní ìbásepọ̀ lórí ètò ọrọ̀ ajé àti àsà.

translation.en: He said Iran has a big role to play in the fight against terrorism, especially in its region, noting that the country attaches importance to the issue.
translation.yo: Ó ní orílẹ̀ èdè Iran ti ṣe gudugudu méje, yàyà mẹ́fà láti gbógun ti ikọ̀ ọlọ̀ọ̀tẹ̀ pàápàá jùlọ ní ẹkùn wọn.

translation.en: ---Senate confirms new Aviation Authority Head
translation.yo: ---Ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin fòǹtẹ̀ lu adarí ilé–iṣẹ́ ọkọ̀ òfuurufú tuntun.

translation.en: Nigerian Senate on Tuesday confirmed the nomination of Captain Musa Shuaibu Nuhu as Director-General of the Nigerian Civil Aviation Authority, NCAA.
translation.yo: Ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin ti fòǹtẹ̀ lu adarí ilé-iṣẹ́ ọkọ̀ òfúrufú tuntun, Nigerian Civil Aviation Authority, NCAA,Captain Musa Shuaibu Nuhu gẹ́gẹ́ bi adarí tuntun fún àjọ náà.

translation.en: Nuhu’s confirmation was sequel to the consideration of the report on the screening of the nominee by the Senate Committee on Aviation.
translation.yo: Èyí wáyé lẹ́yìn àyẹ̀wò tí ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin tó ń mójútó ilé-iṣẹ́ ọkọ̀ òfúrufú ṣe fún, Musa Shuaibu Nuhu, tí ó sì yege níbẹ̀.

translation.en: Chairman of the Committee, Senator Smart Adeyemi said that the “nominee has requisite experience and possesses relevant academic and professional qualifications.”
translation.yo: Alága ìgbìmọ̀ ọ̀hún, Smart Adéyẹmí, sọ pé “Àwon yàn, Musa Shuaibu Nuhu nítorí ìmọ̀ àti ẹ̀kọ́ tí ó ní nípa ọkọ̀ òfuurufú.

translation.en: The Senate President, Ahmad Lawan, on January 28, 2020, read a request on the floor from President Muhammadu Buhari for the confirmation of Captain Musa Shuaibu Nuhu as Director-General for the Nigerian Civil Aviation Authority (NCAA).
translation.yo: Lọ́jọ́ kejìdínlọ́gbọ̀n oṣù kínní, ọdún 2020, ni abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin, Ahmad Lawan, ka ìwé tí ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari fi ránsẹ́ sí ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin nípa yíyan Captain Musa Shuaibu Nuhu gẹ́gẹ́ bíi adarí tuntun fún àjọ náà.

translation.en: Captain Musa Shuaibu Nuhu was a reputable airline Pilot and Aviation Safety Expert with well over 30 years.
translation.yo: Captain Musa Shuaibu Nuhu jẹ́ ògbóǹtarìgì awakọ̀ òfuurufú, tí ó sì tún ṣe iṣẹ́ náà fún ọgbọ̀n ọdún.

translation.en: ---President of the Senate, Dr. Ahmad Lawan has declared open a public hearing on sexual harrassment.
translation.yo: ---Abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin, Ahmad Lawan ti se ìfilọ́lẹ̀ ìta gbangba láti jẹ́ kí àwọn ará ilú wá sọ̀rọ̀ nípa ìwà ìfipá bánilòpọ̀.

translation.en: Senator Lawan said that sexual harassment and intimidation was not just a sexual offence but a criminal offence.
translation.yo: Aṣòfin Lawan ní ìwà ìfipá-bánilòpọ̀ àti ìdúnkookò mọ́ni láti fipá bá ènìyàn lòpọ̀ jẹ́ ìwà ọ̀daràn.

translation.en: He said that there was need for stakeholders to think upon new resolutions and sanctions to check the menace if the extant laws were not tight enough.
translation.yo: Nítorí náà, àwọn tí ọ̀rọ́ kàn gbọdọ̀ leè foríkorí láti ṣòfin tí yóò fìyà tó tọ́ jẹ ẹni tó bá hu ìwà ìbàjẹ́ ọ̀hún.

translation.en: ---Presidency urges Nigerians to beware of fake news peddlers
translation.yo: ---Ilé-iṣẹ́ Ààrẹ rọ ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà láti yàgò fún àwọn akọ̀ròyìn ayédèrú

translation.en: The Presidency has debunked reports making the round that President Muhammadu Buhari would be embarking on a lengthy trip abroad from Wednesday February 19 to 4th April.
translation.yo: Ilé-iṣẹ́ Ààrẹ ti rọ ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà láti yàgò fún àwọn ìròyìn ẹlẹ́jẹ̀ àti àhesọ ti àwọn akọ̀ròyìn kán gbé jáde pé ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari yóò tẹ ọkọ̀ létí lọ sí ilẹ̀ òkèèrè láti ọjọ́rú, osù kejì ọjọ́ kọkàndínlógún títí di ọjọ́ kẹrin, osù kẹrin.

translation.en: Addressing State House Correspondents, on Monday, Special Adviser to the President on Media and Publicity, Femi Adesina said the report, which emanated on the social media on Sunday was full of falsehood orchestrated by mischief makers.
translation.yo: Olùrànwọ́ ààrẹ lórí ìròyìn àti ìkéde, Fẹ́mi Adésínà lọ́ sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lọ́jọ́ Ajé pẹ̀lú àwọn akọ̀ròyìn pé irọ́ pátápátá ni àwọn ìròyìn tó jáde lórí ẹ̀rọ ayélujára lọ́jọ́ Àìkú.

translation.en: He said: “Purveyors of fake and concocted Information are currently on overdrive, and Nigerians are urged to be careful what they consume as news, and also share with others, particularly from the social media.
translation.yo: Ó ní: “Ìròyìn t’ó jáde pé ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, Muhammadu Buhari fẹ́ lọ sí United Kingdom fún oguń ọjọ́, yóò sì gba ibẹ̀ lọ sí orílẹ̀ èdè Saudi Arabia, tún lọ sí orílẹ̀ èdè Austria, irọ́ tó jìnnà sí òtítọ́ ni èyí, láti ọ̀dọ̀ àwọn ẹni ibi.

translation.en: The Presidential spokesperson further said the mischief makers are not targeting only the President for ridicule, but members of his family and cabinet.
translation.yo: Agbẹnusọ ààrẹ tún ní àwon ènìyàn ibi yìí kò tún fi mọ lórí ààrẹ nìkan, wọ́n tún ń sọ  àwọn àhesọ ọ̀rọ̀ wọ̀nyí nípa ẹbí àti àwọn tí wɔ̣́n jọ́ ń se ìjọba.

translation.en: “Transportation Minister, Rotimi Amaechi was said to have been attacked at Rigasa in Kaduna State, he has denied it, the Air Force was alleged to have killed 250 insurgents, they have denied it, just last week, an online platform published the falsehood that Zahra, the daughter of President Muhammadu Buhari, got employment through the back door as a Deputy Manager at the Petroleum Products Pricing and Regulatory Agency PPPRA, there is no truth to it.
translation.yo: “Wọ́n tún gbé ìròyìn ẹlẹ́jẹ̀ jáde pé, àwon jàndùkú kọlu ọkọ̀ ojú irin tí mínísítà fún ètò ìrìnnà, Rótìmí Amaechi wà níbẹ̀ ní Rigasa ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kàdúná, wọ́n tún sọ pé ọmọ ààrẹ Buhari, Zahra, gba iṣẹ́ nílé ìtajà epo rọ̀bì orílẹ̀ èdè yìí gẹ́gẹ́ bí igbákejì adarí ilé-iṣẹ́ náà, irọ́ tó jìnnà sí òtítọ́ ni èyí.

translation.en: ---Borno Governor visits Niger Republic to discuss repatriation modalities
translation.yo: ---Gómìnà Borno sàbẹ̀wò ṣí Niger láti gba àwọn àtìpó tó wà níbẹ̀ padà

translation.en: The Borno State Governor, Professor Babagana Umara-Zulum has visited Diffa, Niger Republic, with the aim of putting modalities in place towards the safe and dignified repatriation of the refugees to resettlement communities in Borno State.
translation.yo: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Borno, ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Babagana Umara-Zulum ti ṣe àbẹ̀wò sí Diffa, ní orílẹ̀ èdè Niger, láti wá ọ̀nà sí bí àwọn tí ogun Boko Haram lé kúrò ní agbègbè, tí wọ́n sì ń ṣe àtìpó ní orílẹ̀ èdè Niger, padà sí ìpínlẹ̀ Borno.

translation.en: During the visit, the Governor met about 120 thousand refugees, who mostly hailed from local government areas in the northern part of Borno state.
translation.yo: Lásìkò tí gómìnà ṣe àbẹ̀wò sí àwọn àtìpó ọ̀hún, tí wọ́n lé ní ọgọ́fà, tó sì jẹ́ pé púpọ̀ nínú wọn ló wá láti apá ìwọ̀ oòrùn ìpínlẹ̀ Borno.

translation.en: The refugees, made up of men, women and children, fled their homes, in hundreds of communities attacked by Boko Haram insurgents since 2014.
translation.yo: Àwon àtìpó ọ̀hún ló jẹ́ ọkùnrin, obìnrin àti àwọn ọmọdé, tí wọ́n sá kúrò ní agbègbè wọn nítorí ìkọlù láti ọwọ́ Boko Haram láti ọdún 2014, ní èyí tí ó ti sọ ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ wọn di ẹni tí kò nílé lórí.

translation.en: It was reported that majority of the refugees trekked distances to enter the neighbouring country in search of safety.
translation.yo: Ìròyìn sọ pé púpọ̀ nínú àwọn àtìpó náà ló rin ona jínjìn sí àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè agbègbè.

translation.en: The host Governor of Diffa, Isa Lameen, led Governor Zulum during the visit, accompanied by the Speaker, Borno State Assembly, Abdulkarim Lawan, who is from the northern part of Borno State.
translation.yo: Gómìnà Diffa, Isa Lameen, tó jẹ́ olùgbàlejò ni ó darí gómìnà Zulum, àti abẹnugan ilé ìgbìmò asòfin ìpínlẹ̀ Borno, Abdulkarim Lawan.

translation.en: While addressing top officials, Professor Zulum expressed his gratitude to the government of Diffa province, the Federal Government of Niger and the host communities in the country for being hospitable to the Borno citizens.
translation.yo: Ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Zulum wá fi ìdùnnú rẹ̀ hàn sí ìjọba ẹkùn Diffa, ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Niger àti àwọn agbègbè tó wà ní orílẹ̀ èdè náà fún ìwà ìfi-ọmọnìyàn ṣe tí wọ́n hù sí àwọn ọmọ ìpínlẹ̀ Borno.

translation.en: Katsina State Governor, Aminu Masari has cautioned communities in the state against taking the law into their hands, following insecurity challenges in the state.
translation.yo: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Katsina, Aminu Masari ti kìlọ̀ fún àwọn ènìyàn agbègbè ìpínlẹ̀ náà láti má ṣe dájọ́ láti ọwọ́ ara wọn nítorí wàhálà tó bẹ́ sílẹ̀ ní ìpínlẹ̀ náà.

translation.en: Masari gave the advice in Malumfashi on Sunday during the distribution of empowerment materials donated by Sen. Bello Mandiya to some constituents in Funtua Senatorial District.
translation.yo: Masari sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lọ́jọ́ Àìkú ní Malumfashi lásìkò tó ń pín àwọn ohun èlò ìrónilágbára tí asòfin Bello Mandiya pèsè fún àwọn ènìyàn tó ń gbé ní ẹkùn Funtua ní ìpínlẹ̀ ọ̀hún.

translation.en: He said that the killing of 30 people in Tsanwa and Dankar villages of Batsari Local Governmental of the state was a reprisal by armed bandits from Zamfara forest.
translation.yo: Masari tẹ̀síwájú pé pípa àwọn ènìyàn ọgbọ́n tó ń gbé ní agbègbè Tsanwa àti Dankar ní ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ Batsari wá láti ọwọ́ àwọn ọlọ́tẹ̀ tí wọ́n wà nínú igbó Zamfara láti gbẹ̀san.

translation.en: The governor appealed to all communities not to resort to self-help, but report suspicious persons to relevant authorities for prompt action.
translation.yo: Gómìnà náà wá rọ àwọn tó ń gbé nínú agbègbè náà láti máa hu ìwá tí wọn yóò fi gbẹ̀san sùgbọ́n tí wón bá fura sí àwọn ènìyàn tí ọwọ́ wọn kò mọ́, kí wọn fi tó àwọn agbófinró létí.

translation.en: Masari urged people of the state to be calm, and assured them that the government and security operatives were on top of the situation.
translation.yo: Masari tún wá rọ̀ wọ́n láti mú sùúrù pé ìjọba àti àwọn àjọ ẹ̀sọ́ elétò ààbò sì ń ṣe isẹ́ lórí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà.

translation.en: He commiserated with the people in the two villages and the entire state over the incident.
translation.yo: Ó wá bá àwọn agbègbè méjì tó kábàámọ̀ nínú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà kẹ́dùn.

translation.en: It would be recalled that bandits believed to be from Zamfara invaded Tsanwa and Dankar villages on Friday and killed 30 people mostly women and children before setting their homes ablaze.
translation.yo: Ó ní àwọn ọ̀daràn tí wọ́n wá láti ìpínlẹ̀ Zamfara ni wọ́n wá sí àgbègbè Tsanwa àti Dankar lọ́jọ́ Ẹtì, níbi tí wọ́n ti pa ènìyàn ọgbọ̀n, pàápàá jùlọ àwọn obìnrin àti ọmọdé, kó tó di pé wón dáná sun àwọn àgbègbè ọ̀hún.

translation.en: The state police command said it has arrested one of the bandits.
translation.yo: Ilé-iṣẹ́ ọlọ́pàá ìpínlẹ̀ náà ti ní àwọn ti mú ọ̀kan lára ọ̀daràn ọ̀hún.

translation.en: ---Minister calls for calm in Bayelsa
translation.yo: ---Mínísítà pè fún ìbálẹ̀ọkàn ní ìpínlẹ̀ Bayelsa-.

translation.en: The Minister of State for Petroleum Resources, Chief Timipre Sylva, has urged the people of Bayelsa to shun all act of violence and lawlessness.
translation.yo: Mínísítà ìpínlẹ̀ fún ọ̀rọ̀ epo rọ̀bì, Timipre Sylva ti rọ àwọn ọmọ ìpínlẹ̀ Bayelsa láti yàgò fún ìwà jàgídí-jàgan, ipá àti àìbọ̀wọ̀ fún òfin.

translation.en: Sylva made this known in a statement he signed and released in Abuja on Sunday.
translation.yo: Sylva sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lọ́jọ́ Àìkú nínú àtẹ̀jáde kan tí ó gbé síta nílùú Àbújá.

translation.en: “I want to use this moment to call on all the people of our dear state Bayelsa to kindly shun all acts of violence and lawlessness.
translation.yo: “Mo fẹ́ lo àsìkò yìí láti rọ gbogbo ọmọ ìpínlẹ̀ Bayelsa láti yàgò fún ìwà jàgídí-jàgan, ipá àti àìbọ̀wọ̀ fún òfin.

translation.en: “Also of great importance to me is to extend my profound apology to our President, Muhammadu Buhari, over the avoidable disruption to his busy schedule which was caused by the events of the moment.
translation.yo: “Mo tún fẹ́ lo àsìkò yìí láti fi tọrọ àforíjìn lọ́wọ́ ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, Muhammadu Buhari, lórí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ burúkú tó wáyé, ní èyí tí ó mú kí ààrẹ yí ìpinnu rẹ̀ padà láti wá sí ìpínlẹ̀ Bayelsa.

translation.en: “I am aware that Mr President and his wife Aisha Buhari had concluded arrangements to travel to Bayelsa to witness the inauguration of the APC Governorship candidate as Governor of Bayelsa State.
translation.yo: Silva tún wá rọ àwọn ọmọ ìpínlẹ̀ Bayelsa ọ̀hún pé, àwọn adarí ẹgbẹ́ APC tí ń ṣe iṣẹ́ takun-takun láti rí i pé wọn yanjú wàhálà tó bẹ́ sílẹ̀ ní ìpínlẹ̀ náà, ní èyí tí wọn ti darí àwọn agbẹjọ́rọ̀ wọn láti gbé ìgbẹ́sẹ̀ lórí rẹ̀.

translation.en: President Buhari salutes Kaduna Governor at 60
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Buhari kí Nasir el-Rufai kú orí-ire ọgọ́ta ọdún.

translation.en: Nigeria’s President Muhammadu Buhari has joined Kaduna State Executive Council and indigenes to celebrate the State Governor, Nasir el-Rufai, who will turn 60 on Sunday.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Muhammadun Buhari ti darapọ̀ mọ́ ìgbìmọ̀ ìjọba àti gbogbo ọmọ ìpínlẹ̀ Kaduna láti bá gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Kaduna Nasir el-Rufai sàjọyọ̀ ọgọ́ta (60) ọdún tí yóò pé lọ́jọ́ Àìkú.

translation.en: In a message, President Buhari congratulated the governor for his distinguished service to the nation.
translation.yo: Nínú àtẹ̀jáde kàn tí, ààrẹ Buhari gbé jáde láti fi kí gómìnà náà kú orí-ire fún iṣẹ́ takun-takun tí ó ti gbé ṣe fún ìdàgbàsókè orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: He also noted that the Governor’s entry into public service was truly accidental, but the contributions he has made are deliberate, well thought out and long lasting.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ tún sàlàyé pé bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé gómìnà náà bá ara rẹ̀ lẹ́nu iṣẹ́ ìjọba láìròtẹ́lẹ̀ sùgbọ́n ipa ribi-ribi tí ó ti kó lórílẹ̀ èdè kò láfiwé rárá.

translation.en: Vice President, Professor Yemi Osinbajo has expressed confidence in the ability and competence of Nigerian professionals to solve the nation’s problems without recourse to foreign aid.
translation.yo: Igbákejì Ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, Ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Yẹmí Òsínbàjò ti ní òun ní ìgbẹ́kẹ̀lé nínú ọgbọ́n, ìmọ̀ àti òye àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè yìí láti yanjú ìsoro tó ń dojúkọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà ĺài nílò ìrànwọ́ láti ilẹ̀ òkèèrè.

translation.en: Professor Osinbajo insisted that, given the impressive performance and achievements recorded by Nigerians across diverse fields, at home and abroad, it is evident that many of the country’s problems can be solved by Nigerians themselves.
translation.yo: Ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Yẹmí òsínbàjò ní pẹ̀lú àṣeyọrí ti àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà yìí ti ṣe nílẹ̀ yìí àti ní ilẹ̀ òkèèrè fihàn pé àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè yìí leè yanjú ìṣòro àti ìpèníjà tó ń dojúkọ orílẹ̀ èdè yìí fúnra wọn.

translation.en: Professor Osinbajo said this when he received a delegation from the West African College of Surgeons (WACS), in his office on Friday.
translation.yo: Ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Òsínbàjò sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lásìkò tó ń gba ikọ̀ àwọn onísẹ́ abẹ láti ilé -ẹ̀kọ́ West African College of Surgeons (WACS), nílé-iṣẹ́ rẹ̀ lálejò lọ́jọ́ Ẹtì.

translation.en: The College formed by a group of young Nigerian surgeons, 60 years ago predated the Economic Community of West African States.
translation.yo: Àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà tó ń ṣe iṣẹ́ abẹ ni wọ́n dá ilé ẹ̀kọ́ náà sílẹ̀ ní ọgọ́ta (60) ọdún sẹ́yìn, sáájú ìgbà tí wọn dá àjọ ilẹ̀ áfíríkà sílẹ̀.

translation.en: The delegation led by Professor Ibrahim Yakasai, was at the Aso Rock Presidential Villa to brief the Vice President on the activities of the College including its planned 60th Annual General Meeting and Scientific Conference scheduled for Abuja.
translation.yo: Ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Ibrahim Yakasai, ló darí ikọ̀ náà wá sílé ààrẹ láti sọ nípa àwọn ojúṣe àti akitiyan ilé -ẹ̀kó náà àti láti sọ nípa ìpàdé ọgọ́ta ọdún àjọ náà, ní èyí tí yóò wáyé nílùú Àbújá.

translation.en: Professor Yakasai is the Local Organising Committee chairman.
translation.yo: Ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Yakasai ni olùdarí ayẹyẹ ọ̀hún.

translation.en: Achievements The immediate past President of the College, Professor King-David Yawe highlighted some of the achievements of WACS especially with regards to free medical outreaches to several Nigerian communities.
translation.yo: Ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n King-David Yawe, tó jẹ́ ààrẹ ilé-ẹ̀kọ́ náà tẹ́lẹ̀rí sàlàyé nípa àwọn aseyọrí tí WACS ti ṣe pàápàá jùlọ nípa àwọn ìwòsàn ọ̀fẹ́ tí wọ́n ti ṣe ní púpọ̀ nínú àwọn agbègbè tó wà lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: ---Nigeria adopts multi-prong strategy for road maintenance
translation.yo: ---Orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà gba orísirísi ìlànà láti tún ojú pópó ṣ̣e.

translation.en: Nigeria’s Minister of Works and Housing, Babatunde Fashola, has affirmed the adoption of a multi-prong strategy for road maintenance across the country to ensure accessibility all year round.
translation.yo: Mínísítà fún èto iṣẹ́ àti ilẹ̀ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà, Babátúndé Fásholá ti fìdí rẹ̀ múlẹ̀ pé láti wá orísirísi ìlànà fún ìtọ́jú ojú pópó ní jákè –jádò orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà nìkan ló le jẹ́ kí gbogbo ọ̀nà ojú pópó wa leè gbóúnjẹ-fẹ́gbẹ́ gbàwo bọ̀ lọ́dọọdún.

translation.en: The Minister made this known at Ugep, the largest village in Africa, Yakurr local government area, during the inspection of critical economic roads within Cross River State.
translation.yo: Mínísítà sọ̀rọ̀ yìí ní Ugep tó wà ní ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ Yakurr, tó jẹ́ agbègbè tí ó tóbi jùlọ nílẹ̀ Áfíríkà lásìkò ètò àyẹ̀wò iṣẹ́ ojú pópó ní ìpínlẹ̀ Cross River.

translation.en: Fashola, who was accompanied by key officials of his ministry, noted that road maintenance especially during the rainy season, required the collective responsibility of everyone.
translation.yo: Fáṣọlá, tí àwon òṣìṣẹ́ rẹ̀ jọ kọ́wọ̀ọ́rìn tún sọ pé ìtọ́jú ojú pópó pàápàá jùlọ lásìkò òjò jẹ́ ojúṣe gbogbo àwọn ènìyàn.

translation.en: “We stopped at the Calabar-Itu road, which was a major problem during the raining season, just like the Calabar-Ikom-Ogoja road.
translation.yo: “A dúró ní ojú ọ̀nà Calabar-Itu, tí ó máa ń jẹ́ wàhálà fún àwọn ọlọ́kọ̀ àti ènìyàn láti gbà lásìkò òjò gẹ́gẹ́ bí ojú ọ̀nà Calabar-Ikom-Ogoja.

translation.en: It requires us to change our strategy and this year, for roads like Numanchan leading to Taraba, Calabar-Itu, Abeokuta to Otta-Lagos – all of those roads where trucks get stuck during the rains – we need a strategy to ensure that our contractors are mindful of the commuters, while the construction is ongoing.
translation.yo: Nítorí náà gbogbo ojú ọ̀nà tó máa ń fa wàhálà fún àwọn ọlọ́kọ̀ láti gbà lásìkò òjò, àwọn bíi Numanchan tó lọ sí Taraba, Calabar-Itu, Abéòkúta sí Òttà-Lagos – a óò wá ètò ìlànà tí yóò jẹ́ kí àwọn agbaṣẹ́ṣe leè máa ro ti àwọn tó ń wa ọkọ̀ lásìkò tí wọn bá ń ṣe isẹ́ wọn.

translation.en: Project Funding The Managing Director of SEMATECH, Isioma Eziashi attributed the delay in completing the project on time to lack of available funds despite the firms readiness to deliver the project as stipulated on the timeline.
translation.yo: Olùdarí ilé–iṣẹ́ SEMATECH, Isioma Eziashi sọ pé àwọn ìpèníjà tí ó máa ń dojúkọ wọn ni owó tí àwọn kò tètè máa rí gbà bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ ilé-iṣẹ́ náà ti ṣetán láti tètè parí isẹ́ náà lásìkò tí wọn fún wọn.

translation.en: ---The Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) has presented Certificate of Return to the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP)’s candidate, Douye  Diri, as winner of the Bayelsa 2019 governorship election, in compliance with the Supreme Court judgment.
translation.yo: ---Àjọ elétò ìdìbò orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà,( Independent National Electoral Commission ,INEC) ti fún Duoye Diri tó  jẹ́ olùdíje fún ipò gómìnà lábẹ́ ẹgbẹ́ òṣèlù Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) ní ìwé ẹ̀rí gẹ́gẹ́ bí gómìnà to jáwé olúborí nínú ìdìbò tó wáyé ní ìpínlẹ̀ Bayelsa lọ́dún 2019, ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú ìdájọ́ tí ilé-ẹjọ́ gíga tó wà l’órílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà dá.

translation.en: Diri was presented the certificate of return by National Commissioner in charge of South/South, Mrs May Agbamuche-Mbu, on Friday at INEC headquarters in Abuja.
translation.yo: Kọmíṣánà fún àjọ INEC ní ẹkùn ìlà ìwọ̀ oòrùn arabìnrin May Agbamuche-Mbu ló fún Diri ní ìwé ẹ̀rí ọ̀hún lọ́jọ́ Ẹtì nílùú Àbújá tó jẹ́ olú-ìlú àjọ náà tó wà ní orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: Earlier, INEC Chairman, Prof. Mahmood Yakubu, had declared Diri winner of the state governorship election.
translation.yo: Sáájú èyí ni alága àjọ INEC, ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Mahmood Yakubu, ti kéde pé Diri gẹ́gẹ́ bí olúborí nínú ìdìbò gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ náà.

translation.en: Receiving the certificate, Diri commended INEC and the judiciary for being the “last hope of the common man.”
translation.yo: Diri wá gbósùbà fún àjọ INEC àti ilé-ẹjọ́ fún bí wọ́n ṣe jẹ́ “Èyí tí àwọn ènìyàn leè ní ìgbẹkẹ̀lé nínú wọn.

translation.en: “We pray and hope that God will heal our land, Bayelsa, and Nigeria. God has taken us through wide road and the road has taught us reconciliation, lessons” Diri said.
translation.yo: "Diri tún ní “kí Ọlọ́run wo ilẹ̀ Bayelsa sàn àti orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà lápapọ̀. Ọlọ́run ti mú wa rin ojú ọ̀nà, tí a ó máa gbà láti leè bá ara wa ṣe papọ̀.

translation.en: The Supreme Court on Thursday sacked David Lyon and Sen. Biobarakuma Degi-Eremienyo, as governor and deputy governor-elect in the Nov. 16, 2019 Bayelsa governorship election.
translation.yo: Lọ́jọ́bọ̀ ní ilé-ẹjọ́ tó ga jùlọ lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà yọ David Lyon ati Biobarakuma Degi-Eremienyo kúrò gẹ́gẹ́ bí gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Bayelsa

translation.en: ---President Buhari arrives in New York for UN General Assembly
translation.yo: ---Ààrẹ Buhari dé sí New York fún Ìpàdé Àpérò Àjọ UN.

translation.en: President Muhammadu Buhari is in New York, to attend the 74th session of the United Nations General Assembly UNGA.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà Muhammadu Buhari wà ní New York, fún Àpérò Àjọ Ìṣòkan Àgbáyé tí ó jẹ́ ìkẹrìnléláàdọ́rin (74) ìpàdé àpérò irú rẹ̀.

translation.en: The President, who arrived in New York in the late hours of Sunday, was received on arrival by Nigeria’s Ambassador to the US, Justice Sylvanus Adiewere, Ministers of Foreign Affairs, Geoffrey Onyama and that of Health, Dr Osagie Ehanire among others.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Buhari, ẹni tí ó dé sí New York ní ọ̀gànjọ́ ọjọ́ Àìkú, tí aṣojú orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà fún ilẹ̀ Amẹ́ríkà, Sylvanus Adiewere, Mínísítà fún ọ̀rọ̀ òkèèrè, Geoffrey Onyama àti Mínísítà fún ètò ìlera, Osagie Ehanire àti àwọn mìíràn wá pàde rẹ̀.

translation.en: President Buhari is scheduled to be the 5th to deliver his address at the UNGA general debate, which starts on Tuesday.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Buhari ni ẹnití yóò jẹ́ ìkarùn-ún nínú àwọn ti yóò máa sọ̀rọ̀ níbi Ìpàdé Àpérò Àjọ Ìṣòkan Àgbáyé ọ̀hún, ní èyí tí yóò bẹ̀rẹ̀ lọ́jọ́ Ìṣẹ́gun.

translation.en: The President is expected to underscore his administration’s commitment to building on the achievements of its three-point agenda following the renewal of his electoral mandate by majority of Nigerians.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Buhari yóò máa sọ̀rọ̀ lórí ìṣèjọba àti ìpinnu mẹ́ta tí ó fẹ́ gúnlẹ̀ níbi ìṣèjọba rẹ̀ lẹ́yìn tí ọ̀pọ̀ ọmọ Nàìjíríà fìbò dá a padà sórí àléfà.

translation.en: He will also reaffirm Nigeria’s position on salient global issues.
translation.yo: Yóò sì ṣàlàyé àwọn ipò tí orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà wà lórí àwọn ọ̀ràn tí ó kan gbogbo àgbáyé gbọ̀ngbọ̀n.

translation.en: The President’s participation at this year’s gathering of world leaders is particularly significant as it coincides with Nigeria’s Presidency of UNGA.
translation.yo: Ìkópa Ààrẹ nínú ìpéjọ àwọn olórí orílẹ̀-èdè àgbáyé ọdún yìí ṣe pàtàkì nítorí ó ṣe pẹ̀kínrẹ̀kí pẹ̀lú Orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà gẹ́gẹ́ bí Ààrẹ Ìpàdé Àpérò Àjọ UN.

translation.en: The theme for UNGA74 is, ‘Galvanizing Multilateral Efforts for Poverty Eradication, Quality Education, Climate Action and Inclusion.’
translation.yo: Àkórí ìpàdé Àpérò Àjọ Ìṣòkan Àgbáyé ẹlẹ́ẹ̀kẹrìnléláàdọ́rin (UNGA74) náà ni, ‘Ìgbìyànjú Nílopo-ọ̀nà láti Mú Òṣì Kúrò, Ètò Ẹ̀kọ́ tó yè Kooro àti Mímójútó Ìyípadà Ojú-ọjọ́ àti Ìfi-àwọn-ènìyàn-gbogbo-kun-ètò-gbogbo.

translation.en: ---First Ebola case recorded in DRC city of Goma
translation.yo: ---Àrùn Ebola àkọ́kọ́ ṣẹlẹ̀ ní ìlú Goma ní Orílẹ̀-èdè Ìjọba Àwarawa Olómìnira Congo.

translation.en: The first case of Ebola in the eastern Democratic Republic of Congo city, Goma, was discovered on Sunday, officials said, raising concerns the virus could spread quicker in a densely populated area close to the Rwandan border.
translation.yo: Àwọn aṣojú ìjọba sọ wí pé, àrùn Ebola àkọ́kọ́ ṣẹ́yọ ní ìlú Goma ní ìlà-oòrùn Orílẹ̀-èdè Ìjọba Àwarawa Olómìnira Congo, ní ọjọ́ Àìkú, tí ó ń bà wọ́n lẹ́rù nítorí ó ṣe é ṣe kí àrùn ọlọ́jẹ̀ náà ó tàn kíá ní agbègbè tí ó mú àlà pẹ̀lú orílẹ̀-èdè Rwanda.

translation.en: Goma, a lakeside city of 1 million people, is more than 350 km south of where the second-largest Ebola outbreak on record was first detected a year ago.
translation.yo: Ó tó àádọ́ta-ọ̀kẹ́ kan àwọn ènìyàn tó ń gbé ìlú Gómà, t’ó súnmọ́ bèbè adágúndò, tó ìbùsọ̀ 350 ní gúúsù apá ibí tí ó ṣìkejì agbègbè tí àrùn Ebola tí ó pọ̀ j ù lọ ti ṣẹ́yọ ní bí ọdún kan sẹ́yìn.

translation.en: But the haemorrhagic fever has gradually spread south, infecting nearly 2,500 people and killing more than 1,600.
translation.yo: Ṣùgbọ́n àrùn ibà ọlọ́jẹ̀ náà tí ń ṣe wérewère tàn ká dé gúúsù, tí ó ti ran àwọn ènìyàn 2,500 tí ó sì pa àwọn 1,600.

translation.en: How Ebola spread to Goma
translation.yo: Bí àrùn Ebola ṣ̣e wọ ìlú Goma

translation.en: The patient was a priest who became infected during a visit to the town of Butembo, 200 km north of Goma, where he interacted with Ebola patients, Congo’s health ministry said in a statement.
translation.yo: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ilé–ìwòsàn náà ṣe sọ, àlùfáà ni ẹni tí ó lugúdẹ àrùn náà lásìkò t’ó wá sí ìlú Butembo, ìbùsọ̀ 200 sí àríwá Goma, níbi tí ó ti ṣàgbákò àwọn ènìyàn tó ní àrùn Ebola.

translation.en: He developed symptoms last week before taking a bus to Goma on Friday. When he arrived in Goma on Sunday he went to a clinic where he tested positive for Ebola.
translation.yo: Àwọn àmì àrùn náà bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní máa jẹyọ lọ́sẹ̀ t’ó kọ́ja lásìkò kí ó t ó wọ́kọ akéròpúpọ̀ lọ sí Goma lọ́jọ́ Ẹtì. Nígbà tí ó dé Goma lọ́jọ́ Àìkú ni ó lọ sílé ìwòsàn, níbi tí àyẹ̀wò ti fi hàn pé ó ní àrùn Ebola.

translation.en: “Due to the speed with which the patient has been identified and isolated, as well as the identification of all bus passengers from Butembo, the risk of spreading to the rest of the city of Goma remains low,” the ministry said.
translation.yo: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí iléeṣẹ́ ètò ìlera ṣe sọ “látàrí ìjáfara kẹ́fin alárùn náà àti bí ó ti ṣe wà ní ìyàsọ́tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀, àti ìṣèdánimọ̀ gbogbo àwọn èrò ọkọ̀ láti Butembo, ewu ìfọ́nká sí àwọn agbègbè tí ó kù ní Goma kéré.” wọn ní gbogbo ibùdókọ̀

translation.en: Goma has been preparing for the arrival of Ebola for a year, setting up hand-washing stations and making sure motorcycle riders do not share helmets.
translation.yo: Ìlú Goma ti ń gbaradì fún àrùn Ebola láti ọdún tó kọjá, ṣíṣètò ibi tí àwọn ènìyàn náà yóò ti máa fi omi fọ ọwọ́, tí wọ́n sì tún ṣe àrídájú pé àwọn awakẹ̀kẹ́-alùpùpù kò yá ara wọn ní akoto.

translation.en: But in more rural areas, the virus has been hard to contain. Local mistrust of health officials and militia violence have hobbled containment efforts, and caused the number of new cases to spike.
translation.yo: Àmọ́ ní àwọn ìgbèríko, àrùn ọlọ́jẹ̀ náà ti ṣòro láti kápá. Àìfọkàntán àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ elétò ìlera àti ìjà ìgboro ti di àwọn akitiyan ìkápá lọ́wọ́, ó sì tí fa kí àwọn tí ó lùgbàdì ó pọ̀ sí i.

translation.en: Ebola causes diarrhea, vomiting and haemorrhagic fever and can be spread through bodily fluids.
translation.yo: Àrùn Ebola máa ń fa àrùn ìgbẹ́ gbuuru, èébì, àti àrùn ibà ẹlẹ́jẹ̀ tí ó lè ràn nípase oje ara.

translation.en: An epidemic between 2013 and 2016 killed more than 11,300 people in West Africa.
translation.yo: Àjàkálẹ̀ kan ní àárín ọdún 2013 àti 2016 pa ju ènìyàn tí ó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún mọ́kànlá (11,300) ní Ìwọ̀-oòrùn Ilẹ̀-Adúláwọ̀.

translation.en: WHO responds
translation.yo: WHO fèsì

translation.en: The first case of Ebola in Democratic Republic of Congo’s eastern city of Goma is a potential game-changer in the scale of the outbreak, World Health Organization Chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said.
translation.yo: Ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ àrùn Ebola àkọ́kọ́ irú ẹ̀ ní Orílẹ̀-èdè Ìjọba Àwarawa Olómìnira Congo ní ìlà-oòrùn ìlú Goma jẹ́ ìṣípòpadà tí ó ṣe kókó nínú ìpele àjàkálẹ̀ náà, Olóyè Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus Àjọ Elétò Ìlera Àgbáyé sọ.

translation.en: Tedros said he was hopeful that there would be no further spread of the disease in the city, but he was convening the WHO’s emergency committee to decide if the outbreak now constituted an international health emergency.
translation.yo: Tedros sọ wí pé òun nírètí pé kò ní sí ìtànkálẹ̀ àrùn náà ní ìlú náà, ṣùgbọ́n ó ń k ó àwọn ìgbìmọ̀ pàjáwìrì àjọ WHO jọ láti ṣe ìpinnu bóyá àjàkálẹ̀ náà jẹ́ ètò ìlera pàjáwìrì àgbáyé.

translation.en: — World Health Organization (WHO)
translation.yo: — Àjọ Elétò Ìlera Àgbáyé (WHO)

translation.en: An Ebola Treatment Centre in Goma, DRC, has been operational since February, and the person is now receiving care there. As part of the preparedness, 3000 #healthworkers have been vaccinated in this city alone.
translation.yo: Ibi Ìwòsàn àrùn Ebola ní Goma, DRC, ti ń ṣiṣẹ́ láti oṣù Èrèlé, tí onítọ̀hún sì ti ń gba ìtọ́jú níbẹ̀. Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìgbaradì náà, òṣìṣẹ́ elétò ìlera 3000 ni a ti bupá fún ní ìlú náà nìkan.

translation.en: ---NMA blame States for poor state of Primary Healthcare
translation.yo: ---NMA dá àwọn Ìpínlẹ̀ lẹ́bi fún ipò àìdára ètò ìlera abẹ́lé

translation.en: The Nigeria Medical Association (NMA), has blamed the state governments for the poor implementation of Primary Healthcare programmes in the country.
translation.yo: Ẹgbẹ́ àwọn Òṣìṣẹ́ Oníṣègùn Òyìnbó orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà, (Nigeria Medical Association, NMA), ti bẹnu àtẹ́ lu bí àwọn gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ ṣe pa ilé ìwòsàn abẹ́lé orílẹ̀-èdè náà tì sẹ́gbẹ̀ẹ́ kan.

translation.en: Dr Francis Faduyile, the President of NMA, told the press in Abuja, that the poor handling of primary healthcare was due to negligence and poor commitment on the part of state governors.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ ẹgbẹ́ NMA, Dr Francis Faduyile, ló sọ fún àwọn akọ̀ròyìn nílùú Àbújá pé, bí àwọn gómìnà Ìpínlẹ̀ lórílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà kò ṣe kọbiara sí ilé-ìwòsàn abẹ́lé ló fà á tí àwọn ilé-ìwòsàn náà ṣe dẹnu kọlẹ̀.

translation.en: He stated that the state government had largely abandoned the state health system, stressing that they had allowed it to suffer serious setback.
translation.yo: Ó sọ pé àwọn ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ ti pa ilé ìwòsàn abẹ́lé àwọn ìpínlẹ̀ náà tì, tí ó ń tẹnu mọ́ ọ wí pé wọ́n ti jẹ́ kí ó ní ìfàsẹ́yìn tí ó pọ̀.

translation.en: According to him, the state government are in charge of primary healthcare centres and they are in charge of the secondary healthcare institutions and the state government had largely not been up and doing in this regard.
translation.yo: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ó ti ṣe sọ, ìkáwọ́ àwọn ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ ni àwọn ilé ìwòsàn abẹ́lé wà àti pé àkàtà wọn ni àwọn ilé ìwòsàn gbogbó wà, tí ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ kò sì ṣe tó ati sa ipá ní ti èyí.

translation.en: He said that the NMA had increased its advocacy and would open up discussions with the state government to see what could be done to remedy the embarrassing situation.
translation.yo: Ó sọ pé NMA ti jára mo àgbàwí, yóò sì ìjíròrò pẹ̀lú ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ láti wá ojútùú sí ipò adójútini náà.

translation.en: “We are hoping to go to the Governors’ Forum when next they have a meeting to draw attention and address concerns.
translation.yo: “A nírètí láti lọ sí Àpérò Àwọn Gómìnà nígbà mìíràn tí wọ́n bá ní ìpàdé láti ṣíjú wọn sí àwọn ohun tí ó kàn gbọ̀ngbọ̀n.

translation.en: Primary health care is very important in rectifying the health situation in the country.”
translation.yo: Ètò ìlera abẹ́lé jẹ́ kọnti nínú àtúnṣe ètò ìlera ní orílẹ̀-èdè.”

translation.en: Faduyile noted that the Federal Government should take action on the issue of brain drain that could help in salvaging the health sector.
translation.yo: Faduyile sọ pé kí Ìjọba Àpapọ̀ ó wá nnkan ṣe sí ti ìwàgbẹ ọpọlọ tí ó lè ṣe ìgbàpadà ẹ̀ka ìlera.

translation.en: According to the NMA president, we have observed that the governments have not performed well in the health sector.
translation.yo: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ààrẹ ẹgbẹ́ NMA ṣe sọ, a ti ṣ’àkíyèsí wí pé ìjọba kò ṣe dáadáa nínú ẹ̀ka ìlera.

translation.en: Faduyile said that as part of measures to salvage the health sector, the NMA had taken a step to support Community Health Insurance Scheme.
translation.yo: Faduyile sọ pé lára àwọn ìgbésẹ̀ láti ṣe ìgbàpadà ẹ̀ka ìlera, NMA ti gbé ìgbésẹ̀ láti gbárùkù ti Ètò Mádàánilófò Àwùjọ.

translation.en: He said that the association would support states that were forming their health insurance scheme, urging them to seek for guidelines from NMA to do it the right way.
translation.yo: Ó sọ pé àjọ náà yóò ṣe àtìlẹ́yìn fún àwọn ìpínlẹ̀ tí wọ́n ń ṣe àgbékalẹ̀ ètò mádàánilófò ìlera ti wọn, wọ́n rọ̀ wọ́n láti béèrè fún ìtọ́nà lọ́wọ́ NMA ní ọ̀nà tí ó yẹ.

translation.en: ---Nigeria reiterates commitment to promote human rights
translation.yo: ---Nàìjíríà tún ìpinnu rẹ̀ sọ láti ṣe ìgbélárugẹ ẹ̀tọ́ ọmọnìyàn

translation.en: The Nigerian government says the use of torture to extract confession or as punishment to alleged victims of crime will not be condoned.
translation.yo: Ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ti ní òun kò ní fi àyè gba lílọ ìwà ìjìyà ìpalára láti gba ìjẹ́wọ́ lọ́wọ́ ẹni tàbí ìfìyàja ẹni tí a fi ẹ̀sùn kàn mọ́.

translation.en: Solicitor General of the Federation and Permanent Secretary in the Ministry of Justice, Mr. Dayo Akpata stated this in Abuja, at an event to mark the 2019 United Nations International Day in Support of Victims of Torture.
translation.yo: Agbẹjẹ́rò Àgbà fún Orílẹ̀-èdè àti Akọ̀wé Àgbà ní ilé–iṣẹ́ Ètò Ìdájọ́, Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Dayọ̀ Akpata l’ó s’ọ̀rọ̀ yìí nílùú Àbújá, níbi ayẹyẹ láti sàmì sí àjọ̀dún Àjọ Ìṣọ̀kan Àgbáyé ọdún 2019 ní Àtìlẹ́yìn fún Àwọn tí ó ń Jìyà ìpalára.

translation.en: Psychological trauma Mr. Akpata stated that the right to freedom from torture is not negotiable.
translation.yo: Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Akpata ẹni tí ó jẹ́ onímọ̀-egbò inú ọpọlọ sọ wí pé ètò òmìnira ìjìyà ìpalára kì í ṣe ohun ìdúnàdúrà.

translation.en: The Permanent Secretary said that millions of people, family and groups around the world suffers severe physical and psychological trauma as a result of torture.
translation.yo: Akọ̀wé Àgbà náà ní ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún awon ènìyàn, ebi ati àwọn lẹ́gbẹ́lẹ́gbẹ́ jákèjádò ilé-ayé ń jìyà ara àti egbò-inú ọpọlọ látàrí ìjìyà ìpalára.

translation.en: “Every individual living in Nigeria is entitled to respect for the dignity of human person hence, nobody should be subjected to torture or inhumane treatment,” he said.
translation.yo: Ó ní, “gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà l’ó ní ẹ̀tọ́ sí ìbọ̀wọ̀fún ìyìn ọmọ-ènìyàn, láti ìhín lọ, kò sí ẹnikẹ́ni kò gbọdọ̀ fì̀yà jẹ ẹlòmíràn tàbí ìwà àìṣènìà."

translation.en: According to him, “Nigeria is a signatory to the UN convention on torture that prohibits the use of torture.
translation.yo: Ní ọ̀rọ̀ rẹ̀, “orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára orílẹ̀-èdè tí ó t’ọwọ́bọ ìwé àjọ UN l’órí ìjìyà ìpalára tí ó ka ìjìyà ìpalára léèwọ̀.

translation.en: “The Nigerian laws empowered the Ministry to ensure the implementation of the act against torture.”
translation.yo: “Òfin orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ti fún Ilé-Iṣẹ́ ètò ìdájọ́ l’ágbára láti mú àbá d’òfin ìtako ìwà ìpalára ṣe."

translation.en: Mr. Akpata was represented by Mr. Hamza Ahmed at the event.
translation.yo: Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Hamza l’ó ṣójú fún ọ̀gbẹ́ni Akpata níbi ayẹyẹ náà .

translation.en: ---VP Osinbajo to meet with Mike Pence, others in the US
translation.yo: ---Igbákejì Ààrẹ Ọ̀ṣínbájò yóò ṣèpàdé pẹ̀lú Mike Pence, àti àwọn t’ó kù l’órílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà

translation.en: Vice President Yemi Osinbajo is visiting the United States where he will be meeting with his US counterpart, Mr. Mike Pence, and other key groups and interests in the country.
translation.yo: Igbá-kejì Ààrẹ Yẹmí Ọ̀ṣínbájò ń lọ sí orílẹ̀ Amẹ́ríkà, United States níbi tí yóò ti máa ṣẹ̀pàdè pẹ̀lú akẹgbẹ́ rẹ̀ tí ó jẹ́ igbá-kejì Ààrẹ orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà ọ̀gbẹ́ni Mike Pence, àti àwọn ènìyàn jàǹkàn-jàǹkàn lorílẹ̀-èdè náà.

translation.en: A statement from the Office of the Vice President said “ahead of his meeting with the US Vice President in Washington D.C on Wednesday, Professor Osinbajo will be meeting with the Council on Foreign Relations on Monday in New York.
translation.yo: Àtẹ̀jáde kan tí ó wà láti ilé-iṣẹ́ igbá-kejì Ààrẹ sọ pé “Igbá-kejì Ààrẹ ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Yẹmí Ọ̀ṣínbájò yóò kọ́kọ́ ṣe ìpàdé pẹ̀lú ìgbìmọ̀ aláṣẹ lórí ọ̀rọ̀ tó jẹ mọ́ ti ilẹ̀ òkèèrè lọ́jọ́ Ajé ní New York, kí ó tó máa ṣèpàdé pẹ̀lú igbá-kejì Ààrẹ orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà ní Washington DC ní ọjọ́ Ọjọ́rú.

translation.en: “In his meeting with his American counterpart, VP Osinbajo would be discussing matters of mutual interests between Nigeria and the US, while he would be speaking on Nigeria’s economic prospects and other related matters in his meeting with the Council on Foreign Relations.”
translation.yo: “Lára nǹkan tí igbá-kejì Ààrẹ, Yẹmí Ọ̀ṣínbájò yóò máa bá akẹgbẹ́ rẹ̀ jíròrò ni lórí bí ìdàgbàsókè yóò ṣe túbọ̀ máa gbilẹ̀ sí i lórí ìbáṣẹpọ̀ t’ó wà láàárín orílẹ̀-èdè méjèèjì, bákan náà, ni igbákejì Ààrẹ Ọ̀ṣínbájò yóò tún máa sọ̀rọ̀ lórí ètò ọ̀rọ̀ ajé.

translation.en: The Vice President left for the US on Saturday afternoon and is expected back in Abuja on Thursday.
translation.yo: "Igbákejì Ààrẹ fi ìlú sílẹ̀ ní ọ̀sán ọjọ́ Àbámẹ́ta, ìrètí wa pé yóò padà sí Àbújá ní ọjọ́ Ọjọ́bọ̀.

translation.en: ---Muhammad-Bande becomes UN General Assembly President
translation.yo: ---Muhammad-Bande di Ààrẹ Àpérò Àjọ UN

translation.en: Nigeria’s Permanent Representative to the United Nations, Ambassador Tijjani Muhammad-Bande has emerged President of the 74th UN General Assembly.
translation.yo: Aṣojú orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà fún Àjọ Ìṣòkan Àgbáyé (United Nations) Tijjani Muhammad-Bande ni ó ti jáwé olúborí gẹ́gẹ́ bí Ààrẹ kẹrìnléláàádọ́rin Àpérò Àjọ Ìṣòkan Àgbáyé.

translation.en: Muhammad-Bande, the sole candidate for the position, was elected through acclamation at the 87th plenary meeting of the Assembly in New York on Tuesday, June 4.
translation.yo: Muhammad-Bande, nìkan l’ó díje fún ipò yìí, a dìbò yàn án nípasẹ̀ pípa ohùn pọ̀ lásìkò ìpàdé àpérò àjọ àgbáyé kẹ́tàdínláàdọ́rùn-ún t’ó wáyé ni New York lọ́jọ́ Ìṣẹ́gun, ọjọ́ kẹrin oṣù kẹfà.

translation.en: He is the second Nigerian to hold the office after Joseph Garba, a retired military officer and diplomat, who led the organ between 1989 and 1990.
translation.yo: Òun ni yóò jẹ́ ọmọ Nàìjíríà kejì tí yóò di ipò náà mú lẹ́yìn tí ajagun fẹ̀yìn tì Joseph Garba tí ó jẹ́ aṣojú tẹ́lẹ̀ rí àti ọgbọ́n òṣèlú, ẹni tí ó darí ikọ̀ náà láàárín ọdún 1980 sí 1990.

translation.en: He will be inaugurated in September 2019.
translation.yo: Oṣù Kesan-an ọdún 2019 ni ó bẹ̀rẹ̀ iṣẹ́.

translation.en: ---Nigerians in diaspora to advocate for diaspora voting
translation.yo: ---Awon ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ní ẹ̀yìn odi ń ṣ’alágbàáwí fún ìdìbò láti ìlú òkèèrè.

translation.en: Nigerians in the diaspora have been urged to advocate for the implementation of a law to allow for diaspora voting.
translation.yo: Wọ́n ti rọ gbogbo àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà tó ń gbé ní ìlú òkèèrè láti ṣe àgbáwí fún òfin tí yóò gbà wọ́n láàyè láti máa dìbò lásìkò ètò ìdìbò níbikíbi lẹ́yìn odi.

translation.en: The Chairman, Diasporas Commission in Nigeria and the Senior Special Adviser to President Muhammad Buhari, Abike Dabiri-Erewa, made the call at a cocktail with a delegation of APC Diaspora members, in Abuja, Nigeria.
translation.yo: Alága, Àjọ Àwọn Ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà nílẹ̀ òkèèrè, tí ó tún jé Olùdámọ̀ràn Pàtàkì fún Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari, Àbíkẹ́ Dábírí-Erewa, l’ó pe ìpè yìí lásìkò àpèjẹ tí wọ́n ṣe fún àwọn aṣojú ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ APC t’ó ń gbé nílùú òkèèrè, ní ìlú Àbújá, orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: ” thank you so much for coming all the way home because you want to be part of President Buhari’s inauguration.
translation.yo: " ẹ ṣéun púpọ̀ tí ẹ wá sílé nítorí wí pé ẹ fẹ́ wá darapọ̀ mọ́ ètò ìfinijoyè Ààrẹ Buhari.

translation.en: You all worked hard for him to succeed and by the grace of God and with determination, the President spoke to you yesterday, he is not going to let all of you down.
translation.yo: Gbogbo yín ni ẹ ti ṣe iṣẹ́ takuntakun fún àṣeyọrí rẹ̀, pẹ̀lú oore-ọ̀fẹ́ Ọlọ́run àti ìpinnu, Ààrẹ bá a yín sọ̀rọ̀ lánàá, kò ní já gbogbo yín kulẹ̀.

translation.en: ” I think one of the greatest goals we all must achieve is the Diaspora voting.
translation.yo: Ó ní " Oun tí mo lérò pé ìlépa tí ó ṣe Pàtàkì jù lọ fún wa ni àṣeyege ìdìbò láti ìlú òkèèrè.

translation.en: And we all have to work together to make it happen.” She said.
translation.yo: Gbogbo wa ni a ní lati ṣiṣẹ́ pọ̀ lati ṣe àṣeyọrí.

translation.en: “I am going to appeal to all of you, as the 9th Assembly comes in, let’s start immediately, let’s move to Parliaments and lobby them to ensure that Nigerians in diaspora can vote, so make it a priority”. She noted.
