translation.yo: Ó sọ “Mo fẹ́ rọ̀ gbogbo yín, bí Àpéjọ kẹsàn-án ṣe ń ilé wọlé, ẹ jẹ́ kí á bẹ̀rẹ̀ lẹ́sẹ̀kẹsẹ̀, kí á gbìyànjú láti lọ sí Ìgbìmọ̀-aṣòfin, k’á sì kó sí wọn lẹ́mìí láti rí i dájú wí pé àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ní ẹ̀yìn odi láti lè dìbò, nítorí náà ó ṣe kókó”.

translation.en: “now you have a Diaspora Commission, work with the Commission to ensure this happens, if smaller counties can do it, I see no reason why Nigerians can’t vote”. She noted.
translation.yo: Ó sọ “ní báyìí ẹ ti ní Àjọ Ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè nílẹ̀ òkèèrè, ẹ fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ pẹ̀lú Àjọ náà, kí èyí ba lè di mímúṣẹ, bí àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè kéréjekéréje bá leè ṣe é, mi kò rí ìdí kan tí àwọn Ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà kò leè dìbò”.

translation.en: ” it’s going to be a tough battle, but we need to ensure that Diaspora voting becomes a reality”. She emphasised.
translation.yo: Ó tẹnumọ " yóò jẹ́ ogun tí ó ṣòro láti jà, ṣùgbọ́n a gbọdọ̀ ṣe àrídájú wí pé ìdìbò lẹ́yìn odi di àmúṣẹ”.

translation.en: ---President Buhari heads to Saudi Arabia for OIC Summit
translation.yo: ---Ààrẹ Buhari forílé orílẹ̀-èdè Saudi Arabia fún Ìpàdé àpérò OIC.

translation.en: President Muhammadu Buhari has left Abuja to attend the Summit of the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation, OIC in Makkah, Saudi Arabia.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari ti fi Abuja sílẹ̀ láti lọ fún Ìpàdé àpérò Ẹgbẹ́ Àjùmọ̀ṣe àwọn Ẹlẹ́sìn Islam, OIC nílùú Makkah ní orílẹ̀-èdè Saudi Arabia.

translation.en: The 14th session of the Summit Conference of the OIC, scheduled to hold on Friday, May 31, will be hosted by King Salman bin Abdulaziz Al Saud and attended by Heads of State and Governments of Member States.
translation.yo: Ìpàdé àpérò gbogbogboò OIC ẹlẹ́ẹ̀kẹrìnlá irú rẹ̀, tí yóò wáyé lọ́jọ́ Ẹtì (Friday) ọjọ́kankàndínlọ́gbọ̀n, oṣù Karùn-ún, tí Ọba Salman Abdulaziz Al Saud yóò gbàlejò, tí àwọn Olórí orílẹ̀-èdè tí wọn jẹ́ ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ àjọ náà yóò lọ fún.

translation.en: According to the OIC secretariat, the summit to be convened under the theme, “Makkah al-Mukarramah Summit: Hand in Hand toward the Future,” seeks to develop a unified stance on events in the Islamic world.
translation.yo: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ilé-iṣẹ́ Akọ̀wé ẹgbẹ́ OIC ṣe fi léde, àkórí ìpàdé àpérò naa ni: “Àpérò Makkah al-Mukarramah: Ìfọwọ́sọwọ́pọ̀ fún ọjọ́-ọ̀la " láti mú ìdàgbàsókè bá ìṣọ̀kan àwọn ẹlẹ́ṣin Mùsùlùmí lágbàáyé.

translation.en: President Buhari is expected to address the forum and underscore the need for member countries to unite and work together to combat common challenges such as terrorism and violent extremism.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Buhari yóò sọ̀rọ̀ níbi ìpàdé náà àti ìmẹ́nuba ìdí tí àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè tí wọn jẹ́ ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ àjọ náà fi gbọdọ̀ fìmọ̀-ṣọ̀kan, láti ṣiṣẹ́ papọ̀ láti gbógun ti àwọn ìpèníjà bí i ìwà ìdúnkookò-mọ́ni àti làásìgbò àwọn alákata-kítí.

translation.en: ---Nigeria seeks U.S. assistance to tackle unemployment
translation.yo: ---Nàìjíríà rawọ́ ẹ̀bẹ̀ ìrànwọ́ sí U.S láti kojú ìṣòro àìríṣẹ́ṣe.

translation.en: Nigeria is seeking help from the United States of America to address the issue of unemployment in the country.
translation.yo: Orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ń béèrè fún ìrànlọ́wọ́ láti ọ̀dọ̀ orílẹ̀-èdè Ìpínlẹ̀ Ìṣọ̀kan Amẹ́ríkà láti gbógun ti ìṣòro àìríṣẹ́ lorílẹ̀-èdè náà.

translation.en: The Permanent Secretary, Federal Ministry of Labour and Employment, William Alo, says Nigeria needs assistance from the U.S in “tackling the unemployment challenges bedeviling the country.”
translation.yo: Akọ̀wé Àgbà fún Àjọ tó-ń-rí-sí ètò iṣẹ́ àti Ìgbanisíṣẹ́ (Federal Ministry of Labour and Employment), William Alo, sọ pé orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà nilo ìrànlọ́wọ́ láti ọ̀dọ̀ U.S láti “dojú ìjà kọ ìpèníjà àìríṣé tó ń kojú orílẹ̀-èdè náà."

translation.en: Receiving a delegation from the U.S. Department of Labour, led by Kurt Petermeyer, who is the Regional Administrator, Occupational Safety and Health Administration, Mr Alo said that assistance from the U. S. to upgrade the skill acquisition centres in the country would be of immense benefit to Nigeria, as it would enhance job creation.
translation.yo: Lásìkò t’ó ń gba ikọ̀ Èka ilé-iṣé ètò iṣẹ́ láti orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà, tí Kurt Petermeyer, ẹni tí ó jẹ́ Alábòójútó Èka Ìṣàkóso Ètò ààbò àtì Ìlera ṣe adarí, ọ̀gbẹ́ni Alo sọ pé ìrànlọ́wọ́ láti ọ̀dọ̀ U.S. láti mú àwọn ibi ìkọ́ni ní ọgbọ́n ìmọ̀ọ̀ṣe yóò ṣe ànfààní ribiribi fún orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà, ní ti ìmúdára ìpèsè iṣẹ́.

translation.en: ---President Buhari continues religious obligation in Makkah
translation.yo: ---Ààrẹ Buhari tẹ̀síwájú nínú ètò ìlànà ẹ̀sìn ní Makkah

translation.en: President Muhammadu Buhari arrived in Makkah, Saudi Arabia, from the city of Madinah where he began the initial leg of his Umrah engagements in the Kingdom.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari dé sí Makkah, ní Saudi Arabia, láti ìlú Madinah níbi tí ó ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ ìgbésẹ̀ tí ó ṣíwájú iṣẹ́ Umrah ní Ilẹ̀-ọba náà.

translation.en: After the evening prayer in the Holy Prophet’s Mosque, the President was ushered to the grave of Prophet Mohammed where he said prayers for the nation, his family and himself.
translation.yo: Lẹ́yìn àdúrà àṣálẹ́ ní Mọ́sálásí Òjíṣẹ́ ńlá, a mú Ààrẹ lọ sí ibojì òjíṣẹ́ ńlá Mohammed níbití ó ti gbàdúrà fún orílẹ̀ èdè, ẹbí rẹ̀ àti òun fúnra rẹ̀.

translation.en: He was seen off at the Prince Mohammed Bin Abdulaziz Madina International Airport by the Governor of the Madinah Province, Prince Faisal Bin Salman Bin Abdulaziz Al-Saud.
translation.yo: Gómìnà ẹkùn Madinah Prince Khalid Bin Faisal Al-Saud, sin ààrẹ jáde ní Pápákọ̀ Òfuurufú tí Prince Mohammed Bin Abdulaziz Madina International Airport.

translation.en: The President was welcomed at Makkah by the Regional Governor, Prince Khalid Bin Faisal Al-Saud.
translation.yo: Gómìnà agbègbè Makkah, Prince Khalid Bin Faisal Al-Saud ni ó kí Ààrẹ káàbọ̀ ní Makkah.

translation.en: Also at hand to receive him were the Nigerian Ambassador to Saudi Arabia, Justice Isa Dodo (rtd), the Director General of the National Intelligence Agency, Ambassador Ahmed Rufa’i Abubakar and officials of the Nigerian Consulate in Jeddah.
translation.yo: Bákannáà lára àwọn t’ó wá láti tẹ́wọ́gba Ààrẹ ni Aṣojú orílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà ní Saudi Arabia, Onídájọ́ tóti fẹ̀yìntì Isa Dodo, ọ̀gá àgbà pátá fún Àjọ Ọ̀tẹlẹ̀múyẹ́, Aṣojú Ahmed Rufa’i Abubakar àti àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ Aṣojú ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdè Nigeria ní Jeddah.

translation.en: After the reception, he immediately went ahead to commence the Umrah rites Friday evening.
translation.yo: Lẹ́yìn ìgbàlejò, lógán ni ó bẹ̀rẹ̀ iṣẹ́ Umrah ní àṣálẹ́ ọjọ́ ẹtì.

translation.en: ---President Buhari will be in Saudi Arabia for Umrah rites.
translation.yo: ---Ààrẹ Buhari yóò wà ní Saudi Arabia láti ṣe àwọn ìlànà-ẹ̀sìn ti Umrah.

translation.en: President of Nigeria Muhammadu Buhari has received a letter of invitation from the King of Saudi Arabia, Salman Bin Abdulaziz, for Umrah rites (lesser pilgrimage) in that nation.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà Muhammadu Buhari ti gba ìwé ìpè láti ọ̀dọ̀ Ọba ti Saudi Arabia, Salman Bin Abdulaziz, láti wá ṣe àwọn ìlànà-ẹ̀sìn Umrah (ìrìnàjò ilẹ̀-mímọ́ kékeré) ní orílẹ̀-èdè náà.

translation.en: Part of those that will go with the President to Saudi Arabia are his special assistance, the President will land in Saudi Arabia on Thursday 16th of May.
translation.yo: Lára àwọn ti yóò tẹ̀lé Ààrẹ lọ sí orílẹ̀-èdè Saudi Arabia ni àwọn olùrànlọ́wọ́ rẹ̀ pàtàkì, Ààrẹ yóò gúnlẹ̀ sí orílẹ̀-èdè Saudi Arabia ní ọjọ́ Ọjọ́bọ̀, ọjọ́ kẹrìndínlógún, oṣù Karùn-ún.

translation.en: ---Nigeria, Angola to strengthen sub-regional security
translation.yo: ---Orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà àti Angola yóò fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ láti mú ètò ààbò agbègbè-ságbègbè gbópọn sí i.

translation.en: Nigeria and Republic of Angola have agreed to work together to enhance peace, stability and security in Africa particularly in the West and Central African region.
translation.yo: Orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà àti Angola yóò fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ láti jọ mú kí ètò àlàáfíà ó ga sí i, ìdúróṣinṣin àti ètò ààbò ni ẹ̀kùn ilẹ̀-Adúláwọ̀ papàá jù lọ ní Ìwọ̀-oòrùn àti agbègbè Àárín-gbùngbùn ilẹ̀-Adúláwọ̀.

translation.en: The two countries agreed on this in a communiqué issued at the end of a meeting between Foreign Affairs Minister, Geoffrey Onyeama and Angolan Minister of External Relations, Manuel Augusto, on Thursday in Abuja.
translation.yo: Orílẹ̀-èdè méjèèjì náà jọ t’ọwọ́bọ ìwé àdéhùn leyin ìpàdé kan láàárín Mínísítà tó ń rí sí ọ̀rọ̀ tó jẹ mọ́ ilẹ̀ òkèèrè, Geoffrey Onyeama àti Mínísítà fún Ìbáṣepọ̀ Orílẹ̀-èdè Òkèèrè ti Orílẹ̀-èdè Angola, Manuel Augusto, ni ọjọ́ Ọjọ́rú nílùú Àbújá.

translation.en: The communiqué was jointly signed by Augusto and Onyeama,
translation.yo: Augusto àti Onyeama ni wọ́n jọ tọwọ́bọ ìwé àdéhùn náà.

translation.en: The two countries stressed the need to deepen political, socio-economic and cultural collaboration in furtherance of the developmental agenda of both countries and the African continent.
translation.yo: Orílẹ̀-èdè méjèèjì náà jọ foríkorí lórí ọ̀nà tí wọn yóò gbà mú ètò ìṣèlú, àwùjọ àti ọrọ̀-ajé rinlẹ̀ àti àjọṣepọ̀ àṣà ní ìtẹ̀síwájú àgbéṣe ìdàgbàsókè orílẹ̀-èdè méjèèjì àti Ilẹ̀-Adúláwọ̀ náà.

translation.en: Both countries acknowledged the global economic crisis, the challenges of climate change and terrorism.
translation.yo: Àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè méjèèjì ti gba àwọn wàhálà, àwọn ìpèníjà ìyípadà ojú-ọjọ́ àti ìwà ìpànìyàn.

translation.en: They agreed on the imperative for concerted collective action to combat effectively, all threats to the sustainable development of the two countries and the African continent.
translation.yo: Wọ́n pinnu lórí kókó àjọṣepọ̀ ìgbésẹ̀ láti gbógunti, gbogbo ìrókẹ́kẹ́ ìmúró ìdàgbàsókè àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè méjèèjì àti Ilẹ̀-Adúláwọ̀.

translation.en: The two countries agreed to leverage on the bilateral relations between them and intensify collaboration towards enhancing the level of peace, stability and security of the subregions.
translation.yo: Àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè méjèèjì náà yóò tún jọ máa jíròrò lórí pípèsè ètò àlàáfíà to yí dandé, ìdúróṣinṣin àti ètò ààbò ní agbègbè náà.

translation.en: ---Senate confirms Abike Dabiri-Erewa as pioneer Diaspora Commission boss
translation.yo: ---Ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin f’ọ̀ǹtẹ̀ lu Àbíké Dábírí-Erewa gẹ́gẹ́ bí adarí Àjọ Ẹ̀yìn odi

translation.en: The Nigerian Senate has confirmed the appointment of Abike Dabiri-Erewa as the pioneer Chairman/Chief Executive of the Nigerians in Diaspora Commission following her nomination by President Muhammadu Buhari.
translation.yo: Ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin ti f’ọ̀ǹtẹ̀ lu ìpinnu Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari láti fi Àbíkẹ́ Dábírí-Erewa ṣe Ọ̀gá-àgbà/Alága Àjọ Ọ̀rọ̀-tó-jẹ-mọ́-ilẹ̀-òkèèrè pàápàá jùlọ ọ̀rọ̀ t’ó bá kan ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà nílẹ̀ òkèèrè.

translation.en: Mrs. Dabiri-Erewa, a former member of the House of Representatives, is presently the Senior Special Assistant on Foreign Affairs and Diaspora to President Buhari.
translation.yo: Ìyáàfin Dábírí-Erewa, t’ó jẹ ọmọ ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣojú tẹ́lẹ̀rí, ni Olùrànlọ́wọ́ Pàtàkì lórí ọ̀rọ̀ tó jẹ mọ́ ilẹ̀ òkèèrè fún Ààrẹ Buhari lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́.

translation.en: “The committee, after a critical scrutiny of the curriculum vitae and other accompanying documents of the nominee, and having been satisfied about her integrity, exposure, suitability, competence and experience in politics and public service, found Hon. Abike Dabiri-Erewa as fit and proper person for appointment as chairman/chief executive officer of the Nigerians in Diaspora Commission”, she said.
translation.yo: Ó ní “lẹ́yìn tí ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin ti parí ìwádìí fínnífínní wọn tán lórí ìwé ẹ̀rí ẹ̀kọ́-àtiṣẹ́ àti àwọn ìwé mìíràn nípa àwọn ẹni-a-yàn, tí òtítọ́ rẹ̀, ìríta, ìbámu, ìkájú-òṣùwọ̀n àti ìrírí rẹ̀ nínú ètò òṣèlú àti iṣẹ́ ìlú sì tẹ́ wọn lọ́rùn, ìgbìmọ̀ náà rí Ẹni-ọ̀wọ̀ Àbíkẹ́ Dábírí Erewa bí ẹni tí ó dántọ́ àti ẹni tí ipò alága/ọ̀gá-àgbà yányán Àjọ ọ̀rọ̀ ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ni ilẹ̀ òkèèrè".

translation.en: She said Dabiri-Erewa was qualified to occupy the position having been screened by the committee in accordance with the provisions of the nation’s Constitution.
translation.yo: Ó ní pé Dábírí-Erewa yege láti bọ́ sí ipò náà lẹ́yìn tí àwọn ìgbìmọ̀ ti ṣe àyẹ̀wò fínnífínní ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú àlàálẹ̀ òfin orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: Senator Oko added that the appointee holds Bachelor of Arts (English) in 1983; post graduate degree (Mass Communication) in 1986 while she also obtained a professional certificate from John Kennedy School of Government, Harvard University, United States in June 2002.
translation.yo: Aṣòfin Oko ṣ’àfikún wí pé ẹni-a-fà-sílẹ̀ náà gba ìmọ̀ ìjìnlẹ̀ nínú Ọnà (èdè Gẹ̀ẹ́sì) lọ́dún 1983; ó tẹ̀síwájú nínú ẹ̀kọ́ ìmọ̀ ìjìnlẹ̀ láti tún gba oyè mìíràn nínú ẹ̀kọ́ Ìbáraẹnisọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́pọ̀ lọ́dún 1986, ó sì tún ní ìwé-ẹ̀rí akọ́ṣẹ́mọṣẹ láti Iléèwé ìmọ̀ ẹ̀kó Ìṣèjọba John Kennedy, ti Fáfit̀i Harvard, lórílẹ̀-èdè  United States, ní oṣù kẹfà Ọdún 2002.

translation.en: ---Cyclone slams Indian temple town after people flee homes
translation.yo: ---Ìjì-líle kọlu ìlú ilé-ìsìn l’órílé-ẹ̀dè India lẹ́yìn tí ọ̀pọ̀ ènìyàn sá kúrò níbùgbé wọn

translation.en: A cyclone barrelled into eastern India on Friday, bringing down trees and power lines and “extensively” damaging the tourist town of Puri, but there were no early reports of casualties with a million people evacuated before it made landfall.
translation.yo: Ọ̀pọ̀ ènìyàn ni ó ti pàdánù ibùgbé wọn, tí àwọn míìrán sì pàdánù ohun ìní wọn ní agbègbè Puri, lórílé-èdè India látàrí ìṣèlè ìjì líle tí ó wáyé lọ́jó Ẹtì, Iròyìn fi múlẹ̀ pé, ìjì líle náà ba àwọn ohun amáyéderùn jẹ́ púpọ̀ bíi òpó iná mọ̀nà-mọ́ná, òpó ẹ̀rọ ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ abbl.

translation.en: Tropical Cyclone Fani, the strongest to hit India in five years, spent days building up power in the northern reaches of the Bay of Bengal before it struck the coast of the state of Odisha at around 8 a.m.
translation.yo: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí àjọ tó ń mójútó ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ pàjáwìrì, wọ́n ní ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìjì líle náà kọ́kọ́ ṣọṣẹ́ ní ẹ̀ka ìlà oòrùn ìlú Bengal kí ó tó sún lọ sí Ìpínlẹ̀ Odisha ní aago mẹ́jọ òwúrọ̀.

translation.en: ---One dead, several injured in Venezuela crisis
translation.yo: ---Ọ̀pọ̀ farapa yánayàna, ẹnìkan pàdánù ẹ̀mí rẹ̀ nínú ìkọlù Venezuela.

translation.en: A woman was shot dead and dozens injured in the Venezuelan capital Caracas on Wednesday, in clashes between opposition supporters and pro-government forces.
translation.yo: Nínú ìkọlù tí ó wáyé lórílẹ̀-èdè Venezuela láàárín ọmọ-ogun ìjọba orílè-èdè náà àti àwọn olólùfẹ́ ẹgbẹ́ òṣèlú alátakò ní ọjọ́ Ọjọ́rú, ìròyìn fi múlẹ̀ pé ọmọbìnrin kan pàdánù ẹ̀mí rẹ̀ látàrí ọta ìbọn tí ó fara gbà, tí ọ̀pọ̀ ènìyàn sì farapa yánayàna.

translation.en: Opposition leader Juan Guaidó called for those responsible for the death of a 27-year-old woman to be found.
translation.yo: Adarí ẹgbẹ́ òṣèlú alátakò ọ̀hún, Juan Guaidó ti pè láti ṣàwárí àwọn tí ó bá wà nídìí ikú ọmọbìnrin ọmọ ọdún mẹ́tàdínlọ́gbọ̀n náà.

translation.en: He urged public employees to act on Thursday, saying the stoppages would lead to a general strike.
translation.yo: Ó wá rọ àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ní ọjọ́ Ọjọ́bọ̀ láti wá fi èhónú wọn hàn, eléyìí tí ó sì le è ṣ’okùnfà ìdásílẹ̀.

translation.en: Mr Guaidó in January declared himself Venezuela’s interim leader, and he has been recognised by more than 50 countries including the US, UK and most Latin America nations.
translation.yo: Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Guaidó kéde ara rẹ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bi olùdarí ìjọba orílè-èdè Venezuela lóṣù Kinní ọdún tí a wà yìí, bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni ọ̀pọ̀ orílè-èdè tí ó làmìi-laaka lágbàáyé bí ilẹ̀ Amẹ́ríkà, UK abbl ṣàtilẹ́yìn fún láti túkọ̀ orílè-èdè náà.

translation.en: The president dismissed suggestions he had been ready to flee the country and accused the US of directing an attempted coup. Those involved would be punished, he said.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ bẹnu àtẹ lu ìròyìn àhẹ́sọ kan tí ó sọ pé Òun fẹ́ fi orílè-èdè òun sílẹ̀, bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni ó tún fẹ̀sùn kan orílè-èdè Amẹ́ríkà fún dídá ọ̀rọ̀ náà lọ́nà tí ò tọ̀.

translation.en: ---Nigeria-UK Economic Development Forum holds in Abuja
translation.yo: ---Ìpàdé àpérò lórí ìdàgbàsókè ètò ọrọ̀-ajé láàárín orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà-UK wáyé nílùú Àbújá.

translation.en: Nigeria’s Vice President, Professor Yemi Osinbajo, says investor-interest is on the rise in Nigeria now.
translation.yo: Igbákejì Ààrẹ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà, Ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Yẹmí Òsínbàjò, ti ní púpọ̀ nínú àwọn oníṣòwò l’ó ti nífẹ̀ẹ́ láti dá ètò okòòwò sílẹ̀ lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà báyìí.

translation.en: The Vice President disclosed this when he spoke at the first Nigeria-UK Economic Development Forum (EDF), hosted by the Federal Government at the Presidential Villa, Abuja.
translation.yo: Igbákejì Ààrẹ sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lásìkò ìpàdé àpérò lórí ètò ọrọ̀ ajé láàárín orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà àti UK, ní èyí tí ó jẹ́ àkọ́kọ́ irú rẹ̀ tí ó wáyé ní Ilé Agbára Ààrẹ, nílùú Àbújá.

translation.en: The Economic Development Forum was signed in August 2018 by President Muhammadu Buhari and Prime Minister Theresa May in London as a platform to foster economic and development ties between Nigeria and the United Kingdom.
translation.yo: Oṣù kéje ọdún 2018 ni Ààrẹ  Muhammadu Buhari àti olùdarí ìjọba nílùú London, Theresa May, tọwọ́bọ ìwé àdéhùn lásìkò Ìpàdé àpérò lórí ìdàgbàsókè ètò ọrọ̀-ajé láàárín orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà àti orílẹ̀-èdè United Kingdom.

translation.en: According to the Vice President, “we have seen increased investor interest in Nigeria between 2017 and 2018.
translation.yo: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí Igbákejì Ààrẹ ṣe sọ, “àwọn oníṣòwò tí wọ́n nífẹ̀ẹ́ láti dá okòòwò wọn sílẹ̀ lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà tún ti pọ̀ si báyìí láàárín ọdún 2017 si ọdún 2018.

translation.en: ---President Buhari directs AGF to intervene in Zainab’s case
translation.yo: ---Ààrẹ Buhari p’àṣẹ fún Adájọ́ Àgbà orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà láti dá sí ọ̀ràn Zainab

translation.en: President Muhammadu Buhari has directed Mr Abubakar Malami, the Attorney General of the Federation and Minister of Justice to immediately intervene in the case of Zainab Aliyu, the student, incriminated in drug related matters and being detained by the Saudi Arabia authorities.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari ti p’àṣẹ fún Adájọ́ Àgbà orílẹ̀-èdè àti Mínísítà fún Ètò ìdájọ́ ọ̀gbẹ́ni Abubakar Malami, láti wá wọ̀rọ̀kọ̀ fi ṣàdá nípa gbígbé ìgbésẹ̀ lórí bí wọn yóò ṣe yọ arábìnrin Zainab Aliyu, tó jẹ́ akẹ́kọ̀ọ́, tí àwọn ọ̀daràn kan kó sínú wàhálà nípa gbígbé oògùn olóró sínú ẹrù rẹ̀, tí ó sì wà ní ìgbèkùn ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè Saudi Arabia.

translation.en: In a statement issued in Abuja on Monday by Abdur-Rahman Balogun, Media aide to Hon. Abike Dabiri-Erewa, SSA to the President on Diaspora Affairs said that the President gave the directive two weeks ago when the matter was brought to his attention.
translation.yo: Nínú àtẹ̀jáde kan tí Abdur-Rahman Balógun, olùrànlọ́wọ́ lórí Ìròyìn fún Ẹni-ọ̀wọ̀ Àbíkẹ́ Dábírí, Olùdámọ̀ràn Pàtàkì Àgbà fún Ààrẹ lórí Ọ̀rọ̀ ọmọ Nàìjíríà ní ilẹ̀ òkèèrè, gbé jáde nílùú Àbújá sọ wí pé Ààrẹ pa àṣẹ náà ní ọ̀sẹ̀ méjì sẹ́yìn nígbàtí ọ̀ràn náà tó òun létí.

translation.en: “President Muhammadu Buhari gave the directive immediately the matter was brought to his attention about two weeks ago.
translation.yo: “Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari pa àṣẹ náà níkété tí ó gbọ́ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ọ̀hún ní ọ̀sẹ̀ méjì sẹ́yìn.

translation.en: “My office has been working with the AGF as well as the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in that regard”.
translation.yo: “Ibi-iṣẹ́ mi ti ń ṣiṣẹ́ pẹ̀lú Adájọ́ Àgbà orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà àti Àjọ t’ó ń rí sí ọ̀rọ̀ t’ó jẹmọ́ ti ilẹ̀ òkèèrè lórí ọ̀rọ̀ náà”.

translation.en: The Presidential aide assured that progress was being made in Zainab case, along with two others in similar circumstances in Saudi Arabia.
translation.yo: Olùrànlọ́wọ́ Ààrẹ fi dánilójú wí pé iṣẹ́ ń tẹ̀síwájú nínú ọ̀ràn Zainab, pẹ̀lú àwọn méjì mìíràn tí ó wà nínú ipò kan náà ní ilẹ̀ Saudi Arabia.

translation.en: Dabiri Erewa said that Zainab, though detained, has not been put on trial by the Saudi Arabia government. And with the hard evidence that those who implicated her have been arrested, a strong legal case is being made to the Saudi authorities
translation.yo: Dábírí-Erewa sọ wí pé, lóòótọ́ Zainub wà ní àtìmọ́lé, ìjọba ilẹ̀ Saudi Arabia kò tíì fi ojú rẹ̀ ba ilé ẹjọ́. Tí ó sì le láti gba ẹ̀rí wí pé wọ́n ti mú àwọn tí wọ́n kó bá a gbọ́, ẹjọ́ tí ó lágbára ni a fẹ́ pe àwọn aláṣẹ Saudi.

translation.en: JAMB conducts foreign based exams in seven countries
translation.yo: Àjọ JAMB ṣe ìdánwò ní orílẹ̀-èdè méje ní ìlú òkèèrè.

translation.en: The Joint Admissions and Matriculation Board, JAMB has conducted a foreign based examination for Nigerian candidates abroad and citizens of other nationalities who wants to study in Nigeria.
translation.yo: Àjọ tó ń mójútó ìdánwò fún àwọn t’ó fẹ́ wọ fáfitì, ilé-ẹ̀kọ́ gbogbonìṣe àti ilé-ẹ̀kọ́ àwọn olùkọ́ l’órílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ti ṣe ìdánwò fún àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè yìí tó wà nílùú òkèèrè àti àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè mìíràn tí wọ́n fẹ́ tẹ̀síwájú nípa ẹ̀kọ́ wọn ní orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: The Board said the examination was conducted to give equal opportunity to Nigerians in Diaspora and foreigners who are desirous of acquiring qualitative Tertiary education in Nigeria.
translation.yo: Ìgbìmọ̀ náà ní àwọn ṣètò ìdánwò yìí láti jẹ́ kí gbogbo àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà t’ó wà nílẹ̀ òkèèrè àti àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè mìíràn tó nífẹ̀ẹ́ láti kẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ní Ilẹ́ẹ̀kọ́-gíga t’ó yé kooro l’órílẹ̀ èdè Nàìjíríà ní àǹfààní kan náà.

translation.en: The examination was conducted in Ghana, United Kingdom, Cameroon, Benin Republic, Cöte d’Ivoire South Africa and Kingdom of Saudi Arabia.
translation.yo: Àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè tí àjọ náà ti ṣe ìdánwò náà ní orílẹ̀-èdè Ghana, United Kingdom, Cameroon, Benin Republic, Cöte d’Ivoire, South Africa àti Ilẹ̀-oba Saudi Arabia.

translation.en: The board made this known in its weekly bulletin, released to the media, by its Head of Media, Dr Fabian Benjamin.
translation.yo: Àjọ náà sọ èyí di mímọ̀ nínú àtẹ̀jáde kan tí Alukoro àjọ náà, Ọ̀mọ̀wé Fabian Benjamin gbé jáde.

translation.en: According to the board, “Over 200 candidates took the UTME examination that held simultaneously on Saturday, 27th April, 2019 in all the aforementioned centres”
translation.yo: Àjọ náà ní “Ó lé ní igba àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ t’ó ṣe ìdánwò UTME tí ó wáyé nígbàkanáà ní ọjọ́ Àbámẹ́ta, ọjọ́ kẹ́tàdínlọ́gbọ̀n, oṣù kẹ́rin, ọdún, 2019 ní àwọn ibi gbogbo tí a dárúkọ tẹ́lẹ̀.

translation.en: “The board wishes to state emphatically that the results of the 2019 UTME have not been released.”
translation.yo: Àjọ náà tún tẹnpẹlẹ mọ́ ọ̀rọ̀ rẹ̀ pé, èsì ìdánwò UTME ti ọdún 2019 kò tíì jáde.

translation.en: It urged the public, particularly parents and candidates, to be wary of dubious elements and disregard any overtures made by anybody touting their power or influence to inflate any candidate’s score.
translation.yo: "Ó wá rọ àwọn ènìyàn pàápàá jùlọ àwọn òbí àti àkẹ́kọ̀ọ́ náà pé kí wọ́n ṣọ́ra fún àwọn oníjìbìtì, tí wọn á sọ pé wọ́n fẹ́ lo ọ̀nà ẹ̀bùrú láti ràn wọ́n lọ́wọ́ fún èsì ìdánwò tí wọ́n ṣe.

translation.en: “The Board will make it public when the results are ready” the board said.
translation.yo: Àjọ náà tún sọ pé “Àjọ náà yóò polongo èsì ìdánwò náà, nígbà tí ó bá jáde

translation.en: Security operatives have picked up some of these nefarious characters and they are on the trail of others still at large,” it added.
translation.yo: "Ọwọ́ àwọn agbófinro ti tẹ àwọn ọ̀daràn kan, ní èyí tí wọ́n ṣì ń wá àwọn yòókù

translation.en: US express satisfaction in partnership with Nigeria to end Malaria
translation.yo: Amẹ́ríkà kan sáárá sí fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ pẹ̀lú orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà láti fòpin sí àìsàn ibà.

translation.en: The United States government says it is satisfied with its partnership with Nigeria and the support towards the fight against Malaria.
translation.yo: Ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà ti fi ìdùnnú hàn bí wọ́n ṣe fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ àti láti ṣàtìlẹyìn fún orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà nípá gbígbógun ti àìsàn ibà.

translation.en: The US Ambassador to Nigeria, W. Stuart Symington stated this in a statement to mark World Malaria day with the theme: ‘‘Zero Malaria Starts with Me.”
translation.yo: Aṣojú orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà sí orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà, W. Stuart Symington l’ó sọ̀rọ̀ yìí l’ásìkò ayẹyẹ láti fi sàmì àyájọ́ Ọjọ́ Àìsán ibà Lágbàáyé tí wọ́n pe àkórí rẹ̀ ní: “Láti gbógun ti àìsàn ibà bẹ̀rẹ̀ láti ọ̀dọ̀ mi".

translation.en: Ambassador Symington also saluted all Nigeria’s health champions ranging from health workers to mothers, pharmacists to drivers, journalists to researchers, teachers to warehouse managers and all those working to end malaria.
translation.yo: Aṣojú Symington wá gbóṣùbà fún àwọn àjọ elétò ìlera orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà fún akitiyan wọn láti orí àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ elétò ìlera, dé orí àwọn ìyá, àwọn apòògùn òyìnbó, awakọ̀, akọ̀ròyìn, àwọn oníwàdìí, olùkọ́ dé orí àwọn alákòóso ilé-ìkónnkanpamọ́ àti gbogbo àwọn tó kó ipa pàtàkì láti gbógun ti àìsàn ibà lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: Ambassador Symington noted that as a global community, they have achieved remarkable success towards the elimination of the disease.
translation.yo: Aṣojú Symington sọ pé gẹ́gẹ́ bí àwùjọ àgbáyé, wọ́n ti ṣe àṣeyọrí nípasẹ̀ ìgbógunti àrùn náà.

translation.en: ---President Buhari demands more respect for farmers
translation.yo: ---Ààrẹ Buhari fẹ́ ìmóríyá fún àwọn àgbẹ̀.

translation.en: President Muhammadu Buhari says a top priority of his administration is to ensure that the efforts of hardworking Nigerian farmers are respected.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari ti ní ṣíṣe ìmóríyá fún àwọn àgbẹ̀ lórílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ni yóò jẹ́ ohun akọ́kọ́ tí ó wà lọ́kàn òun láti ṣe nínú ìjọba rẹ̀.

translation.en: The President said it is in this regard that he directed the Ministry of Agriculture and the Central Bank of Nigeria to bypass the knotty issue of collateral which he described as “a terrible colonial legacy,” so that farmers will get easy access to capital.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ sọ pé òun ti pàsẹ fún Àjọ tó ń mójútó Iṣẹ́ Ọ̀gbìn àti Ilé-Ìfowópamọ́ tí Ijọba Orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà láti yọ àwọn ìṣòro àti ìdíwọ́ tí kò jẹ́ kí àwọn àgbè rí owó yá láti fi ṣe iṣẹ́ ọ̀gbìn kúrò níbẹ̀, ní èyí tí ó pè ní “Ìwà àmúnisìn burúkú".

translation.en: End to Smuggling
translation.yo: Fífòpin sí ìwà fàyàwọ́

translation.en: President Buhari also identified smuggling as a threat to domestic agricultural production and processing, and promised to continue to fight the menace with all means available to government.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Buhari wá bẹnu àtẹ́ lu ìwà fàyàwọ́ tí ó ń ṣàkóbá fún ohun ọ̀gbìn àti iṣẹ́ àgbẹ̀ lórílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà, ó sì ṣèlérí pé òun kò ní káàárẹ̀ láti túbọ̀ máa gbógun ti ìwà burúkú yìí pẹ̀lú gbogbo agbára tó bá wà ní ìkáwọ́ òun.

translation.en: The President gave the assurance that in addition to the focus of his administration on security, economy and the war against corruption, the new administration in his second term will pay greater attention to education and health.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ ni ìjọba òun yóò túbò máa sa ipá rẹ̀ lórí ètò ààbò, ìdàgbàsókè ètò ọrọ̀-ajé àti gbígbógun ti ìwà ìbàjẹ́, sáà tuntun ìjọba òun yóò tẹnpẹlẹ mọ́ ètò ẹ̀kọ́ àti ìlera.

translation.en: “I understand our problems. I am acutely aware of my duty to my God and country. I will continue to do my best,” he told the support group.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ sọ fún àwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ náà pé “Mo mọ ìsòro wa. Mo mọ ojúṣe mi sí Ọlọ́run àti orílẹ̀-èdè mi. N ó máa tẹ̀síwájú láti sa ipá mi.”

translation.en: Earlier, the leader of the group, which is mostly made up of scholars and professionals, Dr Arabo Ibrahim Bayo, said they came together on the basis of a shared passion for the country’s development, and in the firm belief that President Buhari represents the best in terms of leadership that Nigeria can offer.
translation.yo: "Ṣáájú èyí ni adarí ikọ̀ náà, Ọ̀mọ̀wé Arabo Ibrahim Báyọ̀, ní àwọ́n wá sí orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà nítorí ìfẹ́ tí àwọn ní sí ìdàgbàsókè orílẹ̀-èdè yìí àti ìgbàgbọ́ tí wọ́n ní sí ìṣèjọba Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari.

translation.en: The group further pledged support to the President for a formidable and enduring legacy.
translation.yo: Àwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ náà wá ṣèlérí àtìlẹ̀yìn wọn fún Ààrẹ láti ṣe ohun málegbàgbé lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: ---Nigeria calls for safer digital world
translation.yo: ---Orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà pè fún ètó ààbò lórí ìmọ̀ ẹ̀rọ ìgbàlódé.

translation.en: President Muhammadu Buhari has called on world leaders to come up with proposals to create a digital world that is accessible, inclusive and safe to all.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà Muhammadu Buhari ti rọ àwọn adaŕi orílè èdè àgbáyé láti wá wọ̀rọ̀kọ̀ fi ṣàdá lórí bí ìmọ̀ ẹ̀rọ ìgbàlódé yóò ṣe wà lárọ̀wọ́tó àwọn ènìyàn àti èyí tí ètò ààbò tó péye yóò tún wà níbẹ̀.

translation.en: In his keynote speech at the 2019 Annual Investment Meeting (AIM) in Dubai on Monday, President Buhari said a certain level of regulation was needed to preserve the integrity of the digital economy.
translation.yo: Nínú ọ̀rọ̀ rẹ̀ níbi Ìpàdé ètò Okoòwò ti ọdún 2019 (AIM) t’ó wáyé ní ìlú Dubai lọ́jọ́ Ajé, Ààrẹ ní ètò ìlànà gbọdò wà nípa èyí tí yóò máa dáàbò bo ìmọ̀ ẹ̀rọ ìgbàlódé lórí ètò ọrọ̀ ajé.

translation.en: The theme of the summit is: ‘Mapping the Future of Foreign Direct Investment: Enriching World Economies through Digital Globalization.’’
translation.yo: Àkórí ìpàdé àpérò náà ni: ‘Wíwá ọjọ́ iwájú tó dára fún ètò okoòwò: Mímú ìdàgbàsókè bá ètò okoòwò àgbáyé nípa lílo Ìmọ̀-ẹ̀rọ ìgbàlódé.

translation.en: Acknowledging that digital globalisation is transforming the world almost every day with innovations and transformative ideas, the Nigerian leader cautioned that the cyber world would remain a constant threat if left unregulated.
translation.yo: ’’Ààrẹ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ni pípèsè ètò ìlànà fún lílo ìmọ̀ ẹ̀ro ìgbàlódé nìkan ló lè dín wàhálà àti ìsòro tó máa ń wáyé nípa rẹ̀.

translation.en: The President decried the use of the cyberspace to manipulate elections, subvert the democratic rights of citizens as well as propagate violence.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ fi àìdunnú rẹ̀ hàn nípa bí wọ́n ṣe ń lo ìmò èrọ ìgbàlódé láti ṣe ayédùrú ètò ìdìbò, ni èyí tí ó tako ẹ̀tọ̀ ọmọnìyàn, tí ó sì tún máa ń dá rògbòdìyàn sílẹ́ láàrín ìlú.

translation.en: President Buhari, therefore, called for collective efforts led by both public and private sector leaders to address the emerging threats of digital globalisation.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Buhari, wá rọ àwọn adarí ilé-iṣẹ́ ìjọba àti ilé-iṣẹ́ aládàáni láti fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ láti wá ojútùú sí wàhálà àti ìsoro tó máa ń wáyé nípa lílo ìmọ̀ èrọ ìgbàlódé.

translation.en: ---Indonesia Landslides: at least 15 killed after year of disasters
translation.yo: ---ilẹ̀-rírì lórílè-èdè Indonesia: ó tó ènìyàn màrúndínlógún tí ó ti kú lẹ́yìn ọ̀pọ̀ ọdún ìjàmbá

translation.en: Indonesian rescue teams were searching for victims of a series of landslides that killed at least 15 people on New Year Day, officials said, after a year of natural disasters killed thousands.
translation.yo: Ikọ̀ aláàbò tó ń mójútò ìṣèlẹ̀ pàjáwìrì lórílé-èdé Indonesia ti ń wá àwọn ènìyàn tí ó fara káásà nínú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìjàmbá ilẹ̀ rírì tí ó gba ẹ̀mí ènìyàn màrúndínlógún lọ́jọ́ Ọdún Tuntun, lẹ́yìn irúfẹ́ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà tí ó wáyé lọ́dún kan ṣẹ́yìn ti o ṣekúpa ọ̀gọ̀rọ̀ ènìyàn.

translation.en: At least 20 people were missing after landslides during heavy rain buried 30 houses in Sukabumi regency, West Java.
translation.yo: Ókéré tán ogún ènìyàn ni ó pàdánù ẹ̀mí wọn sínú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ọ̀hún, bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni ilé ọgbọ̀n sì bá ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà lo nílùú Sukabumi.

translation.en: “Loose soil is a danger to rescue teams that are working in the field,” said disaster mitigation agency spokesman Sutopo Purwo Nugroho.
translation.yo: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí agbẹnusọ̀rọ̀ ikọ̀ aláàbò náà, Sutopo Purwo Nugroho ṣe sọ,“Ó le púpọ̀ fún àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ oníṣẹ̀lẹ̀ pàjáwìrì láti gba àwọn ènìyàn sílẹ̀ lásìkò ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ilè rírì.”

translation.en: Heavy rain had forced rescuers to suspend the search on Tuesday.
translation.yo: Wàyìí o, àrọ̀rọ̀ dá òjò tí ó rọ̀ lọ́jọ́ Ìṣégun ọ̀hún ni ó dènà iṣẹ́ àwọn aláàbó náà.

translation.en: Indonesia is a disaster-prone archipelago that in 2018 suffered its deadliest year in over a decade in a series of earthquakes and tsunamis in different regions killed more than 3,000 people.
translation.yo: Ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìjàm̀bá ilẹ̀ ríri jẹ́ ohun tí ó máa ń ṣẹlẹ̀ lọ́pọ̀lọpọ̀ lórílè-èdè Indonesia, eléyìí tí o sì ṣekúpa ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́ta ènìyàn ní àwọn agbègbè lóríṣiríṣi lọ́dún 2018.

translation.en: ---Korea donates $500,000 to displaced persons in Nigeria
translation.yo: ---Orílẹ̀-èdè Korea fún Nàìjíríà ni ẹ̀gbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ẹ̀ẹ́dẹ́gbẹ̀ta owó dọ́là.

translation.en: The United Nations World Food Programme, (WFP) has welcomed a contribution of 500,000 US Dollars from the Republic of Korea aimed at providing one month of food assistance for about 125,000 internally displaced persons in Borno, Adamawa and Yobe States, northeast Nigeria.
translation.yo: Ètò Oúnjẹ Àjọ Ìṣọ̀kan Àgbáyé Orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ti fi ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ẹ̀ẹ́dẹ́gbẹ̀ta dọ́là owó ilẹ̀ òkèèrè ran àwọn ènìyàn tí iye wọn dín ní ẹ̀ẹ́dẹ́gbéje ẹ̀gbẹ̀rún fún àwọn ìpínlẹ̀ Borno, Adamawa àti Yobe tí ikọ̀ ọlọ́tẹ̀ Boko Haram sọ di aláìnílé lórí.

translation.en: The Korean Ambassador to Nigeria Major General (Rtd) In-tae Lee, said Korean Government has been making efforts to address the needs of vulnerable people, which was why they are supporting internally displaced persons in Nigeria.
translation.yo: Aṣojú orílẹ̀-èdè Korea fún orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ajagun fẹ̀yìnti In-Tae Lee, ló sọ pé ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè Korea ti ń gbìyànjú láti wá ọ̀nà tí yóò gbé ṣèrànwó fún àwọn ènìyàn tí ikọ̀ ọmọ gun Boko Haram sọ di aláìnílé lórí.

translation.en: He said Korea stands ready to fight against malnutrition and poverty, joining hands with the people of Nigeria.
translation.yo: Ó ní ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè Korea yóò fọwọsowọ́pọ̀ pẹ̀lú ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà láti gbógun ti àìsàn ebi àti òṣì lórílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: The World Food Programme (WFP) Representative in Nigeria, Myrta Kaulard, applauded the gesture saying it would go a long way in sustaining the momentum of WFP’s response in Nigeria.
translation.yo: Aṣojú Àjọ Àgbáyé ní orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà, Myrta Kaulard wá gbósùbà fún orílẹ̀-èdè Korea fún ètò ìránwó tí wọ́n ṣe fún orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà, pé irú ètò báyìí yóò tún jẹ́ kí ìgbé ayé ìdẹ̀rùn bá àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: ---The Yoruba section of Voice of Nigeria (VON) started broadcasting in Abuja.
translation.yo: ---Èka èdè Yorùbá, Ohùn Nàìjíríà (VON) bẹ̀rẹ̀ ìgbòhùn sáfẹ́fẹ́ ní ìlú Àbújá.

translation.en: Voice of Nigeria says the Yoruba section has started broadcasting in Abuja.
translation.yo: Ohùn Nàìjíríà (Voice of Nigeria) ní ẹ̀ka èdè Yorùbá ti bẹ̀rẹ̀ ìgbóhùn sáfẹ́fẹ́ láti ìlú Àbújá.

translation.en: The director of the Yoruba section in Abuja Abiodun Popoola told people that a lot of programs have been specially arranged for the enjoyment of the loved once throughout the nation.
translation.yo: Adarí ẹ̀ka èdè Yorùbá ní ìlú Àbújá Abíọ́dún Pópóọlá sọ fún àwọn ènìyàn pé, ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ètò ni àwọ́n ti yà sọ́tọ̀ fún ìgbádùn àwọn olólùfẹ́ jákè-jádò àgbáyé.

translation.en: He continued that the interest of our listeners are paramount to us, this is the why the authority of the broadcasting of Nigeria, voice of Nigeria began broadcasting from Abuja.
translation.yo: Ó tẹ̀síwájú pé" Ìfẹ́ àwọn olùgbọ́ wa ló jẹ wá lógún, ìdí nìyí tí àwọn aláṣẹ Ohùn Nàìjíríà, Voice of Nigeria ṣe bẹ̀rẹ̀ ìgbóhùn sáfẹ́fẹ́ láti ìlú Àbújá.

translation.en: Likewise we have arrayed different programs for the enjoyment of our listeners most especially Africa.
translation.yo: Bákan náà, ni a ti ya àwọn ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ètò sílẹ̀ fún ìgbádùn àwọn tó ń gbọ́ wa, pàápàá jùlo ilẹ̀ Áfíríkà.

translation.en: “Ewe, who is the director of engineering in Yoruba section said as the yoruba section have started broadcasting from Abuja will make the listeners of Voice of Nigeria from abroad will hear them clearly.
translation.yo: "Ewe, tí ó jẹ́ adarí ìmọ̀ ẹ̀rọ lábẹ́ ẹ̀ka Yorùbá náà tún sọ pé bí ẹ̀ka èdè Yorùbá ṣe bẹ̀rẹ̀ ìgbóhùn sáfẹ́fẹ́ láti ìlú Àbújá jẹ́ ohun tí yóò tún jẹ́ kí àwọn olùgbọ Ohùn Nàìjíríà láti ilẹ̀ òkèèrè tún máa gbọ́ wọn yéké-yéké.

translation.en: He said nothing as good as making people listening to Voice of Nigeria happy to listen the more.
translation.yo: Ó ní kò sí ohun tó dára jùlọ pé kí inú àwọn ènìyàn tó ń gbọ́ wa láti ilé akéde dùn láti máa tẹ́tí sí wọn.

translation.en: Part of the workers that will partake in the programs are Mrs Aderonke Osundiya, Tobi Sangotola and Maryam Yusuf.
translation.yo: Lára àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ tí yóò máa kópa lórí ètò ọ̀hún náà ni ìyáàfin Adérónkẹ́ Ọ̀súndíyà, Tóbi Ṣàngótọ́lá àti Maryam Yusuf.

translation.en: Listen to Voice of Nigeria on 31m 969khz frequency from 11am to 11:45am and in the evening from 5:15pm to 5:30pm.
translation.yo: Ẹ ó máa gbọ́ Ohùn Nàíjíríà láti ìkànnì 31m 9690khz ní déédé aago mọ̀kànlá ààbọ̀ òwúrọ̀ títí di aago mọ̀kànlá kọjá ìṣẹ́jú   márùndínláàdọ́ta àti ní ìrọ̀lẹ́ ní déédé  aago màrún kọjá ìṣẹ́jú màrúndínlógún tít́i di aago màrún ààbọ̀.

translation.en: ---Vice-President to participate in Africa-Europe forum in Austria
translation.yo: ---Igbákejì Ààrẹ yóò kópa níbi ìpàdé Africa-Europe ni Austria.

translation.en: Nigeria’s Vice President, Professor Yemi Osinbajo will be participating in the Africa-Europe High Level Forum with other African and European Heads of States or Government holding in Vienna, Austria on Monday, December 17, and Tuesday, December 18.
translation.yo: Igbákejì Ààrẹ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà Yemí Ọ̀sínbàjò yóò máa darapọ̀ mọ àwọn akẹgbẹ́ rẹ̀ láti orílẹ̀-èdè Áfíríkà àti Europe níbi ìjíròrò tí yóò wáyé ní Viénna lórílẹ̀-èdè Austria lọ́jọ́ Ajé, oṣù Kejìlá, ọjọ́ kej̀idínlógún àti ọjọ́ kẹrìndínlógún.

translation.en: A press release from the Office of the Vice President said that Professor Osinbajo would at the forum, hosted by the Austrian government on behalf of the European Union and the African Union, be speaking on the forum’s theme ‘Taking cooperation to the digital age’.
translation.yo: Nínú àtẹ̀jáde kan t’ó wá láti Ibi-iṣẹ́ igbákej̀i Ààrẹ, ó sọ pé Ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Ọ̀ṣínbàjò yóò máa sọ̀rọ̀ lórí àkórí ’Gbígbé àjùmọ̀ṣe dé orí ẹ̀rọ ìgbàlódé’ ní ìpàdé náà tí ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè Austria jẹ́ olùgbàlejò tí ó dúró fún Àjọ Europe àti Àjọ Africa.

translation.en: The High-Level Forum will promote innovation and digitalisation according to the organizers in the EU and AU, “as important enablers of our future development, so that everyone can benefit from the ongoing digital transformation.”
translation.yo: Àpérò àwọn èèyàn jànkànjànkàn náà yóò ṣe ìgbélárugẹ ìdàgbàsókè ìmọ̀ ẹ̀rọ ìgbàlódé àti ọgbọ́n àtinudá bí àwọn olùṣètò ní EU àti AU, “gẹ́gẹ́ bí àwọn ohun t’ó ṣe onígbọ̀nwọ́ ìdàgbàsókè ọjọ́ ọ̀la wa, kí gbogbo ènìyàn ó lè jẹ àǹfààní tí ènìyàn yóò jẹ láti ara àwọn àyípadà ìmọ̀ ẹ̀rọ ìgbàlódé.”

translation.en: The forum aims at assessing “how current partnerships between Africa and Europe contribute to this goal, complementing the ongoing implementation of the joint declaration of the 2017 Abidjan Summit between the African Union and the European Union, which, among other things, highlighted the importance of unlocking the potential of the digital economy for Africa and Europe.
translation.yo: Ìpàdé náà yóò tún máa wo "bí ìbaṣepọ tó wà láàárín Europe àti Áfíríkà ṣe lọ́wọ́ sí alépa yìí, àṣekún ìmúṣe tí ó ń lọ lọ́wọ́ tí wọ́n fẹnukò lé lórí níbi ìpàdé Abidjan tó wáyé lọ́dún 2017 àti àwọn nǹkan mìíràn, wọn yóò tún máa jíròrò lórí ipa pàtàkì tí ìmọ̀ ẹ̀rọ ìgbàlódé yóò tún fi wúlò fún ìdàgbàsókè ètò ọrọ̀ ajé fún Europe àti Áfíríkà.

translation.en: It also aims at contributing to the Africa-Europe Alliance for Sustainable Investment and Jobs.”
translation.yo: Ó lépa ìdásí Àjọṣe fún Ìmúrò Ìdókoòwò àti ìpèsè Iṣé.”

translation.en: During his trip to Vienna, Prof. Osinbajo would hold a town-hall meeting with the Nigerian community in Austria; and also attend several bilateral meetings with European government leaders, including the Prime Minister of Czech Republic, Andrej Babis; Prime Minister of Finland, H.E. Juha Petri Sipilä; the Federal Chancellor of Austria, His Excellency, Sebastian Kurz; and the UK Minister for Africa, Harriet Baldwin.
translation.yo: Lásìkò ìrìnàjò rẹ̀ lọ sí Vienna, Ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n  Ọ̀ṣínbàjò yóò máa ṣe ìpàdé abẹ́lé pẹ̀lú àwọn ọmọ orílè Nàìjíríà t’ó ń gbé ní orílẹ̀-èdè Austria; bákan náà ni yóò tún máa ṣe ìpàdé pọ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn olórí orílẹ̀-èdè Europe, lára wọn ni Adarí ìjọba ti orílẹ̀-èdè Czech Republic, Andrej Babis; Adarí ìjọba ti orílẹ̀-èdè Finland, H.E. Juha Petri Sipilä; Ọba orílẹ̀-èdè Austria, alayé jùlọ, Sebastian Kurz; àti Mínísítà ilẹ̀ aláwọ̀ funfun (UK ) tó ń sojú fún ilẹ̀  Africa, Harriet Baldwin.

translation.en: Prof. Osinbajo would also meet with top officials of the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation.
translation.yo: Ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Ọ̀ṣínbànjò yóò tún máa ṣèpàdé pọ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ àgbà ilé iṣẹ́ Bill àti Melinda Gates Foundation.

translation.en: The Vice President left Abuja on Sunday night and is expected back on Tuesday.
translation.yo: Igbákejì Ààrẹ fi ìlú Àbújá sílẹ̀ l’áṣàlẹ́ ọjọ́ Àìkú, yóò sì padà wá sí orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà lọ́jọ́ Ìṣẹ́gun.

translation.en: ---President Buhari pays tribute to Holocaust victims
translation.yo: ---Ààrẹ Buhari ṣèbọ̀wọ̀ fún àwọn tó pàdánù ẹ̀mí wọn lásìkò Ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀-ìpaninípakúpa.

translation.en: President Muhammadu Buhari has visited the Auschwitz-Birkenau Memorial and Museum in Oświęcim, Poland, where he paid tribute to Holocaust victims.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà Muhammadu Buhari ti lọ sí ibi tí wọ́n ń kó àwọn Ilé-ọnà ohun àlùmọ́ọ́ni àti àmì ìdàgbére sí ni Auschwitz-Birkenau àti Oświęcim láti lọ bọ̀wọ̀ fùn àwọn tó pàdánù ẹ̀mí wọn lásìkò ogun.

translation.en: After an hour and 10 minutes guided tour of the Museum, devoted to the memory of the victims who died at both camps during World War II, President Buhari penned a hand-written tribute in the visitor’s book, quoting Shakespeare’s ‘Julius Caesar:
translation.yo: Lẹ́yìn wákàtí kan àti ìṣéjú mẹ́wàá tí Ààrẹ ti rin Ilé-ọnà, fún àwọn tí wọ́n pàdánù ẹ̀mí wọn lásìkò Ogun Àgbáyé kejì, Ààrẹ Buhari tún tọwọ́bọ ìwé láti bọ̀wọ̀ fún àwọn akọni náà nínú ìwé àlejò, tí ó sì lo ọ̀rí ‘Julius Caesar ti Shakespeare:

translation.en: ”The evil that men do lives after them; the good is oft interred with their bones.”
translation.yo: Ìwà burúkú tí àwọn ènìyàn ba wù, máa ń tẹ̀lé wọn; ṣùgbón ìwà rere máa ń wọnú eegun lọ."

translation.en: The President also laid a wreath at Block II of the museum, known as the ‘‘Death block.’’
translation.yo: Ààrẹ tún gbé òdódó ibojì si Ilé kejì ti ilé-ọnà, tí a mọ̀ sí “Ilé ikú.”

translation.en: According to an epitaph in the Block: ”Male and female prisoners from all parts of the camp complex were held in this building…following brutal interrogations, they were in most cases sentenced to death by shooting.”
translation.yo: Gẹ́gé bí wọ́n ṣe kọ sórí Ilé ikú náà: ’’Àwọn ẹlẹ́wọ̀n l’ọ́kùnrin àti l’óbìnrin láti gbogbo ilé ìpàgọ́ náà ni wọ́n kó sínú ilé yìí...lẹ́yìn ìfọ̀rọ̀wánilẹ́nuwo ìjìyà, ti wọ́n sí dá wọn lẹ́jọ́ ìyìnbọn pa.”

translation.en: Shortly before leaving the Museum, President Buhari while fielding questions from State House Correspondents traveling with him, described those fanning embers of discord in Nigeria as” illiterates and ignorant.”
translation.yo: "Lẹ́yìn ti Ààrẹ kúrò níbẹ̀ tán, ló ń bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ń dáhùn ìbéèrè láti ọ̀dọ àwọn akọ̀ròyìn tí ó tẹ̀lẹ́ láti ilé –iṣé Ààrẹ pé àwọn tó ń dá wàhálà sílẹ̀ lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà’’ jẹ́ aláìlẹ́kọ̀ọ́ àti aláìmọ̀kan.

translation.en: The President is on Day Four of his visit to Poland, where he had attended the opening of the UN Climate Change Conference in Katowice, delivered his national address at the 12-day meeting of COP24, met several world leaders and visited the impressive Nigerian pavilion at the climate summit.
translation.yo: "Ààrẹ lọ fún ìrìnàjọ̀ ọlọ́jọ́ mẹ́rin sí orílẹ̀-èdè Poland, níbi tí yóò ti darapọ̀ mọ́ ìpàdé Àpérò Àyípadà Ojú-ọjọ́ ti UN àgbáyé ní Katowice, ó ṣe àgbékalẹ̀ ọ̀rọ̀ orílẹ̀-èdè rẹ̀ ní ìpàdé ọlọ́jọ́ méjìlá ti COP24, ṣèpàdé pẹ̀lú àwọn olórí àgbáyé tí wọ́n sì bẹ ibi àfihàn orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ní àpérò ojú-ọjọ́ náà.

translation.en: The President had attended a town-hall meeting with Nigerians in Poland, a day after his arrival in the country.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ tún bá àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà tí wọ́n wà ní Poland sọ̀rọ̀ lọ́jọ́ kejì tí ó dé sí orílẹ̀-èdè Poland.

translation.en: ---Nigeria condoles with US on death of George Bush
translation.yo: ---Nàìjíríà bá Amẹ́ríkà kẹ́dùn lórí ikú George Bush.

translation.en: President Muhammadu Buhari has joined world leaders in mourning the death of former President of United States, George H.W. Bush, who lived a life of service to country and humanity.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari ti darapọ̀ mọ́ àwọn adarí orílẹ̀-èdè lágbàáyé láti bá orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà kẹ́dùn lórí ikú Ààrẹ àna George H. Bush, tí ó gbé ìgbé ayé rẹ̀ láti fi sin ìlú àti àwọn ènìyàn.

translation.en: President Buhari sent his condolences to the government and people of the United States, family of the 41st President and all political associates of the great leader, whose legacies continue to inspire and attract encomiums across the world.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Buhari fi ìwé ìkẹ́dùn náà ránṣé sí àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà, ọ̀rẹ́ àti ẹbí olóògbé náà, tí ó jẹ́ Ààrẹ   ìkọkànlélógójì ní orílẹ̀-èdè náà, ẹni tí gbogbo àwọn ènìyàn ń kan sáárá sí fún ipa pàtàkì tí ó kó lágbàáyé.

translation.en: The President believes the passing of George H.W. Bush is a loss to the entire world, not just America, especially the many people he inspired.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ tún tẹ̀síwájú pé ikú George H. Bush, kìí ṣe orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà nìkan ni yóò dùn,ṣùgbọ́n àjọ gbayé  àti àwọn ènìyàn tí ó ti ko ipa rere ní ìgbésí ayé wọn pẹ̀lú.

translation.en: President Buhari extols the late President’s love for his family and country, which remains legendary as clearly seen in the way his children have taken up leadership roles and are steadily breeding new generation of great thinkers and leaders.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ wá gbóṣùbà fún ipa rere tí olóògbé náà tí kó ní ìgbésí ayé àwọn ọmọ rẹ̀, ní èyí tí ó ń ràn wọ́n lọ́wọ́ láti kó ipa pàtàkì nínú ipò adarí lágbàáyé.

translation.en: The President prays for God’s comfort on the mourning nation, the family of the nonagenarian, and a peaceful rest for his soul.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ wá gbàdúrà pé kí Ọlórun dun orílẹ̀-èdè náà, ẹbí, ọ̀rẹ́ olóògbé náà nínú, àti ìsinmi fún ẹ̀mi rẹ̀.

translation.en: ---Nigeria to produce festivals compendium to boost Tourism
translation.yo: ---Nàìjíríà kò ní pẹ́ gbé àwọn àkọsílẹ̀ ìwé àṣà fún ìdàgbàsókè ìgbáfẹ́ jáde.

translation.en: The Ministry of Culture and Tourism in Nigeria says it will soon produce a compendium of the festivals across the country as part of efforts to boost tourism and showcase the country’s diverse cultures.
translation.yo: Àjo tó ń mójútó àṣà àti ìgbáfẹ́ lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ti sọ pé àwọn kò ní pẹ́ gbé ìwé àkosílè ti yóò sàfihàn gbogbo àwọn àṣà tó wà jákè-jádò orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà síta láti lè mú ìdàgbàsókè bá àṣà àti ìgbáfẹ́ lorílẹ̀-èdè yìí.

translation.en: Minister of Information and Culture, Mr. Lai Mohammed, said this in Istanbul, Turkey, while speaking at the ongoing 3rd UNWTO/UNESCO World Conference on Tourism and Culture, jointly organised by the two UN agencies.
translation.yo: Mínísítà fún ìlanilóye àti àṣà lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà, Lai Mohammed ló sọ̀rọ̀ yìí ni Istanbul, lorílẹ̀-èdè Turkey níbi ayẹyẹ àṣà àti ìgbáfẹ́ tí àjọ àgbáyé (UNWTO/UNESCO World Conference on Tourism and Culture) ṣe,eléyìí ló jẹ́ ìkẹta irú rẹ̀ tí àjọ àgbáyé yóò ṣe.

translation.en: He said with more than 365 festivals across Nigeria, the country can organise one festival per day all year round, thus boosting domestic and international tourism.
translation.yo: Mínísítà sọ pé o lé ni aárùndínláàdọ́rinlé ọ́ọ̀dúnrún ni àwọn àṣà tó wà ní jákè-jádò orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà, ìyẹn ni pé orílẹ̀-èdè yìí lè e ṣe àṣà kan lójúmọ́ kan, ní èyí tí yóò jẹ́ kí ìdàgbàsókè bá ètò ìgbafẹ́ àti ọ̀rọ̀ ajé orílẹ̀-èdè yìí.

translation.en: Different Festivals Mr. Mohammed said Nigeria’s ethnic groups are rooted in their cultures, which they showcase through different festivals like Durbar, New Yam Festival, Eyo and Masquerades, just to mention a few.
translation.yo: Àṣà oríṣiríṣi Alhaji Mohammed ni orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà fìdí múlẹ̀ nínú èdè àti àṣà ni èyí ti àwọn àṣà mííràn tún ti jẹyọ bi I Durbar, iṣu tuntun, Ẹ̀yọ̀ àti ọdún egúngún abbl.

translation.en: He said governments at all levels in Nigeria are striving hard to encourage the festivals in their domains, while the Nigerian government is providing the enabling environment to showcase the various festivals.
translation.yo: Ó tẹ̀síwájú pé àwọn ìjọba ni gbogbo ẹ̀ka lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ń sa gbogbo ipá ní agbègbè wọn láti gbé àṣà láruge, bákan náà ni ìjọba àpapò náà sì ń ṣètò iranwọ láti fún wọn ní agbègbè tó ṣe é gbé, ní èyí tí yóò mú itẹ̀síwájú bá àṣà lorílẹ̀-èdè yìí.

translation.en: The Minister said the Abuja Carnival was particularly designed to enable the 36 States of the federation and the Federal Capital Territory to showcase the country’s cultural diversity which he described as a source of unity among the country’s ethnic groups.
translation.yo: Mínísítà tún tẹ̀síwájú pé ayẹyẹ àjọ̀dún àṣà tí ó máa ń wáyé nílùú Àbújá jẹ́ ohun tí ó wá láti gbé àṣà lárugẹ, ní èyí tí gbogbo àwọn ìpínlẹ̀ mẹ́rìndínlógójí  àti ìlú Àbújá tó wà lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà máa ń kópa níbẹ̀.

translation.en: He said festivals are not just for entertainment but major contributors to job creation and economic development.
translation.yo: Ó ní ayẹyẹ àjọ̀dún àṣà kìí ṣe fún eré ìdárayá nìkan, bí kìí ṣe láti tún pèsè iṣẹ́ àti ìdàgbàsókè fún ètò ọrọ̀-ajé lọrílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: More than 30 Ministers of Culture and Tourism from around the world are attending the three-day conference.
translation.yo: Àwọn Mínísítà tó lé lọ́gbọ̀n ló wà níbi ayẹyẹ ajọdún agbaye yìí, ọjọ́ mẹ́ta gbáko ni wọn yóò fi se ayẹyẹ yìí.

translation.en: ---WANEP, AU conduct training on election conflict prevention
translation.yo: ---WANEP, AU ṣe ìdánilẹ́kọ̀ọ́ nípa ààbò lásìkò ìjàm̀bá ètò ìdìbò.

translation.en: Ahead of Nigeria’s 2019 General Election, the West Africa Network for Peace building, the African Union and ECOWAS have trained about 80 people from civil society organisations on conflict monitoring, aimed at preventing conflicts within the election period.
translation.yo: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ètò ìdìbò ọdún 2019 ṣe ń súnmọ́ etílé àjọ tó ń mójútó ètò àlàáfíà lórílẹ̀-èdè Áfíríkà West Africa Network for Peace building àti Àjọ Áfíríkà  àti àjọ Ecowas ti ṣe ìdánilẹ̀kọ̀ fún àwọn ènìyàn tó lé ní ọgọ́rin, pàápàá jùlọ àwọn ilé-iṣẹ́ aládàáni tí kì í ṣe ti ìjọba láti kọ́ wọn lọ́nà tí wọn yóò fi lè máa dáàbò bo ara wọn nígbà tí ìjàm̀bá bá wáyé lásìkò ètò ìdìbò.

translation.en: The organisation says the training, which brought participants from all 36 states of Nigeria and Abuja.
translation.yo: Ẹgbẹ́ náà sọ pé àwọn olùkópa níbi ìdánilẹ́kọ̀ọ́ náà wá láti gbogbo ìpínlẹ̀ mẹ́rìndínlógójì tó wà lórílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà àti ìlú Àbújá.

translation.en: It is part of a broader election monitoring, management and mitigation project, designed to mitigate election violence in the forthcoming election.
translation.yo: Ẹgbẹ́ náà sọ pé àwọn ṣe ìdánilékọ̀ọ́ yìí fún àwọn ènìyàn tí yóò kópa láti mójútó ètò ìdìbò, ní pàtàkì jùlo ní ìgbèríko àti ní ìpínlẹ̀ tó wà lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: The West Africa Network for Peace (WANEP) building says it considers the capacity building of those likely to be engaged as community and state monitors an important assignment because Nigeria has entered a critical phase of election process in the midst of unfolding skirmishes in the political arena.
translation.yo: Ẹgbẹ́ WANEP  tún tẹ̀síwájú pé ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn ènìyàn ni ẹ̀rú ti ń bà nítorí ètò ìdìbò tó ń bò , pàápàá jùlọ nípa ètò ààbò tí kò fẹsẹ̀ múlẹ̀ , bi àwọn olóṣèlú ṣe ń bú ara wọn àti bí wọ́n ṣe ń dún ìkookò mọ́ ara wọn.

translation.en: Against this development, the Executive Director of the organisation, Dr. Chukwuemeka Eze, said the three organisations had instituted a project to monitor and analyse situations to mitigate and develop a response platform to any likely violence, during election.
translation.yo: Alákòóso ẹgbẹ́ yìí Chukwuemeka Eze tún ni àwọn ẹ̀gbẹ mẹ́tẹ̀ẹ̀ta yìí fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ láti ṣe ìdánilẹ́kọ̀ọ́ yìí láti lè dénà àwọn ìjàm̀bá tó máa ń ṣẹlẹ̀ lásìkò ètò ìdìbò.

translation.en: “WANEP, ECOWAS/AU developed election specific indicators and contextualized online system for constant monitoring and reporting.
translation.yo: Eze tún sọ pé “WANEP, ECOWAS/AU ti ní àwọn yóò gbé àwọn iṣẹ́ àkànṣe kan dìde lórí èrọ ayélujára, ní èyí tí yóò máa jábọ̀, tí yóò sì tún máa tọpinpin bí ètò ìdìbò ṣe ń lọ sí.

translation.en: It will also provide analytical reports highlighting prioritized areas of risks of violence and make recommendations to key national and zonal influencers that respond to election threats such as the Independent Electoral Commission, Nigeria Police, Jama’atu Nasril Islam, Christian Association of Nigeria, Ministry of Internal Affairs, National Peace Committee,” Dr. Eze said.
translation.yo: Bákan náà, ni ẹgbẹ́ náà yóò tún gbé iṣẹ́ àkànṣe mìíràn dìde tí yóò ran àwọn ti ọ̀rọ̀ kàn lọ́wọ́ láti lèe gbógun ti ìjàm̀bá tó bá lèe wáyé lásìkò ètò ìdìbò , àwọn bí i àjọ elétò ìdìbò, ilé-iṣẹ́ ọlọ́pàá,àjọ tó ń mójútó ọ̀rọ̀ tó jẹ mọ́ ìlù, ẹgbẹ́ onígbàgbọ́ (kristeni) ẹgbẹ́ àwọn mùsùlùmí àti àjọ tó ń pèsè àlàáfíà.

translation.en: President Buhari refutes claims he was cloned
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Buhari ní òun kì í ṣe ẹda.

translation.en: President Muhammmadu Buhari has for the first time refuted the rumour of him being cloned, saying he is the real Buhari.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari ti sọ̀rọ̀ nígbà àkọ́kọ́ láti tako àhesọ ọ̀rọ̀ pé òun kì í ṣe ènìyàn, pé ẹ̀dà ni òun.

translation.en: He refuted the claims on Sunday in Poland, during a parley with members of the Nigerian community in Poland.
translation.yo: Ó tako ọ̀rọ̀ yìí lọ́jọ́ Àìkú ní orílẹ̀-èdè Poland lásìkò tó ń bá àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà tó wà ni orílẹ̀-èdè Poland sọ̀rọ̀.

translation.en: A Nigerian residing in Poland wanted to know if he was the real Buhari or the much talked about Jibril from Sudan, at the town hall meeting in Krakow on Sunday evening.
translation.yo: Ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà tó wà ni Poland fẹ́ mọ̀ bóyá Ààrẹ jẹ́ ènìyàn tàbí ẹ̀dà, láti fi òtítọ́ ọ̀rọ̀ tí wọ́n ń sọ múlè, eléyìí wáyé ní gbọ̀ngán tó wà ní Krakow lọ́jọ́ Àìkú.

translation.en: President Buhari said a lot of people had hoped he was dead during the period of his ill health.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Buhari ní ọ̀pọ̀lọ́pọ̀ àwọn ènìyàn ni wọ́n fẹ́ kí òun ti kú lásìkò tí ò ń ṣàìsàn.

translation.en: He described the sponsors of the rumours about his person as “ignorant and irreligious.”
translation.yo: Ó ṣàpèjúwe àwọn tí ó ń sọ̀rọ̀ yìí gege bi "Aláìmọ̀kan àti aláìlẹ́sìn.

translation.en: According to him:“A lot of people had hoped that l died during my ill health.
translation.yo: "Ààrẹ sọ pé: “Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn ènìyàn ni wọ́n fẹ́ kí n kú lásìkò tí mo ń ṣàìsàn.

translation.en: I will soon celebrate my 76th birthday.
translation.yo: Èmi kò ní pẹ́ ṣe ayẹyẹ ọjọ́ ìbí kẹrìndínlọ́gọ́rin mi.

translation.en: The meeting afforded the Nigerian leader an opportunity to interact with Nigerians living in Poland, which was the President’s first official engagement, ahead of the Conference of the Parties (COP24) of the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC), taking place from December 2-4.
translation.yo: "Ìpàdé yìí tún fún àwọn aláṣẹ orílẹ̀-èdè yìí láti jíròrò pẹ̀lú àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà tó ń gbé ní Poland, eléyìí ni yóò jẹ́ àkọ́kọ́ irú rẹ̀ tí Ààrẹ  yóò wá sí ìpàdé àwọn ìgbìmọ̀ tó wà lára àjọ àgbáyé tí wọ́n ń rí sí bí ojú ọjọ́ ṣe ń yí padà (COP24 of Climate Change (UNFCCC), ní èyí tí yóò wáyé ní ọjọ́ kejì sí ọjọ́ kẹ́rin, oṣù kejìlá ọdún yìí.

translation.en: At the meeting, the President expressed his happiness with the report by the Nigerian Ambassador to Poland, Eric Adagogo Bell-Gam.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ fi ìdùnnú rẹ̀ hàn pẹ̀lú ìròyìn tí aṣojú orílẹ̀-èdè Poland Eric Adagogo Bell-Gam sọ nípa àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà tó ń gbé inú ìlú náà.

translation.en: On the economy, the President said Nigeria has virtually stopped the importation of food, especially rice.
translation.yo: Lórí ètò ọrọ̀-ajé, ààrẹ ní ìjọba òun ti dá kíkó oúnjẹ láti òkè òkun wá sí orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà dúró, pàápàá jùlọ ìrẹsì.

translation.en: “I am trying to save a lot of money, l only go out when it is necessary. My priority is to secure Nigeria.”
translation.yo: “Mò ń gbìyànjú láti má ṣe owó orílẹ̀-èdè yìí báṣubàṣu, mò ń jáde nígbà tí ó bá pọn dandan.”

translation.en: “I am always upset when l see little children taking bowls about begging for food.
translation.yo: Inú mi kìí dùn nígbà tí mo ń bá rí àwọn ọmọdé tí wọ́n tọrọ owó àti oúnjẹ lójú títì.

translation.en: ---Taliban kill at least 22 Afghan police in ambush
translation.yo: ---Ikọ̀ ọmọ-ogun ọlọ̀tẹ̀ Taliban ṣekú-pa ọlọ́pàá Afghan méjìlélógún.

translation.en: At least 22 police were killed in a Taliban ambush in Afghanistan’s western province of Farah late on Sunday, officials said, adding to the growing casualty toll on Afghan security forces fighting an increasingly confident insurgency.
translation.yo: Ó kéré tán ọlọ́pàá méjìlélógún l’ó pàdánù ẹ̀mí wọn nínú ìkọlù ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun ọlọ́tẹ̀ Taliban sílé-iṣẹ́ ọlọ́pàá Afghan lágbègbè Farah lọ́jọ́ Àìkú.

translation.en: Police spokesman Mohebullah Moheb confirmed the ambush but gave no details. A spokesman at the provincial hospital said 22 bodies had been brought in from the incident.
translation.yo: Agbẹnusọ̀rọ̀ fún ilé-iṣẹ́ ọlọ́pàá Afghan, Mohebullah Moheb ló jábọ̀ ọ̀rọ̀ náà ṣùgbọ́n ti ṣàlàyé bí ọ̀rọ̀ ọ̀hun ṣe lọ lẹ́kùnrẹ́rẹ́.

translation.en: Taliban spokesman Qari Yousuf Ahmadi said 25 police, including senior commanders, had been killed and four vehicles were destroyed in the attack. Large quantities of weapons were captured, he said.
translation.yo: Agbenusọ̀rọ̀ ikọ̀ ọlọ́tẹ̀ Taliban, Qari Yousuf Ahmadi sọ pé, ọlọ́pàá márùndínlógbọ́n tí o fi mọ àwọn ọ̀gá àgbà ọlọ́pàá ni wọ́n ṣekú-pa, tí wọ́n sì dáná sun ọkọ̀ ọlọ́pàá mẹ́rin.

translation.en: Afghan authorities no longer release detailed figures but U.S. Defense Secretary James Mattis recently confirmed casualties have been running at some 500 a month, a figure many officials in Kabul say understates the real toll.
translation.yo: Ẹ̀wẹ̀, agbenusọ̀rọ̀ nílé ìwòsàn tí wọ́n gbé àwọn tí ó fara kaasa ìkọlu ọ̀hún ló sọ pé, ènìyàn méjìlélógún ni wọ́n ti gbé wọ ilé ìwòsàn náà láti ibi tí ìṣ̀ẹ̀lẹ̀ ọ̀hún ti wáyé.

translation.en: The losses have been mounting even while U.S. diplomatic efforts to begin peace talks with the Taliban.
translation.yo: Ìpàdànù náà ti ń wáyé ní lemọ́-lemọ́, tí ó fi jẹ́ pé òṣìṣẹ́ akọ̀ròyìn ilẹ̀ Améríkà sílùú Afghan ti pè fún ìjíròrò àlááfíà pẹ̀lú ikọ̀ ọlọ́tẹ̀ Taliban.

translation.en: ---Nigerian President bags Polio Champion award
translation.yo: ---Ààrẹ Buhari gbà àmì ẹ̀yẹ fún akitiyan láti dénà àrùn rọmọlápá-rọmọlẹ́sẹ̀.

translation.en: President Muhammadu Buhari has been conferred with the prestigious Polio Champion Award in recognition of his uncommon commitment and leadership in the polio eradication programme in Nigeria.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari ti gba àmì ẹ̀yẹ ti àrùn rọmọlaparọmọlẹ́sẹ̀ fún gudugudu méje, yàyà mẹfà tí ìjọba rẹ̀ ti ṣe láti gbógun ti ààrùn yìí l’órílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: Rotary International President, Mr Barry Rassin, who is on a four-day official visit to Nigeria, presented the award to President Buhari on Thursday, at State House, Abuja.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ ẹgbẹ́ Rotary International, Barry Rassin, tí ó wá fún ìrìnàjò ọlọ́jọ́ mẹ́rin sí orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà, l’ó gbé àmì ẹ̀yẹ náà fi dá Ààrẹ Buhari lọ́lá nílé Ààrẹ t’ó wà lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà, ní ọjọ́ Ọjọ́bọ̀.

translation.en: The Polio Champion Award was instituted by Rotary International in 1995 to recognize and appreciate Heads of Governments and organizations that have played a key role in polio eradication around the world.
translation.yo: Ẹgbẹ́ Rotary international ti máa ń fún àwọn adarí orílẹ̀-èdè àti ilé iṣẹ́ tí ó bá fakọyọ nínú ìgbìyànjú wọn láti dénà àrùn rọ́mọ-lapa-rọ́mọ-lẹ́sẹ̀ l’órílẹ̀-èdè wọn.

translation.en: The last recipient of the Award was Justin Trudeau, the Prime Minister of Canada.
translation.yo: Ẹni t’ó gba àmì ẹ̀yẹ ọ̀hún kẹ́yìn ni Justin Trudeau, tí ọ́ jẹ́ Adarí Ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè Canada.

translation.en: Other past recipients include Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany and former UN Secretary General Ban Ki-Moon.
translation.yo: Lára àwọn ènìyàn tí ó tún ti gba àmì ẹ̀yẹ ọ̀hún ni adarí ì̀jọba orílẹ̀-èdè Japan Shinzo Abe, adarí orílẹ̀-èdè Germany Angela Merkel àti akòwe àgbà fún àjọ àgbáyé tẹ́lẹ̀rí Ban Ki-Moon.

translation.en: Receiving the award, the Nigerian leader, while thanking Rotary International for the honour, lauded their commitment to humanitarian work across the globe.
translation.yo: Nígbà tí Ààrẹ ń tẹ́wọ́gba àmì ẹ̀yẹ yìí, ó dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ ẹgbẹ́ Rotary Internàtional fún àmì ẹ̀yẹ tí wọn fi da a lọ́lá.

translation.en: ‘‘Rotary International is well known to my generation. Your work is really humanitarian; no amount of materialism can pay you for what you have been doing and we thank you very much.
translation.yo: ’’Ìran mi mọ́ ẹgbẹ́ Rotary International bí ẹní m’owó. Ní t’òóto, iṣẹ́ yín ní í ṣe pẹ̀lú ọmọnìyàn; kò sí iye ohunkóhun tí ó lè san àwọn iṣẹ́ ribi-ribi tí ẹ̀ ń gbé ṣe, a dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ yín gidi gan-an.

translation.en: ‘‘I am pleased with the efforts of Rotary International, you are champions of the weak, and I pray that God will abundantly pay you for your humanitarian services.
translation.yo: ‘‘Inú mi dùn sí ipa pàtàkì tí ẹ̀ ń kó láwùjọ, ẹ jẹ́ alágbára fún àwọn tí kò lágbára, mo gbàdúrà pé kí Ọlọ́run san àwọn oore tí ẹ ń ṣe wọ̀nyín fún un yín ní ìlópo fún iṣẹ́ ọmọnìyàn yín.

translation.en: I am also pleased that I have a competent Health Minister, who supervises the work,” the President said.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ ní “inú mi dùn pé mo ní akọ́ṣẹ́mọṣẹ́ Mínísítà fún ètò ìlera, tí ó ń bójútó iṣẹ́ náà.

translation.en: Earlier in his remarks, Mr Rassin, while commending the President for providing significant leadership in the efforts to eradicate polio in Nigeria.
translation.yo: ’’Ọ̀gbẹ́ni Rassin wá gbóṣùbà fún Ààrẹ Buhari fún iṣẹ́ gudu gudu méje yàyà mẹfà tí ó ń ṣe láti dẹ́kun àrùn rọmọlápárọmọlẹ́sẹ̀ l’órílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: He advocated for increased political and financial commitments at all levels for routine immunization and primary health care strengthening.
translation.yo: Ó tún rọ Ààrẹ láti túbọ̀ mú kí ètò ìṣèlú àti owó àyàsọ́tọ̀ ó gbé fúkẹ́ sí i kí gbogbo ìpele fún ètò ìbupá àti ìlera abélé ó ba kẹ́sẹjárí.

translation.en: ---Trump to nominate retired General as ambassador to Saudi Arabia
translation.yo: ---Trump yóò yan ọ̀gágun tẹ́lẹ̀rí gẹ́gẹ́ bí aṣojú sílẹ̀ Saudi Arabia.

translation.en: U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday nominated a retired Army general to be the country’s ambassador to Saudi Arabia, as Washington faces pressure to respond to the killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi inside the Saudi consulate in Istanbul.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ ilẹ̀ Amẹ́ríkà, Donald Trump ti yan ọ̀gágun ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun orílé-èdè náà tí ó ti fẹ̀yìn tì gẹ́gẹ́ bí aṣojú ilẹ̀ Amẹ́ríkà sí orílé-èdè Saudi Arabia, gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìlú Washington náà ṣe ń kojú ìdojúkọ látàrí ikú akọ̀ròyìn ọmọbíbí ilẹ̀ Saudi, Jamal Khashoggi tí ó kú sí Ilé-iṣẹ́ Aṣojú Ìjọba Saudi ní Istanbul.

translation.en: The White House said Trump has chosen John Abizaid, who as a four-star Army general led the U.S. Central Command during the Iraq war, to be Washington’s ambassador in Riyadh.
translation.yo: Ilé-iṣẹ́ Ààrẹ sọ̀rọ̀ ọ̀hún di mímọ̀ pé Ààrẹ Trump ti yan ọ̀gágun tẹ́lẹ̀rí ọ̀hún, John Abizaid, lẹ́ni tí ó tukọ̀ ọmọ ogun ilẹ̀ Amẹ́ríkà lásìkò ogun pẹ̀lú orílé-èdè Iraq.

translation.en: Abizaid must be confirmed by the U.S. Senate.
translation.yo: Ní báyìí, ìrètí wà pé ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣòfin ilẹ̀ Amẹ́ríkà yóò ṣèpàdé láti bọwọ́lu ìyànsípò tuntun náà.

translation.en: In addition to the scandal over Khashoggi’s death, Washington is also grappling with criticism from U.S. lawmakers over its support for Saudi Arabia’s military intervention in Yemen’s civil war.
translation.yo: Ní àfikún sí ikú Khashoggi, ilẹ̀ Washington fẹ̀sùn kan àwọn aṣòfin ilẹ̀ Amẹ́ríkà fún ṣíṣe àtìlẹ́yìn fún ikọ̀ ọmọ ogun ilẹ̀ Saudi Arabia nínú ogun ilẹ̀ Yemen.

translation.en: The United States has not had an ambassador to Saudi Arabia since Trump took office in January 2017.
translation.yo: Orílé-èdè Amẹ́ríkà kò ì tíì ní aṣojú sílẹ̀ Saudi Arabia láti ìgbà tí Ààrẹ Trump ti gorí àlééfà lọ́dún 2017.

translation.en: White House national security adviser John Bolton said on Tuesday he does not think recordings related to Khashoggi’s killing, which were shared by Turkey, implicate Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman.
translation.yo: Olùgbani-nímọ̀ràn lórí ètò ààbò nílé iṣẹ́ Ààrẹ Trump John Bolton sọ lọ́jọ́ ìṣẹ́gun pé, òun kò rò pé àwọn àkásílẹ̀ àwòran tí ó rọ̀ mọ́ ikú Khashoggi, ti àwọn àra ilẹ̀ Turkey ń pín káàkiri, lọ́wọ́ ọmọọba ilẹ̀ Saudi, Mohammed bin Salman nínú.

translation.en: Nigeria seeks stiffer penalties for perpetrators of illicit transactions
translation.yo: Nàìjíríà fẹ́ ìjìyà tó nípọn fún àwọn t’ó ń ṣe owó ìlú mọ́kumọ̀ku.

translation.en: Nigerian President, Muhammadu Buhari on Sunday in Paris, called for stringent actions against perpetrators of illicit financial flows, including crackdown on safe heavens.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ orílé-èdè Nàìjíríà, Muhammadu Buhari ní Paris lọ́jọ́ Àìkú, pè fún ìgbésẹ̀ ìjìyà tí ó gbópọn fún àwọn oníjìbìtì owó, títí kan ìségi ọwọ́ pálábá àwọn ibi ìbapamọ́ wọn.

translation.en: He warned that continuous impunity will encourage more pilfering of countries’ resources to the detriment of poor and vulnerable populace.
translation.yo: Ó kìlọ̀ pé àbálé-àbálé ìwà kòsẹ́nimáamfúmi yóò túbọ̀ mú kí ìṣe owó ìlú mọ́kumọ̀ku ó pọ̀ sí i tí ó máa ń ṣe àkóbá fún àwọn mẹ̀kúnnù àti àwọn ará ìlú.

translation.en: Speaking at the first edition of the Paris Peace Forum, held on the sidelines of the Centenary of Armistice Day, President Buhari said Nigeria had strengthened its laws and institutions to fight corruption, fast-track recovery of stolen assets and punish offenders, urging more commitment from governments and international institutions.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lásìkò ìpàdé tó wáyé ní Paris, Ààrẹ ní orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ti ṣàtúnṣe sí àwọn òfin àti ìlànà rẹ̀ láti gbógun ti ìwà ìbàjẹ́ àti láti gba àwọn owó tí àwọn oníwà ìbàjẹ́ kán kó sálọ sí orílẹ̀-èdè mìíràn, kí wọn sì tún fi imú àwọn ọ̀bàyéjẹ́ náà jófin.

translation.en: The President delivered his statement on “Illicit Financial Flows (Iffs) and Corruption: The Challenge of Global Governance’’ during the event, which was attended by about 70 world leaders and governments.
translation.yo: Ọ̀rọ̀ Ààrẹ dá lórí “Ìbàjẹ́ ṣíṣe owó ìlú báṣu-bàṣu ati Rìbà: Ìpèníjà lórí Ìṣèjọba Àgbáyé’’ èyí tí àwọn àádọ́rin adarí orílẹ̀-èdè àgbáyé àti ìjọba wà níbi ìpàdé náà.

translation.en: “We must crack down on safe havens for corrupt assets.”
translation.yo: “A gbọ́dọ̀ gbógun ti ìwà ìbàjẹ́ ní gbogbo ọ̀nà.

translation.en: “I also advocate sanctions by professional bodies against transactional middlemen (lawyers, bankers, brokers, public officials, etc.) who facilitate Illicit Financial Flows,” the President said.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ tún sọ pé “mo ti bá àwọn ẹgbẹ́ agbófinró, ilé–ìfowópamọ́, àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ìjọba àti àwọn mìíràn sọ̀rọ̀ láti ṣàtìlẹ́yìn fún ìjọba nípa gbígbógun ti ìwà ìbàjẹ́.

translation.en: “Our experience in Nigeria is that financial crimes, such as corruption and fraudulent activities, generate enormous unlawful profits which often prove so lucrative that the threat of a jail term is not sufficient to deter perpetrators
translation.yo: “Ìrírí wà lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ti fihàn pé ìwà ìbàjẹ́ nípa ṣíṣe owó ìlú kúmọ-kùmọ máa ń jẹ́ kí àwọn ènìyàn jẹ èrè níbi tí wọn kò ṣiṣé sí tí ìjìyà lílọ sí ẹ̀wọ̀n kò tó láti jẹ́ kí àwọn oníwà ìbàjẹ́ wọ̀nyí ronú pìwàdà

translation.en: The Nigerian leader urged world leaders and global institutions to remain resolute on the Global Declaration Against Corruption made in London in 2016.
translation.yo: "Adarí orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà wá rọ àwọn adarí ìjọba àgbáyé láti tẹpẹlẹ mọ́ ìlànà tí wọ́n tọwọ́bọ̀ nibi ìpàdé tó wáyé nílùú London lọ́dún 2016 nípa gbígbógun ti ìwà ìbàjẹ́.

translation.en: “These revolve around the formulation of policy and regulatory frameworks that cut across different jurisdictions. We must not lose sight of the role played by secret companies, banks and law firms, all too often based in developed economies and their related offshore centres.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ ni àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè Áfíríkà ti gbóṣùbà fún òun nípa ìgbésẹ̀ tí ó ń gbé láti gbókun ti ìwà ìbàjẹ́ lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà, ní èyí tí ó ti jẹ́ kí ìbáṣepọ̀ láàárín àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè Áfíríkà wọn tún gún régé.

translation.en: He disclosed that the Whistle-Blowing policy had facilitated recovery of billions of naira from corrupt persons, which had been redirected to the development of critical infrastructure and programmes that will benefit all Nigerians and realization of the SDGs.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Buhari tún ní ètò tí ìjọba òun fi gúnlẹ̀ láti máa ṣòfófó àwọn t’ó bá jí owó ìlú, ti so èso rere nípa pé ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ owó bílíọ́nù ni wọ́n ti rí gbà padà lọ́wọ́ àwọn ọ̀bàyéjẹ́, ní èyí tí wọ́n ti lọ láti pèsè àwọn ohun amáyédẹrùn àti ètò tí àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà yóò jẹ ànfààní rẹ̀ àti àfojúba àwọn Ìmúró Ìlépa Ìdàgbàsókè.

translation.en: Duke and Duchess of Cornwall arrive in Nigeria
translation.yo: Adaríkùnrin àti Adaríbìnrin ti Cornwall dé sí orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: The Prince of Wales and heir to the British throne, Prince Charles and his wife, the Duchess of Cornwall, Camilla have arrived in Abuja.
translation.yo: Ọmọoba Wales, tó tún jẹ́ àrẹ̀mọ sí ipò ọba ní orílẹ̀-èdè Britain, Charles àti Adaríbìnrin Cornwall, Camilla ti dé sí ìlú Àbújá.

translation.en: Their visit to Nigeria is part of a 9-day tour to Africa.
translation.yo: Wíwá sí orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà wà lára ìrìnàjò rẹ̀ lọ sí ìlú Áfíríkà.

translation.en: Series of engagements The Royal Highnesses would undertake a ‘series of engagements in Abuja and Lagos.’
translation.yo: Àwọn ètò tí wọn yóò ti máa kópa. Àwọn ọmọọba yìí yóò máa kópa nínú àwọn ètò ọlọ́kan-ò-jọ̀kan nílùú Àbújá àti ní ìlú Èkó.

translation.en: They are expected to meet some of Nigeria’s dynamic youth as well as traditional leaders, the business community, the armed forces, and people from the arts, fashion and charitable sector.
translation.yo: Wọn yóò máa bá àwọn ọ̀dọ́ orílẹ̀-èdè yìí sọ̀rọ̀ àti àwọn ọba aládé, àwọn oníṣòwò, àwọn ọmọ–ológun, àwọn ayàwòrán, àwọn oníṣe-òwò àti àwọn ilé-iṣé tí kìí ṣe ti aládàáni.

translation.en: The visit will highlight key themes in both nations’ relationship, including the importance of Commonwealth ties, youth opportunity, business and entrepreneurship, educating of women and girls, and defence co-operation, among other issues.
translation.yo: Lára àwọn ohun tí orílẹ̀-èdè méjèèjì náà yóò máa jíròrò ni bi ìbáṣepọ̀ wọn yóò ṣe tún túbọ̀ máa tẹ̀síwájú, okoòwò, ẹ̀kọ́ fún àwọn obìnrin àti omidan àti nǹkan mìíràn.

translation.en: This is the third time the Prince of Wales will be visiting Nigeria, his previous visits were in 1990, 1999 and 2006 while it will be the Duchess of Cornwall’s first visit to Nigeria.
translation.yo: Eléyìí ni yóò jẹ́ ìgbà kẹta tí Ọmọọba Wales náà yóò wa ṣe ìbẹ̀wò ní orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà, ó kọ́kọ́ wá sí orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà lọ́dún 1990, 1999, àti ọdún 2006, ṣùgbọ́n ìgbà àkọ̀kọ́ nìyí fún Adarí-obìnrin ti ìlú Cornwall láti wá sí orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: ---Nigeria pledges more dividend of democracy
translation.yo: ---Nàìjíríà ṣèlérí láti jẹ́ kí àwọn ènìyàn jẹ̀gbádùn ètò ìjọba tiwa-n-tiwa.

translation.en: The Nigerian government says it will continue to focus on the provision of critical infrastructure of the present administration across the country.
translation.yo: Ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè ti ní ohun kò ní káàrẹ́ẹ̀ láti túbọ̀ lọ́wọ́ nínú ìdàgbàsókè ohun amáyédẹrùn jákè-jádò orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: President Muhammadu Buhari stated this on Monday, while receiving the outgoing British High Commissioner to Nigeria, Paul Arkwright, in a farewell address at the State House, Abuja.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari lọ́ sọ eléyìí lọ́jọ́ Ajé, níbi ọ̀rọ̀ ìkẹyìn tó sọ nílé Ààrẹ t’ó wà nílùú Àbújá lásìkò ètò ìdágbére ti wọn ṣe fún asojú orílẹ̀-èdè Britain, Paul Arkwright tí ó ń padà lọ sílùú rẹ̀.

translation.en: He said: “Our focus now is on infrastructure; roads, rail, power and others.
translation.yo: Ó sọ pé: “Ìfojúsùn wá ni láti mú ìdàgbàsókè bá ohun amáyéderùn; ojú-pópó, ojú irin, iná mọ̀nà-mọ́ná, àti àwọn ohun mìíràn.

translation.en: How I wish we had fixed all those when we had money.
translation.yo: Inú mi ìbá dùn púpọ̀ t’ó bá jẹ́ pé, a ti ṣe gbogbo eléyìí nígbà tí a ní owó lọ́wọ́

translation.en: He, however, lamented that with the humongous resources at the disposal of Nigeria between 1999 and 2014, it is sad that infrastructure went to rot completely within the same period.
translation.yo: Ó sọ̀ wí pé pẹ̀lú owó tó wọlé sí àpò ìṣúná orílẹ̀-èdè yìí láti ọdún 1999 sí 2014 wà nínú àkọsílẹ̀ ṣùgbọ́n wọn kò lo owó yìí dára-dára láti fi pèsè ohun amáyéderùn nígbà náà.

translation.en: President Buhari commended the outgoing High Commissioner for his warm and pleasant disposition, which has seen him traversing almost the entire country.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ Buhari wá gbóṣùbà fún Aṣojú orílẹ̀-èdè Britan fún gudu-gudu, méje yàyà mẹfà tí ó ṣe lásìkò ìgbà tí ó jẹ́ aṣojú orílẹ̀-èdè yìí.

translation.en: “I always see you all over the place,” the President noted.
translation.yo: Ààrẹ tún ní “Mo máa ń rí ọ ní gbogbo àwọn ìpínlẹ̀ orílẹ̀-èdè yìí.

translation.en: Arkwright, who spent over three years in Nigeria, said he visited 30 of the 36 states, and found the people quite enterprising and engaging, adding that the British government would be glad to offer a helping hand as required in any part of the country.
translation.yo: " Arkwright, t’ó ti lo ọdún mẹ́ta lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà náà sọ pé òhún ti lọ sí ìpínlẹ̀ ọgbọ̀n nínú ìpínlẹ̀ mẹ́rìndínlógójì, ó sì ní àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè yìí jẹ́ ọlọ́pọlọ t’ó nífẹ̀ẹ́ àlejò, ó wá ṣèlérí pé orílẹ̀-èdè Britain yóò túbọ̀ máa ṣètò ìràńwọ́ fún agbègbèkágbègbè ní orílẹ̀-èdè náà.

translation.en: He thanked President Buhari for his support, adding that the relations between Britain and Nigeria have improved tremendously in the past three years.
translation.yo: Ó wá dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Ààrẹ Buhari fún àtìlẹ́yìn rẹ̀, ó ní ìbáṣepọ̀ tó wà láàárín orílẹ̀-èdè Britain àti orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ti tún ní ìdàgbàsóké ju bí ó ṣe wà tẹ́lẹ̀ lọ láàárín ọdún mẹ́ta.

translation.en: ---Indigenous Miners to benefit from N5bn mining fund
translation.yo: ---Àwọn tó ń wa ekùsà l’órílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà yóò jẹ́ àǹfààní bílíọ́nù márùn-ún owó ìrànwó.

translation.en: Miners Association of Nigeria has been included in the N5billion FG intervention fund to Artisanal and Small-Scale Miners across the country.
translation.yo: Ìjọba àpapọ̀ ti fi orúkọ ẹgbẹ́ àwọn tó ń wa ekùsà lórílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà sí ara àwọn tí yóò jẹ àǹfààní bílíónù márùn-ún tí wọ́n yà sọ́tọ̀ láti fi ran àwọn oníṣẹ́–ọwọ́ àti oníṣòwò kéékèèké lọ́wọ́ ní jáke–jádò orílẹ̀-èdè.

translation.en: The association said that the Federal Government has agreed to involve its executives in the disbursement of the N5 billion fund.
translation.yo: Ìgbìmọ̀ aláṣẹ náà sọ pé ìjọba àpapọ tí ṣèlérí láti fi ẹgbẹ́ náà sí ara àwọn tí yóò jẹ àǹfààní bílíọ́nù márùn ún náà.

translation.en: President of the association, Alhaji Sani Shehu said in Abuja that the decision was taken by the Ministry of Mines and Steel Development (MMSD).
translation.yo: Ààrẹ ẹgbẹ́ náà, Alhaji Sani Shehu ló sọ eléyìí nílùú Àbújá pé àjọ tó ń mójútó wíwa ekùsà àti irin lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ni wọ́n gbé ìgbésẹ̀ yìí.

translation.en: The involvement of the association would enhance the effectiveness of the disbursement to genuine miners across the country.
translation.yo: Ó ní bí wọ́n ṣe fi ẹgbẹ́ náà sínú ìpinnu wọn yóò jẹ́ kí ìdàgbàsókè túbọ̀ ba àwọn tó ń wa ekùsà lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: The miners executives had complained of not having access to the fund due to stringent conditions by Bank of Industry (BoI) saddled with the disbursement of the fund.
translation.yo: Egbẹ́ tó ń wa ekùsà lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà ti kọ́kọ́ fi ẹ̀dùn ọkàn wọn nípa ìṣòro tí ẹgbẹ́ wọn ń dojúko láti rí owó gbà láti ọ̀dọ̀ Báńkì tó ń mójú tó ọ̀rọ̀ tó jẹ mọ́ ìdàgbàsókè iṣẹ́, tí ó lẹ́tọ̀ọ́ láti fi owó ràn wọn lọ́wọ́ fún ìdàgbàsókè iṣẹ́ wọn.

translation.en: This effort was a plan by the Federal Government through the MMSD to rejuvenate the mining sector as a means of economic diversification.
translation.yo: Ìdàgbàsókè ilé-iṣẹ́ ìgbésè náà wà lára ìpinnu ìjọba àpapọ̀ láti ran àwọn ilé-iṣẹ́ kéékéékè lọ́wọ́, ní èyí tí ìdàgbàsókè yóò fi dé ba ètò ọrọ̀-ajé orílẹ̀-èdè yìí.

translation.en: The aim of the intervention was to address lack of fund which was a major factor militating against artisans and small-scale miners operations.
translation.yo: Ìgbésẹ̀ yìí tún wà lára ìpinnu ìjọba láti tán ìṣòro t’ó máa ń dojúko àwọn oníṣẹ́ ọwọ́ àti àwọn oníṣòwò ìwakùsà kéékéékè.

translation.en: He said that the ministry had also discovered some reasons why miners were not able to access the fund.
translation.yo: Ó ní àjọ náà ti rí ìṣòro tí ó ń dènà àwọn tó ń wa èkùsà láti máa jẹ́kí wọ́n rí àǹfààní èyáwó òhún.

translation.en: “Government has given us the opportunity to be involved, identify and also to guarantee our members access the fund.
translation.yo: Ó tún sọ pé “ìjọba ti fún wa ní àǹfààní láti lọ́wọ́ níbi etò ẹ̀yáwó náà, wọ́n sí ti ṣèlérí pé àwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ wa yóò jẹ àǹfààní ètò ẹ̀yáwó ọ̀hún.

translation.en: “We are happy with this arrangement, we will soon come up with a tripartite arrangement with the ministry and Bank of Industry which the fund is domiciled with to ensure miners access the funds on time,” he said.
translation.yo: Ó sọ pé “inú wa dùn sí èyí, àjọ tó ń mójútó ọ̀rọ̀ tó jẹ mọ́ wíwá ekùsà àti irin, báńkì tó ń rí sí ọ̀rọ̀ tó jẹ mọ́ ilé-iṣẹ́ àti ẹgbẹ́ wa yóò fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ láti ṣe ìpinnu lórí ọ̀nà tí àwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ wa yóò ṣe máa jẹ àǹfààní ètò èyáwó náà.”

translation.en: According to Shehu, all conditions required for accessing the fund remains valid, adding that the association would now serve as guarantor for its members.
translation.yo: Shehu tún sọ pé gbogbo ìgbésẹ̀ ni àwọn ti gbé báyìí láti rí i pé wọ́n rí ètò èyáwó náà gbà, bákan náà ni ẹgbẹ́ náà ni yóò dúró fún ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ wọn láti yá owó náà.

translation.en: ---NIBUCAA: The United nations will support Nigeria to fight incurable diseases.
translation.yo: ---NIBUCAA: Àjọ Ìṣọ̀kan Àgbáyé yóò sàtìlẹ́yìn fún Nàìjíríà láti gbógun ti àrùn kògbóògùn.

translation.en: The United nations has said that incurable diseases HIV/AIDS concerns the health of people, therefore, the United nations is prepared to hold some programs that that will support Nigeria, in that it will stop the spread of incurable disease in Nigeria.
translation.yo: Àjọ àgbáyé ti ní ààrùn kògbóògùn HIV/AIDS ní í ṣe pèlú ìlera àwọn ènìyàn, nítorí náà, àjọ àgbáyé ti ṣetán láti ṣe àwọn ètò tí yóò máa ṣàtìlẹ́yìn fún orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà, ni èyí tí yóò fi dẹ́kun ìtànkálẹ̀ ààrùn kògbóògùn lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà.

translation.en: The United Nations representative on fighting incurable diseases Erasmus Murah said this in a program Nigeria Business of HIV/AIDS (NIBUCAA) in Abuja, on Wednesday this week.
translation.yo: Aṣojú àjọ àgbáyé ní ẹ̀ka ètò tó ń rí sí gbígbógun tí àrùn kògbóògùn Erasmus Murah l’ó sọ̀rọ̀ yìí níbi ètò tí àjọ t’ó ń gbógunti àrùn kògbóògùn lorílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjíríà NIBUCAA ṣe nílùú Àbújá, lọ́jọ́Rú ọ̀ṣẹ̀ yìí.
